title: The Hotel is next to everything we needed !
text: Thank you for the upgrade and dinner choices Maria me and my boyfriend had a great time. We will be back !!! , enjoyed walking around the area and having dinner at a few different places my experience was a 10/10 will recommend to anybody traveling to NYC

title: Great experience for our sons wedding guests.
text: The front desk staff and manager were incredibly helpful and friendly for our son's wedding weekend with many guests, welcome bags etc. The Lobby is hectic on weekend nights but our room was very quiet with a nice view. Highly recommend for groups.

title: Our wedding
text:
We just got married in New York last weekend and the Dream was our home base. It was incredible.

We booked the Guest House to use for our wedding party to get ready and for some guests to congregate for our afterparty (and of course for the two of us to sleep at night). The room itself is stunning, with two floors, all high end finishings and furniture, tons of usable space, great light, modern conveniences like digital room controllers to customize the color scheme of the funky LED lighting in the living room, seamlessly project music through all the rooms and control the 10(!) head shower. And, of course, don’t forget about the glass bottom hot tub on the patio upstairs. Totally awesome, and we comfortably fit 30-40 people at a time between the bridal party, family, photographers, hair and makeup staff, etc. We also had the South Tower Terrace across the hall so we had the whole floor and plenty of overflow space, and the terrace in that room is enormous and has really good views. They offered us a good deal to combine them and we are glad we did. The lobby area also looks really cool and was a great setting for a chunk of our photo shoot.

But of course a hotel is only as good as its staff, and this place has a Dream Team. From Esther in sales, who answered a million questions and helped prep for our arrival, to Irtiza at reception who managed the flow of dozens of guests and ensured they could easily get to our suites and that our every need was taken care of, to the maintenance team who rushed upstairs with a crow bar to remove a cement block on the patio when one of the wedding rings was dropped in the crack during the photo shoot (yikes). They helped make the weekend so enjoyable and removed so much of the stress we were expecting. 

Thank you so much for an amazing weekend!

-Josh and Ali

title: Ridiculous stay at the Dreams Downtown
text: I paid full rate and booked through the website. We did not book a cheap hotel stay. Our room was the 11 floor. Their club is the 12 floor. The noise was ridiculous. We could barely have a conversation until 4 AM. No help from the hotel. I will never stay at another Hyatt due to this experience. Have the owners stay in this hotel on the 11 floor and then call me to have them tell about their experience. I would understand if there was a warning when booking or if we had some cheap rate. Shame on you Hyatt.

title: Excellent Service at the DREAM
text: Just checked out of the Dream Downtown. I have to say the hotel is amazing with a great location to many fabulous neighborhoods. At the the hotel I have to say that Irtiza D. at the front desk was able to handle all of our needs and went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. With that I have Anthony P. Who also looked out for us as well. Thank you gentlemen for your attention bro detail.

title: The place was lovely.  Loved c;lub upstairs and the promoter of the club.
text:
The place was beautiful, love the wall with the art on it.  The Club was awesome.  The staff was great.
Rooms clean and beautiful.  I only had one issue with bathroom shower, weird smell came from running hot water. I went to my co-workers room he also had the same experience with the bathroom shower.  But the place is wonderful.  Love the decor.

title: Living the Dream at The Dream
text: It is a great place to  stay, great location, and excellent service from the staff in attendance. The rooms are well kept, clean and the adjustable air conditioning allows for preferred comfort levels.

title: Great Staff, Great Location
text: Staff welcoming and friendly.  Located near great food options and shopping.  Was directed to great dining experiences and a Deli, Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts nearby if not wanting fine dining.  Hotel had modern decor and a cool vibe.

title: Google Visit
text: I had a business meeting in Google , the Hotel was located conveniently across the street from their 9th Ave location, easy access to mass transit and traveling from JFK airport. The Hotel has a small Name on the entry so be careful not to skip it when walking pass it.

title: Well located and clean but tight quarters.
text: It was a tight fit to be sure and a little worn in around the minibar. You can see the old dream in the bones of the place. But, it's also clean and an excellent location if you want to be in Chelsea, Meatpacking, walkable to Union Square or Madison Square. Close to the subways, which is nice. The only big reservation I have on recommending is that I was traveling with my toddler and the hotel is not toddler safe. The showers and bathrooms are iffy (she tried to climb the unattached towel ladder) and there was nowhere to put a suitcase or let her play because the rooms are so tiny.

title: Average
text: Good location. Very busy hotel with a lot of none hotel guest in the hotel for the roof top bar. Very noisy at times. Inconsistent hot water during our stay waited over 20min for the water to heat up. Room was clean and bed was comfortable.

title: Fell a bit short
text: For the cost of the hotel, I expected to al least have the basics of an upscale stay.. The shower pressure was low. There were not enough outlets and for those that were there, the were inconvenently located. There was no mini bar and no bottled water. The sink was too small to lay out toiletries and the closet light would not turn off.

title: If you are not planning to be up late partying do not stay here
text:
I should have read the reviews more closely on this hotel. It is a party scene.  My daughter and I stayed here on a Saturday night after seeing a Broadway show because I wanted to be in a better location than Times Square.  While the location is great and the hotel itself is nice, we would have better off in Times Square.  We were up until 2:00 am with rowdy neighbors partying and playing music.  The walls are paper thin in this hotel.  I read complaints about the club music but we were on the 3rd floor so it wasn’t the rooftop club it was the group of partiers on our floor.  We had to ask security to come up twice and finally around 2:00 am things settled down.

The staff at check in was friendly and they were very responsive when we did call security.  That is the main reason I didn’t give this hotel a 1.

title: Bring your own coffee and sit in the dark. Then wake up and go to the Chelsea market.
text: The location can’t be beat, directly across the street from the Chelsea market. I booked a terrific rate at the tail end of the Winter special. It’s hard to take this seriously as a hotel because, at least at the rate I booked, there isn’t even a coffee machine in the room. I called the front desk and was told that “only platinum level rooms have coffee machines.” I don’t know where on the website that information is. This is also a good room, on the seventh floor facing north, if you like to spend your time in the dark. There is one overhead light, with what passes these days for a trendy fixture: a glass globe and enclosing a bare lightbulb. There is one small reading light on one side of the bed. I called the front desk last night to ask if there were any more lights available. No, there are not. At least not for bronze or silver or whatever room it is I have. Looking for art? Something your teenager might like: a very large picture of a teenage face with dark red goggles. If you are looking to overpay for bottles of booze in your closet,, this will, indeed be your dream. I have five nights to go…

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Wonderful stay. Accommodations were fabulous, staff was helpful and kind. The room was clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic, very centrally located and was safe with so many great spots nearby. I highly recommend the Dream Downtown

title: Good hotel great location
text: Great location and service. avoid it if you are looking for a quiet night, Nightclub mode is the main mood of this place. if you are into party and wild drunk stuff this is the place for you. but the hotel is fine.

title: Wished it was better.
text: Staff was nice. Location great for public transportation, local eats and sights. Shower curtain didn’t fully close so it was drafty. Food from the hotel was good. Musty smell in the bathroom and a roach crawled in my daughter’s pillow. It wasn’t completely bad but could’ve been a ton better.

title: Interesting and fun location - not the highest quality accommodations but good value
text:
If you are young and partying the night away the hotel has a night club on site, that being said make sure you request a room away from the night club.  

The hotel location is very close to the beginning of the hi line, a great traffic free walk to midtown and is convenient to the little island with great views of the city and NJ.
The hotel seems to focus on trendy decor and digital art and is fun and comfortable although is a little cheesy on some of the quality of furnishing and mechanicals,
There is a bit less hustle and bustle than midtown with still plenty of restaurants and things to do.  If you are looking for bagels " the Ark:" is a block or so east with fantastic bagels, not too crowded either.
Be careful of high destination fees which can be added on after depending on how you book,  If you get a good deal than I would recommend

title: Fabulous downtown hotel
text: I cannot say enough good things about Dream Downtown. I have stayed there for business numerous times and have thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff is so kind and helpful and the rooms are lovely. 5 stars!!

title: Awful stay
text: We had a horrible night at the Dream hotel. We arrived around 11 PM after a show and there was a line around the hotel to get into the night club. Check in was prompt and easy once finding a way around the line. The area of the hotel where we stayed could use an upgrade. Table in hallway outside of the room had cracks in it, buttons to turn on lights in our room were not working, stains on tiles in bathroom. Our room was located on the third floor facing the front of the hotel. The noise was unbelievable through the night. As parents of young children, we were so excited to have a weekend away and be able to sleep through the night. This did not happen - the noise from the club, people outside and taxi cabs beeping went on until 3:30 AM. We even checked to make sure our windows weren’t open. The hotel offers earplugs (per other reviews) but cannot believe they do not warn people about the noise pollution. It seems there is another part of the hotel that may be quieter. We ended up cancelling our 2nd night here and booked at another where we had a wonderful experience! Unbelievable that they are able to book the rooms we stayed in without any kind of warning. Not worth risking if you want to sleep at night. I would not recommend!

title: Don’t stay on the 11th floor!!
text: Dream more like NIGHTMARE!! My wife and I decided to stay at the dream for her birthday. We live about 2.5 hrs away and come to the city all the time. Check in was fantastic.. thought it was gonna be a great trip. Well that all turned sour at about 10ish. My wife wasn’t feeling well so we decided to stay in for the night instead of going out. The night club was so loud you could feel the bass in the floor. We called the front desk and we were offered ear plugs!! The music got so loud at about midnight we considered leaving the hotel and going home. We called the front desk the counter person said he will tell them to turn it down yeah right! What a joke if anything the music got louder!!!!! My poor wife not only not feeling well but can’t even fall asleep to get some rest. We feel like a hostages being stuck in a room subjected to muffled club music!

title: Dj Cribb @ the Dream hotel
text: The Dream hotel exceeded all my expectations with its exceptional service, luxurious accommodations, and delicious dining options. The stylish and modern design of the hotel creates a welcoming atmosphere, and the location is convenient for exploring the city. I highly recommend the Dream hotel for a truly memorable stay.

title: Wonderful experience & quiet & relaxing
text: This place was a dream… the check in was so easy and quick. The room so clean and really nice and comfortable. The staff brought us hot water for our tea within minutes of calling and asking .. so fast. Its was so quiet too. Like I was nervous about the club on the roof .. but I didn’t hear a peep .. and I’m super sensitive to noise .. it was overall amazing and I would absolutely stay again.

title: Party hotel with poor customer service - not worth the price
text: I'm a Hyatt loyalist and I expected the hotel to be buzzing, but on a Saturday night it truly is an oversized club. It's nice enough but feels despite the 2000s modern aesthetic, it's starting to look a little rough around the edges. I paid extra for two beds for a room to share with my sister which we were happy enough with until we got back from dinner and seeing a show - the dance party in the room next to us was vibrating through the paper thin walls. I went to the front desk and asked for a different room as we didn't want to cause problems, just to sleep, but was told only king beds were available and security would come ask our neighbors to quiet down. Security came - and of course the music only got marginally more quiet for 5 minutes, so we finally just settled for a king room, but were not offered even a partial refund for the room I'd paid extra for.

title: Great Stay, would stay again
text: The rooms were decorated a bit odd but it fit the charm of the hotel. It was clean, staff was very friendly, had lots of amenities and overall location was good for my purpose. I would stay here again.

title: Night on the Town
text: My girlfriend wanted to go out for the night and we landed on going to PHD Rooftop bar and decided to stay at Dream Downtown to make our life easier. Overall a wonderful experience and would highly recommend! Especially so if you want to make a night of going to PHD if you do not live in the area.

title: Don't stay here if you want to sleep. Do stay here for the clubs.
text: Not a place to stay for business travel - if you are on floor 7 and up (facing the pool) you will hear the rooftop club that goes until 4AM and won't be able to sleep. But if you are visiting to party then I highly recommend.

title: Dream Downtown -great experience
text: Great property, great location. The rooms were extremely comfortable, quiet and nicely appointed. Would stay there again in a minute and will definitely be back in the spring when I am in that part of NYC again.

title: Cutesy hotel in the heart of the meatpacking district!  Great vibes and central to all in NYC!
text: Boutique like resort with great service, cool location and good for social or business.  I have gone twice on a staycation and I enjoyed it both times. I didn't order in room dining because there is Catch, Tao and a full array of restaurants nearby.  The check in staff were delightful and very responsive.  If you are looking for a lively experience by the pool I recommend Fri-Sat.

title: Perfect for an NYC vaca
text: We did a 3 person girls trip for my birthday out here and the hotel was our favorite part. Located within walking distance of so much fun stuff & right by the subway if you want to head out to other areas. Great staff - especially housekeeping! We needed some extra things and they were fast, kind, and brought extra things they’d thought we might need - we did!

title: Birthday weekend!
text: this is a trendy hotel in a great area, close to lots of bars, restaurants and shopping!  Overall, pretty good except for the $57 a night resort fee which includes nothing especially in the winter months that the pool is closed.  Also, rooms are small and dated and the bed isn't the most comfortable but because the hotel is in such a great area and has such a fun vibe on the weekend if the price is right I would stay again!

title: Good for play, not for sleep
text: I read a few of the reviews and knew what to expect with the club noise. It definitely was that. Thumped until 4am (it was a Saturday night). The location was convenient to great restaurants. When we arrived our sink was clogged and there was no ice bucket or wine glasses. Had to call for some but they arrived promptly. The view wasn’t great. The room is perfect for a sexy retreat but there is not a lot of privacy for the bathroom. Huge open ring door handle opposite the toilet. The glass to the shower shows the outlines to anyone in the room. Not saying that’s bad but I wouldn’t like it if traveling with extended family. Lighting was an issue. Difficult to turn on and off because the words had rubbed off the plates. It was a challenge to get mood lighting going. It was too bright or just dark. The light in the closet wouldn’t go out because the door wouldn’t close properly so maybe that is the best they have? The bed is low to ground and the headboard is cool looking with circle cutouts that seriously need a good dusting. With the press of a button the shower glass becomes a mirror which extends the length of the bed. Walls are extremely thin so you can easily hear your neighbors enjoying. Moral of the story is don’t come here with any expectations of sleep and you will be fine.

title: Save your money
text:
We checked in and immediately realized that this hotel is very much a party environment with clubs, bars and restaurants. This clearly made the noise a big issue especially when our PLATINUM suite was right above the club. As soon as we got to our room we realized our fridge was broken, then our closet door which therefore caused the light in the closet to not turn off. normally not an issue but the door has a port hole style facing the bed. When we called the front desk they sent someone up who told us there was nothing he could do. when he came back for the light same issue... he had to undo the wiring to disconnect the light so it would at least stay off. After that another employee came up with a bucket of ice suggesting this was the only way to main our drinks cold. We were told to take photos of all these issues and ask for a refund. That was the solution provided. We showed them the exposed wiring in the bedroom they once again said they couldnt do anything. 
The bathroom lights turn on and off with a button, the cover of the button kept falling off, only way to use the lights was turning them on in the living space or bedroom. Our shower curtain was 2 sizes too small for the size of the shower and had some type of leak that flooded our bathroom floor no matter how much we pulled the curtain. To top it all off the sink head fell off and our sink was clogged so it would take forever for the water to go down. 
There's no seperatiom between the club guests and hotel guests so if theyre drunk and all over the lobby you're in for a show and an obstacle course to the elevators and your room. 
I was holding off on leaving a review since I was told someone would get in contact with me to come to a resolution but it has now been 2 days and no one has even reached out. 
We love to do staycations and apart from the great view and convenient location this was an awful experience and highly recommend you look elsewhere for a much cheaper and better run hotel that is being maintained.

title: Cool hotel
text: It was so fun to stay at Dream! I really liked the circular object design. If you’re looking for a unique hotel this is it. Also, the digital art in lobby area was very interesting. I would stay at this hotel again.

title: Dream (of a different place to stay) Downtown
text: This hotel was really cool "back in the day".  Unfortunately, it is clear that the management has waited too long to make the necessary investments to keep the facilities in line with present expectations. Everything is worn out, from elevator interiors to guest room amenities and furniture.  I would advise to stay elsewhere until the property is completely renovated.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: This hotel is in a great location with great rooms and great staff . The rooms are cozy and spacious with really comfortable beds. The staff are really nice and helpful especially the lovely ladies who cleaned our room with there big smiles and great sense of humor. I really recommend you stay at this hotel we will definitely be back .

title: Not worth the money
text: Room is tiny. Don't stay if you have more than 1 person. The window is hard to open and close, hurting my finger. The table is tiny as well. The bed is okay. Light control is super weird and has learning curve.

title: Unable to sleep
text: I stayed here on a business trip and they put me In room directly below their club. I had to change rooms in the middle of the night. In the new room it sounded like an industrial vacuum cleaner was being used on the floor above me at 3am. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone except people looking to go to a club until 4 am.

title: nowhere near living up to my expectations of a four star hotel
text:
The hotel is in a good location (my employer's major office is right next door). However:

The carpet was filthy. There were bathrobes, but no slippers (essential because of the filthy carpet). The bathroom was enclosed in glass walls (not clear, but one can still see shapes pretty well). The light switches were confusing. The glass bathroom door scraped on the floor every time it was opened or closed, making an extremely annoying sound. There is a nightclub on the top floor so the upper floors can suffer from noise. The bathroom sink was made of metal - felt more like a prison bathroom than a four star hotel. There was the option to order food (I got a order) from a neighboring restaurant delivered to the hotel reception; the burger was decent, but the fries were caked together and tasted of old frying oil - I threw them out. The right place to enter from the street could be clearer (it says the hotel name on the side but not directly on the door); this fact was abused by a scammer who intercepted me as I was arriving looking for the entrance, and tried unsuccessfully to lead me away.

Overall, this was a much worse experience than I would have expected. I've now warned coworkers against staying here and I will never stay here again.

title: Very tired "style over substance" hotel in a convenient location
text: It felt grotty as soon as you entered the building. Reception and the lobby is all frayed carpet and tired sofas. Receptionist was very nice overall but very cold initially. Rooms are polished concrete floors and mine had the worlds most stained and grotty rug. The light switches are lit all night (why?!) and baffling to use. The veneer on the "desk" was cracked and lifting as was the fake wood surround for the sink. It had a chainmail shower curtain as well as a nylon one. It has clearly been designed to be young and hip but I hated it.

title: Gorgeous West Village Location
text: Enjoy my stay every time. Beautiful, unique rooms in a great location. Steps away from the Village, Chelsea and the Hudson River. Its so easy and convenient to most of Manhattan while being in a quiet, strollable area. Love this hotel.

title: Lots of partying and rooms need updating
text:
Room was clean but needs to be updated. Our fridge was not running, lamps were not working, light on/off buttons were falling off the wall upon being pressed. 

On top of that there was a group partying outside our room (yep, in the hallway) until after 5am, so we got very little sleep. Not an enjoyable stay.

title: GREAT STAY
text:
Interesting hotel with circular windows, very clean and modern, food was great
Staff was very helpful, bathroom had stainless steel sink - quite interesting - faucet sticks out too much while water comes out half way along faucet.

title: Loud dance music from nightclub reverberates through the walls into the room
text: Loud dance music from nightclub reverberates through the walls into the room. Couldn't sleep until 3 am on a Wednesday night. Rooms are not sound proof. Otherwise, the hotel is in a very good location. Very clean room with nice ambience. Support staff are very helpful.

title: a night out
text: I would have had a 5star all around like I have always when I stayed there. That's why I came back. i hope the next time i come back this place is back to normal. if you want to reach out to me thats fine. thank you

title: Great location, good breakfast, very polite staff, good rooms, good bar. Highly recommended!
text: If you want to stay in this neighborhood, don't go to any other hotel. It is a perfect location, has very polite and helpful staff, and limited breakfast choices, but all good choices. I am a Globalist, so it was free for me, and I was surprised to hear that there was no limit for me and I could pick up 2-3 juices, not that I did, but I found that very rare. The hotel has a nice bar and a very friendly bartender. Very good ambiance. I was upgraded to a suite and found it very roomy, clean, and modern. The automatic light was not perfect, but it was a small con. The hotel has a night club or lounge which was very busy at night, I didn't go so not sure how it was but saw a lot of crowd visiting. Parking was expensive and annoying; it was contracted and across the street. It was $60 for a night and had no in-n-out privileges, so if you took it out once, you had to pay another $60 for parking. I will always prefer this hotel for my future office trips to NYC

title: Avoid at all costs
text:
I was pretty obviously on a business stay, M-Th, on a corporate rate.  Why on earth they put me underneath the rooftop nightclub, I do not understand.  M and T, no noise, club closed.  W a little after 11, the bass starts up.  I'm already in bed, I'm leaving the next morning, it's just not worth getting dressed and trying to change rooms.

As to the rooms, it feels like the old person in the club desperately trying to be cool, but it's been done so badly on the cheap.  Ooh, nice cool lighting fixture ... that's stupidly dim.  Ooh, nice industrial looking bathroom ... that doesn't have enough light to get ready for work.  Ooh, a trendy platform bed ... that's super low to the ground and has a mattress on par with a Motel 6.  Ooh, a fancy Samsung TV with Chromecast ... that doesn't work at all.  Ooh, a fancy looking metal mesh shower curtain ... that's so heavy it's difficult to open and close.

The *one* redeeming quality (disagreeing with some of the previous bad reviews) was the shower.  Rain shower with plenty of hot water and great pressure.

It *was* clean, the staff was nice (except for whatever genius didn't put me somewhere away from the club).  Nice location by Chelsea Market and the High Line.

title: Avoid Dream Downtown - Roof Nightclub Makes Sleeping Impossible
text:
I learned that the Dream Downtown has a nightclub on the top floors when, at 11:30pm my room on the 11th floor started shaking with a heavy bass beat.

This wasn't clear at booking and the staff did not warn me of this at check-in.

Don't stay here if you want to sleep.

title: Great Location & Hotel
text: Wish I knew about this hotel years ago! Great location for West Side business meetings and Broadway plays because the A, C, E subway line is less than a block away, within minutes to Penn Station for a LIRR Train to Jamaica for the JFK airtrain, to the 44th St exit to plays avoiding Times Square, and meetings all the way to Midtown or the Upper West side. Plus across the street from Chelsea Market for restaurants, shopping, and close to the walkway. Plus the hotel is very modern, clean, and beautifully decorated. Plus the best feather pillows!

title: Nice hotel, no coffee.
text: For a Manhattan hotel, the Dream has large, clean rooms with decent views. We are early risers and were disappointed to discover that there was no coffee to be had prior to 8:00 am. Starbucks a block away was the only solution, and it was 11F in the morning. Not a pleasant walk for a cup of coffee. For $300/night, good, complementary coffee in the lobby would be nice.

title: Trendy, but Very Inadequate
text:
The hotel was very trendy, and I value its unique ambiance. However, it seemed to sacrifice basic things. There was no plug near the bed. The bed was so springy and uncomfortable - and a low platform bed, which is not my preference, but especially not so with a thin, spring mattress. 

The towel hangers were really high and odd to reach (one higher than I could reach and above a shelf, the other opposite the side of the bathroom over the toilet). 

They had a wooden towel ladder that leaned against the wall, but it kept falling every time I tried to pull a towel off. 

The sink water came out oddly far back from the spout, so much so I actually couldn’t fit the iron under to fill it with water. No matter, as there was no place to actually use the ironing board, except the floor. That would have been okay, except it was a table top model - and the only surface in my room was a thin desk, and it didn’t fit there (literally not wide enough). 

The lighting system was also way too complicated, especially when you enter a dark room and can’t read which button is for what. There were 6 push buttons for basic lighting options (not switch, dial, or slider), some with fade control and some not, but all push button - which was also hard to figure out.

title: Dream Downtown; a DREAM
text:
LOVED our stay here. I read some reviews that were not so great but our stay here was AMAZING. The service was great/everyone was very friendly. I had requested early check-in and they were able to accomodate us. The location is awesome; literally right next to the Chelsea Markets. SOOO many thinks are walkable. 

I had read reviews that the noise from the club had ruined people's stays; this was not the case. The front desk even warned us that our room was close to the club/could be noisy but we did not care because we wanted the specific room/view (views are great!). The noise truly was not bad. You could hear a faint bass; but nothing that kept us awake.

title: Great Chelsea location.
text: Located in Chelsea and near subway entrance. Hotel has some food service but restaurant is Asian and coffee bar has very limited hours. You can request in room coffee but it's an old Keurig...no real cream given nor any tea. Bathrobes are provided as well as bottled water...but it would be better if it were more environmentally friendly, such as refillable bottles or boxes water. Lots of plastic and waste. Bed is comfortable though very low to the ground. Trendy opaque glass between bathrooms and bed... not great for more than one person. And the low ambient lighting sucks.

title: Too cool and hidden fees
text: Staying at Dream is like when you meet someone trying way too hard to be cool.  However, more importantly, if you book via Expedia or whatever, you will find that you have a nightly destination fee of $57.  When you ask for an explanation, the person at the desk will search his or her mental index for reasons, including "the pool" in the middle of winter.  One last point is the internet connection sucks.

title: Great staff and location
text: The check-in staff was so great and very courteous, he made sure my stay was comfortable and enjoyable.  The location is unbeatable. I stayed in January, the pool in the courtyard would be amazing in the summer.

title: clean and nice
text: The hotel is very clean and quiet. It is very close to the city center and can be walked. It is also very close to the subway station. I will choose you again next time I travel to New York. The staff is also very enthusiastic and professional. It is great and worth recommending.

title: Fabulous New Year's stay
text: All of the staff were super friendly. It was easy to find the hotel and parking was available across the street. Check in was quick. We also stayed for their New Year's party where we were treated like royalty. They were attentive to us for the whole night. Our room was clean and comfortable. It was a nice modern setting. The bathroom was good sized with a big shower area too. I would definitely stay here again

title: Decent hotel in good location, but needs updating.
text: We arrived early and were able to pre-check in and store our bags, however, when we returned there was a fairly long line at the front desk and only one person working behind it. The public spaces are clean and well maintained. Our room (double queen) was larger than expected for NYC. The bedding and bathroom were clean, however the carpet looked like it hasn’t been updated in a decade. It was seriously almost worn through in the high traffic areas. It made us wonder how and when it was last cleaned. Carpeting in the hallways are also worn, torn and frayed. A request for extra pillows was fulfilled quickly by a friendly staff member. The extra pillows were much better than the ones in the room – fluffier and firmer. Mattresses were very soft (good for me, meh for my girlfriend).

title: Not great
text:
I would have liked this hotel a lot better if they discussed ameneties with me during check in. I see there's a pool in the picture? But I wasn't told about that. 

The good:

Nice location
Seems to have an interesting restaurant
Nice bar

The bad:

Cold water showers. Absolutely no hot water during any shower in the four days we stayed.
A group of people partied from 1-6am on our floor. I called the front desk who "sent up security" - party still didn't wind down until 6 am.
No cups for water? No coffee? Nothing in your room?
Weird buttons that control the lighting - most of which barely worked. Not user friendly.

title: Excellent Chelsea Hotel
text: Great addition to the Hyatt brand, Dream Downtown is in an excellent location within Chelsea Meatpacking District. Super close to Hudson Yards and the village. My room was a balcony king room which was worth the extra for the space and outdoor area. TAO Downtown and Philippe Chow is around the corner. PHD is amazing with the rooftop views. Excellent coffee at Natura Cafe (Brenda is the BEST). Definitely returning.

title: Needs repairs but great location
text: Refrigerator was broken. The shower valve would not maintain temperature, had to continuously adjust. It was either hot or cold. Storage for clothes was one small drawer and very small hanging bar. The mattress was beyond crappy, all springs and noisy. Unbelievable that any hotel would have this bad of a mattress. The TV signal would freeze every one to two minutes for 5 seconds, made watching football really frustrating. The room is very small. The view of the pool.... Skip this room. The view also includes the other side of hotel, so no view. Balcony is small chair wide by 6 feet long.

title: Great hotel with great views in a great location!
text: We couldn't believe the view of the city we had from our room when we arrived! It was spectacular. The room was cute and clean and in a great location. From the hotel we walked everywhere and had access to everything we needed in a short radius. The Chelsea Market is right across the street which has so many great food and shopping options! We were within minutes of great breakfast and coffee spots we found as well, and we had so much fun just exploring Chelsea. We walked down to the waterfront and enjoyed the High Line, all just a short walk from the hotel - and for such an incredible price compared to other hotels we were looking at. We paid WAY more at another hotel later with no where near as good as of an experience as we had here at Dream. It's such a great value! We would absolutely stay here again.

title: Excellent Value and Unbeatable Location
text: The Dream Downtown is steps from everything that Chelsea, Meatpacking and the West Village have to offer. There are few good hotel options in this highly desirable, residential part of town and the Dream is hands-down the best. Clean, comfortable rooms, good design and excellent service (especially Anthony at the front desk!) make the Dream a no-brainer. We'll be back!

title: Dreamtown Hotel on the West Side
text: I attended the hotel for a work meeting. It was very fun and modern. Everyone seemed very nice. It was a very short visit so I cannot comment on the food at all. We had a dinner out somewhere else as well as breakfast. Location was perfect for what we needed near the Fig and Olive and Chelsea Piers.

title: So disappointing
text: The staff at Dream Downtown are incredibly rude and have little to none customer service. Do not stay at this hotel if you would like a friendly, warm atmosphere as you will be sorely disappointed. Upon check in, the lady barely looked at us. Anytime we asked for extra towels or why our room had not been cleaned, we were greeted with hostility and a sour attitude. We spent as little time as possible in this hotel and will not be returning.

title: Great Hotel with Amazing Service
text: WOW what a great hotel and above and beyond service, will defiantly Stay again thank you Ester for helping me out for this stay and many more to come, Great Location, close to trains and very clean hotel

title: DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT A POUNDING NIGHTCLUB IN YOUR CHEST and NO SLEEP
text: The property is in a good location, and it is kind of a cool vibe, but that is the end of the good part of our stay at this hotel . We booked a higher end large king room with a view on a higher floor spending over $900 A NIGHT.  We stayed for 4 nights, nights 1 and 2 were great, but night 3, Wednesday the nightclub at the hotel opened and we were WOKEN AND THEN UNABLE TO SLEEP FOR TWO NIGHTS IN ROW. Night 3 we beared through the pounding as we didn't need to wake up so early, but night 4 we were very tired AND NEEDED TO WAKE BY 5CLUB WOULD PLAY MUSIC UNTIL 4AM that night !!  They gave us another room at 12:30AM TO THE 7TH FLOOR BUT THE THUMPING COULD STILL BE HEARD.  This place ended in a flop, and we will never stay here again. We are fighting to get some portion of our stay back, but so far, the hotel is playing hard ball and gave us only $100 back.   DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YU WANT TO PARTY ALL NIGHT.

title: Bad service 0/10
text: When you spend a substantial amount on a luxurious hotel stay, you expect a certain level of satisfaction and service. However, this hotel disappoints greatly in that aspect. The manners of the staff, particularly the receptionists, are appalling. The lobby, which transforms into a nightclub, exacerbates the situation, leading to an unwelcoming atmosphere akin to that of encountering nightclub bouncers.

title: A wonderful dream at the Dream hotel.
text:
The hotel is just short cab right away from everything. The hotel staff has been very friendly. Our thanks to Esther Song for setting up the room and the amenities. I would highly recommend this hotel.
The room is clean and tidy. The bathroom is large. The lighting is good. There is an excellent security system for do not disturb and made service.

title: Appalling and dishonest - do NOT stay here
text:
What a terrible hotel and customer service.  Apart from generally a poor hotel, they hosted two hiddeous 'events' directly under our room that meant the entire hotel throbbed and shook until 4 am 2 nights in a row. This was not the club, which we knew about (and carefully booked a room to be away from) but additional events.  

Obviously we complained and were slightly pacified when they said they would refund those 2 nights (we stayed a total of 8 - and honestly most of the trip was ruined because we were wall eyed zombies and thoroughly miserable from no sleep).  But now they are refusing to make that refund!  We have been battling for 2 months via expedia - initially they claimed they'd refunded but hadn't, then they finally refunded 10% of those nights.  It's so disgusting - we even have recording of the manager promising us that refund which they are still refusing to make.  

Even if this hadn't happened I really wouldn't stay there.  We were in a supposed 'gold' room.  A bleak, tired room with no facilities, no space, uncomfortable beds, weirdly enormous shower, barely functional electrics.  Common areas hopeless - because they close they pool they also close the only decent areas to hang out.  Basically the only option is the tiny lobby bar with about 4 chairs.  Even by NY standards this is just a bad bad hotel.  How on earth do Hyatt put their name to it?

title: Cloud cub music alllllll night, don’t plan on getting any sleep here.
text: This is a beautiful, hip hotel in Chelsea but what you don’t know before you come is that there is a club that plays music into the early morning hours every single night. You hear the music & vibrating bass all night & some of the of the hotel goers come home from whatever bar/club & talk loudly down the hallways going back to their room. This will be my 3rd night here & I haven’t gotten any sleep on this entire vacation. Worst part is, you need all the energy to walk miles & miles throughout the day in NY & with no sleep it completely ruins your energy level to enjoy the city. I’ll never stay here again.

title: Great experience
text: The hotel was beautiful and a good location. Staff was friendly and informative! We came for the Thanksgiving parade and some shopping and the location was perfect ! Good location to restaurants and lots of site seeing!

title: Great experience
text: Is a beautiful hotel, well located in Chelsea area, all we needed. Does not include breakfast but there are some options near by. I would like to have better lighting in the room, mostly for doing my makeup. You have infront the Chelsea market and the highline.

title: Great front desk staff and location. Beware of loud dance club.
text: The front desk staff were nice enough to warn us of the music from the rooftop dance club and suggest that we move from our 11th floor reservation down to the 9th floor. However, the music was still loud enough to keep us awake (mainly the bass frequencies). The club is loudest from 1am - 4am. Suggest staying on a lower floor if you’re sensitive to noise or a light sleeper … u less you’re a night owl in which case it won’t matter! We were traveling with a toddler so it wasn’t ideal. But the room was beautiful, the hotel is super cool and the staff were amazing. Fantastic location.

title: Not a Dream for over 65
text: While clean and very modern, the Dream was too much of a boutique hotel for anyone over 65. The bed was VERY low to the ground, no towel racks or hooks in bathroom, large porthole window required a heavy curtain that you had to pull over the couch, in front of the window, to insure privacy making the couch useless. It may be a very nice hotel for a younger, trendy customer but not a Dream for us.

title: Convenient, quiet, comfort
text:
Conveniently located. A good variety of places to eat and shopping nearby. Staff is professional and go out of their way to assist. Rooms are spacious, extremely clean, comfortable, and quiet. 
Pool area way closed for the season, but it looked very nice.

title: Dream Downtown
text: Amazing hotel with easy check-in, friendly staff, awesome rooftop bar/lounge. Can't beat the location. Would definitely stay here again. Room was clean and efficient for the amount of space. Hotel bar opens at 5.

title: Basic hotel for the price with broken hardware
text:
I booked my 5 nights stay through AMEX corporate travel and was surprised to be told that it is not eligible for Hyatt points. Usually corporate travel bookings are always eligible at other chains. So after spending $3K for the stay, I came away with 0 points. I would not have booked this if I had known, and will avoid for future business trips.

The hotel is also not very well designed and maintained. My towel rack was half broken and unstable. The shower curtain is this metal mesh material that is both hard to manoeuvre and terrible for shower since it is harsh and cold on your body if you accidentally come in contact with it. The noise insulation was not good especially for a hotel with a nightclub attached.

Stay somewhere else is my recommendation.

title: Fun trendy spot
text:
Enjoyable stay. Nice view. Good desk staff made check in/out very painless. Only complaint was that the bed was a bit uncomfortable though. Definitely would stay here again though. 

…………….:…………:.::.::.

title: GREAT PLACE FOR ALL TYPES EVENTS AND OCCASIONS!!!
text: To the "DREAM TEAM" :  As often as I travel, the last thing I need is to have an unpleasant lodging experience at the hotel I'm staying with. My team and I had to make a last minute decision to stay at The Dream Hotel in Chelsea. Where as we were accustomed to staying at some of the other formidable competitors. TOTAL GAME CHANGER!  The entire staff took great pride in executing their rolls with excellence. On the day of our check out, I wanted to make a point to speak with a manager and that's when I met Randy! Good dude! I see where some draw inspiration in regards to taking pride in their jobs. I simply wanted to commend them on such a great job. I wanted to remark on the exquisite job Maria does while on her post. Not only was she amazing with us but I had moments to observe her encounters with other customers. Some were rude and disrespectful, yet she maintains a high level of professionalism Ive not seen often. Hats off to you all.         ps. SEE YOU VERY SOON!

title: Cool design, great location, cheaply put together
text: I will stay here again on business because it was so convenient, but I will not choose it for personal travel because the room was cheaply put together. The AC clanked, so I had to turn it off. The drawer broke. There were not outlets on both sides of the bed. It just felt cheap, sadly.

title: Horrible sound isolation
text:
The rooms have basically no noise isolation. I could here everything happening outside my room.
From waking up at 6am one day because the couple in the room next door was arguing to staying up until 12:30am the next day because my other "neighbor" was having a conversation over the phone with a friend (who I could also hear over their speaker phone)

title: Just ok
text: We paid for a silver room but received a bronze room. The shower set up wasn't ideal because the shower head hose was constantly in the spray of water. The light switch by the head of the bed is constantly lit so we had to cover it up with a towel while we slept. The beds are very low platform beds so if you have a hard time getting up this might not be the one for you.

title: No HOT WATER
text: I stayed at the Dream Downtown for 1 night this week. Initially my Internet in the room did not work. And my phone service was not working in the room. Later this was fixed. The fire alarm went off at 6am. And I could not hear the PA announcements in my room. I had to dress and go down to the lobby for information as to MY SAFETY. And then my shower had no hot water. None. When I later asked at the desk on my way out she said, "They were supposed to turn it on at 4am. I don't know what happened." 2023, New York City, no hot water?

title: A fabled legend deteriorates
text:
TLDR: overpriced for super small rooms. There are much more affordable hotels with nicer ameneties within a few blocks. Go to one of those.

This place used to be the spot 10 years ago, but now it stands boldly un-updated, deteriorating on the coattails of its former glory. The rooms are very small and poorly lit. I was using my phone flash to find things. There are 6 buttons for 2 lights, but only 2/6 do anything. The button labels have worn off with age. The bathroom door is hefty, like mean hefty, and the bathroom walls are transparent -- thankfully, because the light spills into the darkness of the bedroom, helping to compensate. When I asked the front desk person via the telephone in the room for a food recommendation, he said he didn't know. I later discovered the hotel has at least 2 entire restaurants, one of which might also be a night club? 

The air conditioning, however, was perfect. 71 meant 71. The fans were high up near the ceiling, so there wasn't a constant draft of air. Really wonderful.

title: Overrated, expensive hotel
text: Overall, it's a place to sleep. However for the price we pay and the lack of amenities(no great place to work outside of your room), privacy (thin walls, club entrance in the lobby, etc.) I would consider staying elsewhere in the future especially if you're visiting for work. The hotel isn't the best for extended stays. Better for a weekend getaway to party in NY versus a professional hotel where you can have a comfortable place to work, etc. I will say the staff were friendly and did the best they could!

title: Good hotel, but bad experience because of the rooftop nightclub
text: The overall experience of the hotel would be much better without the rooftop hotel. I was 3 floors down from the club and I could not fall asleep because of the music until 3am. That was on a Wednesday! Completely unacceptable and should be disclosed ahead of time.

title: Was just as dreamy as expected
text: Overall experience was great. Easy to check in and out, staff was very friendly. And the rooms were cozy... Stayed here for a work trip. The hotel has several restaurants within feet which was a plus. It is also very close to 2 Starbucks and that is a must when I travel! Though they have a great cafe connected to the lobby.

title: Great hotel with great location
text:
Amazing hotel
Best location 
Room was big and great. Bathroom was very nice and big.
At the hotel is a small coffee shop and nearby is Chelsea Market. 
Close to the metro, blue and red lines. 
Even the price was reasonable

title: Worst Business Experience in 2 years
text:
I shared my many complaints with the front desk.  The staff at the front desk couldn't find me when checking in, even though the reservation was made through my corporate travel agency.  I was there for 30 minutes and had to reschedule a meeting.  The room was rather dirty, had no trash bin, a TV service that wasn't working (even though I called ahead of my trip to ensure it was as it was essential to prepare a presentation on a big screen), and old TV and barely working remote.  

I was on the 3rd floor and the music was so loud I couldn't sleep.  I asked for water and ice and never received it.  It's like I was screaming into the wind.  I asked for washcloths (the weren't restocked) and never got them.

I came back on day 3 of my stay to a rollaway bed (even though I was alone) in a KING ROOM that took up the entire room.  The "next morning" I was awoken after finally falling asleep as per usual for this stay at 5am when the crowd below calmed down.  Apparently the person who finally came for the rollaway bed earlier hit the alarm and it kept going off at 6am, 6:08 am...and on and on.  Then the fire alarm went off at 7am (three times) so I went to my VERY important presentation with no sleep thanks to the hotel.

I travel weekly for business and this was my worst experience in 2 years.

title: Good for a night or two, not longer
text: I stayed here for a work trip for 8 nights. The mattress was very springy and uncomfortable. The front desk staff was helpful, but not friendly. It’s really hard to find water in the hotel so I would recommend bringing bottles water with you for your stay. The room is primarily metal and concrete, so if you’re looking to feel at home, this isn’t the right hotel for you.

title: Sleepless night.
text: Nightclub on 12th floor was open until 4AM and music was so loud it pounded through my 11th floor room. Staff did NOT inform me of the club when I arrived and didn’t seem to care about my complaint (“Hotel is full. Sorry, can’t change room.”)

title: Beware of the sound of the night club overhead
text: Was on the 9th floor and ear plugs and white noise from phone was not enough to keep to sound of the base  beating. This was Saturday night, it went on until 4 am. Sunday was quiet. The furniture in the room is aging. The room had a fine view of Manhattan’s skyline.

title: It's a Dream - Location and View!
text: The Dream is in Chelsea is in a wonderful location blocks from the water and Pier 57.  The staff was great.  The rooms are very nice. I would have given this review 5 Stars however, all the outlets for charging your phone or laptop are along the wall in front of the bed.  There was no lighting, USB, or outlets next to the bed for reading, charging your phone or working on laptop.  I was there for a conference and had work to do before and after conference.  The location is everythng.  Steps away from Chelsea Markets, Pier 57, the water and more.  Blocks away from Starbuck's Reserve premier location.  Phillipe Chow is attached to the hotel.  The Tao club next store.  Easy to get an Uber.  Plenty of restaurants, green spaces nearby.

title: Not what expected for rate and “room with view” was of 16th street.
text: Paid for a city view and looked at street and building across. Pool area and courtyard not open to enjoy even just to sit. Rooms are rather bland and bathroom is not user friendly. They could also use some plugs on both nightstands.

title: Dream Downtown - Solid Boutique Hotel in Chelsea
text: I have now stayed at the Dream Hotel Downtown on two occasions, both for business, and I think it was a good choice and good value for the rates I paid (under $400 per night).  The first time I stayed, I was in one of the smaller rooms, which seemed a bit claustrophobic.  For my second stay, I chose to go with the King "gold" (320sf), which was MUCH better, although the bathroom was still quite tight.  The mood lighting was a little over the top, as it was so dim it was hard to read and even do makeup in the bathroom.  Every light is equipped with a dimmer setting, but the highest setting is not high enough to be practical.  Also, odd that they didn't have facecloths as part of the bathroom towels.  Other than that, the decor was wonderful.  Lots of cool art in the lobby and the rooms reflect the same sensibility.  There is some sort of night club on the roof (that I did not attempt to visit) and there are some fancy restaurants in and around the hotel.  The Chelsea location is great for any activites in that area (close to the Highline and Chelsea Piers).  Also, the front desk staff was great on both of my visits.  On my first visit, I thought my room had been booked by another party; it was not, but the night shift concierge (so sorry I can't recall her name), really made effort to accomodate me and find me a room at a good rate.  On the second visit, the other night shift concierge was great about giving me neighorhood restaurant recos (clearly NOT paid referrals - just where she liked to eat), and the place she recommended - a Cuban-fusion local spot (Coppelia) - was terrific.

title: Moldy Sheets, Towels and Shower Curtain
text:
So so moldy!! The smell of mold and dampness was everywhere in the room. I couldnt sleep and was disgusted to shower/use the towels. The common areas of the hotel are trendy and well kept. Shocking how old and moldy the room was.

Aside from mold, the room lightign was so so dim!! Possibly to hid being able to see the mold fully?

title: Great place!
text: This is a "dream" of a place, which I highly recommended. The location was perfect for my needs, a short walk to take care of my business and close to excellent dining and shopping locations. I will definitely staying during my next visit.

title: Great hotel but party crowd
text: I had a great stay but be prepared for the party crowd that runs through this hotel. If you can deal with those that get a little loud then it might not be a bad stay for you. It’s unfortunate that the roof top bar is only open for the night club at 10pm. I hope Dream considers opening the top earlier for those of us that would like to sip a cocktail and view the nyc skyline. I would have no problem clearing out at 9pm. This way they could charge a cover for entry after 10pm.

title: The name speaks louder than the place itself.
text: Very dingy. Old.  Curtains were ripped,  stained.  Shower curtain were old.  The fridge did not work.  Ac also did not work.  Repair man never came back to see if his reset of the device worked. We lost out on a very expensive meal due to the fridge not working.

title: Great location but the rooms feel a little tired
text:
The rooms are a decent size for NY and offer everything you need - hair dryer, USB ports, TV, etc. Staff was very friendly and the location was super convenient. 
The one thing I will say is that the bed was incredbily hard. Like I was on a futon in college instead of a mattress in a 4 star hotel. Oh and no washclothes included in the linen. Just hand and body towels. A little odd but a choice, I guess.

title: Tiny Rooms with part soft and part lumpy beds
text: If your idea of a great stay is paying $796.61 per night (that includes the seven types of taxes and fees for the city) and receiving very basic service, beds that are low to the floor and not comfortable in a tiny room equipped with a very expensive mini bar, then this is the place for you!

title: Won’t be returning
text:
Cons
- staff at checkin was extremely rude and gave no instructions about the hotel. No details were shared about wifi, pool, bar area hours, food, amenities, check out time, house keeping, etc. nothing. We didn’t get so much as a smile or hello, just a “your name?”
- there were no water bottles in the room upon arrival 
- The room was not well kept. There were dents on furniture and walls, stains on furniture. Generally, furniture and decor was outdated and felt cheap. 
-   Definitely a party hotel, there was used glassware up and down the hallways morning and night 
- We called the front desk 3 times for ear plugs and waited 45 min and got nothing. The 4th time we called the receptionist was super rude stating “we sent them up a long time ago”. 
- The audio and lighting in this room is horrible. There are no reading lights by bed. The only option if you want to read at night are the the full blown overhead lights. The sound from the TV oddly plays in the bathroom??? 
- there were only 2 towels for us in a room that was sleeping 4 so we had to call to request more sets 
- there were No smart plus and the outlets were very inconveniently placed 
- there were Hairs on the bed upon arrival and under the sheets 
- the Shower is see through.  if someone is showering you can see them through the bedroom. Not a good hotel if you’re staying and sharing the room with people you don’t want to see you naked. 
- If the bathroom light is on, the whole hotel room lights up so if someone is trying to sleep while another is in the bathroom, it’s impossible. 
- there is a weird Peep hole in the bathroom door (basically a hole where the handle should be) so there’s no privacy 
- they run Test alarms in the middle of the day with No notice at check in 
- there is No information in room on hotel amenities or instructions 
- the shower has a Shower curtain which billows and sticks to your body when showering

Positives
- Rooms were massive by NYC standards 
- Housekeeping staff was friendly 
- Water bottles were re stocked in our room daily at no charge once requested 
- One front desk gentleman was lovely. We asked to borrow a pen and he was nice. Can’t be said for any other staff we interacted with.

title: Dream stay at the Dream Hotel
text: My friend and I had a fabulous moms' weekend out at the Dream Hotel in Chelsea. It was such a lovely, relaxing experience. We're from Brooklyn, so it wasn't a far trip, but it definitely felt like we were transported to a different world for the weekend! The room was beautiful, the hotel staff was great, and having a club right on the roof was a plus!!

title: Should change its name to NIGHTMARE HOTEL
text: Would NOT recommend staying here. Was told one thing and received a different experience altogether. Not mention that this hotel is run down and old and should be gutted and redone. The staff was nice, but they promised things (e.g., free access to the club, upgraded rooms, etc.), but not only didn't deliver on them, but charged for club access and downgraded the room (for the same price). The staff also did not know what features/amenities the hotel had - asked for a business center (as it stated on the website) and was told that we could email them our files and they could print it out at the front desk. Asked for a meeting room (as stated on the website) and was told they did not have any (manager later confirmed that they do have meeting rooms and that they are available). Was told we would get premium Wifi, instead we received standard wifi that cut out or did not work for long periods of time.

title: Dare to Dream!
text: Overall the location was great. The hotel is walking distance from some great restaurants. On the weekends the lobby and front of hotel can be crowded as people are trying to go to the club that is located in the hotel. The quality of the rooms are lacking as well as the customer service.

title: Worst Hotel in New York
text: This hotel is trying to be both a nightclub and a hotel. If you expect to sleep, do not stay here. The quality of the rooms is terrible. Lumpy pillows, aged bedding, horrible lighting, no tv remotes or drinking glasses and a staff that is numb to the obviously persistent complaints.

title: Good for Partying; not for Relaxing
text: Definitely not a hotel to stay at for any sort of quiet. Getting to elevators on Friday and Saturday took over 10 minutes as crowds going to club take up all the space. Non-working toilet. Super Loud.

title: Most annoying hotel I have stayed at in NY
text: Let me start by saying that the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The view from the room was exceptional. The room and bathroom were poorly lit. Could hardly see it was so dark. The biggest complaint is from the dance club noise which started around 9:00pm and didn't stop until 4:00am. The whole building was reverberating from the beat of the music.  Did not help in getting a good night's sleep.

title: It’s like sleeping in a nightclub
text: Hotel didn’t have any facilities it took responsibility for.  You could only sit by the pool until 10.30am then after that you had to pay up to $300 to sit on a lounger so if you didn’t you had to sit on the floor whilst ‘reserved’ loungers stayed empty all day.  The hotel had a club on roof so at night the hotel and outside the hotel becomes a nightclub.  the noise is so bad it kept me awake all my last night and I was only on the 8th floor.  There were other floors in between me and the club on the roof.  I am looking for a refund for my last night as it was dreadful.  It’s just all cold and far too trendy for its own good.  Great location but that is the only thing going for it.  Do not book unless you want to use the club or sleep in a night club.

title: Bedroom disco
text: If you want to get zero sleep because of noise from the hotel nightclub (think pounding base vibrating through the bedroom) then this is the place for you. Otherwise the rooms are an ok size and have basic functions but really nothing special. The facilities of the hotel all seem to be operated as independent businesses - a couple of hundred dollars for a pool chair for the day is egregious at best. The only thing going for it is location

title: Terrible Stay - Please Avoid
text: Terrible experience....my room smelled like smoke for two days straight. Management told me they would take care of the issue and were not able to find a solution (person who was previously smoking cigarettes continued to do with no regard for management). I was then told that I would be eligible (a) move to another room (I had already paid for a pool access one and their offer didn't include this) or (b) change hotels and be refunded for the remainder of my stay. They have now refused to refund me the remaining stay after being told by the manager that I would be eligible. Would avoid this place as they do not care about you as a guest and do not honor their refunds.

title: A Perfect Manhattan Hotel Stay
text:
We were celebrating a significant wedding anniversary and wanted a hotel in Manhattan that could accommodate 14 family members in seven rooms. We also knew that the hotel had to have a large lobby so we could sit together with our family in the evenings.   We searched for a hotel in an exciting area of Manhattan to accommodate our guests' diverse interests and ages. The solution was the Dream Hotel in the Chelsea/Meatpacking district of New York. We were not disappointed! The hotel was once the annex of the National Maritime Union and, therefore, the round porthole windows. The hotel has a lovely outdoor pool, which was terrific for guests in July who had spent the day touring the city. Chelsea Market was a five-minute walk from the hotel, a site where our guests spent a lot of time exploring.

The staff of the hotel was incredible! They are trained to meet guests' requests with kindness, patience, and courtesy. In fact, in all of our travels, we have never worked with such an accommodating staff.  

Although the rooms we reserved were small, they were clean and more than adequate for everyone's needs. The bathrooms are large and very modern. They look as if they had just been renovated. There is a small cafe in the lobby where one can buy breakfast, which we did twice during our 5-day stay. However, with the Chelsea Market so close by, along with dozens and dozens of restaurants and bars within a short walking distance from the hotel, a restaurant was not needed. We think the Dream Hotel (now part of the Hyatt Hotel system)  is a wonderful and reasonably-priced choice in the most exciting area of New York.

title: Awesome stay
text: Enjoyed the atmosphere, train is nearby, very enjoyable stay. I usually stay in flushing because the city is a little hectic for me but I liked the area this hotel was located ins would definitely stay again

title: Dream?   Should be called Insomnia.
text: If you like loud thumping music resonating through the walls from the night club starting at 10pm, you’ll love not being able to sleep here. Avoid staying here if you want a good nights sleep!  Stay here If you like tossing and turning in bed while feeling the vibration of club tunes.

title: Perfect Proximity/Terrible Hotel
text:
Unfortunately the only pleasant experience I had was checking out. The room wasn’t clean, I went out and purchased cleaning products to clean it myself. 

Because we have children, we could only utilize the pool between 8:30AM-10:30AM. We saw there was a cafe by the pool however it did not operate during the time we were limited to using the pool. The pool attendant was lovely. 

We’ve stayed here several times. This was our first visit post pandemic, sadly the quality has gone downhill. The location of the hotel is convenient, but I will choose another hotel in the area for my next stay. 

I can not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Please consider staying elsewhere!
text:
My boyfriend and I booked a long weekend here, stayed from a Friday evening to Monday morning. I chose this hotel due to location, being close to part of the city we had not explored yet and because it had a pool.  It was an easy walk to Chelsea Market, The Little Island, The High Line, The Vessel, Greenwich Village & Meatpacking District, etc. It was a great location, but honestly, there wasn't enough positives about the hotel itself.  The line to check-in was long, which we understood for a Friday evening, and didn't seem so bad after I saw the line was nearly triple the size the next evening!  After checking in, we found out that the pool is only open to registered hotel guests from 8:00-10:30am daily. At 10:30am, they empty the pool area, close down for 30 minutes, then reopen to the public from 11am-6pm.  We also found out that you have to reserve pool chairs ahead of time (days or maybe weeks ahead of time, actually) and I was personally told by someone poolside that it cost them $200 for two chairs for the day.  With a wristband you have to acquire the day of from the front desk,  you can enter the pool deck with the outside guests between those hours of 11am-6pm - only if they have the space limitation to allow you in.  We did get wristbands for Sunday afternoon, so we sat on the edge of the pool, as there were no chairs available to us.  The poolside DJ was great, everyone seemed to be having a good time.  But when I tried to order a drink from a poolside waitress, she said "I'm only allowed to serve guests who reserved chairs, but you are welcome to walk inside to the bar to order for yourself."  The color of our wristbands were different than those who reserved and paid for chairs, that's how they could tell.  When really looking at the hotel website now, this is what it states:  "Daily Hours: 8:00am to 6:00pm. General Admission Pool Access does not include lounge chairs. Lounge chairs may be reserved in advance by clicking "Learn More".  General Admission Pool Access will be available to Registered Hotel Guests on a first come, first served basis due to spacing and capacity limitations."  
So my point is, please just be aware that as a registered hotel guest, you will only have access to the pool from 8:00-10:30am. Otherwise, you will either have to pay and reserve chairs for the day way ahead of time OR just take your chances and on a first come, first serve basis see if space limitations allow for you to get a wristband just to enter the  pool deck with no chairs or poolside service!  Yay!  I overheard from another pool guest that the hotel and the pool are separately owned, so this makes a tad more sense as to why it's ran this way.  
The King Bed Platinum Suite (with direct pool access) had a lot more space than you'd get at most NYC hotels, but the décor and quality of furniture was unimpressive.  The sitting chairs in our room were very tiny and not comfortable to sit and watch TV in them.  The bed was a very low platform style that was awkward and not comfortable to sleep in, the low profile ended up feeling very odd for a hotel room.  The walls are paper thin and we could clearly hear people talking and walking around in high heels next door... among hearing other things, ha!  The toilet resembled one you'd find in a campground bathhouse and was situated so high that my toes could barely touch the ground when seated (I'm 5'5").  The night club in the hotel is open until 3am - from our room we could definitely hear the music but thankfully not loud enough that it kept us awake.  The line for the night club started in the lobby and extended outside to the front of the building making it super congested when we'd enter/exit the hotel.  We did order room service the first night, which delivers from Philippe, an Asian inspired restaurant in the hotel.  Food was great and super easy to order online, but very pricey... we split one main dish, one side dish, one appetizer and one cocktail and it came to $123.99 with tip.
To top off our trip, my card on file was charged a $50 plus tax per night "facility fee" upon checkout.  I paid in advance for the hotel room and I've never, ever seen a fee like that being charged after the fact.  I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, especially with kids, as it's not kid friendly at all.  And maybe I should have read the fine print on the website a little closer and maybe I wouldn't have felt so disappointed or unwelcome in my own hotel.

title: Don’t
text: The staff does not cater to ethnic populations. The customer service was below average. There was a giant cockroach in my shower upon arrival. There were no washcloths in the room hence they do not cater to ethnic populations. I would not suggest this hotel to any friends or family very disappointed with my choice to stay here.

title: Not sold on this one….
text: Staff was friendly, conveniently located , but it really stops there. I would never stay here again or recommend it. Not sure who determined this was a luxury hotel… furniture is small & uncomfortable, which brings me to the bed…also uncomfortable and the bed frame or platform, if you can call it that sits on the floor… I’ve never stayed at a hotel with the mattress almost on the floor. Not enough outlets and extremely slow charging. It’s a hip, cool vibe…until you come to your room. We won’t discuss “fees” not to mention you’ll call downstairs, but no one answers..Wish I would’ve paid more attention to reviews. There are better options, I blame myself for not finding one.

title: Such a big room!
text:
Absolutely loved this hotel! 
Great location - subway 2 minutes walk away, although we walked everywhere! Chelsea Market at the end of the street, easy access to Meatpacking district, Greenwich village.
Away from the madness with a real ‘local’ feel.

The hotel itself…..the room was amazing! Really spacious, modern & clean with a great bathroom.

Lots of people coming & going because of the restaurants & rooftop bar/club, but we liked that. 
We had a room on the 9th floor and the club didn’t disturb us 🤷🏼‍♀️

Pool area is great with a DJ and a beach club feel - you need to reserve & pay extra for a bed but are able to sit by the pool & have a drink/food anyway. 

Staff were all great - the guy running the door for the rooftop club got us in even though there was a private party as it was our last night. Think if you’re polite & friendly it works wonders 😊

title: Dreamy Chic Hotel
text: Dream is a great location to have an adventurous weekend whether you want to stay in or not. The room was smaller than expected along with the mini balcony. Check out my picture. The pool was nice and the roof top bar was not open when I stayed at this location.

title: Gross rooms
text:
The hotel lobby is very nice and the pool is interesting.  I don’t think people should be able to just buy a wrist band and sit around the pool for $25.  

The rooms were gross.  Low beds, uncomfortable, pillows were HORRIBLE and when I asked for additional they didn’t have any. Not impressed at all. Did not have a nice bar. 

The area is awesome but find someplace else. Definitely not a 4/5 star hotel.

title: Will not be back
text:
Hidden fees ( 50 S for facility fee with its corresponding occupancy facility fee and its taxes) so do not believe the price per night announced it goes up by 100$ with these extras and nyc taxes .  
It is a cheap design hotel, a "wanna be". Uncomfortable table to work.
 Will not be back

title: Amazing Stay!
text: I went with my wife and had a wonderful time. The service was amazing. We had an amazing room which was spotless. The location was great, you could walk anywhere. I highly recommend this wonderful property!

title: Never never never again
text:
PROs - 
The staff is very nice, and they brought me a bucket of ice each night when I asked. The location is excellent.

CONS -
-So loud. The nightclubs and clientele of the hotel (lots of young partygoers) meant that I was regularly woken up at 4am to loud music, yelling, door slamming, etc. I stayed for 2 weeks for work, and this was the norm more often than not.
-Old and shabby. I stayed in 2 different rooms, both had ripped carpet, almost non existent lighting in the bathrooms, and finicky air conditioning. Some of the outlets didn't work, the TV kept freezing, and the fridge was half stocked/not cold.
-Horrible bed. Super itchy sheets, low to the ground, very uncomfortable.
-Room service. No room service until the evening, and they will not charge to the room (no clue why). 

I didn't use the pool or club so can't speak to that. This place gave me nightmares - never again!

title: Disappointing
text:
Place lacks basic amenities, not enough staff, the pool had a cover charge even  though we  were hotel guest. No place to buy a drink other than pool bar. I would not recommend unless you are 25 and enjoy overpaying for a bed.

No concierge, no way to get a taxi,

title: Dream? More like a Nightmare!
text:
This hotel is a nightmare!!!
Let’s start off with Friday check in:  there was only 1 agent,  a line of more than 10 people trying to check in and it was moving very slow. Also, the lobby sits directly  below the hotel pool; so, the “pool party” guests were crowding the lobby making the area hot and uncomfortable. air conditioning wasn’t working and the lobby was extremely hot.

Secondly, the room was super small! No convenient outlets to charge phones, very little water pressure in the bathroom, not enough towels, and the beds were super lumpy (I had to sleep on the floor) and the pillows were paper thin. I tried asking for more pillows but housekeeping said they ran out. 

Third- they charge guests to use the pool $50/lounge chair on the weekends. Guests could only go from 8am-10:30am.

Fourth- there is a rooftop lounge/bar “PHD” in the hotel. We had to wait in a long line to get in, but after 30 minutes we gave up. The entrance/line for the rooftop lounge PHD is in the the main entrance and makes the lobby very bus at night. 

Fifth- -the back elevator lobby  area smelled like sewer/dirty diaper/garbage through our whole 4 day stay here.   

Sixth- the bathroom lighting was very dim. Hard to apply make up.  The bathroom fixtures are awkward, could poke your eye out trying to wash your face.

Seventh- the touch button light switches were very hard to figure out (and I’m a techie), and one of the beds was near the panel of switches glowing in your face while trying to sleep. 
Lastly, I would not recommend this hotel unless you are in the I “don’t care mode”. This is hotel is too loud, too many people walking through the hallways, and you can 
hear the partying. Would not come here with a family of young kids. 

Not worth the money, at all!!

title: An unpleasant stay at the dream hotel
text:
I regret to share my recent experience at Dreams Hotel in downtown, which was far from the dreamy getaway I had hoped for. From the moment we checked in, the service was subpar, with Paul attempting to juggle too many tasks at once, resulting in a frustrating check-in process.

To add to the disappointment, our room was a major letdown. The outdated furniture covered in layers of paint gave the room an unpleasant and worn-out feel. The old AM/FM radio seemed like a relic from the past, contributing to the outdated ambiance.

The room's poor lighting only worsened the situation, making it difficult to create a cozy and relaxing atmosphere. Moreover, the window was in dire need of a thorough cleaning, obstructing any chances of enjoying the outside view. The dirty shower curtain and the smelly, filthy carpet further added to the lackluster experience.

As if that wasn't enough, the pool area, which was oversold, posed a safety hazard, while the service staff exhibited a complete lack of professionalism, leaving us feeling unwelcome and disappointed.
