In summary, my stay at Dreams Hotel in downtown was marred by an overwhelming list of issues - from the insufficient service during check-in to the disappointing room conditions and inadequate amenities. It's unfortunate that the hotel failed to meet even the most basic standards of cleanliness and comfort. I sincerely hope that the management addresses these concerns promptly to ensure a more pleasant experience for future guests.

title: Dirty bed sheets from previous occupancy
text:
I stayed here for a work trip for training at Google. The hotel is nice. However, our bedsheets were never changed from the previous guests. My co worker found a strange drawing in her bed, probably from a kid. I then noticed mine had some evidence of not being clean. We arrived super late (coming from west coast) and we’re extremely tired so we didn’t even bother to bring it up. This happened a little while back, but I am still scarred from this experience. My advice just make sure your bed has been cleaned if you stay here!

Besides that everything was nice. But I’m sorry I have to give 2 stars because of having a dirty bed.

title: Read reviews before staying here!
text: Read reviews before staying here!   Not worth the money they want.  Desk clerk said the 5th floor facing the street would be quiet.  Guess he never stayed there before!  Noise and more noise!  Drunk people coming out of their nightclub and where ever they come from.  Shouting until all hours, horns blowing, people slamming the doors to their rooms!  Very displeased!  The bed was a small mattress on top of an oversized board underneath it.  Very tacky indeed!  Booze on the shelves and in the fridge!   Really!  Don't take any of it because you will surely be overcharged!  Who needs an overrated place like this!  Only in NYC!  So beware if you plan on staying at Dream Hotel because it is anything but!

title: Don't expect to sleep.
text: I am here for work and haven't slept at all. Constant noise from drunk club goers loitering on the street out front. The street gets gridlocked from Ubers picking up people from the club so the horns never stop. Garbage pickup at the Google offices at 3 am which also causes horn honking.  I get that this is a vibrant environment but get a doorman and soundproof something. I'm not new to NYC but have never experienced noise like this in my life. As I write this at 4:12 am there is a fight out front. 4th floor room and south tower. Nightmare

title: Be careful picking this one
text: I thought I did all my due diligence on this one. I read all the reviews read articles one that called this the number hotel in the meat packing district. I travel to NY twice a week every month and thought I would try this area and hotel. The area is great the hotel not great at all. I asked for a lower room in the north tower as I heard the other rooms are noisier. I got a room on the 4th thank you. But the walls are so thin I could hear the room next to me at 3 AM each night. We had lots of street people loitering at the entry door, this hotel doesn't have a door person. The rooms are very dated and not very clean. The beds on the floor. The location is great the pool looks great. Be careful picking this one it's not a Hyatt Dreams you would expect.

title: do not stay, unless you plan to stay up all night
text:
I wanted to share with you all a recent experience that I had at the Dream Downtown which is near Chelsea market in New York City. I booked my hotel through my CC rewards program from June 30 to July 3 of this year, 2023. 
They gave me the room on the second floor south facing right above the entrance to the hotel. Once the club began it was nonstop music, rowdiness, doors slamming until 5:45 in the morning!!! I traveled with a noisemaker and earplugs; which did not help!!
Ihighly recommend not staying at this hotel as when I complained that night they said that they were booked and would be unable to give me a new room that was at 1:30 in the morning. 
When I went downstairs the next day to complain and to cancel the rest of my reservation due to my inability to sleep the entire night they said that they could give me a new room, I politely declined and said that I will be contacting them through my rewards program to receive my cancellation paid in full. They said that they would keep a note of that on my account as they said that they would be happy to help with this matter since I had such a horrible night. 
 I called my rewards program company for my refund and they called the hotel and they only gave me a refund for Sunday night i.e. the cheapest night. I highly recommend staying elsewhere if you choose to stay in that area.

title: Exceeding expectations!
text: Booked the Dream Hotel only because I got a fab deal on the room. Half the rate if the Citizen M Bowery where I usually stay. The rating was not great but I thought for one night I would take a chance. The only thing not so great was checking in. Friendly service could not really compensate for late check in and long lines. . The lobby is really beautiful with the bottom of the pool right above letting sunlight in. The rooms are really nice and the view to the north is amazing of the Empire State Building. The Pool area is not huge but lovely. The location is amazing right by Chelsea market, the  High line and my fave in the city - Little Island. Would 100 percent stay again …

title: Imperdible
text:
Gran hotel en pleno barrio chelsea… pileta cómoda con el detalle de sus vistas desde PB de entrada al hotel… buen atencion, tanto en la recepción y demás lugares. Cuarto muy cómodos, buen baño, y buena vista.
Es un hotel muy recomendable para un viaje de pareja. Y con muchas opciones en cercanía

title: DO NOT choose this hotel for the rooftop bar - It is not part of the hotel!!! But the rooms are fantastic.
text:
Overall it was a nice hotel, but very misleading regarding the rooftop bar which was why we decided to stay there.  The rooftop opens at 10 pm so there is no chance to see it during the day except for Saturday when it opens at 5 pm - but there is no guarantee you will get to actually get to go to the rooftop!!!!  It is separate and you have to take a separate elevator that is guarded by a bouncer.  We were told that we would have to get in the line that was out the door and down the sidewalk to talk to the bouncer who would then decide if he wanted to grant us access and tell us how much we needed to pay, he said it could be $100 per person or $500 up to a $1000 per person and this was up to the bouncer.  What???????  So we never even got to see this rooftop area,  The pool is also not really meant for the guests either.  It is open for guests from 8:30 am till 10:30 am then it closes for an hour and at 11 am you can go to the pool but you have to pay for a chair and again some bouncer is able to charge you whatever he feels and there is a line for this also.  

On a positive note, our room was awesome - we stayed in a King Gold room,  it was huge and we had a view of the Empire State Building.  I had no complaints about the room or the lobby they were both very nice,  The noise from the rooftop was not bad either it really was no big deal.  The front lobby staff was very nice and our room was cleaned every day.  Our View was amazing.

title: Odd - and unexpectedly expensive for the experience
text:
Part hotel and part nightclub, this is one of those places that is well situated but unsure of which it wants to be. 

Located in the Meat Packing district on the west side of the island, it’s just yards from Soho and Chelsea Market, where there are plenty of bars to enjoy. A metro link is 200m away, and loads of buses will connect across the city. 

But with a nightclub on the 12th floor, be warned mid week onwards for a packed lobby of excited clubbers from late evening through to groups of dazed young things into the early morning. The club sound permeates the building, I was on the 9th, asked to be moved to the 8th and still the beat and the bass rumbled through. 

The rooms are basic but comfortable, however the sound proofing between rooms is poor. Enjoy the bottles of tequila, vodka and the usual minibar but don’t expect a kettle. There’s a small bar in the lobby, and a small cafe on the ground floor which serves excellent coffee, but that’s it for food & beverage.

The sting? Watch out for the 'facilities fee' charge at $50 per day of stay plus taxes. This is quite an uplift for the most basic of services: bottled water, wifi and a basic gym.

Upside? Helpful staff, clearly trying to navigate the needs of guests in the melee of clubbers accessing the club..via the lobby!

title: Young, Fly, & Fun !!
text: Amazing stay! i had complications with a different hotel, i artist Dream Downtown after 1am and was pleasantly greeted by Chad with the warmest smile. I needed that after the HORRIBLE day of travel I had. Chad went above and beyond to accommodate me & my sister so last minute. He made us feel like VIP guests to take our minds off of the stress we endured. Kara rushed up to the room to make sure it was just right before we went in. I’ve never been treated with such kindness. I genuinely appreciate the level of customer service I received at Dream hotel. Chad disproved the stereotype that New Yorkers are rude, because he was the nicest person I’ve met in a long time. If you see this Chad THANK YOU!  Bed was so comfortable (Alaska deli & Stella pizza for delicious cheap eats. The chopped cheese at Alaska deli is bangin)

title: Worst Service & Sleep of my Life!
text: If you want to have the WORST night of your life for Mother’s Day weekend then stay at dream hotel on the 11th floor in the Gold Room. Specifically room 1105. It was bad enough that they made us wait 20mins in the lobby for our room to be ready because housekeeping was ‘slow’ that day when check in is suppose to be at  3pm. You just hear constant booming all night like you’re being punched in the head until 4am from the  club on the rooftop & the front desk doesn’t care one bit &  HANGS up on you when you call & complain that you can’t sleep & the sound machine is broke in the room. Worst hotel & worst service ever. Literally have never been treated this way before in my life ! We have stayed here 4x before & will never stay again! How insulting that they would even give someone this room…. You should be ashamed of yourselves!

title: Cornelius is excellent and efficient
text: I am leaving this review for Cornelius at security. He’s come in today on his day off to cover for a colleague. He had the job of searching for a package for me that got delivered last week that front desk had not passed on to the guest who it was addressed to. He took the information, investigated, and although the staff member who signed for the package was off today, he ensured that he resolved the issue by finding the package and leaving instructions for it to be collected on my behalf, when he is not on shift tomorrow. Excellent and efficient and patient.

title: Top Hotel in Meatpacking for the Right Price
text: I spent much of last year in New York City working on a project for my company. So I've tried many of the hotels in the area and some a bit further away. There's no better choice than the Dream. By far the best value in the Meatpacking district, and Chelsea too. Its at least on par with the most well-known Meatpacking hotels, but for a much more appropriate price. Rooms are extremely spacious (for NYC) and the suites are great if you need more space. Good water pressure, which is surprisingly scarce around town. It can be noisy, especially on the weekends, as they offer some great nightlife. But here's a tip for the entire Meatpacking district where every hip hotel has a nightclub or two: its noisy on the weekends. Long story short, great value, great hotel.

title: Return trip from our honeymoon
text: Very close to the train and Chelsea market, good price for the location. Felt a little dated and the shower curtain chain link didn’t seem practical. The bell staff was exceptional, had a great chat with the gentleman who took care of our bags.

title: Dream Does It Again!
text:
Again, the Dream delivers! I've stayed at the one in Los Angeles and now in NYC! It was amazing! I read some of the reviews and was very skeptical, but thank God I went with my better judgement! It was a great location! The staff was great! EXTREMELY friendly and offered lots of help with an extenuating circumstance I had arise. The rooms were clean and up to date. A bit smaller than I'd prefer, but hey... its NYC.... what do you expect? 
I would suggest staying in the tower opposite of the nightclub of noise is an issue with you. We stayed in the 3rd floor of the north tower and couldn't hear anything. The pool was closed, but I'm sure we would've had lots of traffic outside of our balcony had it been open. 
We visited the nightclub on the top floor and it was really cool. You can really come to this hotel and not have to leave. I didn't leave very much at all. I'll definitely be staying here again if I come back

title: Nice Room, Trendy Younger Vibe, Not a business hotel.
text:
The hotel location is just on the outskirts of the Chelsea area in Manhattan. Overall the vibe here is very cool and lots of younger people here. 

When I walked in the check in the lobby was going off with some sort of party and people were having a good time, no big deal, But the lobby often has parties going on it seems.

Check in was quick and I was directly to the 2nd tower where my room would be.

The room itself was really nice, clean and modern, I did find some broken glass in my carpet, but i can deal with it.

The bed was comfortable and the shower was good and I enjoyed the view from my room.

I was on a higher floor and the only issue with that, though it did not effect me, was I could hear the club on the top floor until about 230AM, the bass from the music did sort of make it's way down to my room, but I had no problem sleeping through it.

Overall a really nice stay here.

title: Stay away
text:
Don’t go to this place. At check in, we were charged and additional $50 “facility fee” in addition to the quoted rate. I asked what facilities they had. He said, a bar. I asked if the drinks were therefore included. He said, of course not. 
They highlight “night life” at this location. The only night life we were treated to was the knock down drag out fight the couple in the next room had from 3 to 3:45 am. I think he left then. 
The $290 room cost us $405. Even the water in the room came at an additional fee. 
Rip off.

title: It's not a cookie cutter hotel
text:
Stayed at the hotel for a work function. The hotel doesn't have the best signage on the street so it is easy to pass by if you're not really looking. The lobby was pleasant and very modern. The front desk staff were helpful. I was able to check in and go right to my room, but they do offer baggage storage if your room is not quite ready.  The lobby/bar area is fun and was crowded most evenings. 
The rooms were pretty funky. Lots of glass in the rooms. The lights are controlled by buttons on the walls. The bathroom has the tallest shower curtain I've ever seen and it's made out of chains. There is a mini bar available. The room was actually a decent size for NY standards. I had a large bed, a big window and the bathroom was good sized. 
Since I was there for a work function, I ended up needing to print a few things and they do not have a business center. I was surprised by that, but the front desk staff were helpful and printed it for me. 
My one complaint was that my lights were not working properly. They would go on and off throughout my two day stay at random. Wasn't great to have the lights go out in the middle of my shower. I reached out to the front desk twice about it. The first time they sent a maintenance staff up to look at it and he couldn't fix it. The second time I'm not sure anyone came up. Thankfully there were two lamps (desk lamps) that did not operate off the main lighting system so I wasn't completely in the dark.

title: Great Time!
text: Ray Wong & the rest of the Dream/Tao team made my dinner experience amazing! I was hosting friends from out of town and the surprise dessert boat & carrot cake really tipped the experience over the edge.  Great to see the collaboration between the hotel/food & beverage team!

title:
I was promised a refund due to a 4am
Party below our room but still waiting
text:
We were recommended this hotel by Booking.com and I need to post this as I don’t want another family suffering the same fate.  It’s not for family it’s a pretentious hang out with night club built into it. 
This hotel had a party till 4am with music so loud it vibrated the walls and was impossible to sleep.  We were in our room listening to drunk people run up and  down the halls. 
The hotel said it’s a party area! No refund sorry you could have moved rooms
Booking.com promised a refund for the night but are now backing down even though I have it in writing from them
This was meant to be a birthday treat for our son it ended up being a nightmare and to be honest a little scary. 
The rooms have very small beds, no cups, not enough towels for our party size. Parking is opposite and it’s $80 a night.

title: Customer Service Appreciated!
text: I have an upcoming visit in March and I made an error on my reservation and made it for Feb by mistake. I contacted the reservation office and spoke with Yelenda who was not only able to help me correct the issue, but also made sure I was I was not penalized for my error. This is outstanding customer service. 👏 Thank you. I look forward to my upcoming visit with the confidence Dream Downtown has the customer service values I respect and value.

title: Immaculate
text: Stayed for a last minute stay and everything from the amenities to the cleanliness were top notch. The staff were very pleasant and accommodating too. I will definitely be returning for future upcoming trips.

title: 10 minutes Waiting for the Elevator to go to the 2nd Floor
text:
Great location in the Chelsea area - just across from Chelsea Market
BUT...rooms need major updating, the carpet in my room looked so filthy it made me cringe.  Furniture worn out and uncomfortable. Needs new paint job.
My worst complaint is waiting for an elevator for 10 minutes (because they were having a party on the Penthouse) they dedicated 1 of the only 3 elevators to the guests of the party.  Most annoying part was my room was on the 2nd floor but had NO staircase access? Is that even legal?

title: Great service, convenient location
text:
I enjoyed my stay at the Dream Downtown. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the room was lovely. Being able to open the window was awesome. The king bed wasn't as firm or supportive as I'd like, but perhaps they'll be changing the mattresses soon. Look out for the mini-fridge and mini-bar; the front desk warned us that they are easily triggered and you'd have to have things taken off your bill. 

We were on the 7th floor, and from Wednesday night on we could hear the bass coming from the upstairs nightclub. That said, with earplugs it wasn't really a problem at all and otherwise it was very quiet. Very little street noise even, which surprised me.  I got several fantastic tips from the concierge including the best massage I've ever had, so kudos for the great recommendations. Also, there was a lovely note greeting me when I arrived along with a small box of chocolates and water bottles. Much appreciated.

 I loved the Karl Lagerfeld toiletries that were provided--I'm trying to find the same Agrumes et Vetiver lotion somewhere online because it was so yummy.

title: Amazing hotel, great staff and a great experience.  Hotel was elegant, with amazing fun decor and a great vibe!
text: This hotel is posh and cozy in a really great area with lots of dining options.  The rooms are clean and elegant, the staff is also top notch.  With the area being safe and subway being so close it was east to enjoy my stay outside the room.  Stay here you will not be sorry!

title: What a dreamy place!
text:
What a “dreamy” experience we had at Dream Downtown! Our entire experience was great - from the comfort of the rooms to the friendly, helpful attitude of the staff. I particularly loved talking with a guy named Mike that worked there. He was so informative about the history of the hotel and surrounding area.
I’d love to return in the summer when the pool is open.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: This hotel is opulent and the staff  is accommodating.  Don’t miss out on one of the best hotel experiences in NYC.  Room are spacious and well appointed.  Don’t miss out on summer and the warmer months for the amazing pool experience.  Thank you Dream for making my NYC trip awesome!

title: Do not stay on the 11th floor
text:
There is a club on the 12th floor of the hotel that makes the 11th floor rooms unlivable. The hotel night staff is snarky unhelpful and condescending when you call about the thumping music saying that if you don’t like it you can leave. 
Would strongly suggest avoiding that floor at all cost, not worth the frustration. Would also suggest the hotel re train or replace the night manager of the front desk- his attitude is simply not cut out for a role in hospitality.

title: Second visit so disappointing
text: This was a return visit after a few years and it was such a disappointment. Beginning with the rude front desk staff. The noise from the nightclub was all night (4am) and we had strange knocks on our door early in the morning (both days). very thin walls between rooms. No amenities (one roll of TP). Do not recommend.

title: Worst hotel ever!
text:
Worst hotel /definitely not a 4 star/awful rooms and extremely bad service.

1-We checked in and reception hardly greeted us. They made us stand in a long queue and didnot even apologise for the inconvenience
2-The room was booked for 2 people. They gave us a 1 dressing gown and no toiletries. We had to call them and then they came with everything. The room had nothing in it. The room is also very small and bare.
3-No complimentary water so make sure you buy your own!
4-The heating in the room didnot work and in -2 degrees you definitely need heat. Again we had to call them to come fix this
5-At 12.30am we were woken up by lots of noise from our neighbours. This went on for 1 hour and we had to call reception twice to sort this out
6-The though of staying in this hotel for the next couple of nights was a dreadful thought
We complained to the manager who didnot seem to care. He gave us a refund back but charged us for our night which is disgraceful. His name was Chris and he could not even look at us face to face.
8-We then had to find new accommodation for our short Christmas trip to New York which we were so excited about.
9- This caused us to spend more money and lots of inconvenience

Do not stay at this awful hotel!

title: Best choice in Meatpacking
text: I have stayed in a few hotels now in the Meatpacking area in NYC these past few months and have had the best experience with Dream. I found the room the biggest and well cleaned; and the service overall much better than the other hotels (including the Standard). The team at Dream Downtown went above and beyond to make sure I was looked after - especially Anthony, who is charming. It is also worth a massive shout out to Phillipe Chow - the restaurant in the hotel, which has hands down the best Chinese food in the city. I will only be choosing to stay with Dream for my upcoming trips to NYC. Thank you to all the staff for making my trip so enjoyable.

title: $500/night, but no bar soap?
text:
Pretty disappointed with my stay - expensive room, and they couldn't even include bar soap in the room, I had to buy my own at CVS.  Seriously, will never forget that.  In addition, the one garbage can in the room was the size of a soup can.  Just weird.

My friends stayed in a separate room and had an alarm go off every hour on the hour.  For a top tier NYC hotel, didn't really seem like it.

title: Dream or Nightmare?
text: Ordinary amenities such as a coffee maker, ice bucket and shower cap are lacking. Supposedly you call call the front desk for these items, but no where does it tell you, you can request a coffee maker. There is a top floor club that blasts the bass until 4 am so if you plan on sleeping, which is generally why one goes to a hotel, forget it!! Was given late check out needed because I hadn't slept, went down to buy cofee because there was not maker in the room, came back and the key no longer worked. The desk clerk failed to mention that I needed to stop by the front desk to have the key reactivated. For the exhorbitant price that I paid for the room, this was not the type of service I expected.

title: Depends what you are looking for
text: Stayed at the Dream this past weekend. The location is awesome. Across from Chelsea Market and attached to some of the nicest bars/restaurants in Chelsea. The lobby is super trendy and fun and check-in was quick. The rooms are outdated, especially the bathroom. The amenities in the room are minimal. We had a beautiful view on the top floor but were kept up all night from the DJ at the rooftop and unfortunately the sound machine in the room didn’t work. I’d stay again but only if I had to be in that area and received a better rate.

title: Dream hotel for a dream stay!
text:
Amazing experience at Dream Downtown. 
Perfect location with walking distance from the fabulous Time Square and Central Park.
The decoration of the rooms were done with style and simplicity. Everything was perfectly clean and the staff was really helpful and welcoming. Also I've rarely slept in beds that comfortable! And even thou the city is very loud, the room was totally quiet once the windows were shut. Just like magic.
To finish, the view was absolutely stunning! 

Nothing wrong to say about the place. Just go see by yourself!

title: Very central hotel with amazing cafe food, lots to do around and very friendly staff.
text:
We visited the Dream Downtown hotel between the 17th and 22nd October 2022. We had 3 adjoining rooms on the 7th floor with a massive terrace right opposite the Google building and with the Empire State & 1 Vandebilt Buildings as our views. Right above our rooms was the PHD club but the rooms are so well sound-proofed that had I not seen the flashing lights reflected in the building opposite us, I wouldn’t even have known there was a club upstairs. 

The hotel lobby is magnificent and leads to the lobby bar with its very futuristic NFT Gallery curated by Ice Cube himself and includes art by Paris Hilton amongst others. The decorations are modern, fun, avant-garde and sublime. 

All the staff I interacted with went out of their way to help us out. I requested a kettle to make tea on our first day and they promptly delivered one up to the room. There is no room service currently but the hotel is located a stone’s throw from Chelsea Food Market which is very reasonably priced considering the area. 

The rooms themselves were fun. Each room had a murphy bed that could be stowed away for more space if needed and the TV comes right out of the ceiling. There is a safe and a mini fridge. The bathroom design is futuristic, the towels are replaced whenever required / requested and the water pressure is spot on. Furthermore,  toiletries are Karl Lagerfeld branded and give a further air of class and sophistication. 

Restaurants & Clubs - The hotel is right above Philippe’s - legit the best asian fusion cuisine I have EVER tasted - which doubles as a bar. The most amiable manager, Kostas, took great care of us. On the other side of the Dream Downtown is the TAO nightclub, right around the corner from the TAO restaurant, a gyro truck and another steak restaurant. 

The cafe at the hotel boasts the most delicious pastries and definitely try the avocado toast if you’re there. It is THE BEST! 

Many thanks to our housekeepers and service staff who all made sure we were comfortable and even anticipated our needs. They delivered the service with a friendly smile and a can-do attitude.  

I will definitely be back and I cannot wait!

title: First Solo trip in nyc
text: Best hotel room, I had a great view of the street below from my balcony, and the room was super clean, bed and pillows were great and the staff was so so friendly. The maid who was working on my floor was so so friendly and accommodating, she made me feel so welcome. The hotel itself is beautiful, I can’t wait to come back during the summer when the pool is open. Thanks dream for the best hotel stay ever!

title: the Dream Downtown lives up to its name!
text: I love the Dream Downtown! I have stayed there numerous times on business and its incredible. The wonderful service, rooms, fitness room, Philippe restaurant, in hotel coffee shop, are just amazing. Also close to the highline, Chelsea Market, Meat District, subways, great restaurants and everything you could want. Esther Song is an amazing hotelier and always makes sure everything is perfect. I also go to Dream to have drinks, rooftop party, corporate events and much more. 5 stars!

title: Almost sublime?
text:
I want to love this place. The portholes staring off into the endlessly entrancing Manhattan skyline. Morning Noon and Night it does not fail to captivate. What would I want to compliment this? A cocktail? Perhaps a liquor from your own minibar or maybe from outside>  Very well.   what else could complete this transcendent night? I look for the ice machine that is literally available in every hotel I have every stayed in, from a Motel Six to All Luxury places....and
 
Oh No Ice.....I call...No Service.........hmmmm.. They just don't do that there.....OK I make my way downstairs alllll the way.........The Front Desk is Amazing and Accommodating as they can be and give me ice in a giant metal champagne container.  huh, not what I imagined.  I suppose this is the punishment for not being the right kind of person to come to the nightclub?  Ok Sure. I got the Ice. But I had to trek downstairs and bother the poor person there to do something that is not remotely a task they are supposed to do.  Just not a thing one should have to do when paying this kind of money. 

Why die on this hill? Just give your guests ice.

title: Amazing Location !!!
text: Dream is located in the heart of Chelsea and Meat Packing and only steps away from Little Island. Not only were the city sites amazing but so is the hotel. From the friendly and accommodating Chad at the Front Desk, to Esther Song for making all our special requests happen, to housekeeping. Can’t wait to stay again!

title: Guest Friendly
text: A wonderful experience. The staff were eager to assist booking, organizing and finding the best deals. I had a large party to contend with and received over and above, experienced personnel assistance. I strongly recommend Dream Downtown.

title: Hotel with IT factor
text: Hosted an event here in late September and couldn't be happier with the experience. The staff are knowledgeable and extremely accommodating and the hotel itself just has the ultimate cool factor. Hotel was very clean with great and interesting interior design unlike any other hotel I've been to before. Major shoutout to to Esther Song for being an amazing hotel contact and making our time in NYC so memorable. I highly recommend this hotel for a younger crowd; two restaurants attached with a café ad lobby bar and rooftop bar so you don't need to go far for amazing food (highly recommend TAO). Our corporate event was elevated thanks to the amazing staff and location here at the Dream.

title: Pretentious and mediocre
text: Loud music day and night, i paid $600 a night and couldn't get a wink of sleep as the bed was trembling from the bass. The elevator doesn't work properly and you have to try your card 5 times to get to your floor. Below average bedding, the decoration may have been swanky in the past but now it's just tired. Lady at the reception was nice though. Probably a good nightclub but a bad hotel, they simply have none of the basics right.

title: Excellent Choice for NYC!!
text: I have had the pleasure of staying at both the Dream Midtown and Downtown properties, are both are fantastic locations and vibes.  Rooms are great, staff are wonderful , prices are reasonable -- all round great choice.  Have dealt with the hotels on a Business and leisure level and couldnt more highly recommend!

title: Maria Maria she reminds of a Dream team story!
text: Maria treated me with the warmth and kindness that makes those that work in the service industry is customers happy to do business with establishments that employee “Maria-esque” quality members of their squad.  Thank you Maria, and the rest of the Dream team that make this hotel my choice stay on all past and future NYC stays!

title: Nice an lively hotel, need a bit more mainteinence
text:
Nice and lively hotel.
I've come back after years of lockdown.
It is still nice even if a bit of mantainance would be need.
Overall is OK.
Unfortunatelly NY need to find a new normal as it is not populated as before

title: Amazing Staff Made the Stay Perfect
text:
Stayed here labour day long weekend with my fiancé. We were early for checkin but they were able to hold our bags and send us a text when the room was ready. The lady who did our check in was very helpful and friendly. As well as the gentleman who handled our bags. 

The gentleman Chad at the reception desk in the evenings was so courteous and friendly. He made my trip! He was so welcoming and went above and beyond for us. Dream hotel is lucky to have him because he treats the guests so perfectly! 

The only compliant I have is with the PHD staff. The men that run the club upstairs are very rude and need to learn that this is a hotel first and club second. The hotel guests are always here and the club patrons stay for a few hours and leave. Therefore they should treat hotel guests with respect. 

Overall I do recommend this hotel. It was clean and a good size for Manhattan standards. The hotel staff are exceptional! Great spot for the younger crowd that enjoy nightlife, since it is right in the heart of meatpacking district.

title: Never again
text:
No one was around to check in 
Rude, unhappy check in clerk experience 
Employee by the bar cutting his finger nails standing up while another employee laughed so disgusting 
Room was dirty 
Loud music all day and night
Don’t stay on the second floor ever
Horrible experience and extremely disappointed

title: Good for couples
text: Miguel was an excellent host by the pool very accommodating. The housekeeping people were friendly too. The room had a comfortable shower, good-smelling toiletries, and a comfortable bed. Good place to come on a weekend lots going on. Come on a Sunday so that the parking is free.

title: A Magical Night
text: I wanted to do something special for my engagement and decided to surprise my girlfriend after dinner. I reached out to the hotel and was assisted by the Director of Front office Chris Budhu who helped organize the surprise and personally took care of the booking. On the day of the engagement Chris  was not working, but when the extra mile to make certain everything was perfect and placed me in the great hands of the Hotel Manager Ray Wong. Ray took the service to the next level and personally set up my room with the candles, rose petals, and “marry me” sign. It was perfect.  Needless to say my girlfriend said “yes”. It will be a moment that both me and my now fiancé will always cherish and remember. Thank you for helping to make my proposal seamless and amazing; and thank you Ray and Chris for going the extra mile to make that night magical.

title: Thank you Maria!
text:
The Dream hotel is a fine hotel in a great location.  The rooms are as small as you’d expect them to be, but they’re adequate.

All of the staff was very friendly during my stay, but Maria went above and beyond to help me out when I had a last minute change of plans.  Thank you very much Maria for everything you did to help me out!  I am beyond grateful.

title: Vacances de rêve à New York
text: L’hôtel est super la piscine aussi voyions l’empire STATES building de la fenêtre de notre chambre petit inconvénient par rapport à la piscine et aux enfants qui n’ont pas le droit d’y aller l’après-midi car ils y font des ventes d’alcools

title: Perfect Pool Escape for the Day!
text:
While we didn't stay at the hotel overnight, we did purchase day passes to its gorgeous pool The Beach at Dream Downtown. We visited on a Thursday in August and it was fantastic. Not too crowded, beautiful space, delicious food & drinks, and fantastic service. If you're looking for a perfect escape right in the city, I'd highly recommend at least booking a pool reservation for the day -- it truly felt like an oasis and not a hotel right in the heart of the city!

The food was great -- we had the chips & guac appetizer and the fish tacos and steak tacos. All were delicious and very well-priced. Drink menu was great too!

Reservations were easy to make (prices vary based on the date), and they send you a reminder text the day before. Cancellation policies are super generous too (we actually had to cancel our first reservation, so this was a makeup). 

We took the train into Penn Station and it was a quick 15-minute walk. What we saw of the hotel was beautiful -- the lobby was gorgeous and the staff was super pleasant.

We will absolutely be back, and will probably consider spending the night, too!

title: Incredible spot
text: Absolutely the most beautiful hotel I’ve stayed in in New York. From an architecture and interior design perspective, I haven’t been to any other hotels yet that really compare. The lobby is extremely inviting with art all over the place that catches your eye as soon as you walk in. The room was perfectly designed with the low bed and dimmed lighting. I didn’t get to check out the pool but it looked amazing from above! Definitely want to come back here soon.

title: Mauvaise expérience
text:
Chambre minuscule donnant sur une minuscule cour avec vis à vis. Pas de minibar ni même une bouteille d’eau.
Mauvaise literie
Je suis restée deux nuits et le ménage n’a pas été fait après la première nuit.
Petit déjeuner tres basique. Pas de choix. Ils annonçaient un «  granola » . Il y avait des céréales mais pas de fruits.
Au global accueil tres basique.

title: Fun place for a few days
text: Stay was good. This is not the hotel for you if you are looking for quiet as there are lots of things going on from pool to club, etc. I was fine with it all and went to the club one night which was fun. Room was pretty good; hallways of hotel need to be updated. Staff were kind and respectful always. Maria at the front desk was incredibly helpful this morning on checkout. Five stars for her!

title: Style over substance
text:
Positives: Friendly staff, beautiful rooms Negatives; the light switches don’t all work, the shower curtain doesn’t fit or close, no
glasses or washcloths in the room, the AC can’t keep it cool, and the 3rd floor gym lights mostly don’t work, but the cheap, glaring daylight white lights beside the bed are way too bright l. I’ve seen worse - and much better too.

title: Swanky hotel - but not the most family friendly
text:
Don’t get me wrong, the Dream Downtown has a lot going for it.  Location being one, and it’s got a certain cool vibe about it. But as a family visiting NYC for a few days it felt a bit like it wasn’t for us. Kids under 21 couldn’t use the pool (one of the main reasons we booked it for our son) after 11am, as it turned into a party beach bar somewhat reminiscent of Entourage (cocktails, jewellery-draped beautiful people and open smoking of drugs). I get that’s how they market the place, but to have a pool that your paying guests can’t use after 11am (and not at all after 6pm) isn’t the best. We also had a few other issues - bathroom fan and a fridge that didn’t work, and were never fixed even after we reported them (we stayed 3 nights). Plus no coffee making facility or complimentary water - something you get in many of the most basic of motels. 
Overall, it didn’t spoil our trip, but for the hefty price, the hotel itself should have been part of the treat.

title: Nightclub (and hotel). The worst!
text:
They prioritize the public pool and nightclub over the hotel guests.  We paid a $50/day "resort fee" but it doesn't cover much (a gym that I didn't use). You have to compete with non-hotel guests after 11 am for space at the pool and IF you are lucky, they charge $150 for a chair.  They no longer offer room service (blamed Covid) but of course those non-hotel guests at the pool can get food delivered.  Super loud nightclub on the roof at night and obnoxiously loud pool during the day. 
I never took a nap and my swimsuit never hit the water. I wanted to like this place, but I'm done.  They don't deliver.  Housekeepers were great.

title: Very poor! Not clean
text:
Unfreindly staff, room very tied, room not clean every day , trash in corridors, no breakfast option, no coffee or tea in the room , very noisy at weekend when clubbers book room to carry on partying.
The hotel has a great location and great nightclub on the roof top. However everything is treated like a nightclub and guess like nightclubbers. So good if you are 25 and want this kind of experience. 
Pool is nice but overcrowded with external booking.
Hotel has potential but in needs of investment and better staff

title: Very nice hotel, recommended
text:
This hotel was a pleasant surprise!
Very modern, stylish place, great swimming pool, excellently located, great service by the staff.
The artwork in the lobby is amazing.
This hotel will be more suitable for youngsters and young couples because of the clubs / bars within and next door, however nice to families as well.
Close to Chelsea market and to the subway.

title: Dream Downtown was a Dream
text:
Loved it!  I wanted a hotel that was inspiring, modern, and in a great location. Dream hit every note. After a 15 hour road trip in a minivan with my 79 year old parents, three teenagers, and a guitar we arrived at Dream only to find out that Hotels.com had somehow accidentally cancelled our reservation at 3 am that morning. We were exhausted, frustrated and hotels.com offered us a measely $50 voucher for our inconvenience. The teenagers had already fallen in love with the hotel and didn't want to leave and we now needed two rooms for 3 nights and the price at Dream had almost doubled. 

Chris Budhu, the front office director saved the day. Chris is the definition of hospitality. He did everything he could to help us and even worked magic to honor the price that we originally had with hotels.com. People always make places great and thanks to Chris and the rest of the staff the Our stay was a 10 out a 10 which is not easy when you are dealing with three different generations.

title: Best Stay Of My Life
text:
Someone recommended i stay Here when i visited from LA. I’m originally from nyc and always heard great things however staying there is 10x better. The building is Gorgeous, the pool is immaculate, the service is top tier, and food was outstanding. 
If that’s not enough the location is the best in NYC, every restaurant and night club is in the area. 
20/10 stars

title: Money > Guests; Find a different hotel in NYC
text: I was very disappointed with my stay at the Dream Downtown. From beginning to end, and even after voicing complaints to the hotel manager after my stay, I experienced an impressive lack of hospitality from a hotel I used to think of as one of the top in NYC. I chose this hotel for my best friend’s bachelorette party and booked one of their top + most expensive suites for 2 nights. The Dream Downtown Sales Director provided me with inaccurate information about the bed sizes in the suite. When I went to speak with her in person after seeing the room, she could not care less that I was unhappy. The least she could have done was provide something minimal like a bottle of champagne to show any sense of empathy, however that was not the case. Another issue arose as I had been communicating with another employee of Dream about going to PHD on Friday around 6pm. She only told me it was up to doorman discretion (which is still ridiculous given we are high paying hotel guests). She neglected to tell me that PHD didn’t open until 10pm that night, and Google has the hours listed as open at 5pm. Again, the employee who told us it wasn’t open until 10pm could have provided the slightest bit of hospitality and said they could accommodate us elsewhere at the hotel. And lastly, we had lunch near the pool area. Each person’s meal was brought out separately over the course of 1 hour. Meanwhile the place was nearly empty. Overall, with the countless other hotel options in NYC, I would recommend going to many others before being ripped off at the Dream. I realize this is NYC, as I’ve lived here for 8 years. However I’ve stayed at other hotels for staycations and had much better experiences. And lastly after being passed around to different people for days before reaching the hotel manager, I still have not received any official form of compensation for the complaints I voiced almost a month ago.

title: Loved it!!!!
text: We came to the hotel after an event with a day full of more events. We were checked in by Anthony, who was courteous and extremely professional. He gave us a wonderful room. Truly amazing experience!!

title: Beautiful Hotel & Great Staff!
text: Stayed for only night but I wish it was longer! Greeted and checked in by the amazing Anthony! He gave us a beautiful room overlooking the pool. Room was big, very clean and modern. Will be visiting again! 10/10

title: Money is more important than Guests
text:
This hotel is beautiful, and we love the uptown location. But be warned: in the summer, their clubs are the priority. 

At 11am, hotel guests are asked to leave the pool and get wristbands if they want to return, and then the lounge chairs are $150 a person on top of the room we were already paying for. If you don’t want to pay that, you have to sit on the concrete. 

In addition, they are blasting music all day. They loved us to keep us from the rooftop club music, but that meant we could hear the pool music in our room all day. If you have to arrange your guests to try not to make them upset about the loud music, maybe just don’t have music that loud? 

Finally, the rooms had no coffee or tea. Not even on request. They tell you to go purchase it at the lobby cafe. 

It’s clear they are cutting corners to save money and their hotel guests are not important to them. The silly thing is: if they just made the pool for hotel guests only, they could fill their hotel and make the money they need without alienating the other guests.

title: We had an amazing time!
text: We loved staying at the Dream. Because we were on a lower floor it was more quiet which was perfect for my husband and I and our toddler. The cafe downstairs is great for quick breakfasts, we loved the pool even though we couldn’t use all day. The rooms are smaller but comfortable and the bathroom is quite big. Big thanks to Ray Wong for arranging the car service from and to the airport! Also - best location! We didn’t take one cab. Walking and subway are the way to go!

title: Best NYC hotel stay in YEARS!
text: I travel for business frequently and I have yet to come across a staff as wonderful at the people of Dream Downtown. On check in we dealt with Oeteka, she was fabulous. The Front Office Director Chris went above and beyond!! 10/10 will be back!

title: Had higher expectations
text:
When i used to live in NYC, i dreamt of staying here as I worked across the street.  Its circular exterior captivated me whenever i stare at the window.

When the chance to visit NYC for work, I jumped at the chance and booked my stay at the Dream Downtown.

Upon my arrival - the welcoming from the front desk was mediorce, it wasnt warm but it wasnt cold.  I had asked if my colleague and I could get a room close to each other but alas, we were able to get to be on the same floor.

The elevators are difficult to use - the card doesnt quite register your floor so you have to try a couple of times and if you miss it, you either end up going in the other direction (not just me but other guests had the same issue)

The hallways are extremely narrow and a bit dark but i guess that is the vibe of the hotel.

I got the bronze room (621?) which is the queen bed room.  The bed pretty much takes up the room itself and you have one chair and a desk with a chair.  It is really meant one person and i'm 5'1 and feel a bit crammed.

The bed itself is okay - more on the firm side, pillows are too soft.  The nightstands barely had any usb-a plug so i had to charge my phone by the desk.  There are light switch for you to turn off the lighting in the room by the bed.  
Desk area is pretty slim - my 13" laptop fit right but its still a bit slim for a standard desk.  The chair for the desk definitely looks worn and its feel fragile.

Mini bar - dont bother refrigerate anything because theres no space for your stuff - it is filled with beverages and if you remove any of it, it has a sensor to charge you.

Bathroom - its really spacious - too spacious -  Stand up shower with lots of room.  Karl Lagerfield toiletries, sink is wide but not too much space for your own items.  There is a towel ladder for towels.

here were my biggest peeves of this place
-the walls are pretty thin - i heard almost every single person who rolled through the hallways, i heard every door close and it kinda shook the room.  I generally dont think about it but it was very obvious in my room
-the bathroom is blocked by "glass panels", when i close the bathroom door, i swear the whole thing will fall apart - you can literally see it swaying
-the temp isnt stable - it will either be too hot or too cold 

My colleague said it was difficult for her to sleep since she heard the nightclub partying through the night (yes there are nightclubs and parties at this hotel)

If you are looking for a peaceful stay - i would recommend elsewhere

title: Make a special request NOT to be on floor 11 (top floor) or  don’t  get the  rooms!
text:
Nice looking hotel but don’t go for the Gold Rooms which are on the 11th Floor. You’re underneath a nightclub which is open until 4am. My room shook with the bass and you could hear every song as it if was playing in my room. 

The “be considerate of the your neighbours” sign in the room was thoughtful. I was going to start screaming along to Avicii with the crowd upstairs before in spotted that. They didn’t have to wake me up when it was all over. That’s when I got to sleep!

Save your money and go bronze, silver or stay elsewhere.  

Nice of them to offer ear plugs  for my trouble though…

title: Average for business, wouldn't pay for it myself
text:
-: During check-in, the staff didn't volunteer any details about the hotel (gym location, is there breakfast, etc), so I assumed that there would be a book of details in the room, but there wasn't.
-: When I called to the lobby to ask my questions, I had to try 3 times before getting an answer.
-: There was no privacy curtain on the window, so you either had to block out all light or give the neighbors across the street a view of your room.
-: Ask to be far from the club to avoid noise. Colleagues advised me to ask to be far from the club, so it wasn't a problem for me. But also the fancy "noise cancellation" switch did nothing at all.
-: The gym was weirdly dark, and had only one working elliptical machine, but had a nice window/view.
-: The elevator was operated by a key and was really finicky. I had many issues with it, and several other folks said they struggled with it.
-: The lightswitches were really fancy, but also super annoying! They were only somewhat responsive, and confusingly labeled. It was just trying way too hard.
+: The room felt super clean.
+: The bellhop was very nice.
+: The bathroom was well-laid-out, including a decently-sized counter and storage space below.

title: Very disappointing
text: This hotel tries VERY hard to be hip. They advertise that they have a pool but when you get there they tell you no children after 10 am. No mention of this when you book your room. Not cool. Also make you feel like a nuisance when you want to use the other facilities. Very disappointing.

title: Amazing Service, Great Hotel
text: I stayed at the Dream Downtown for 8 days in early May 2022. Service was great. The room is standard size for Manhattan, with good mattress and nice shower. I didn't have issues with noise from the club (stayed on the 4th floor). What made this stay five stars was definitely Chris Budhu, the Director Of Front Office who went above and beyond on any requests. I definitely recommend this hotel, and I'm looking forward to staying there again.

title: Sleep, per chance to dream? Fat chance.
text: If you plan to stay on a Thursday night, switch hotels. I understand that this hotel is a “scene” but the music thumped until 5:30am Friday. Forget sleep. The mattress felt like cardboard. The sheets like  burlap. Halls/common areas filthy.

title: Just a room, mostly uncomfortable.
text:
The only positive comments I can make are the front desk staff, especially Maria, were incredible. There is an inroom safe. The lobby is very well appointed.  Oh but you do not stay in the lobby so here’s the deal on the rooms.
The platform bed is very low and hard.  The side tables are small with no drawers.  There are no hooks in the bathroom.  The is no heat/air option on the thermostat.  If you sent the temperature to 68 and the room gets cold and you adjust the temperature to 70, the heat goes on!!
There are no coffee makers in the room (there is a bar however) and no room service no free coffee in the lobby.  You must get coffee from the restaurant which is $3.  The chair in the room was so low to the floor, it was difficult to get up.  The room overhead lighting is extremely dim.  
The location is not great.  It is near Chelsea market but no other shopping.  The subway is just down the street.  The nightclub folks are out on the street making noise until the wee hours of the morning.
I would never stay here again.

title: Flight Canceled
text: After spending all day in airports and a flight delay to accommodate me missing my connecting flight I had the pleasure of a free room. Downtown Manhattan didn’t get to explore much room was minimalistic with a modern feel no USBs which would have been nice, bed was low to the floor and bathroom had a massive tub.

title: Lobby very nice, rooms leave a lot to be desired
text:
A different and memorable hotel, unique design to say the least. Lobby and lobby bar look great, very cool design. Room really needed an upgrade. Very worn rug, bathroom had nowhere to put toiletries (my wife said "this was definitely designed by a man"), and the light switches may have been hip but were maddening, impossible to find out what switch controled what light. 

Definitely a party hotel, the club on the rooftop is pretty cool, patrons trying to be cool (ha). Overall a decent stay, but definitely not more than a 3.5 star hotel

title: Frat House
text:
The Hotel is like a frat house, loud and uncomfortable. Staying on the fourth floor we were far from the action, however the music shook the walls until 1 am when we were finally able to fall asleep. Then they start vacuuming the halls at 9 am to walk up the guests that partied until 4 am. The actual hotel room is beautiful, however completely unfuctional. There is a hole in the bathroom door that looks directly onto the toilet, no washcloths, and a mental shower curtain we couldn't close. No iPhone 12/13 USB and a minibar with full size liquor bottles, however not one bottle of water. The experience was honestly exhausting. 
On another note, the hotel posed a danger for guests, as I took the stairs out entire stay which was riddles with broken glasses, old food trays, cleaning equipment and dead roaches.

title: SCAMMM
text: This hotel is a scam, and the doormen are hustlers and are quite rude when you don't allow them to park your cars on the street, theres literally a garage right across the street. I will not be staying there anymore !!!! This is a disgrace, I forget the young mans name i believe it was Megan or Meglin about 5'9 hispanic decent such a rude young man, when i didn't have cash to tip he basically rolled his eyes at me unbelievable stay away from that place if you have any sense.

title: Excellent service
text: When traveling to NYC, I always stay at the Dream Downtown. Not only is the location prime & around the best restaurants. Their staff is super accommodating and friendly. Daniel Perez the manager is sweet and makes coming back to the dream much more enticing.

title: "Pure Bliss located right in Chelsea"
text:
First and foremost my wife and I would like to Thank the G.M. at The Dream Hotel Mr. Raymond Wong.  Mr. Wong and his amazing staff went above and beyond to welcome my wife and I at their beautiful hotel from Dec.30th-Jan.2nd. The hotel is spectacular from top to bottom: We stayed in a beautiful Silver King Balcony room  overlooking 16th street and can't wait to go back in April of this year for the Phish shows ;)  The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful, very clean/ spotless, the staff is very welcoming, very kind and  always willing to help.  You can't ask for a better location within the city, Chelsea is amazing!!! We will not stay anywhere else when we visit NYC , The Dream Hotel is the place to stay.  Thank You to Dream Downtown for your hospitality, your professionalism and for just being YOU!! 
 P.S.= those shower heads in the rooms are amazing, was like standing in a waterfall!!!    See Ya'll April 21st-24th

title: Gorgeous hotel in a great area - service is top notch!
text:
We stayed at the Dream Hotel downtown, and our stay was perfection!
The room was stunning, with 7 windows, and a view of the Manhattan skyline that was beyond compare!   It had a huge bathroom and was very clean and well laid out.
The best part was the staff.  They are SO incredibly kind and helpful, and they went out of their way to make our stay amazing!   Highly recommended!

title: The best hotel with even better staff
text: The rooms were clean, very comfortable, and the staff were amazing, especially Daniel Perez. He went over and beyond to help make our stay enjoyable. As soon as we walked in Daniel and the rest of the staff made us feel at home. I highly recommend staying at Dream downtown. I have stayed at many hotels in Manhattan and this hotel is by far my favorite.

title: Holiday Getaway
text: My wife and I stay for two days over the holiday weekend, we must say Keenan the bell captain had a great attitude the whole way through and provided great service. The area is great by the hotel with lots to do would definitely recommend staying here.

title: great experience
text:
Nicely designed, modern and unique
comfortable beds, tech on point and outlets everywhere.
robe provided, minibar and iron in the room 
nice courtesy set and netflix in the room 
strategic position close to chelsea market and the high line 
subway just a few blocks away 

Friendly and helpful staff with special mention to Keenan Davis
If we have the chance we will definetly be back again.

possible improvements:
shower courtain that reaches the floor
reglue corners of the wallpaper in the bedroom

title: It was a DREAM!
text: I had a great stay at the Dream Downtown. I came with a few friends from the west coast so they could experience NYC in the winter. We were greeted and assisted by Daniel, a manager at the Dream. The room and the service were great. It has a great location and beautiful amenities. Can’t wait to visit again in the summer!

title: Dream Big
text:
Daniel at the front desk was excellent. I haven’t been back since the hotel opened back up last summer and good to see this great place thriving again!

Great location and it makes it better that there is excellent service. I would recommend this on your list.

title: Great hospitality
text: Had a great time this past weekend, Keenan the bell captain literally did everything for my family we are grateful big shoutout to him. He checked us in, took care of our car, brought up our luggage, he even brought up ice and always had a smile on his face. Can’t wait to be back in a few weeks thank you.

title: Dreaming at the Dream
text: Great stay! Our room was very nice. Our views were good and the staff was helpful. The location was perfect, right across from the Chelsea market. Dave the night life manger was the best! He was so accommodating,my granny loved him!

title: Amazing experience at The Dream Downtown
text:
I have spent several nights at The Dream Downtown, and as the holidays approach, I’m planning to spend several more before the year ends. This hotel really does have it all - prime location, modern feel, cleanliness, and endless options for food and entertainment in the surrounding area. 
But it is the way I’m treated by the people that work at The Dream that really sets the experience apart from other hotels. Every time I stay at The Dream that people there make me feel safe, looked after and special. I’d like to specifically mention Daniel Perez who is constantly checking on me throughout my stay, and genuinely cares about all hotel guests, and the experiences they have when at The Dream!

title: Great getaway!
text: Beautiful hotel with great service. Daniel Perez helped at front desk and was very helpful and polite. Definitely coming back.  Everything thing you want is of walking distance. Definitely recommend trying out.

title: My stay at dream
text: My stay was nothing short of sensational. The service was exceptional thanks to Daniel Pérez and the entire dream  staff. From restaurants to night life venues, every recommendation was on point. Definitely the hotel to be while in NYC . Nothing but great service and a great time! Looking forward to my next stay here !

title: NUL NUL NUL
text:
Nous  y sommes allés car le quartier est sympa, les photos de l’hôtel donnaient envie mais…:
- service déplorable !! Notre chambre n’a pas été nettoyée la 2 eme nuit ! Agréable quand on rentre d’une grande journée … Une fois nous sommes rentrés à 16h, la femme de chambre faisait le ménage… nous avons attendu 30min qu’elle termine !! Je suis allée me plaindre et on m’a répondu « l’hôtel est grand, le temps que toutes les chambres soit nettoyées nous sommes obligés de faire comme ça » .. dieu merci les autres hôtels ne font pas comme ça !!   Pas d’excuse, pas de geste.. rien!! On se fait engueuler alors qu’on est client !!  A plus de 300$ la nuit c’est un scandale, surtout quand on vous dit « attendez je suis avec un client » comme si nous n’en étions pas…

Le matin personne ne vous dit bonjour, comptez encore moins sur le « bonne journée ». N’oubliez pas: vous êtes intéressant qu’au moment du paiement ! 

- la chambre est pas top… un tout petit placard pour 2… le lit à ressort n’est pas très confortable et la Clim se met sur chauffage d’un coup. Il n’y a pas d’endroit pour ranger les grosses valises … 

Bref, n’y allait pas !!

title: Run away from that hotel (noisy, unprofessional, unkind...)
text:
The location of the hotel is OK and the bed also. This is the 2 only good points. 
Then, when you are in your room, it is like you are in a club. The noise is super loud (note that the noise starts at 7 pm on saturdays and sundays!). 
And when you want to change your room, they don't care. You bother them and they make you feel that way.
So please, trust me, avoid this hotel. 
It probably used to be cool. But now it is aging badly. You have scraches on the floor, stains on the curtains, fridge does not work well, switchers are missing...

title: Amazing Experience Thanks to Daniel Pérez!!
text:
A group of business associates and I stayed at Dream Hotel for 5-7 days for the UFC fight and launch of our tequila brand. We had an amazing time from start to finish. I particularly had to travel with 3 suitcases weighing 250 pounds, and as soon as I got to that prime location at Dream Downtown, Daniel Pérez (the manager) came out with the luggage cart to assist me. Super attentive, efficient, and with an easygoing and approachable smile, Daniel helped me get to my room quickly. 

As all my business partners trickled in, Daniel smoothly and efficiently helped each of them get to their respective rooms too. The rooms were immaculate and cleaned every morning. The lobby had a good bar, TV, and alcohol selection; Chris, the bartender, was very friendly and gave generous pours (and gets a pass even though he’s a Brooklyn Nets fan. Go Lakers). And the rooftop at PhD was buzzing with electricity and beautiful people every night. 

Daniel and the staff had the best recommendations for bars, food, restaurants, and everything else you can think of in NYC. Will definitely stay at Dream Downtown NYC again - this spot was 10 stars in every aspect! Thanks Daniel and everyone at Dream for an amazing time!

title: 10/10 experience
text: This hotel was absolutely perfect. Clean, fun, very convenient, the list goes on. Danny who works at the front desk was very accommodating. He made sure we were content at all times and was very helpful!

title: not a dream …
text:
Called hotel prior to booking to confirm the valet was working only to find out when I checked in that there is no valet. 

Front desk staff super helpful. 

Room: gross. Carpet was ripped up and fraying. Fur ottoman was crusty with something spilled on it. Hotel very understaffed. No one answers phone to front desk , concierge , housekeeping. 

No restaurants were open. 

Waste of a trip into the city.

title: Best hotel service
text: The best service you can ask for. Front desk is very quick, kind, and friendly. Aeenan helped me so much with everything from showing my room, helping with my luggage, just about anything. The place is very sophisticated and clean, staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Would loveeee to stay there again!

title: Disappointing
text:
I really wanted to like this hotel, it was recommended to me by a couple friends who stayed frequently in the past. I want to blame covid protocols but I don't necessarily think that was it. Besides a great location, that was about the only positive. And the bed was comfortable.

First the room, was just run down and so basic. The lights? Don't even get me started on whatever person created that button system. The view I had was great though. The fridge wouldn't open. The blow dryer didn't work. There was one tiny trash can in the bathroom. We were sparingly given two towels, one each. The toiletries were awful. Just all little things that when you stay at high end hotels, are standard, you shouldn't have to ask. This was not the case here.

The staff was nice for the most part, minus the one morning it rained, and I asked for umbrellas, and the girl at the desk had a major attitude problem about it. Another day we asked for recommendations of places to go eat/grab a drink outside and the staff was clueless. Gave us 1 recommendation. I understand NYC has been closed down for quite some time but come on, they looked so confused. Then the desk girl made some comment about us wanting to go party? I was like it's 2:00 in the afternoon, we just want to go some drinks and apps and sit outside. When someone travels to a city, they expect the staff to be knowledgable of the area and have decent recommendations. The worst.

Food options, absolutely terrible. The one cafe that serves breakfast had a "limited" menu. With ONE option for food that wasn't a pastry. What kind of cafe in a hotel literally has one option.  Room service? Nope. You'd think a hotel that's supposed to be "high end" would have room service and food options for late night or early morning. Just sad. The bars weren't open in the hotel.

We wanted to get a cab to take us to JFK? Nope, they didn't have anyone to help us do that. Unheard of. There was no doorman. No one helped with anything.

Overall? Disappointed. Would not stay here again. Take your money elsewhere because I have stayed at hotels in the city with less stars than this one and had 100x better service.

Again, I want to blame covid but honestly, I don't think that is it.

title: Bachelorette
text: My sister celebrated her bachelorette here last week & the experience was just amazing from check in to check out. Everyone is so kind there especially Keenan. My family & I loved him. Made sure our stay was one to remember.

title: Nice stay.
text: Had a really nice stay this past weekend, nice lively place to be. My girlfriend and I want to give a huge shoutout to Keenan for his helpful advice and pleasant attitude throughout our stay. Definitely would recommend for a nice trendy weekend getaway.

title: Wedding celebration
text: Amazing stay …. Again lol. Big shoutout to Keenan he accommodated us a couple weeks ago and was very consistent again in making our family and friends feel welcomed. This weekend was very important to us. The hotel staff was great.

title: Amazing Vibe
text: This was my first time visiting this hotel for a little birthday getaway and I must say this place was AMAZING. Spacious room especially being in New York City , cool atmosphere , and several options for food and entertainment. And most of all the staff was so nice and accommodating , Ray was extremely helpful from the moment we walked in and made my whole experience  there feel very special and I really did appreciate that. Highly recommend this hotel no matter what your looking for!

title: Birthday celebration
text: My husband and I celebrated my birthday this weekend. Although things are a little different with pool reservations since pre COVID, it’s still a fun place and area to be. Keenan was amazing he took care of myself and my husband the whole weekend it felt like, big thank you to him.

title: Great place to stay.
text: I visited for my friends bachelorette party, amazing time at the hotel. Big shoutout to the Keenan he was literally amazing, he was there for everything we needed. We’ll be back in 2 weeks to run it back.

title: Loved the stay
text: The best part of this stay was the bell Captain Keenan Davis, he helped all my friends from the curb to the lobby to our rooms, brought glasses and ice, recommended great places to party, recommended great places to eat, always had a smile on his face he was such a joy.

title: Find a better deal
text: It is awful what happened to this place as well as NYC overall. The rooms are very small and need an update. The carpet was ripped.  The furniture was damaged and old. No water bottles or glasses were provided. No, I would not recommend this hotel for this price range.

title: A Big Disappointment
text:
From the website, the hotel has a lot going for it: great location, cool design, nice pool and stunning views from the roof terrace.  Yet, when I stayed during the July 4th holiday weekend, I was incredibly disappointed at so many aspects of the hotel, that I felt compelled to write this review.  First of all, the roof terrace is not accessible to guests during the day, and is only accessible if they visit the club on the weekends, in which case they have to be "screened" by the door staff.  This is because, like the pool, it is an area which is managed by a separate company.  Access to the pool costs $80 (just to get a lounger and couple of towels). When I arrived in the room, the minibar had no water or sodas - just hard liquor and wine.  There were no snacks or glasses.  In addition, there was no room service available, which was because of the lack of staff, I was told.  In fact, there was no food or drink available in the hotel at all. 
So: for what you pay per night, this is definitely terrible value for money, and I would not recommend it at all. Do yourself a favor and stay in another hotel.

title: Wonderful stay in meatpacking district
text:
We often travel to nyc and this was our first stay in this hotel. The location couldn’t be better for the HighLine, Whitney, the new City Island and ant other attractions in this area. 
The staff was beyond helpful, friendly and even solicitous. Somehow they knew your name and greeted you with offers to help. 
The concept of a beach club is totally unique for nyc with a beautifully designed outdoor garden pool, sumptuous chairs and great drinks/ food. Kudos to Morgan our server. 
Yes the rooms are nyc small, but the brilliance of the design made them seem large and open. I would recommend a room overlooking the pool  the very large round window makes it seem like you are open to the outdoors. 

My only negative is that the furniture is not for older folks. Both the bed and chairs are so low that you need a young body to sit down and get up. The bathroom,although beautifully designed, has a tub/ shower that is very deep making access hard for some folks. 
Having said this I would definitely stay here again. Note we stayed just post pandemic and not all services were yet available

title: Can't beat location, but defo a party palace
text: Can't beat location on the edge of Chelsea and Meatpacking and walking distance to Soho and Tribeca but hear this: if you're hoping for someplace quite to grab a whisky at night, look elsewhere. This place is popping, and it's fun! You can still rest in your spacious rooms, just know that the vibes are high.

title: Min tredje vistelse och sannolikt mitt sista besök
text:
För ett antal år sen lämnade jag en strålande recension av mitt besök på hotellet. Jag var så nöjd med allt från området, personalen och rummet. Mitt andra besök var inte alls lika trevligt då vi hade rummet precis under diskoteket. När vi checkade ut påtalade vi att det var störande och personalen var mycket förstående och uppmanade oss att be om ett tyst rum vid nästa vistelse. 

När det var dags för en tredje vistelse så bad jag uttryckligen om ett tyst rum och långt ifrån diskoteket. Mycket riktigt fick vi ett rum i andra delen av hotellet men hamnade under en svit där man hade fest som pågick till kl 05 vår första natt. Vi fick byta rum efter första natten och det blev lugnare men inte tyst. Rummen hade sedan vår första vistelse blivit betydligt mer slitna och det var fläckar på både heltäckningsmatta och gardiner....

Vi har för vana att starta utekvällen i hotellets bar och även ibland runda av kvällen med en drink i hotellobbyn men den här gången hade man satt ut "reserverat" på alla borden...varje kväll! Vi lyckades få sitta ner och ta några drinkar men varje gång med en tid att förhålla oss till. Som boende på ett hotell var det första gången man prioriterade andra än hotellets gäster?!

Våra första vistelser så hade hotellet en mexikansk restaurang som serverade en riktigt bra frukost som vi besökte varje morgon. Nu hade det övergått till ett café med en betydligt mindre och enklare menyn.

För att sammanfatta det hela så hade tyvärr allt blivit sämre :( Så tråkigt för jag älskade verkligen det här hotellet efter vår första vistelse.

title: Best Stay-cation in the City
text: This past weekend, my husband and I stayed at Dream Downtown to celebrate my birthday. The ambiance was fun and lively and we had a wonderful room with our own private terrace leading out to the pool. Lauren Nordstrom, the Front Office manager was very helpful in making our experience truly special and personalized! And Raymond Wong, the Director of The Front Office, ensured a pleasant and smooth checkout with his warm and friendly send-off. I will definitely visit Dream Downtown again soon!! And I will be recommending it to anyone and everyone looking for a sweet, unique escape in the city!

title: Amazing Stay
text:
I celebrated my Birthday at the Dream Downtown and had one of the best stay in years. I heard so much about this hotel  but due to corona my expectations were not high. I can safely say they were met. The hotel was so cleaned. Sanitizers were on every corner of the hotel. Our room had a seal on the door saying “ so clean so fresh, your room is protected”  

The level of service was consistently high, especially at Front Desk. He was very welcoming and professional. I loved the design in the room and bathroom. The pool was great even though the weather was not favourable.

I will definitely return to the Dream in meatpacking Manhattan soon.

title: Birthday night stay
text: We were in downtown Manhattan to celebrate friends birthday. Needed a room somewhere for just 1 night. Walked in to dream hotel to find may be 3 or 4 bedroom suite. It was available but was expensive. Gentleman at front desk very professionally guided us and recommended to book 4 rooms. He also gave us rooms next to each on same floor. We had an amazing stay. Everything that we asked was delivered to us whether it was towels or bathroom amenities. We will return here soon. It was nice experience.

title: Best in Downtown!
text: I had such an amazing experience at the Dream. From beginning to end, the entire staff was welcoming and exceptionally accommodating. Absolutely astounding service from the front desk, security, bellman, upstairs restaurant, and pool. Neat common spaces and I can tell the rooms had been cleaned with extra care. The design of the rooms and lobby is so unique and modern. It's gorgeous. The pool and upstairs dining was heaven! This is a great sanctuary in the heart of Downtown. Easily accessible to the subway and restaurants nearby. And I love how well they had put in procedures for social distancing, etc. Would definitely recommend!!

title: Disrespectful Suite
text:
I made reservations to stay in a Platinum Suite at this hotel. This was one of the most horrible suites I've ever stayed in anywhere. I felt as though there was absolutely no quality check for this suite. In my opinion this room should have never been sold. 
1. No glasses or Box tissues in the room (basic requirements)
2. One of 2 balcony doors broken (I was unable to utilize one of to balconies I paid for)
3. Worn out and shabby furniture (broken and ripped couch) 
4. Nothing in the mini bar (empty fridge, once again basic necessity) 

On top of all this I had to pay a $99.00 pet security, and obviously they were not using this for up keep or repairs.

The Hotel  staff was friendly but, I was a little disappointed in the fact that even though I was staying at the hotel, I still had to pay $125.00 to rent a pool chair and still pay for food and drinks at the pool. There was also a $100 "minimum spend" at the rooftop bar.

I paid for a "suite experience" but received less than mediocracy, I will not be recommending this hotel to anyone without warning.

title: Great views and good food
text:
This is specifically about Beach at Dream Downtown

Beach is an oasis during these times. It is outdoors, has a great view and a pool! What could be better than that? On top of it all, it has good food and a very helpful and friendly staff. It has great scenery for taking pictures and you can never go wrong with these menu items...the burrito bowl, the tacos, the steak and the guac and chips. All these items were really good and surprisingly huge portions. I recommend getting a reservation and ask for JD the manager if you ever need anything...he's super helpful and a great host.

title: Not ideal for the work trip
