text: Overall it was nice and hipster hotel. However on 5th floor room, I couldn’t get any sleep. The music beat from 6th rooftop club literally bounce the room under. I had great time enjoying modern design of the room and cute little cafe for the breakfast but not for the rest.

title: Helt ok, og grineren selfiewall
text: Hel ok hotel. God beliggenhed og chick enterieur. Rummene er ok størrelse, men heller ikke mere. Fin udendørs pool og lille gym, som har hvad man har brug for. Elevatorerne kørte som vinden blæser. Venligt personale, og hver aften kom horder for at tage selfies foran en kæmpe blomstervæg

title: Recent Dream Downtown Stay (Feb-March)
text: I recently stayed at the Dream Downtown (Meatpacking District), and could not have been happier. First, the staff easily accommodated a last-minute booking, and also provided a late checkout (that I requested) and were able to upgrade the initial room. Friendly does not even begin to describe the front desk and concierge staff. The exterior and interior are top-notch, and the room was impeccable. I should note that the balcony view is REALLY cool. Modern room with newer technology, including bathroom speakers, which is a very nice touch. You really get your money's worth at the Dream Downtown, without question. The bar area is clean, with a wonderful clientele. Location - cannot be beat. The heart of New York's most popular area and across the street from the Starbucks Reserve (if you have not been - GO!). If you're looking to impress or meet someone - stay at this hotel; don't waste your time trying to compare with others in the area. Special thanks and recognition to Lauren at the front desk - she is truly wonderful and a nice introduction to your entrance to the Dream :).

title: Great for a conference, and a fabulous experience!
text:
This hotel is nothing short of extraordinary, from the design of the rooms, the bar area and the restaurants, to the outstanding service provided by the staff. Maria at the front desk was particularly kind and helpful.
I attended a conference, but will be looking for opportunities to visit NYC and spend some time at the Dream Hotel Downtown 😊

title: Great stay at the beach
text:
DREAM South Beach was the perfect match for my stay. The neighborhood is full of 
great variety of restaurants, you can walk to everywhere so easily. The staff was incredibly helpful giving directions and suggestions, always available to help us, Ilson at the front desk is a very special asset for the hotel. The rooftop bar is incredible. I totally recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.

title: Exciting Week - FANTASTIC stay at the Dream Downtown!
text: DREAM Downtown was the perfect hotel for my recent stay in NYC. The neighborhood is filled with a great variety of restaurants. Easy walks to Times Square, Chelsea Market, Whitney Museum, and Metro is on the corner. The staff was incredibly helpful with information, directions and did not miss a beat with special requests.  The rooftop bar was sensational. The café and restaurant were both great – delicious food.  Over-all experience was awesome!  I was traveling with my son and his friend.  I can easily recommend this hotel to couples and families with young adults.

title: Dreamy Business Travel
text: Making business travel a dream is a standard I don't usually hold a hotel to, my expectations of a hotel for business travel were exceeded during my stay. I enjoyed my room and had a restful two nights sleep during a hectic week of travel. I took two meetings at the hotel and was pleasantly surprised by productive networking with other guests. I'll be back and look forward to inviting friends to join me for dinner and drinks after a productive day! Dream allows me to work hard and play harder!

title: a Gem in Chelsea
text: Staff, value, cleanliness, ambiance, food, drinks, design ---all top notch. Better than pricey 5 star hotels. A+ on every level. I won't stay anywhere else in NY, ever. Plenty of space in the room, excellent design..can't say enough about the 5-star service I received. Ray , the manager, responded to my email quickly...Concierge was a true gentleman, front desk staff, wait staff  in the lounge and what can I say about the roses - just picturesque. Can't wait to return and this time, I'll stay longer to enjoy the hotel better.

title: The hotel was amazing!
text: We had a wonderful experience at the Dream hotel! From the time of check in, staff were friendly and helpful! The lobby was perfect and attracted so many people to just converse and take pictures. If there was a need from housekeeping, they were very responsive. I have not one complaint about this hotel and we cannot wait to come back when it warms up! The convenience of Phillipe Chow being downstairs and the rooftop lounge upstairs was wonderful because we didn’t even have to worry about going outside in the cold! Perfection! See you all in a few months!☺️

title: Dream Downtown
text: This hotel was so awesome. Starting with the inside it is so trendy so fresh so clean. The staff is wonderful. The location is in the beautiful downtown area. The restaurants are great too ( Bodega Negra next door has some good drinks and food) And the night life is unreal PHD, TAO the list goes on but man oh man you really do live the dream at dream. Highly recommend

title: Dream Downtown below 30
text:
Dream Downtown is not so much of a dream. The decor is dark and it's hard to say if the lights are down to hide things like uncleanliness or other defects. The staff is not very friendly, If you have a question and call the front-desk from your room, rarely does anyone answer. There is a nightclub within the hotel and at a certain hour it becomes more important to get the nightclubbers up on the elevators than the clients. In order to dream, also, once has to be able to sleep but the noise quotient is quite high.
If you are under 30 and can afford it, this might be the place for you. It was not for me. (My daughter is 18. She didn't care for it much either.)

title: Cheap for NYC with some good and lots of bad
text:
I spent a full week in the Dream Downtown last week and I had very mixed feelings about the hotel. Lets start with the good:
On the plus side the location is excellent. Its a 5 minute walk to the subway, a 2 minute walk to Chelsea Markets and its a very cool neighborhood in general. 
Also on the plus side is the cost - its very affordable for New York. We had a special rate that worked out around $200 per night including tax, but that was in January, I'm not sure what you pay for it during a higher season. But $200 per night in New York is very rare indeed.
Other positives - the bed was comfortable and the room was clean,

Now to the negative:
So many things irritated me about this hotel. Firstly, it has a nightclub and bar on the premises and becomes a magnet for an extremely noisy and trashy clientele that fill the lobby and the public areas. That's fine if you're a 20 something into clubbing looking to hook up with loose, half naked women, but I prefer my hotels a little more quiet and respectable.
Next, nothing seemed to work as it is supposed to. The elevators need a keycard and don't always read them properly, the sink has a strange faucet that just doesn't make sense, the TV channels were impossible to decipher so you had to play roulette to try and find a channel - sometimes you go back and the channel had disappeared, sometimes you go round and there were channels that weren't there last time.... I just found the place poorly thought out. 
Overall I would not return to The Dream, but I can understand its appeal to younger travelers looking for a low budget NYC hotel. It wasn't for me.

title: Excellent Hotel Guest Services
text: Lauren and her Dream Team rendered excellent guest services.   Had a great time at the Dream.   Hotel staff was courteous and effective in making sure we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel.  Dream's Bodega Negra restaurant was great.

title: Great Hotel
text:
The Hotel is beautiful,the platinum suite was very impressive and clean.The Hotel staff was friendly and very helpful.
Drinks in the Lobby bar were very good.many choices for dining.  I look forward to a return stay soon

.

title: Home away from home
text: This hotel is always consistent going above and beyond to make their guests stay 5 star experience. Dream downtown is always my preferred hotel in NYC. A must for anyone who wants great amenities service dining and nightlife in the heart of the best area in NYC. Cheers.

title: Nice but overly hip hotel
text:
You might love this hotel and I wouldn't argue with you. It has many good qualities, but it just irked me. But you're not me, and I'm sort of annoying.

It gets the most obvious and important things right: The staff is friendly. The hotel is very clean. The room was small, but normal size for a NYC hotel. It's in a fun part of town. It's modern. So, they nailed the basics.

Here are the discretionary things they could have gotten right but, according to my irked judgment, they did not. (It's in no particular order, but the last one is the most egregious.)

The wifi was ok at 12mbps, but not great these days.

The free exercise room was surprisingly small, with only a handful of machines. For a large hotel, that can be a problem.

I know the following is a tiny nit, but, like many hotels, the little shower bottles are identical except for a small print label. Those of us who are older generally don't want to have to shower with our glasses on. So, yes, you can line the bottles up in the shower beforehand, but I was irked. Irked, I tell you!

The TV channel guides was inaccurate, so finding a channel you wanted was very annoying. There's an onscreen guide, but the numbers it lists are not the numbers you need to enter to get to the channel. Plus, the guide scrolls so very slowly. A printed list of channels would have been far handier, especially if its channel numbers were accurate.

The little cocktail lounge charges $20 for a cocktail. Big city prices are irksome.

The towel rack was a wooden ladder that leans against a bathroom wall. I found it virtually impossible to remove a single towel without dumping others on the floor. Very trendy, but a waste of towels.

The lights, etc., are controlled by button panels in various spots. They make no sense. (I'm not an idiot about tech. About other things, yes, obviously.)

When I arrived, the TV in the main room was blasting its sound into the bathroom, I had to call the desk to find out how to turn it down; there's an inconspicuous, unlabeled dial near the toilet.

Finally, I'm posting a photo of the only art in the room. What the heck are they thinking? Really? I've shown this to a few other people just to be sure that I'm not the only one who finds this to be an inappropriate painting.  The hotel should think about replacing its art with paintings of creepy clowns. It'd be a step up. 

So, all of these are small points -- assuming you can ignore the creepshow on the wall -- that mar a hotel that otherwise is good. If my company puts me up there again, I won't complain. I may sigh, but I won't complain.

title: Great location, bit of a party scene
text: The location in the meatpacking district is great, and very convenient to subways.  The lobby is quite the party scene for a young crowd, so not exactly the scene for this couple of sixty-something visitors.  (Actually, it wasn't even my scene when I lived in NY in my 20's.)  So the lobby wasn't anywhere I would want to hang out in the evening, although it was a little entertaining to see the line-up for the elevator to the club upstairs.  (The wait for elevators left a little bit to be desired.)  But actually, the room was fine and surprisingly quiet.  Nice bathroom.  We had a comfortable stay here.  And, like I said, the neighborhood can't be beat (depending on where you're planning to spend your time in NY, of course, but proximity to subways was great.)  Chelsea Market is just a block away, too.

title: The best stay in nyc
text: We just stayed here to celebrate my husband’s birthday as we do each year and it keeps getting better and better!  We are New Yorkers so we choose the dream downtown for fun weekend staycations.  I can’t think of one thing that could be improved.  Everything about the service is perfection.  Lauren Nordstrom, Director of rooms is absolutely wonderful! From all my questions and requests prior to checking in  and the time of checkout, she was hands down a delight to work with.  She is so attentive, personable and professional.  It’s a privilege to have been able to communicate with her.  I felt like we were VIP guests and that’s definitely not the case when you stay at nyc hotels.  I am looking forward to our next stay and Lauren had a lot to do with that. Just amazing hospitality!  Neglin was so friendly and took all our bags to the room and was so courteous.  Great conversation with him.  All the concierge and staff are super friendly and dedicated to ensuring we have the most perfect stay.  The platinum pool suite is breathtaking! The hotel is gorgeous and trendy.  We probably stay here 2-3 times a year but I hope to stay more!  Definitely the best hotel in nyc.  Thanks Lauren and team!  Keep up the fantastic work!  Until next time.

title: Amazing experience! Highly recommended.
text: We booked our room with only a 5 day notice because of last minute changes. Once we arrived the staff was wonderful and courteous and instructed us on the hotels amenities and policies. I had called in advance to order a bottle of champagne and balloons through concierge to surprise my husband for his birthday. Once we arrived the room was fully decorated in gold and white balloons, the bottle of champagne and a bottle of Prosecco from the Hotel Manager Felipe! The Dream Downtown is definitely by far the best hotel we have ever stayed ( and we’ve traveled to very nice hotels abroad). Everything in the room was well thought out, the decor was impeccable and the suite was very clean. Thank you to the whole Dream staff for making our short stay an unforgettable experience. We highly recommend anyone thinking of staying here for their future NYC trip. PS: make sure to visit the rooftop and lobby bar.. best cocktails!!!

title: Fun but you kinda need to be young and hip to fully appreciate it
text:
Wanted to stay at a cool hotel for a birthday weekend with our young adult daughter. The Dream hotel fit the bill. Was super cool.. maybe a bit to cool for us it turned out (as older parents).

Location: Loved the location in the meatpacking district. Beautiful views of the skyline from the rooftop bar/club- Phd. Convenient to the High line, The Whitney museum, tons of bars, restaurants and the subway. (see below tips)

Decor/room: The decor was very stylish. I liked the American flag made out of Mexican beer cans in the lobby. Wonderful view of the skyline including Empire state building from the round “porthole like“ windows. Had a hard time locating the drinking glasses in the room. (ended up being inside a cabinet in the bathroom). I would’ve expected them to be near the mini bar. We found the light switches to be difficult to use. I know that sounds strange but trust me. Also, I was not a fan of the big hole in the door where the doorknob should be. Looks cool but I didn’t like the “Peephole” Lovely smelling toiletries. Sadly, we couldn’t take advantage of the pool as it was Nov. But it looks super fun.

Rooftop bar “Phd": The lobby was absolutely packed with young adults in skimpy clothes waiting for the bar to open. Once upstairs, it was quite the scene.  The bar was fun to people watch, and has a fantastic view. We were there in late fall but I imagine it’s spectacular in the nice weather when it is more open. 

Cons: Even though we were floors away, the music from the club kept us awake. Drunk PYTs were walking around our hallway, cursing and making lots of noise. The elevator is confusing.  You need to put you room key card in for security but there were glitches and many guests including us almost gave up and walked down the stairs. All the beautiful young people made me feel old. LOL. 

Tips: Be prepared to be surrounded by young hipsters. It can be fun but if you aren't in the mood.. well then... don't stay here.  Bring earplugs, If you plan on going to the rooftop bar for the view and not staying to dance and party… go early. Go all the way to the back for a great view.  Be sure to check out Chelsea market for many cool shops, bars, and restaurants. We loved The Meatball shop place a short walk from the hotel on 9th Ave.   If you are in the mood to slurge… dine at Del Posto! It’s fantastic! 

And of course….. walk on the High Line!

title: Awful. DO NOT STAY HERE!
text:
This was my second time staying at the dream. I had a horrific first experience but always like to give everyone a second chance and the location works for me. We arrived and our room smelled like cigarettes. Our TV didn’t work. We called to ask them to fix it and no one answered, continually calling for a total of 12 minutes...12. The technician came. They couldn’t fix the tv. No one cared. I reached out the next day and the manager didn’t care. I didn’t have time to move hotels.
Once I got back the second night the TV still didn’t work and the hallways reeked of marijuana. When asked for at least 1 night refunded due to the TV the hotel totally ignored me and never got back to me. Oh also there were call girls and club promoters all in the lobby bar at 10pm when I got home last night. DO NOT STAY HERE.

title: I wanted to love it....
text:
Stayed at the Dream the weekend of Jan 3rd for an event.  The cons unfortunately out weigh the pros.  The beds were really really soft, too soft to even feel refreshed in the morning.  They felt like you were sleeping on 2 down comforters on the floor.    The walls are paper thin,  I could hear the conversation next door as if they were in our room at the foot of the bed.  The light controls/switches did not dim so it was very bright in the middle of the night.  

Only good thing was the Philippe restaurant... now that was really good.  Just got a little lost trying to find it down the elevator... LOL.

If we attend the event next year we will unfortunately book our stay at another hotel.

title: Dont waste your money party hotel
text: We checked in at 11:30 at night to be greeted by a nightclub type bar in the foyer area alarm bells started to ring that we had made a huge error , accommodation was not cheap but we were staying in a hotel that had not 1 but 2  nightclubs that went  till 4am every day and we had a 7 day booking , this place should come with a warning its ok if your in your 20s and into staying up all night but not when your an older traveller . Rooms were ok staff ok but i dont recommend staying here hindsight is a wonderful thing

title: The Dream in December
text:
I wish I could say I was able to dream in this hotel.  Thankfully the trip was short.  Its a great location, but not for a Friday night unless you really want to party as this seems to be the main location.  Also the rooms do hear quite a lot of the noise from the bar and club.
Rooms very compact

title: Hipster Hotel in Chelsea
text:
Spent 3 nights in this young hipster hotel in a fun part of NYC. The bathroom was quite large the bedroom typically  NYC small. t
The staff was great, the king bed was nice the linens were good. The restaurants that are attached to this property are very good and it is conveniently across the street from the Chelsea market which makes it easy to grab water, etc. 14th street subway nearby. All in all a good stay, if a little loud at night with revelers coming home at all hours making alot of noise in the hallway.

title: Have a smart choice
text:
If want to be threatened like sh**t stay at the Dream Hotel. I am stayed with them for several years. 
They are mean and harsh with their guests. We have 7 rooms at the hotel and this will be our last year. Find somewhere else to stay

title: Christmas time in NYC
text:
We were three that booked a platinum king room over the holidays and the room was very spacious and comfortable!  It's chaotic in the lobby but once in your room, it's private and quiet.  The beds were comfortable and even the pullout was comfortable to sleep in.  Bathroom is huge!  Space is not a problem.

Natura for breakfast and coffee is highly recommended.  Although Chelsea Market and other neighboring areas is a walk away.  The overall location of this hotel is very good!

title: Lástima del personal de la cafatería
text:
Gran hotel con maravillosas instalaciones, vistas y comodidad. Lo único malo es la atención del personal de la cafetería. No te ayudan cuando estan viendo que tienes problemas para entender la carta de desayuno y sobretodo un chico que estaba en la barra y era hispano. Fue muy desagradable.
