Únicamente por este motivo dudaría mucho en volver a alojarme en el hotel.
El resto del personal muy correcto, incluso nos ayudaron con un problema realizando ellos mismos la Gestión por nosotros.

title: New Year Celebration At Dream Downtown
text: Our Daughter and her friend had a fantastic stay at Dream Downtown in NYC on New Years Eve! This was her second stay at this location and she was welcomed back with a beautiful upgraded accommodation and a delicious surprise amenity awaiting them at check in! The attention to detail and genuinely warm hospitality exhibited by Mr. Haduch and his staff was exceptional and greatly appreciated!  We look forward to staying at this hotel again in the future!

title: Best Xmas Eve ever
text: We stayed here for Xmas Eve and Xmas morning. This is by far my favorite hotel in NYC. It’s trendy, modern and fun. The location is great as it’s close to everything. The hotel staff treated us like family from the minute we checked in. Rooms were great. I loved the bathroom and the shower was huge. Room service was fast and the food was delicious. Drinks were very strong so watch out. Lol! If you need help Keenan was our go to for almost everything. We can’t wait to go back to enjoy the pool. The pancakes were delish btw.

title: Christmas Holiday was perfect here!
text: I loved my room! Amazing view of the city including the Empire State Building. I found myself in no hurry to leave the hotel each morning. But when I did, the location made it so easy to get around. Close to the subway and Chelsea Market. Easy walk to Greenwich Village. So many great restaurants and shops. I would definitely stay again.

title: Great Party Hotel - Average Elsewhere
text:
Great stay in NY over Xmas, this hotel is great location and very cool. 

However it was also frustratingly terrible at times which went against the backdrop of the beautiful lobby, helpful staff and great location. 

A couple of gripes with the hotel: 

- It feels like a nightclub with room comfort second in line, I had no glasses in my room. When I called to ask for some glasses I was brought up around 6 plastic pint glasses. This was so misjudged I couldn’t believe what I had been handed, picture attached. I wanted a few wine glasses and some tumblers as I expect in any hotel room. Even when I complained, the glasses were removed the following day by room service. Odd considering there is a large variety of drinks in the mini bar. I wouldn’t advise providing plastic pint glasses to a customer requesting glasses again. 

- the shower was poor for a gold standard room and was not powerful, something I would expect from a 4 star hotel. Also no adjustable option to move so a very limited “waterfall” shower. 

- the noise was quite distributing to sleep however I’m a deep sleeper and didn’t spend too much time in my room on an evening however I can see prior reviews point of views.

title: BFF Holiday Shopping Weekend!
text: The Dream Hotel was the perfect place to stay for our girls’ getaway and holiday shopping spree. Such a cool vibe, sooo many amenities and great restaurants/lounges. You don’t even need to leave the hotel! Chelsea Market is a two minute walk and the area is brimming with energy and hotspots. It will absolutely be our go-to boutique hotel in The Big Apple.

title: Amazing Stay
text: Stayed at this property this weekend for 2 nights to celebrate my wife"s birthday. The staff was very courteous and professional. I had the pleasure of meeting the guest service manager Brett Haduch and Oeteka who works at the guest service desk. They both exceeded my expectations and we will be visiting that property again in the near future. My wife had a great birthday thanks again Brett.

title: Disapointed
text:
Have been staying here approx 2 times per year for the past 5 years for leasiure.  5 Years ago had phenomenal stays rooms were great staff was great service was great price was still high but you got what you paid for.  

In recent years the price has gone up which is fine but service has plummeted and they nickle and dime for everything.  Paid 500 per night for room and they dont have ice machines and charged 6$ to the room for a bucket of ice thought that was funny.  

Could go on and on about it but long story short the service was just horrible in many instances, time to find a new hotel in the city.

title: Приятный отель
text: Хороший отель, приемлемая цена. Но туристы дома не сидят, только принимают душ и спят. остальное время за бортом, как и многие из нас. Прибывала пару ночей, за пару ночей толком не поймешь, все тонкости,,,

title: One of New York's finest!
text: The property is in a great location - walking distance from the subway, tons of dining options at the property and nearby, nice area overall.  Room cleanliness was exceptional and all staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

title: Way overhyped
text:
One of the worst night sleeps of my life. First let me start off by saying our room smelled like a moldy gym sock. We got in and had to immediately open the window for some fresh air. I just got the vibe that the room wasn't clean. 

The beds are horrendous. Our mattress had a feather pillow topper on it and you could feel the feathers from underneath the fitted sheets, poking and scratching you all night. I slept with pants and a shirt on and it was still insufferable. The pillows were flimsy and ended up completely flat after laying on them for a short amount of time. They offered no neck support.

For being a party hotel, they've done absolutely nothing to soundproof. We could hear every single person walking by to get into their rooms and heard every word they said. Additionally, we were on the 4th floor of the hotel and could still hear the club music coming from PhD on the top floor. 

All in all, this hotel is 100% overrated and not worth the cost. It's only saving grace is that it's in a good location.

title: Great Service!
text:
The service in the Dream Downtown is phenomenal. There were times when I stepped out of my room in the morning for just 15 minutes to go grab some breakfast, I'd signal for "clean the room please" sort of half-expecting nothing to happen, and return to a room that had been fully serviced.

My only complaints are about room size (a typical NYC hotels issue) and a lack of availability for AC power at the nightstands for plugging your own devices in. (The nightstands _do_ have USB chargers, but USB charging is not sufficient for all things, especially for folks who travel with a CPAP machine).

title: 2* party bus at 5* prices
text:
The first thing to know about the Dream hotel is that it's known first and foremost as a club / party scene.  We lived in NYC for 17 years, we heard about it alongside the Gansevoort Hotel and others in the meatpacking district.  If you're looking for new york's hottest club (think SNL's Stefon), and a safe place to crash once the sun comes up, you've come to the right place.

However, that doesn't mean it's a good hotel, if you're there for lodging purposes.  Let's leave aside the typical ~$500 price tag.  The rooms are tiny, the amenities few, the design downright odd, the space not very clean, and (worst of all, for a party hotel) the soundproofing is miserable.  There's a mini fridge, thoroughly stocked with stuff they want to upcharge you for, but no room for you to put extra takeout food.  There's a wonky shower curtain that appears to be made out of linked chainmail, but the curtain liner has mold all over it.  The light switches are unusual, not intuitive, and hard to figure out if you're coming to it in the dark.  There's a coat closet that holds, at most, 2 garments (other than the Dream Hotel bathrobe they're trying to sell you).  And a desk with a depth of about 10 inches, so your laptop is cantilevered off the edge.  Basically, the decor tries to be funky while not being either classy or functional, and as a result comes off as tacky and cheap.

But the soundproofing, oh man.  We were back in town for the first time ever as ex-New Yorkers, and our rooms were near (but did not back up on) the elevator on the 8th floor.  We heard every word of every conversation in the hallway, elevator lobby, and adjoining rooms.  We could hear the oontz-oontz of dance music from the rooftop club.  Without white-noise apps on our phones, it's doubtful we would have gotten to sleep at all.

If you're coming to the Dream for any reason other than keeping it going all night, I strongly recommend going elsewhere.

title: Great Vibe - Cool Rooms - Superb Staff - AMAZING HOTELS
text:
I have stayed at the Dream many, many times.  If you are looking for a trendy fun vibe, then this is where you want to be.  The lobby has great food, drinks, music, people watching as well as fun places to take your selfies.  There is a lounge downstairs with music, a roof top upstairs for those who like to dance.  Phillip Chow is a great restaurant inside the hotel with good food, and a fun atmosphere.  
The rooms are fun and modern, I like a one bedroom suite, but have stayed in a standard king and it's perfect for two.  
JANE ATENDIDO IS THE GREATEST!!!  She was so helpful and on top of things - If you are looking for a place for a group stay, B day, Bachelor/ Bachelorette Party, team building, ect call Jane - She is amazing.

title: AMAZING HOTEL - Brett Haduch
text:
The Dream Down town Hotel is definitely the place to stay @NYC. It has been amazing staying there! we had an amazing night at their rooftop enjoying the best views from the city! The location is great too!
I would like to give a special mention to Mr. Haduch and Mrss. Cyrus for helping me, in an extremely professional way, solve a small issue we had. They knew how to treat the guest in the best way possible!
Thank you both!

title: Great stay
text: What an amazing staff at the dream, came to visit with some family for the holidays checked in by Aaron he was very nice and super patient . He also did let us  know about some great places to have after dinner drinks. The view was amazing will definitely book my next visit to the dream.

title: Great Location, Fab Room
text: The room was beautiful and spacious, with circular windows that provide views of the NY skyline. Watching the winter sunset was stunning. We had a room on the (relatively) quiet side of the hotel. The staff was professional and helpful. The location —near Chelsea market and The High Line, can’t be beat.

title: Unmatched Personalized Service
text:
Good hotel in a nice area - Meatpacking District NYC near many popular eating spots and the High Line.  We stayed here for 5 nights.  Highlight here was actually at the front desk - I met Amanda over friendly conversation regarding their in-house restaurant Phillipe Chow, which she highly recommended.  Little did I know that Amanda was going to make such an impact on our stay at the time.  Later that night, we encountered some challenges with our room and it was Amanda who was there to provide top notch personalized service and support to make my family’s stay comfortable and happy for all.
Thanks Amanda - dunno what we would’ve done without your help!

title: Didn't have to stay there to get great service!!!! Thanks Alicia G!!
text: Im a travel agent and I booked some clients for a Dec stay. There were a few snags that I ran into and that's when I got the call from Alicia G in reservations. She not only answered allllll my many questions, she went over a few that I didn't even think to ask. She made sure that all the t's where crossed and that the i's were dotted so that my clients would have a flawless check-in & stay. She was so thorough and didn't hang up with me until she knew that all my needs were met for me and my client. If the other employees are anything like her the Dream brand is doing an amazing job!! Keep up the great work!! And I want to send out a huge thank you to Alicia G, just for being her!!

title: Review
text: My name is wesley Steve isaacs I am writhing to commend the professional help , and assistance I have received with my interaction with one of your employees, Mrs Alicia grant , it is while trying to make the necessary bookings with my wife , that I was experiencing a few issues , the young lady was very patient , professional , and seemed extremely knowledgeable on the protocols of your business , it’s is because of her our stay and transition was a worthwhile one , and my wife and I would like to commend her on professionalism and patience, a very good aqusition and Representitive of your establishment.

title: Best experience
text: Klawson is the best guest service agent manager and made a great experience for me to come back again. Sonia also provide amazing customer service as well and would not be able to complete tonight with out them

title: Business Trip
text: During my conversation with Alicia Grant she assured me that my reservation and bookings were done and secured despite how busy it seemed. When i finally got to the hotel Alicia was the most pleasant , and welcoming person ever. With her kind of service I will most definitely be returning here .

title: Jail cell don’t not book
text: I was staying at the hotel which I thought was family friendly totally not! We had a two month old and stay up late night I stepped out for some food and wasn’t allowed back in the entrance 4 employees started swearing at me asking for my if which I didn’t have then they asked me if I had a green card very wrong disrespectful I highly recommended to stay away from this place it’s a disaster start to finish very unprofessional all the staff treat you like a inmate rather then a customer or guest!

title: Spacious!
text:
4.5 stars . I stayed here for business in October. While my expectations were somewhat low, I was still very impressed with the hotel and my experience.

The good:
- free breakfast for two people (which I was not able to use as I had brunch plans)
- extremely spacious room/suite with a huge balcony! I’m not sure how I scored an upgrade (or maybe it was a mistake?!) but I wasn’t complaining. It was the most spacious room I’ve ever stayed in in NY. I was so confused by the outdoor space that I had all to myself - it was larger than any other NY hotel room as well. I wish I had guests or a party so I could have taken advantage of all the space! 
- nice welcoming touch from the manager who sent two huge food trays of cheese and fruit + bottles of red wine and water to my room. Again, I was thinking, was this a mistake?! 
- very comfortable bed and relatively quiet room. While I did hear my neighbors through the connecting door, I at least didn’t hear any street or club noise, given that this is a party hotel.
- location is awesome! It’s just two blocks away from Chelsea Market and is close to so many restaurants and bars.

The bad:
- decor isn’t necessarily my type, and certain areas are a little too dark. Bathroom
design and functionality were also less than ideal.
- if I weren’t upgraded, I’m not sure this would be good for a hotel stay. This is really more of a party hotel.

If I got the same level of service as my last stay, I will definitely stay here again.

title: Mr
text: Aaron Overton was by far the most professional and diligent customer service representative I encountered in New York during my stay at the Dream Hotel Downtown. He makes you feel appreciated and goes above and beyond his line of duty. Keep up the good work and I will definitely recommend the Dream hotel to others. Job well done!!!

title: Drunken screaming in corridors
text:
The rooms are nano-sized and poorly maintained - the armchair collapsed and the backrest stabbed my husband in the ribs, towels are frayed, carpets and wallpapers look like they have been scuffed or ripped for years. There is an air of general disrepair and squalor.  

But the worst and most unforgivable problem? Several times a night, between 11pm and 4am, there are shrieking, obnoxious groups searching for friends' rooms so they can make their next party stop. 

There is NO true effort by the hotel to address or contain this issue, even though this is a known problem and they recognize that many of their guests are here for business. And is it practical for me to move rooms or hotels while I am here on business? No, and that should not be the default response. The hotel staff and management reply here in the reviews that they want to do everything they can to give guests a great experience, but their promises are ultimately empty. 

The hotel should recognize a responsibility to its guests, or it will see that corporate clients will cut their contracts.

title: Joseph the concierge is the greatest!
text:
I stayed at the Dream Downtown for the Dead and company Halloween show and had an amazing experience.   Joe at the concierge desk was so helpful.  

Lauren from the front office team made us feel so welcome and she is a shining star. 

The manager Chris sealed the deal and escorted my party to our suite he so kindly placed us in.  

I will be back very soon because of Joe Lauren & Chris!!!

title: LOUD &
text: I would not recommend this hotel. The first night I experienced a drunk person somehow getting onto my floor and banging on the door to let him in. I was so startled and when the front desk finally answered my frantic calls after 10 mins, they were so rude about it. Every night you can hear the music from the club from 10pm- 2/3 am- the rooms are not sound proof at all. My showers and mini bar was not being restocked and when I called to request this, they were so rude and said I had to request it. I was very disappointed about my experience and the service I experienced. The rooms are cute,nice decor and the location is great but unfortunately,  based on my stay, wouldn't recommend.

title: Great!
text:
Great service. Came here for business but I think this hotel is also good for pleasure. The swimming pool is a plus even when it is cold as its heated!
This place is also clean and the location is great. Will come back to this hotel.

title: Amazing Chic Spot with Top Notch Hospitality
text:
It was the best kind of Dream staying at this hotel. The group was my girlfriend and another couple, and we stayed for a weekend.

The first kudos goes to the hotel itself. The lobby is very chic with beautiful decor. Check in was nice and easy. Then we went up to our rooms. We booked the Silver King for both couples. The room was beautiful! High ceilings with a comfy bed. Big room as well. Bathroom was really nice. The location was awesome too. Close to everyting the west side has to offer. Stones throw away from Chelsea Market.

Next Kudos goes to the staff. Specifically, Felipe. Our trip to the city was amazing, and many of the best moments can be attributed to Felipe's hospitality. Can't say enough great things about him and his staff. They really brought the whole experience together. Big thanks!

I'd highly recommend staying at Dream Downtown on your next visit to the city!

title: Great Stay
text: Great hotel - not my first trip and always my favourite place to stay in NY. Great service, really friendly staff, cool hotel and decent clientele. The location is perfect with loads to do and some great bars and restaurants close by... already looking forward to my next visit!

title: Overpriced, terrible rooms, lots of noise
text:
Wow--again, another overhyped New York location.

We were here for business.  The lobby is a dungeon.  Everything looks poorly maintained.

The beds are on the floor and are uncomfortable.  Very flat pillows.  Lots of noise unless you're in the middle of the hotel (floor 7 was good, but other people had to move rooms from higher up).

No place to sit.  Terrible table.  Bad tvs.  Small rooms.  Elevators don't work well.  Key cards don't work well.  They were painting without any warnings of wet paint--nothing like paint on your coat.

This is a hook-up party joint, not a place to stay for business.

Rooms were stinky (mine smelled like weed).

Oh, and this was at the "discount" price of only 350 a night.  Terrible.  Oh--and the attached hotel (bodega negra) has a pornographic website.

Avoid, unless you like to party.

title: No service
text:
I don’t know what to say about this hotel. What do they stand for, what is the brand?? All very confusing, even more when you read TripAdvisor and the Hotel manager’s answers. He mentions a lot of times that the hotel wants to give a good service and experience. 
Here is our experience:
The room was clean and modern. We had a suite on 10th floor, a quiet room. No disturbance from all the parties at all. Good size of the bathroom and great view. But that is about it. The service of this hotel is really bad. I have never been to a hotel with so slow service of all in the staff. We arrived just before midnight on a Saturday, then you have a dj just by the front desk. So you cannot hear anything and our check in took more than 30 min. We were so tired and just wanted to sleep after a 24 hours travel. A good hotel would have given us the key and asked us to to the real check in the next morning. We asked for an extra duvet, we got one after a long waiting time but without a cover.... Everything we asked for took ages to get and usually it was wrong. I wrote an email to the manager and got a nice answer, but no action. Usually you see if a hotel is good or not by how they deal with problems. Here I gave them a chance but nothing happened. Not even a small gesture. I must say that it was surprisingly empty words. 
We asked for 10 more hangers, got 4. We asked for normal coffee, got decaf. Asked for a cover to our duvet three times until it was fixed. This list with small, not important but annoying things could continue...
Worst was the drive back to airport. 
We grabbed a taxi from the JFK airport that cost us $58 with an ok driver. The hotel arranged a bigger car but still bad quality back to airport but for a cost of $105 (hotel said it was $80, but then toll and tip was added) and with a crazy driver. 
So my proposal is that this hotel should just go for being the party hotel and not try to be the nice service hotel. Be honest who you are and be clear about that. Then you will have many more happy customers.

title: Surprisingly luxurious
text: I have been coming to NYC on business for roundly 25 years, and single, affordable hotel rooms for short-term travel seem to be getting more spartan with each passing year. I had never stayed at Dream Downtown before, and I chose it based on price and convenience to my event. The room was spotless and surprisingly roomy, even with the king-sized bed. All the furniture was in good shape. The bathroom was big enough to move around comfortably, the shower stall huge and open, and everything worked just as it was supposed to. Nice to see a boutique-style hotel that still puts robes in the closet. From a design perspective, to the extent that matters, it was cool, too. Overall, a total value proposition, and I would definitely stay here again.

title: Friendly and Inviting Hotel!
text: I was in NY for business for just under two weeks and staying at the Dream Downtown. Check-in was seamless and all that I needed during my stay was catered for with ease. The hotel has a fun and friendly atmosphere. The rooms are comfortable and stylish. Room service is delicious too! Overall, a great place to stay given it's proximity to Chelsea Market - Thanks Dream Downtown for a great stay, will see you soon!

title: Albergo moderno e trendy
text: In zona meatpacking e a pochi passi dalla fermata della metro e dal Chelsea market. Hotel giovane e modaiolo. Tendenzialmente costoso. Camere moderne e relativamente ampie. Molto ben frequentato e affollato per feste in particolare nel fine settimana. In estate rooftop e piscina

title: Spacious and great location
text: It's simply a nice hotel. The rooms are amazingly quiet and the hotel has good amenities and service. I would definitely stay again. For business purposes, there are plenty of nice restaurants and places to entertain. If you are doing anything at Chelsea Piers you will be happy to have stayed here.

title: A nightclub, not a hotel
text: This was the worst hotel stay I have had. This hotel needs to figure out what business it wants to pursue. I was booked in this hotel by a third-party service for a trip with two older teens. The location is good, and when our room was quiet, it was a nice place. The problem was that our room was not quiet when one would like it to be, like between the hours of midnight and 5 am.  The hotel had an event that we heard, and even more disruptive to any hope of sleep, felt in our room, with the LOUD music vibrating walls and the beds. The hotel told me they could not turn the music down, as it was from one of their biggest events of the year. Moving to a different room at 3 am was not the situation I wanted to be in and not a positive solution.  The hotel could have handled the situation much better from the very beginning by alerting me about the conditions when I checked in, not booking rooms impacted by the noise, not running a nightclub, etc.  I left feeling really unwell, tired, misled and unwanted.  I have never stayed at a hotel that created such an unwelcoming environment—and all utterly avoidable. Management reached out after my stay and I appreciate that gesture, but the fundamental issue I have with this establishment isn’t addressed by an afterthought. The inhospitable environment was intentional and a bigger priority to the hotel than my comfort. This business needs to figure out what it wants to be—a nightclub or a hotel. Until then this hotel is only suitable for people who go to bed when the sun rises.

title: Hosted Large Corporate Event
text:
On September 24th and 25th, we hosted 31 companies and 33 attendees at the Dream Hotel Downtown for nearly two full days. The hotel is located in the heart of the Meatpacking District and across from Apple Store, Starbucks and Restoration Hardware. 

Our front desk staff, corporate event host (Amanda), AV crew and food service team was A+ from start to finish. Our clients and consultants had an amazing experience and loved it. Client feedback was stellar. 

Let me just say that I hate buffets, but loved the breakfast and lunch buffets. The food quality and variety was spectacular. 

We will be back in 2020. Great job, Amanda, Brent, Front Desk and Food Service staff. 

Thank you very much.

title: Never stay at this hotel
text: My plans changed and I had to check out of the hotel one night into a four night stay.  They refused to refund the balance of my stay.  Also there are several night clubs at the property and that are very loud and do not close till 3 / 4 am.

title: Great Location and Service
text: Nice and local hotel - good nightclub and bar - 4 starts as breakfast was a bit overpriced. I liked the staff and check in and out was fast - rooms are snug but work well. Dont get a room beside the booming nightclub though!!

title: Atrocious customer service
text: I try not to be negative in reviews. This is  all  about customer service and has nothing to do with the facility. Show up around 5 o'clock. Room is not ready. Already a problem. And hour later the Room is still not ready and they will not change my room. Honestly, I have very rarely experienced such a disregard for a guest. Especially  in light of the abundant hotel available around there. I will never go back again.

title: One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in
text: I really hate this place. The rooms are supposed to be hip, but they're just annoying. The lighting is terrible. The dimmer switches are maddening. The bed is practically a mattress on the ground and terribly uncomfortable. The nightstands have no place to store anything; no shelves, no drawers. There are no outlets near the bed unless you pull the bed out and probe around with your fingers near the baseboard. The ironing board is useless. There were no washcloths. There's a peephole into the bathroom. The do-not-disturb sign is a light on the doorbell that is so impossible to comprehend that even the housekeeping staff ignore it. The refrigerator is crammed with things to buy but has no room to put any of your own food in it. There's not even a coffee machine. What kind of hotel doesn't provide a coffee maker? (Hint: this one.) There's a speaker in the bathroom to play the sound from the TV--why? The bathroom has a sink that reminds me of a prison. But there's no place to put my toiletries save a teeny glass shelf. There are no reading lights near the bed. But there's a useless purple entry light. One of the outlets on the desk works but the other doesn't. No idea why. There are maybe 2 small drawers, one half the depth of the other, to put clothes in. The only positive thing I can say about it is the water pressure in the shower was good.

title: Elegant, men mye støy og arrogant personale
text: Endelig er tre netter på Dream Downtown over. Vi hadde booket superior rom, som man skulle tro var bra. Det som er dumt er at diskoteket PhD er i 12.etg og vårt rom var i 11.etg. Støynivået var så høyt at jeg kunne bruke en app på mobilen for å se hvilke sanger som ble spilt. Dette varer frem til kl 4 om natten. Første natt ble det derfor lite søvn. Vi fikk litt motvillig byttet rom til 9.etg. Lyden fra PhD når også ned hit, men ikke verre enn at vi klarte å sove. Personalet på hotellet er dessverre gjennomført arrogant og lite serviceinnstilt. Det var ingen særlig tegn til beklagelse for støy på rommet, men over alt på hotellet og kafeen var det det samme. Hoteller i USA pleier alltid å ha svært god service, men ikke her. Aldri et hei, eller god morgen, kan vi hjelpe med noe, eller noe så enkelt som et smil, som det er vanlig å oppleve på andre hoteller. Det som er bra med hotellet er at det er svært flott og elegant. Det er rent, rommene er store, og hotellet har en god beliggenhet i bra og rolig nabolag med Chelsea Market og en rekke gode restauranter i nærheten.

title: Pleasant, Relaxing Stay
text:
My girlfriend and I wanted to stay at a hotel that was hip, nicely decorated, offered a relaxing stay and fun at the same time. We got exactly what we were looking for!
Let me start off by saying that I was a bit concerned because of the mixed reviews recently left here; complaints of noise from the parties being heard from the rooms, elevators smelling like weed, and bad service from staff. 

This was far from the truth!

We chose the weekender package directly from their website, highly recommended! It included continental breakfast at Bodega Negra; the best continental breakfast I’ve ever had! Their menu had a nice variety of breakfast options, from a delicious smash avocado toast to a massive stack of pancakes, all fresh made to order. And of course, breakfast isn’t complete without mimosas, but if spicy is more to your liking, they had bloody Mary’s to kick start your morning! We only had a chance to try the carrots off their lunch menu, very tasteful by the way, but there was an option for every palette. 

All of the staff was very accommodating! Check-in was smooth. The staff addressed our questions and helped us with recommendations on local sites to check out and try. We got the bronze king room without balcony and were situated the ninth floor. It was plenty of space for the two of us on our 3 night stay. Besides, you don’t visit NYC to be trapped in a room all day, get out there and take in the sights😉. The service requests we had (one of the light fixtures weren’t working) were addressed immediately. Best of all, in my opinion, is that they message you directly to your phone after check in should you have any questions or concerns. This is where we addressed the lighting fixture, and they fixed it while we were out and about. 

The 12th floor rooftop venue called PHD came with great music and drinks. Whether your thing is to sit back and sip on your manhattan or show off your freshest dance moves, there’s plenty of space for both with the views and decor to add that finishing touch for your next night photo selfie. We already had plans for Saturday night, but we had some serious FOMO when we saw the crowds start to arrive for PHD. 

We didn’t come prepared, but they also have a heated pool with beach beds, cabanas, and a bar just steps away.  Definitely something to consider for our return during warmer weather. 

Needless to say, I recommend this place to anyone who is looking to be centrally located with shopping dining and leisure all within walking distance.

title: A hip hotel that charges for ice
text: The hotel is for young people. Room size is good but the beds are very low to the floor. Not for people with hip or knee problems. They charge an extra resort fee per person and then have the audacity to charge you for a bucket of ice. I’ve stayed all over the world and never been charged for ice. Wouldn’t stay there again 😫

title: The Best of NYC all in one place!
text: I have been staying at The Dream Downtown for several years and I am always pleased with my stay.  The staff, the clean rooms with amazing views of the city or their beautiful pool, the restaurants, the lobby, etc., all make this the best place to stay when visiting NYC.

title: Fantastic Place to See and be Seen
text:
We chose this hotel following a personal recommendation from a friend who is a local. The hotel is very modern and has a hip vibe to it from the time you arrive. I loved the style and arty decorations throughout the building.
As I was travelling with a friend we had booked a two bedroom room (A Silver Double) which looked cute and quirky online.  To be honest I was disappointed with the room when we checked in.  Yes it had the quirky feel of the photos (with round windows reminiscent of ships port holes) but it was missing basic amenities such as tea and coffee provision or complimentary water.  These are standard items in a hotel of this quality and price point.  In addition the room was incredibly small and had very limited storage space, to the point we both lived out of our suitcases for the week! It was also dirty in places, the 'carpet' was surprisingly threadbare, and the bathroom fixtures were not secure (the toilet roll holder fell off the wall at one point).  I get the feeling this is the kind of place the young hip crowd go for a weekend to party but isn't really somewhere that caters to international guests wanting a longer term luxury holiday.  We did spend time at the Beach Club / Pool and PHD (separate reviews) both of which were fantastic.  The location for visiting Chelsea and Greenwich is also perfect.

Having said all of the above, except for a little hiccup at check-in we could not fault the service of the staff.  Incredibly warm, welcoming and professional.  All requests to the guest services, housekeeping and bell staff were dealt with quickly, efficiently and as though nothing was too much trouble for them.

In Summary: Great place to stay to see and be seen and to experience the celeb life style BUT you are paying for the name and the associated brands of the restaurants and bars, not necessarily the quality of the hotel itself.  We did have a blast however and would definitely stay again, just perhaps in a different room and for a shorter time.

title: Great stay!
text: Amazing stay. Location was great and staff was phenomenal. We went to PHD and Electric Room and had a blast. Front desk and housekeeping staff were genuine and willing to go the extra mile to help us. Came here for anniversary and hotel overpassed expectations. Will definitely be coming back.

title: Perfect city stay
text: This was the perfect location for me and my sisters trip into NY. Its a beautiful area. The staff and hotel was wonderful. Our room was a very nice size with a great little balcony overlooking the pool. I would definitely stay again. We left talking about when to make plans to come back.

title: Nightclub atmosphere
text: I wouldn’t recommend this hotel if you are looking for relaxation and class. Hotel was more of a nightclub atmosphere. The hotel lobby had a DJ playing and a rooftop bar so if you wanted to relax in lobby and have a drink you had hundreds of drunk girls and guys coming in and out of hotel all night. The floor I was staying on smelled like marijuana all day. The front desk and concierge weren’t friendly or nice at all. Glad I was only staying one night.

title: Can’t get better during the summer
text:
Perfect hotel with rooftop pool. Amazing for summertime. 
Hotel is very modern , minimalistic but still feels warm. Great location. You can walk to Times Square but if you don’t want to cab is only $12 from here - amazing. 
I enjoyed it so much. I would definitely come back.

title: Horribly maintained and filthy, rude staff
text: Arrived early and room wasn’t ready, was greeted by multiple massive cockroaches in the hotel facilities/gym. Reception brushed it off and said they really need to call pest control. Stayed from Sept 12-17th. Definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone, small rooms, dirty, and extremely rude staff (especially entrance staff at PHD). Also, the entire floor I was on stank of weed.

title: Great location
text: Awesome location! Near some great restaurants and Chelsea Market. It was a great stay. The room was clean and the staff was very courteous and attentive. The only downfall was the construction on the street. Will be back!

title: More like The Nightmare
text: It was never a great hotel but it’s now just awful. It’s a nightclub with beds. If you like noise 24/7, flat pillows, paltry room amenities and lights that don’t go out, then by all means, this is the place for you. I only stayed here because of the proximity to work and others nearby were sold out. I’ve learned my lesson.

title: Awesome location and atmosphere
text:
The hotel has a very defined value proposition: being a place for outgoing, fancy and urban guests. It meets that with the decoration, room, architecture, nightlife and overall atmosphere.

I really enjoyed my stay, I had a room with a balcony to the street (which was a bit noisy from all the construction work below, but thats not the hotel's fault).

One minor setback is that the hotel can be noisy during the weekends, since guests come back from the nightlife options a little bit loud. That happened to me on Saturday night but others were fine.

The hotel is very well located between 8th and 9th and literally across the street from Chelsea Market.

title: Horrible smelling hotel, poor service, poor attention to detail in room
text:
Ignoring for a moment that the north elevator bank always smells like sewage, there was an even worse experience with smells in my room.

I had to work late just about every night during my recent stay, and there's a tiny 'desk' on the wall to put my laptop on. Each night as I sat there working, I would frequently get a whiff of really strong air freshener, like the kind you smell in public toilets. And it was giving me the worst headaches, and itchy, burning eyes.

I called the staff about it several times and they assured me they didn't have anything like that in the rooms, and housekeeping said they didn't do anything like that.

I turned the room over more than once trying to find where it was coming from, and I thought I was maybe just losing my mind. But on the fourth night I finally found it!

Hidden inside the hollow spaces in the desk where I'd been working were bits of a scented urinal screen that had been cut into little pieces. Some were caked in dust and had been there for years, others were brand new. 

Maintenance crew came by and acted surprised to see that, but that was all I got from the staff. I complained to front desk workers, and they said a manager would get back to me, but they never responded.

If you like your hotel and room smelling like a men's toilet, this place is for you. It's definitely not for me.

Lastly, the room was not stocked with glassware other than two tumblers in the bathroom; no facial tissue; missing items in the mini-bar which I could've been charged for had I not noticed and said something.

title: What a complete disaster - Avoid this hotel at all costs
text:
Was not told at check in there would be a $150 per DAY charge on my CC (I had planned to stay for 4 days and only realized this per day charge as I was looking at my credit card statement - I was shocked to see a $600 hold on my card after having pre-paid nearly $1600 for a four night stay.

Next: While the room was fine, I ended up being up until almost 5am as the music from the lobby was blasted through the hotel until 4am. I could feel the bass in my body, my bed was vibrating and the walls were too. It was unreal. Not one person at any point of booking or check in ever mentioned they turn their lobby space into a MASSIVE party. 

I was here for work and completely missed my entire next day due to being a total zombie. 

They let me out of the last two nights, thankfully (the right thing to do). I'll never stay at another Dream hotel. I can't even believe places like this exist. What a terrible place.

title: Just wrong!!!
text:
I have been all over the world and traveled at the best of best hotels to the slums of all... never have I ever heard of a hotel CHARGING for a bucket/cup of ice ... NEVER heard such a crazy thing 
... makes the whole stay here a downfall cause I’m afraid to ask for extra towels now cause that might be a charge

title: Excellent for families and when running solo. But it’s the staff (and pool and clubs) which make it a super steal
text: It’s hard to imagine a more boutique feeling hotel with an all year pool 24 hour room service top-notch clubs for as cheap as you get when staying at dream downtown. But I’m not writing about that, but instead about the staff. Whether you have two little kids who enjoy the adults pool too much to a mom who is little too vocally pro-trump with who ever she meets, or some tired parents that need some help, everyone here was super friendly and accommodating. Not the experience I’m used to in nyc, but I could. This is our second trip here this year. Really impressive.

title: going back 4th time
text: i love this property as it suits my needs. shopping by the day and partying at night! hotel not suitable for kids. Most of the staff is amazing. Had a couple of rude experiences but i would still give 5 stars for location and ambience and for most of the staff. I decided my upcoming stay will be the last chance i will give to the hotel since i love the lobby and the vibe of the hotel a lot and comfortable with the location. whenever i stay here , it is for more than a week. Although the hotel does need a refurbishment. we were a group of more than 12 people staying there in end of may to beginning of june, some of my friends didn't have a door for the bathroom. the hotel is noisy and if you are in new york for early morning work schedule, this is not the place for you. the food and the restaurants are fabulous. looking forward to a better stay in october.

title: Tres bruillant, plus une boite de nuit que un hotel.
text:
Nous avons organises un seminaire d'entreprise dans cet hotel. La salle de danse 'electric room' au sous sol c'est vu transforme en salle de reunion. C'est original, mais ce n'est vraiment pas terrible: Bruit permanent d'un aggregat de clime ou autre dans une piece a cote, apres quelques heures ca devient vraiment insupportable. Une grande TV plutot que un videoprojecteur, acceptable mais pas top. 
La nuit, il y a un rooftop sur un des batiments et la piscine de l'hotel est entoure par des jeunes cadres dynamiques qui y prennent un verre. Les chambres sont corrects mais pas non plus extraordinaires, et surtout, on entend le boum-boum-boum jusqu'a 2h la nuit. Le quartier est genial, c'est a deux pas de la high line et super pour des ballades. Mais je ne retournerai certainement pas a cet endroit.

title: Staff Treated Us Like Family
text: Spent the weekend in New York City at this lovely hotel which was a million dollar experience. Just want to give a shout-out to manager Maria who took the extra time to provide my family with the greatest and highest level of service possible. Also, wanted to thank guest service supervisor Lauren Nordstrom for helping facilitate our family reunion and special family day by the pool.

title: Great location, stunning hotel and spacious room
text:
Staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave us recommendations on arrival where to go shopping and eat. The room was nice and spacious and have a view of the pool.
My favourite part of the visit was the bed! I went as far as to ask reception where this was from so i could purchase the mattress and the duvet because we had such an amazing sleep in this room because it was so comfy to sleep on. this is my 6th time going to New York and i have been in a different hotel every time, next time i return i dont think we will change up the hotel and return to Dreams. The location was perfect for us, subway down the street, cafes and restaurants on every corner. Very impressed with the hotel.

title: スタッフのホスピタリティが最悪
text:
マネージャーのマリアは一般客にはとても傲慢な接客をし、グーグルの宿泊客には笑顔を振り撒く。ルームサービスで水、トニックウォーター、クランベリージュース、氷を頼んだだけで$100請求された。友達は前回の滞在でノートパソコンとiPadを失くされたが、補償も特に何もなかった。同建物内に二つのクラブ、隣にもハイエンドなクラブがあるのでそれが目的だったら楽しめるのではないかと思います。
The manager Maria at the front desk was super arrogant and I had the worst customer service. It seems like she does not know what hospitality is. Also my friend left her laptop last time she stayed but they never gave her back. You should avoid staying unless you work at google. They only treat well google guest.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Hotel muito bonito, limpo e organizado. Atendimento é excelente, todos os colaboradores foram muito atenciosos em todos os momentos. O Bar "embaixo" da piscina é um show a parte. Fiquei no setimo andar, e apesar de haver festas quase que diariamente no rooftop no hotel, não ouvi nenhum barulho que me incomodasse.

title: Not a dream...cant sleep here!
text: I travel to NY for work frequently. So I try to stay at recommended hotels and I do read the reviews on Trip Advisor. I must have missed the review that said “Don’t stay here if you want any sleep”. Ugh- 3 nights of loud DJing in lobby (he was good though!) and pool area party until10:30pm. My room was on 3rd floor so I could hear the party. My tv didn’t work when I arrived but they fixed it the next day. The people who stay here want to party. All 3 nights there was a group of dudes yelling down the my hallways in a drunken rage. Loud and obnoxious swearing a lot and clearly wasted. So, if you want a great club environment, this is the place. Great people watching .If you want to sleep and hope to to walk to work in Chelsea. Don’t do it. It’s a scene. There’s a coffee place in lobby and the coffee is very good but the service is slow.  The elevators are slow too. This is a expensive hotel due to the location -I left after 3 nights and stayed with a friend because I really needed a good night sleep. the amenities are meh and the Um, no, I won’t be back.

title: Simply Awful
text: From the rude receptionist at check in, to thumping bass till 4am in the morning, this hotel is absolutely awful. They care more about their night club guests then they do those staying in the hotel. This place used to be great and has gone off the rails. Avoid this place at all costs if you actually want to enjoy your travels.

title: Superb guest service supervisor!
text:
My hubby and I came to the Dream Hotel to celebrate our anniversary. As we were checking in we told Lauren Nordstrom(guest service supervisor) that we were celebrating our anniversary. She was super friendly and accommodating. But not only did she provided superb guest service when we were checking in, she surprised us with a bottle of wine sent to our room. What a pleasant surprise! The hotel is amazing. Rooms are clean and bed really comfortable. The pool is great! And the guest service is fantastic.
Thank you Lauren Nordstrom and the Dream team for making our special date an unforgettable memory!

title: Booking Promo Just To Get Your Attention
text: I booked this hotel strictly for the promo 'book direct and save" and it was not up to snuff.  Part of the reason I liked this promotion was because it offered early check in or late check out based on availability.  I get that.  However, when we arrived at 5PM (check in at 3PM) our room wasn't even ready and we were asked to wait an unknown amount of time.  We had an event to go to and needed to change and get going and this delay ended up making us late to our event.  Front desk tried to get me to agree to temporarily be moved to a bronze room ( we booked gold) in the interim which was unacceptable.  The promo offered a free complimentary upgrade.  If there was ever a time for an upgrade I would assume your room not being ready by 5PM would be one of those things.  So we waited at least a half hour or more, and when we got to our room there were dirty room service dishes on the floor next to the door of our room.  So gross, obviously they must have JUST cleaned it who knows but that is terrible to see dirty dishes from the guests before you.  Upon check in I asked about the late check out (we needed it) and he said he would accommodate it up to 1PM the next day.  Sure enough that was not communicated because a woman came by our room at like 12:15 asking us to leave.  I explained we arranged for the late checkout with the desk but she said she never got any word of that so that was another factor of the promo that never panned out.  We valeted our car and forgot something in the vehicle by accident.  We were told they would charge us a whole day valet charge to bring it around.  They told us to walk across the street to the parking lot and find an attendant to help locate the car so we could find what we were looking for,  When we got here...no attendant in sight.  We ran back to the hotel and one of the very nice bellmen escorted us back to the car and here's the kicker...they left the car unlocked!!  Terrible, who know what could have happened with an unlocked car in that lot.  Room was very small but had a great view.  The beds were terribly uncomfortable and temperature set point in the room was hard to get to the right temperature.  It was either too hot or too cold.  There was a strange moisture odor in the hallway that I attributed to the fact they have a pool but why would you smell moisture on the 10th floor?  One positive was the Concierge was very helpful though for an urgent request that he helped us with.  I would not book here again.  Promo seemed like a scam just to get you in the door.  There is too much competition in NYC with hotels that have great customer service.  This location needs a good lesson on that as well up front customer marketing.  I left feeling very disappointed and ripped off.

title: Fantastic Location, OK accomodation
text: You can't beat the location of this hotel. It's in a great spot near the Chelsea Market, restaurants, highline, great jumping off point for dining.  I don't have any real issue with the room quality but i would by no means consider this a luxury hotel hence the 3 star rating.  The rooms are small (ok, expected in NYC), and the bathroom somewhat institutional.  That might be the effect they are going for though  Think hard metal surfaces throughout and clouded glass separating it from the actual room. I would actually probably stay here again simply due to the where the hotel is located.  It offers a good price for what you get and the staff is very nice.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: The staff was nice , the room was clean ! And the party during the night is awesome ! They have a breathtaking view . I like the fact after dinner I could go to my hotel to party and go straight to me room after

title: If you would like to sleep or take a hot shower, stay at the Holiday Inn instead and save your money . . .
text: Luckily, I have time to write this review tonight since it is so loud no one could possibly sleep. Admittedly, there is a certain crowd who would love this hotel; however, if your purpose for getting a hotel room is to take a hot shower OR to sleep, forget it if you stay here. There are loud parties that go on until all hours and yesterday there was no hot water. The person at the front desk just told me "that's what we're known for." So there you go. Now you can make your own decisions about whether this is the place for you. She didn't specify whether they are "known for" not having not water or loud parties when people like me are usually sleeping. EVERY Holiday Inn I've ever stayed in has allowed me to have a hot shower and to sleep at most any hour I wanted, so if that's your goal too, hang out in the lovely lobby of this hotel then go back to your Holiday Inn to actually shower and sleep.

title: Very Noisy
text: Nevermind the music you hear from neighboring clubs, cars and people outside, there is a loading doc directly across the street so 4 am starts the trucks backing up, guys yelling, banging, truck engines, ugh! You won't sleep past 4 am! Hotel never even asked how my stay was.

title: First Class Service!!!!!!
text: Upon checking in to The Dream Downtown I was greeted by the wonderful and friendly Lauren Nordstrom, Guest Services Supervisor.  She was extremely professional and made me feel right at home. I also must say that the GM, Ray Wong is ALWAYS gracious and accommodating when I visit the Dream, whether for business or pleasure. The food in the lobby cafe was delicious, especially the homemade chocolate cake that I brought up to my room for a late night dessert :)  Finally I wrapped up my stay with coffee by the pool in the morning, which is a rare treat in NYC.

title: Nicest penthouse in new york city
text: I stayed at the guesthouse in the dream downtown for my birthday. It is by far the  most extravagant penthouse in the entire 5 boros. The staff and service all deserve 5 stars. We visited the phd rooftop club as well. The club has stunning views and great music however the staff and cleanliness was lacking. They are custom to a certain tax bracket of customers and are not afraid to show it. Also someone had used the bathroom on the dance floor and it was never cleaned. We also spent an entire day poolside and had a blast! So much fun i forgot i was in the busy streets of new york! I lost a large some of cash in a robe at the pool, and get this,three staff members by the names David, Maria, and Juan were able to find it and return it to me, in full! Big shout out to you guys, honesty is a hard trait to come by im any business and they showed it with extreme professionalism. All in all i had an amazing birthday and am headed back this weekend for the same! See you soon.

title: Noisy and Poor Service
text:
Have to say I'm inclined to agree with reviewer below me. This about sums it up for me: convenient location and clean room, but needs to treat their guests better than party goers. 

I booked this hotel earlier than normal, multiple months ahead of time for a business trip. I specifically requested a quiet room as soon as I booked the hotel. Instead I received a room where I listened to thumping club music until 3:30am. When I called the management at 2:30am to enquire about a quieter room they informed me there was nothing they could do.

Overall feeling from staff is you are unwelcome and an inconvenience to them. No hotel or front desk employees say hello when you walk through the doors, club bouncers waiting at main elevators to let people up into club frown at you as you try to get to your room (the elevators are shared/next to each other). The cleaning staff were the one exception, super friendly and sweet, said hello to me multiple times as I passed in hallways even though I don't use housekeeping when I'm on a short trip.

 I will not be staying here again and definitely would not recommend for business travel.

title: Fun hotel but needs to treat their guests better than party goers
text: The overall feeling as a guest staying in this hotel is that you are in a 24/7 nightclub. No hotel or front desk employees say hello when you walk through the doors. The doormen or club bouncers I should say, are more concerned that if you are here for the club that you have a stamp and are not sneaking past the line. Last night (on a Monday) we slept to loud thumping club music until what had to be 4am. And if you want to take a nap during the day, forget about it. The vibration of the music from the daytime pool party will overwhelm you. The room was a decent size although felt like a cruise ship cabin from the 70s. No coffee maker. No access to water other than the (1) 12 ounce bottle they provided over the 3 nights we were there & of course the $15 bottled water options from the mini fridge. The toilet in the bathroom was way too high and a huge design flaw in my opinion. I was on my tippy toes to even use it and I am not short. We had fun at the restaurant downstairs (bodega negro) and enjoyed cocktails on the rooftop - despite those around us being overly intoxicated and throwing up on the terrace. I liked that there was a lot going on at the hotel but it should not have been to the extent it was. The hallways always had empty drink glasses and leftover room service trays that would sit for almost 24 hours before anyone came to pick it up. It’s just clear that there is little concern about providing good hospitality and that the focus is on the party scene. I would like to note though that the housekeeping staff is far better than any other staff in this hotel. They always said hello, serviced our room as soon as we would leave and responded right away when we needed fresh towels. I am giving 2 stars bc of this and the location but my husband and I would never stay here again.

title: Nicole Lampon made the difference!
text: My stay at the Dream was excellent. I booked my reservation and needed to make adjustments. Nicole Lampon assisted me, SHE WAS EXCELLENT. She ensured both rooms that I booked had my preferences. There was even a hand written note in both rooms from Nicole. This kind of service is above and beyond. She listened to the fact that I did not have a great check in experience on my last stay. This time it was excellent and because my stay started off so well it set the tone for the rest of my trip. Thank you Nicole for going above and beyond for my birthday booking.

title: Great hotel and Service!!
text:
I was in town for a few nights with some friends and the service and hotel was awesome. We especially appreciated the incredible service provided by Danny at the front desk and pool area. He's truly a great ambassador for this wonderful hotel!!
We'll definitely be back within the next few months.
Awesome pool, incredible roof top bar and modern look.

title: Big Thank You
text:
I would like to say Thank you to all the staff at the hotel and 
specially to Lauren at the reception.
She was so polite and helpful with great smile and manners and made very good impression on how guests should be treated.

Thank You Lauren 

Best Regards Nikolay

title: Bar with lodgings
text:
Finishing up our stay here. The room clean and foyer during the day lovely are the only two compliments that can be provided.
Better lighting is needed in the bathroom, mirrors need replacing as they have a sheen over them and there is no bench space . Air con unit is noisey. No water is provided for the stay.
The worst thing about the hotel though was being made to feel like an imposter; either up beside the pool or walking to the lift of an evening. Be warned; after 6pm you’re use of the hotel is limited to your room and the gym.  The hotel lobby is turned into a nightclub and all the seating is reserved, the use of the elevator was confined to one out of three and when we ventured to the roof top for a drink we were met with boredom and disdain by the security and bar staff.- the area was empty however service non existent , the joke on the wait staff though as we were ready to have a great night and spend- which we did elsewhere!  Not sure what the hotel and resort charges go to as multiple times the facilities were closed for private events. go elsewhere

title: Excellent service and location
text: We stayed at Dream Downtown in July and we are definitely coming back really soon. The location is close to everything. Bagatelle was 5 minutes away and the Chealsea Market 2 minutes away. At first, we picked this hotel because it had a pool but everything was beyond our expectation. The pool area was great, super clean and the restaurant next to it had great drinks and food. Try the Frozay next time you go. The view from the rooftop is breath taking. If you want to enjoy a drink, you can do it on the roof top and have an amazing view on the city. The service was great and the stuff made our stay even more enjoyable. Daniel Perez at the front desk welcomed us and checked us in very quick. He was super helpful in answering all of our questions and he recommended us a few placed to visit in NYC. The hotel also has a cute lounge area and a gym.

title: Very pleasant and fun stay
text:
We loved it! We booked a room with 2 beds but the hotel upgraded us to a platinum suite at no additional cost, since there were no more rooms with two beds available. The suite was very large and comfortable; clean room and modern bathroom. Our room was facing the pool and we could hear the music in the afternoon however, I expected certain level of noise in a hotel like Dream. Noise level was really not bad at all though. Check in process was very easy and the front desk staff was very cordial and accommodating. The rooftop bar has beautiful views and DJ. 
The pool was quite large; it gets crowded and there is often waitlist to get a lounge chair. My only complaint is that one of the swimming pool attendants told our group that one of us had to occupy the lounge chair at all times otherwise it would be taken away (??). At the time we were swimming and it seemed like a very unreasonable demand especially since we only used ONE chair for 4 of us. 
Other than that, everything was great and I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Dreamy time at Dream Downtown
text: We just returned from a weekend in the city to celebrate my daughter's 30th birthday and we stayed at the Dream Hotel Downtown in NYC.  Our visit was wonderful.  The staff was friendly and helpful from the front desk staff at check-in, (which took about 5 minutes), to the concierge, room service and cleaning staff.  A piece of birthday cake was even delivered to our room at 10 pm, compliments of the management--complete with the nicest hand written birthday note.  I have NEVER received anything so nice at any other hotel.  We had requested a room away from the nightclubs when we made the reservation, and when we arrived we had been upgraded at no extra cost to a beautiful room with a king bed.  The room was fresh, modern and immaculate.  The bathroom is very cool with a tiny round  tile on the floors all the way to the high ceilings, and a chainmail shower curtain and a rain shower head.  I have stayed at a lot of Hilton, Mariott, and Holiday Inn hotels and the bathrooms frequently have dingy baseboards, peeling wall paper in the corners and plastic enclosure showers but this bathroom is new looking and spotless.  The towels are hanging on a ladder leaning against the wall.  The inside of the bathroom is frosted glass and the outside is mirrored glass.  Plenty of hot water.  Some reviewers complained about a lack of towels and no blow dryer.  We had plenty of towels, a blow dryer, and complimentary tubes of shampoo, conditioner and body wash, and a nice, cozy bath robe.  People complained that the concrete floors were cold.  The concrete floor lends to the industrial chic look of the room and there is a large antique style rug under the bed, which covers most of the floor.  The small section of concrete floor you might walk on is cool and feels good in August.  People complained about a lack of plugs by the bed.  There is a plug strip on the floor on one side of the bed with plenty of outlets.  There are also USB ports for charging phones, on the side of the bedside lamps on both sides of the bed--as well as multiple plugs on the small wall mounted desk across from the bed.  We requested a refrigerator, (for $10), which was in our room when we arrived.  We went to Chelsea Market, (across the street), and purchased delicious croissants and teeny tiny jellies from Sarabeth's Bakery which we ate for breakfast the next day.  We also went to Duane Reade drug store down the sidewalk from Dream and brought back water, soda, OJ, chips and snacks--so we didn't miss the fact that there is no coffee maker in the room.  There are also snacks in the minibar for a charge--and there is an order form for breakfast you can fill out and hang on your doorknob and your breakfast will be delivered to you at your preferred time.  Some reviewers complained about noise.  There was absolutely no noise at all in our room....no noise from either night club, or from the room above us or beside us, or from the hallway.  There were no rude or loud obnoxious guests anywhere--and the guests we did encounter in the public spaces and on elevators, were nice, polite and well dressed.  Speaking of elevators, there are several and we never had more than a minute or two to wait. And there was no smell of smoke of any kind anywhere.   We did not have time to go to the clubs or the pool, but the front dest was happy to share information on both.  The clubs are not owned by the hotel itself, however, hotel guests are guaranteed entrance if they wish to go before 9:30 pm.  If you want to go after that time, it is like entrance to any other NYC nightclub, which means you may have to stand in line, or pay for a minimum drink order.  As for the pool lounge chairs, they are first come, first serve starting at 8 am, but you can be wait listed or sit at the grill and wait. We found street parking nearby and were able to stay all Sat/Sun free of charge.  In all, we found the Dream Hotel to be a peaceful and amazing get-away, and will definitely return.  It is a great value in a great location!

text:

title: Can’t wait to come back!
text: Had the most amazing trip to NYC while staying at Dream. Definitely the place to be if you’re looking for a lively atmosphere am to pm. The location is amazing and we were able to explore different areas of the city within walking distance/short cab ride. The staff were all super friendly and took the time to get to know us. Danny at the front desk was extremely helpful/accommodating and remembered us every time we needed something. Looking forward to my next NYC visit and will definitely be staying at Dream Downtown again-no question.

title: Dream Downtown is GREAT
text: I had the most amazing stay at Dream downtown! Lauren was so kind and helpful when making our last minute reservation and Daniel blew us away with our check-in experience! We had so much fun in the area and our room was fabulous! I will definitely recommend to friends and family and I can’t wait to come back!

title: Below expectations
text:
Unless you are young and want to party I would avoid this hotel. 

It feels like a nightclub all throughout. 
The pool area is surrounded by great big walls (no view at all) and feels enclosed and prison like. 
There are lots of questionable smells around the hotel (musty, stale, nightclubby). 
The rooftop bar is frequently unavailable as can be booked for functions by non hotel guests. 
The amenities in the rooms are packing, barely any toiletries, towels etc.

The only positive is the location. That is excellent

title: By far the worst hotel I've stayed at in years
text: Stayed here because my office is across the street. This hotel is by far the worst I've stayed at in years. The main thing I pick a hotel for is the ability to get a great night's sleep. I stayed here 3 nights and was a walking zombie by the time I left as I wasn't able to get a single night of good sleep. It's incredibly loud and definitely caters more to the party crowd than the those who want a good night's sleep. Really disappointed in my experience here and will never stay here again.

title: Staycation !
text:
I want to write a lot more but its limited ! 
Yogi the best bartender ever! He red my mind !
Karina/ Naomi /Cathy Lynn -the best service!!
Camillo & Sara- always took care of me at the pool non- stop!!

title: Great Hospitality
text: Love the fact they are pet friendly. Hard to find that anymore. Front desk was friendly and super helpful. Only stayed for a weekend to get away from the hustle and bustle with Hubby. That did us good. Love the roof-top pool. Good Spot in the city for sure!!

title: Excellent location and service
text: Stayed at the dream for a week and really enjoyed the stay.  Staff is friendly while not overdoing it and rooms are nice.  Rooftop is great even if drinks are $$$.  It is a busy hotel with good nightlife.  Would not recommend for very young kids but no problem with teenagers.  Several restaurants in the area and Chelsea market is couple streets away.  I was but worried since a everal comments talk about the noise from bar and nightclub but we did not hear a thing.

title: More like a nightmare
text: They were renovating our floor and the hallways have no carpeting. It makes it extremely loud when people are passing our room door. Our bathroom shower ceiling has water damage with drywall and paint peeling, also damage to the corner of the tile in the shower, and mildew growing. I took pictures and brought this to the staff's attention and nothing was done whatsoever. Also starting around 3 a.m. in the morning club-goers drom the in house rooftop nightclub started to arrive back to their rooms and were extremely loud and boisterous in the hallways making it impossible to sleep until after 5:30am when the noise finally stopped. If you want a peaceful rest during the day forget it, as the pool has DJ blasting music most of day until 8pm at window rattling decibels that can be heard from most rooms.

title: The lobby smells like pee
text:
The absolute first thing we noticed was the lobby smelled like pee. My coworker & I tried to explain it away ( they're dog friendly, no it's probably just from people walking thru to the pool etc.) but it really does smell like pee. Considering this was not a cheap hotel that was a big first problem. 

Cons:
1) You can hear everything outside your door. Everything.
2) They have a nightclub on the roof and reserve one elevator for this. One elevator was broken. So that left one elevator for guest AND staff. The first night we were there we waited for 35 minutes to go to our room ( we took the stairs after this but we had luggage the first night). By the time we went up there was a group of about 16 guests who had been waiting, including a small child. We asked if we could please use the club elevator since they weren't super busy yet but they refused.
3) The staff generally doesn't care about your stay (one except with the guy who checked us in who was really nice).
4) After the hotel staff cleaned our room I found a candy bar wrapper on my side of the bed that was definetly not me, nor there before they cleaned.
5) They play incredibly loud music on the pool deck on the weekends during the day, this isn't the worst thing, but worth noting. We had come back to the hotel to do some work but it was too loud.

Pro:
 The bed was really comfy.

title: Nightmare in Dream hotel
text:
It was like a nice promise for our 5 days in NYC : good location in Chelsea, “we emphasize customer service “ was part of the message on the welcome web page and nice pictures illustrating modern design. And the dream came a lie...

The real story started with waiting about 20 minutes to access the check in which has been a long process about 15 minutes more. It continued with 1 lift out of order and another one reserved for non hotel customers (!) but for making life easier to external people who want to access the roof top. So, before reaching our room, we were waiting, again, about 20 minutes. Not enough, il was under the control of two large guys, private security, to keep us quiet, welcome ! Customer care they said?

The room is quite small, we’re in NYC. First issue is the air conditioning! Noisy as a B737 taking on JFK ! And the set up to tune for a low speed fan was not working. We ask for help at the desk... with no real effect. Customer care they said?

If you like to read in your bed (no other space in room to do) during a rest or before sleeping, forget it. Here we have the only hotel I know after 30 years of global travelling where there is no light beside the bed.

It’s also the only one international class hotel I know where maid, room service or all other internal services hasn’t their own service lift. Lucky you are if you don’t share your lift with sheets deliveries or garbage evacuation. Customer care they said?

The announced high speed wifi runs like the ADSL I used 15 years ago in my far countryside ... All public and free access you find during your walk through the city run faster! Time to write this long message isn’t enough to load my daily newspaper on my tablet ... Customer care they said?

Back to the lift or the lobby, in addition of noisy and more or less drunken people coming for or from the roof top, we had also to do with the same but almost naked from the swimming pool... looking at their eyes, alcohol seems not to be the only substance they took... really make us uncomfortable ...

Everyone has the dream he wants but if you are looking for an hotel to enjoy a confortable and quite moment after a tough business or tourist day, try one of the other 500 Manhattan’ hotels . For same price you could expect a lot more .

In this bad mood, a special thanks to the maids, smiling, enjoying and efficient!

title: Should be called 'A BAD Dream Downtown'
text:
Run down, dirty, overcrowded (with QUITE the interesting clientele), small rooms, WiFi doesn’t work well at all, elevators are incredibly slow and used as service elevators even with guests in them, basic “amenities” don’t even work (such as bathroom sink drain), etc. Mold in the bathroom, dust all over the room, hallways were filthy, pool area is disgusting and packed to the point where the pool becomes cloudy. The list goes on... 

This hotel is marketed (and priced!) as a “posh” hotel in the Meatpacking District. We were beyond disappointed with the state the hotel is in, the halls are filthy, everything is outdated, blah blah blah. Would never stay again nor would I recommend anyone staying here. Truly would’ve been more comfortable at a Holiday Inn. 

The only pleasant part of our stay was Amanda, one of the front desk employees! She was very kind, helpful, and professional. :)

title: Nightmare dressed like a daydream
text:
I'm not sure what hotel someone would dream about staying in, but it is definitely not the Dream Downtown. 

The Dream was disappointing, considering how much we paid for a pool suite + a regular room. 
1) Requested 2 beds, had 1. The second bed was actually a sofa turned into a "bed" with a sheet over the cheap leather sofa. To say it was uncomfortable was an understatement. 
2) 3 fire alarms in 6 hours from 3am-9am. Good to take guests safety into consideration, but they need to figure out better fire practices + communicate with their guests. 
3) I asked if we could have some type of complimentary breakfast or free coffee drinks for the day to make up for how tired we were. Finally, she gave me breakfast vouchers and took off a room charge for water and ice. That's it. 
4) Pool Suite - woke up at 7:30 to reserve chairs (first come - first serve, then a waitlist), only to be told that a man had reserved the 3 chairs in front of our suite for his family... kids are allowed at the pool until 12. When he left, we were heckled by employees who said we needed to go on the waitlist to take those chairs. We explained to the employees that we had already spoken to the manager at the pool and finally, they let us have the two chairs. 

The Dream doesn't care about giving their guests an enjoyable experience, as it seems that staying there was an inconvenience to them. Stay almost anywhere else unless you like rude service, multiple fire alarms, and uncomfortable accommodations.

title: Too trendy for its shirt.
text: The hotel is trying very hard to be very trendy. We had to wait for a space at the poolside (not a problem in itself) but found out that a number of people using the beds were days guests or friends of those working there. Given it’s not a cheap hotel I do feel guests should have first dibs. While at the pool a number of people ordered from the expensive bar menu with the champagne delivered with the full fanfare, sparkler and parade. You couldn’t swim in the pool as it was where people stood to drink. We paid for our drinks but not before we filled in the room charge sheet first. Decided to leave cash instead. I was then charged again for that bill. Not only have the hotel done this, they have refused to investigate it when I have complained and have simply ignored my emails & my tweets. If you like being looked down on, pay over the odds even for a hotel for drinks, be ignored and stay in rooms that haven’t been properly cleaned (it looked like it was raining all the time the windows were so dirty), then this ex hospital is for you. The rooms were probably quite the spectacle when new, but are in need of major tlc given the price. Plus side it’s in a great area of town and we dealt with one member of reception who was lovely. The bus boys were lovely as were the bouncers for the club.

title: Never again
text: My wife and I decided to go back for our 4th visit to this once cool hotel. We booked a king Platinum room as we have each past visit. We arrived and it took a little bit to get help for our bags. The bellman Paul was very nice. We were taken to our room and then it went downhill from there. The room was not the room we booked. It was way smaller and you couldn’t even walk around the bed without bashing into the wall. Then there was a small bug in the middle of the bed. Now my wife has had a horrific bedbug experience and there was no way she was staying in this room. We showed Paul and he agreed. So we went back down to the front desk and met Maria the manager. I explained the situation and was met with a high level of indifference . We were told the best they could do was to move us to a 2 bed room and possibly move us the next day. Now after a long day and it being late at night, I was disappointed at the callousness of Maria. I explained that my wife and I own our own businesses and we don’t get away often. That we were looking forward to staying here for our 4th time and pleaded with her. She couldn’t have cared less. Now I am in the customer service business and know when I am dealing with a corporate robot!! She didn’t even offer us a bottle of water or a drink at the bar or better yet, maybe dinner since we are shoving you into a smaller room because there was a bug on your bed!! So my wife and I sat in their lobby now looking to find a hotel at 11:30 on a Monday night!!! Thank god we found that the William Vale in Williamsburg had an opening. We got out of there as fast as we could. This manager cost the hotel a 3 night stay and this review.

title: The Dream is the dream...as always
text: This was my third visit to the Dream and as always, such a treat spending time at the hotel.
