From arrival with the friendly guys welcoming you at the door, to the way the luggage is handled and the super friendly staff at reception...all round a superior guest experience. Lauren and Nicole are super stars in the way they make you feel at home, and deal with any query you may have in the most professional and friendly manner. Thanks for the personal touches and "welcome back" present. This has become my home away from home and makes any business trip a delight.

title: Nightclub with Rooms !!!
text: Full disclosure, I am a fan of the Dream Hotel group.  I stay at the Dream hotels in NYC and Hollywood quite regularly.  I am  also a fan of a good party as well.  The Dream is a good hotel, but I think people need to understand what they are getting into when they stay here. Especially in the Summer from Weds- Sunday. I have to give it to PH-D ( the rooftop club), at the Dream. In club years the run has been amazing and it is still packed on most nights. The pool in the summer is a zoo . Understandable  it is NYC and the Soho House is not letting just anyone come to their pool and the Gansevoort is not cool anymore. The point I am trying to make is this, if you are a conservative business person in town for meetings or traveling with a young family , this probably is not the hotel for you.  This is what I would call a party hotel. As party hotels go The Dream is the best , as I mentioned largely based on the success of their in- house club PHD.   A lot of wear and tear  on the rooms comes with being a party hotel, look at the Standard or the old W hotels. The Public  hotel is dealing with that now. The Dream has been pretty good at keeping the wear and tear to a minimum. And it is a hell of a good time!!!

title: Swanky lobby / Average rooms - AVOID 11th floor
text:
Just a quick summary of Pros and Cons at this hotel:

Pros:
•	Look location
•	Attractive large lobby
•	Front desk staff is friendly
•	Large shower (in my room)

Cons:
•	Flimsy furniture in bedroom
•	I was placed on 11th floor; even the with noise canceling device in the room and the ear buds that were delivered to me in the middle of the night, the music of the DREAM night club (closes at 4am each night) on the floor above made for restless sleeping.  This was a Tuesday night. The hotel did accommodate my request for a different room the next evening.  Upon checking out of the hotel, I observed 2 people who were also on the 11th floor commenting about the same issue.
•	Limited amenities in room:  There was shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in the bathroom – nothing else.  For body lotion, Q-tips, etc, you are required to contact housekeeping.
•	Found bedding not to be consistent (stayed in 2 rooms during my stay). The first bed (room 1113) was uncomfortable. There was a thin pad on top of the mattress.  The room I moved to on the second night (#522) was much more comfortable as it had 2 thick mattress pads between the mattress and the sheets.

In short, it appears to be a  great party hotel with several lounges and clubs on the property but I would avoid the 11th floor unless you plan to celebrate all night.

title: Beaucoup de bruit et beaucoup de fric
text: Ambiance et accueil assez arrogants. L'hotel manque singulièrement de charme et de simplicité. Piscine agréable mais petite. On doit payer en quittant l'hotel plus de 25 dollars de frais annexes cachés. C'est honteux.

title: The Beach pool at the Dream Downtown
text:
At first, my experience was off to a terrible start. After arriving to the pool at 8:30 AM (they open at 8AM), there were no chairs available due to capacity. The pool is very popular in the area so even though we were hotel guests we still had to wait to POSSIBLY get chairs. After expressing my frustration to the life guard Clarisse she was compassionate enough to understand my disappointment as a guest where she then put us on a waitlist for a chair. Herself and Tabetha were sure to turn our experience around and found us a tanning chair to enjoy the rest of the day on, instead of directing us to the hard concrete floor. I was very impressed with their determination to make me a happy hotel guest. 

Thanks girls!

title: If you are Ghetto, then this hotel is Ghetto Fabulous!
text: We decided to come back for a quick night in the city - break up routine. Chelsea is a great area and we've had fun here at PHD in the past. However if there were fewer hookers and drug dealers by the pool (you know who you are because we saw you), this could be a more enjoyable experience. Walked out of our room to greet 6 police officers in a hallway confrontation with what could have been guests (same pool patrons), but it is unclear. The hallways reeked of pot - I thought I would walk up high the next morning. I guess you get what you pay for when you decide to stay in a hotel in a great location for under $300/night. It's a shame about the quality of the guests because it used to be a cool place. I feel especially bad for the few families we saw in the hotel because there were confrontational people yelling at the front desk too causing a scene.

title: Unparalleled with Disappointment
text: Location was great and staff were friendly, however...  Tried to call 4 times before arriving at the hotel and not a single answer.  Three attempted to call the front desk from our room while we stayed and no answer then either (Had to walk downstairs).  Pictures of the rooms look fantastic but in reality our room was dingy, musty, and did feel in the slightest clean.  Left our name with the pool to get a chair and never got a call back.  Took us asking multiple times to have our mini fridge emptied out.  Ordered food at one of their restaurants and they somehow forgot to make it.  As someone who stays in only 4 or 5 star hotels I cant even imagine how much money this place paid to receive a 4 star ranking since they clearly were not capable of delivering the service required of one.

title: Belated 50th Bday
text:
Met my girlfriend in the city to celebrate my bday. The hotel is in a great location and the lobby is very cool. She was checked in already when I arrived and we went up to the room to change and head out. The room is ample size for NYC and has an interesting vibe. The only room complaint is the bathroom door is awkward to open and very heavy. The view was ok aside from the rooftop next door looked like a garbage heap. 

Beds were comfortable and room stayed dark and quiet for a nice rest. When we arrived back at night there had been some type of altercation and police and broken glass were strewn in front of our hotel. I almost fell into an officer as I tripped over the broken bottles. 

This hotel seems very young and I probably wouldn’t stay there again. The nightclub up top, which we didn’t go up to, had a long line of 20 somethings waiting for the elevator, so probably not our scene.

A nice pool in the middle, with limited seating and girls twerking were also not really our speed.

title: WHERE DO I BEGIN
text: Where do I begin...Dream hotel is supposed to be a fun getaway in the city in the summer. I was disappointed as soon as I walked in. Check in is at 3pm, our room was not ready til 5:20. At this point that is unacceptable as you are cutting into the guests time. We had reservations that had to be pushed back because we had to shower and get ready and did not get settled in until late. Secondly, because of the late check in they offered to upgrade us...when we walk into the dream it seemed like a downgrade. we initially booked a room with a balcony and they gave us a room with no balcony. How is that an "upgrade"? We then go back downstairs say we want the room we booked in the first place and the girl at the front desk says "oh so you want to downgrade?" we politely say we do not understand how a room with a balcony is a downgrade but we would like our regular room please. At this point, it is now 6pm. Lastly, service at pool is SUPER SLOW and no one checks up on you. If you order any drinks or food be prepared to wait 40+ mins for it. Very bad impression, do not think I will be recommending anyone to stay here.

title: Fun, cool place
text: Lobby gets crazy at night with club-like atmosphere, but room was nice, clean. Bathroom amenities are OK, less than what you'd expect from this expensive of a hotel. Overall though... Good experience and great location.

title: BEAUTIFUL PLACE
text: It is a wonderful hotel for the best attention and good place to be with the family. It has a restaurant and a fine bar an it has an excellent location. it has very close train stations, restaurants and shopping places.

title: Hyvää ja huonoa.
text:
Listaan hotellin plussat ja miinukset:

+ Loistava sijainti !
+ Laadukas hotelli ja hyvä palvelu.
+ Uima-allas.

- Viikonloppuisin bilehotelli ja uima-altaalta pauhaa musiikki huoneisiin asti koko päivän ilta-kahdeksaan asti. Uima-allas ei myöskään viikonloppuisin ole lasten käytössä kuin puoleen päivään asti.
- Vaikkakin laadukas, silti hinta-laatu-suhteeltaan ylihintainen.

title: Nyc Fun
text:
This hotel was definitely a great choice, my friends and I were really happy with the choices; as soon as we  arrived we  were quickly checked in. The hotel has a lot of venues right there that we didn’t even went out for a whole day, we spent a whole day time at the pool which was so fun ( quick tip: if you want to get chairs you do have to wake up early to get them, but don’t worry that there are good cocktails at the pool that makes your time go so much faster. I couldn’t believe we were in the city;) of how stunning it is), at night we went around meatpacking area which has a lot of restaurants and places to go,  and then back to go to their rooftop, PHD. The rest of the days we explored the rest of the city but another plus was that the hotel is ajís  across the Chelsea market which we loved it!  

P.s. I was obsessed with their lobby!

title: Satisfied Customers!
text: Location was great really close to chelsea market and subway stations. Very comfortable bed and the cleanliness was outstanding. The staff always willing to assist. The pool was definitely a plus on an 90⁰F summer day in NYC. Great job!!

title: Birthday Pool Day at Dream Beach
text: I decided to have a pool day by myself for my birthday this year. I purchased a day pass on Monday and was taken care of from then on. Adriana was a wonderful hostess and provided all the answer to my questions promptly. The pool area is very chic and eclectic and had a very cool vibe. I love all the foliage and trees surrounding the pool deck. I especially want to give a huge shoutout to one of your standout employees Karima. She was attentive and wanted to make me feel special on my day!!! I have not stopped telling my friends how much I enjoyed your pool and the staff. Several of us are coming next week. Thank you for making it a special day and I hope you have more employees like Karima!!!!

title: Is it really a hotel?
text: Lovely building. Rooms were great. Location was perfect for Exploring. Stayed her for 3 days and never quite figured out how the key cards in the lifts worked. Also, be aware that the hotel turns into a nightclub after dark - complete with lobby dj, security moving party goers up to the roof top bar and unfortunately hotel guests are not priority.

title: Dream hotel
text: Our july 4th weekend getaway at the dream hotel was lots of fun! We had a room with a balcony and had no complaints, perfect for us. The pool was a lot of fun but wayyyy too crowded. The pool should only be available to hotel guest for a holiday weekend or any weekend for that matter. We ended up sitting at the edge of the pool for two days and did not get a chance to lay on a chair. Hotel guest should get priority for amentities. The staff at the pool were amazing!! Naomi was amazing, super sweet, and attentive,We love you girl!!! We also enjoyed the restaurants bodega negra is great and Phillipe's was even better!!! the rooftop was Great too but once again hotel guest should get priority to enter and enjoy the nightlife. The staff at the front desk were nice and helpful when needed. I would probably not stay here again because of the overcrowded pool but we did have a very good time! The design of the hotel was also very cool! I love that we can see the pool from the ceiling of the lobby.

title: AWFUL - Rude, Unhelpful Staff!
text:
The staff at this hotel was dreadful, unhelpful, rude and unprofessional. 

Let me start by saying I have frequented many trendy establishments in NYC including hotels/restaurants where the employees know how much you’re paying and are pleasant. I know the clientele this place mostly attracts. I have been to PHD and Bodega Negra at Dream several times before, without ever staying at the hotel. 

I have stayed at Dream Hotels outside of NYC and had wonderful experiences where the staff treat you like a paying guest, and even more-so, a friend. The front desk staff here was extremely unwelcoming from the moment we walked in to check in. When asked questions the lady at the front desk was dismissive and seemed like she didn’t want to be bothered. We thought maybe she was having a bad/busy day and let it go.. next. We arrived around 9 AM, and were told by the same lady the room would be available around 12. We decided to try and enjoy the pool in the meantime, we found a tiny spot in the corner to cram our stuff into and sit in the cramped pool. During our time at the pool Sara let us know she’ll try to help us get a seat while we’re on the waitlist. She then proceeded to text me a bit later that she can get find us three seats for $200. Is this a joke?  Cheating hotel patrons for a quick buck? First off, I am already paying $200+ a night to stay in this hotel, shouldn’t that give me some kind of priority to enjoy myself at the hotel pool? Nope, not at Dream downtown where the employees couldn’t care less about you. Pool enjoyment was also interrupted by guests complaining and frequently calling management and security - clearly they know this is a problem - BUT YOU GUESSED IT why would they care when they can make some extra money letting people buy day passes and cheating them to get chairs 😉. 

12:39 PM we got a call from the same woman we checked in with that the room was ready. We show up to the front desk about an hour later and a different front desk employee tells us that it looks like the hotel is so busy and backed up because of the holiday weekend our room isn’t ready yet... mind you this is almost 2 hours after scheduled check in time. We of course tell him that we got a call that the room was ready so how does that happen? He checks again, says oh looks like she gave it away to someone else. EXCUSE ME? IN WHAT WORLD DOES THIS HAPPEN? This isn’t my first (luxury) hotel stay, especially in NYC and only made me think about how many patrons they lie to and abuse. 

When he realized our room had in fact been ready and given away by another employee he did rectify the situation and get us another room - took about an hour, but resolved. This was the one and only front desk employee that was somewhat welcoming throughout our entire stay and felt extremely apologetic towards the situation so he actually worked it out, but here we are, getting to our room about 4 hours post check in time. 

The next morning we got up at the crack of dawn to get a chair at the pool as we were told by others the day before that people line up around 7 AM. When we got downstairs at 7 to what we thought was the only pool entrance and there was no line we asked the lady at front desk if this is where people line up, she seemed to be dismissive of our comment and just stared at us with a smirk, while another guy chimed in just saying ‘yes this is the entrance it open at 8, you can wait here’. As a couple people joined us they were also surprised and going to the front desk to ask if this is where we wait, and everytime the front desk was approached they answered in a rude unhelpful tone. Of course they know what we’re asking and that there was another place where people where supposed to line up but for some odd reason they decided they didn’t want to help the hotel guests. We figured it out on our own and found a line of about 15 people lined up at the other entrance. Thanks for the help. 

I WILL GLADLY LET ALL MY FRIENDS VISITING NYC TO NEVER BOOK A STAY AT THIS GREEDY UNWELCOMING PLACE AGAIN. There are way too many other great, trendy and welcoming places to stay where the front desk never make you feel like crap, and you don’t have to deal with pretentious personalities. Shame on this place!

title: Terrible
text: This is a place that values street crowd more than their guest. The pool is public, theres huge lines for the club and the rooms are dated and old. I've stayed at dream for the past 5 years and I havent been back for over a year and it lost its charm. The staff shows no compassion for service at either the restatraunt or hotel. It's also very over priced for what? I'll take my money elsewhere.

title: Party hotel
text:
As the other reviews have said, eyes open when booking this hotel. This is NOT FOR FAMILIES OR BUSINESS TRAVELLERS OR OLDER ADULTS OR CHILDREN. Take the hint. I can't be more clear than that.

We stayed at this hotel for Gay Pride because it had a pool, it was close to the gay area, the pride march route and we knew this would be a bit of a party hotel. Upon checkin we were given a room on the 2nd floor facing the pool. They probably thought looking at 2 gay men for pride we wanted to be in the complete thick of it. We do...but not for sleeping. We walked into the room and the pool could see us and the noise, well, we might as well have been outside stood next to the speaker. We handed back the room and took one on the 8th floor. So hint, do not take a room on the 2nd floor or the top floor below the rooftop bar. Room was nice, small, but it's New York. Little storage space. No bin, why no bin? Made us laugh.

As other's have said, the pool is not owned by the hotel. I'm not sure how this can be, it sounds beyond strange. Anyway, we went to the pool to be told there is a waiting list. Basically forget the waiting list. If you're an internal traveller they don't ring you because ringing an international number requires going downstairs. We just grabbed towels and found a spot in the pool by the steps. Best place to be honest. It's too hot on the sunbeds and the pool is the place to be. It had a great party vibe and to be quite frank we got drunk on champagne in the pool and just people watched. It kept us thoroughly entertained for the whole afternoon and left laughing in hysterically. The sights by that pool. I doubt you'd see the same if it wasn't Pride. Annoyingly to order drinks you have to provide ID or a credit card. Annoying to have to go back to your room just to get ID!

At night the hotel transforms again, I presume the rooftop turns into a nightclub because downstairs becomes the queuing lobby with roped queues, bouncers and a dedicated lift. Do like we did, cheekily view the upstairs when it is closed. Get the lift to the 11th floor (as they close the 12th so you shouldn't be able to get access). Then just take the emergency exit stairs up to the 12th and have a nosey round. We even walked up further to the roof roof, probably a little dangerous, this is not for the faint of heart.

Checkout was a mess, at checkin we gave a different card to the reservation card to use for incidentals. During our stay any pool/minibar charges were charged to the wrong card. So frustrating and they couldn't fix this.

title: Girls On Tour In The Big Apple
text:
Well … 'girls' is pushing it a bit!  We are 2 mature ladies who abandoned our families and flew off to NYC for fun. We chose the hotel for its pool (which we thought would be a great place for relaxation when needed - how wrong can you be!) and for its location near Chelsea Market and the great restaurants and cafes in the nearby areas.

First impressions of the hotel were fabulous; It is a very unusual building which appears to have been styled and targeted at upwardly mobile, young people and we were probably NOT their target market.  Visually, it is a dream but it was definitely a case of 'form over function' and there were lots of little issues that marred the experience.  

We enjoyed our stay despite the little niggles: not enough towels left for 2 adults, inconstant turn down service, inadequate storage for a 2 x Queen Room, lifts out of order, very fancy but dodgy electrics, hoards of non-residents using the pool at weekends/queuing for lifts to get to the roof top club/attending private parties held in the communal areas, no first aider available when my friend had a nasty accident, traffic and street noise until dawn, mistakes on the bill etc.  

The hotel is obviously a very popular venue with NYC clubbers, corporate and personal events and pool parties and we enjoyed the buzz, on the whole. There is a sense, however, that residents, are insufficiently catered for and that the Hotel's Management Team would benefit from reviewing their product through the eyes of the resident if they want guests, other than weekend clubbers, to come back.

All that said, the staff were wonderful and the concierges couldn't do enough to help.. A special shout out to Joseph Sabatelli, who is a true gent and looked after us very well - 5 Stars for him!

title: Caution! The pool in this hotel does not belong to the hotel. Its a public pool.
text: Unfortunately, even the staff was asking me to rent somewhere else. That was enough for me. Apparently the hotel is a party and drug infected property. I am thinking if you are young and love that sort of all day and night party , then this is your place. However, guest and the public have the same privilege at this hotel. You will have to wait and see if there is place for you at the pool, however for$150 extra they will hold a chair for you! Whaaaaaaaat!!!! Enter at your own risk. The prices are not that cheap either, but.

title: Over Priced and Over Rated hotel
text: While the room was a decent size for a NY hotel, the noise was unbelievable.  We complained the first night about the guests next door which did nothing because the second night was just as bad.  It was certainly overpriced to get no sleep.  We had to sleep in during the day and miss out on activities which was annoying.  The pool is very small and you need to get up at 6 am to get a spot.  We did not experience the food.  Staff was decent.   I agree with all of the negative reviews.  OVERPRICED / OVER RATED

title: Very average modern hotel in a great location
text:
I want to preface this review by saying that there's a good chance I'll stay here again because the location was fantastic and the rooms were clean, but other than that, everything about this stay was average.

This hotel is the definition of hip and modern - my hotel room looked like a spaceship.  The window was a circle, and there were buttons to do everything, and every inch of the bathroom was covered in tile.  The room was very small but very high ceilings.  The bed was extremely low and uncomfortable, and then the TV was quiet small and high on the wall.  I was satisfied with my room on the 5th floor, however my boss stayed on a higher floor underneath the bar and he said it was noisy.  I stayed there on a Tuesday and Wednesday night, and the lobby was filled with young women in tiny dresses.  I'm a 30 year old woman who appreciates night life, however when travelling for work, I want to relax in a quiet environment.  One of the three elevators wasn't working (from other reviews it looks like this is always the case), and another elevator was reserved for guests of the bar, so there's only one elevator for the hotel guests and an annoyingly long wait at 11pm when you just want to crash.

That being said, although it wasn't a relaxing or cozy hotel, as I mentioned, it was very clean and the location was unbeatable, so I would likely stay here again.  I just hope they get the elevator fixed!

title: Hotel Design but BAD INTERNET CONNECTION
text: Bad internet connection and rooms after the usual cleaning are not ventilated.  As a result the room always has a bad smell. Rooms not soundproofed is very noisy. Very nice view of the rooms on the upper floors

title: GET SLEEP, SAVE MONEY, GO ELSEWHERE
text:
We tried to reach the hotel prior to arrival and also asked a Hotel Tonight rep to reach out, they did not answer their phones. Upon arrival we were able to check into the room early.  DO NOT GO HERE FOR THE POOL. Btw it’s 21+. It is nice but they’ll put you on a waitlist, and might end up getting to you as there is no time limit or even an estimated time if you don’t show up at 10am. The elevators do not work properly. The hotel is a nightclub. The lobby has a DJ and also the rooftop and pool are bar/party spots. The music is so loud that it can be heard everywhere in the hotel. People screaming and walking down the hallway until 4am.  The mini bar is in a fridge and they charge you to take the stuff out. There is no ice machine and again, it’s 5$ for a bucket of ice. This hotel does not live up to its four star rating and I am disappointed with the room and staff, definitely with the almost 400$/night rate. 

Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

title: Absolutely amazing service
text:
Decided to stay at dream after a meeting ver local for a network i work for. The level of service provided by Chris B. And his front desk staff was fenominal. Attentive to detail and extending service to follow through with short last minute reservations with all amenities in the hotel. From dinner reservations to even being provided vip to the late night rooftop event to unwind. Needless to say even though my stay was short i still managed to enjoy food from both bodega negra and phillipe. I will definitely stay again for my meetings when I am in town. Thank you for providing the dream service at dream and making it special!
Regards
Manny

title: Do not stay here. Hotel is vastly overpriced for facilities on offer and managed very poorly.
text:
The Bronze rooms at Dream Downtown are too small for 2 people to both get ready at the same time. One of us had to sit on the bed whilst the other moved around the room getting ready. Very limited storage. This became very draining after 5 nights. Too many rooms are crammed into too small a space. 
The ironing board is a luggage rack with a puppet-sized board simply placed over the top. There actually isn’t the space to open your suitcase on the luggage rack. 
The is the first hotel I’ve ever stayed in, including budget ones, which does not provide a refreshments tray with a small kettle, instant tea/ coffee etc to guests. Usually, this is checked and replenished by housekeeping each day. 
I had to speak with staff, including Front of House Manager Ray, about getting one in my room upwards of 15 times. 
I was charged $13 for milk for a cup of tea, despite being told it would be wiped from my bill.
There is something cheap, nasty and mean-spirited about this hotel. It seems it has tried to be a hip, ‘Intagrammable’ (tragic) establishment at the expense of actual quality. You seem to have lost the all-American high hospitality standards in your quest to appear modern and edgy. It does not work. I went on the Omni Parker Hotel in Boston after New York and you should take a leaf out of their book. Spacious room, proper ironing board, friendly and knowledgeable staff and a refreshment tray which is replenished each day.

title: Dream Disappoints
text: Online reviews and images were terrific, sadly, expectations were not met. The pool area had extremely loud music, and the pool deck and surrounding area was dirty - lime rinds, straws, hair bands, empty paper bags, knocked over glassware, etc. The pool water was cloudy and not at all inviting. Of three elevators, one was dedicated to the dance club on the 12th floor, one was inoperable, leaving only one in use. It was generally overcrowded and there was no a/c. The elevator waiting was always chaos. During check in, I asked for a quiet room and was given a room on the floor BENEATH the dance club. The room had a sound masking system which did little to curb the music's bass vibrations. The next morning I asked to move to a different floor, and I was. Being on the 10th floor made all the difference. The room is architecturally interesting but in poor condition. The wall plate for the toilet flush was not attached to the wall, and every time you pressed the button, it would jostle the plate. Bedroom furniture was chipped. Carpet smelled slightly dank. Shower curtain smelled mildewy.  I loved the location and the concept, but sadly, I don't see myself returning. I really wanted to like this place.

title: Amazing Service
text: My daughter was getting engaged, and I wanted to send champagne to their room.  I called the conceriege and spoke with Joseph.  He was extremely helpful and very efficient.  He emailed me my options, took my order over the telephone.  He called to confirm that it was completed.  I was so impressed with the care he took to make this happen.  Thank you again, Joseph.

title: Too much work!
text: I stayed at Dream downtown this past weekend.  Staff members are very nice. I only gave stars for the staff. I was told I would be called when my room is ready. That didn’t happen. I waited a few hours and then went back and they told me the room was ready. They couldn’t find our luggage. I went into the room with the bellhop and found it and asked for it to be sent up. It took almost an hour, probably because of the elevators. I have gone there other times but not always stayed there. The elevators are always broken. You wait about 20 to 30 minutes just to get in the ONE that works. The elevator key takes another 10/15 minutes. Also, we were told at desk all 4 rooms were close. One room was in a different tower. It’s entirely too much work. I want to feel relaxed and have fun at a girls getaway.

title: Mauvaise Blague très  coûteuse !!!
text:
Le Dream Hotel New York ou l’escroquerie hôtelière !! Comment passer 4 jours dans une boîte de nuit alors que vous pensiez arriver dans un hôtel 4 étoiles classe. Au début enchantés bel endroit, bon emplacement vu sur Empire State Building splendide,  jolie deco !! 
et puis 4 jours de soirées non stop, 3 ascenseurs dont 1 en panne pendant les 4 jours, 1 réservé aux clients extérieurs participants aux soirées, il en reste 1 pour les clients soit 15/20  mn en moyenne de la réception à sa chambre !!
Petits déjeuner commandé qui arrive froid après 45 mn, WI FI payante après les 1 ère 24h alors qu’elle est annoncée gratuite sur le site !!! 
Piscine minuscule, et, en continu des noceurs(es)  fétards ivres et déshabillés dans l’hotel, (Heureusement nos enfants n'étaient Pas avec nous !! Étrange quand même de prendre l’ascenseur en Topless) 
Voici donc la plus mauvaise expérience hôtelière (ou plutôt la plus belle Escroquerie) que nous avons vécu avec mon mari. 
Les clients des diverses soirées  sont prioritaires sur les clients de l’hotel ! Qui de par le fait est plus une boîte de nuit ou l’incontournable Rdv des clubeurs qu’un hôtel. Pourquoi pas ! Sauf que Il suffisait de nous prévenir

title: Trashy, Trap Hotel
text: This hotel was beneath standard for a professional business traveler. If you are traveling with a group of friends wanting to party and turn up, this is the hotel for you. If you need a quality space to spread out, get work done while in a pleasant environment, this hotel is not for you. It's super noisy, super annoying, the service is sub-standard, and the rooms are trash. The music goes in all day from the pool and all night from the club. I'm a business traveler who decided to bring my 12yr son who's out of school and staying here was a HUGE Mistake!!! Half naked girls running around screaming, he couldn't go to the pool because its "adult only". The bathroom is a joke, the bed is like a college dorm room bed that is super uncomfortable. In short, this is more like a trashy MOTEL with a pretty face. It appears to be a chic and modern hotel but, but it's super underwhelming and basically a loser of a hotel on this inside. I feel like if I were to describe this hotel, I would use the phrase, "Douche Bag".

title: Above & Beyond
text: Blown away by the service I received from Alicia in reservations. Helpful, knowledgeable, thorough and genuinely cared about helping me to book the right room. She was also genuinely excited for us to stay in the hotel. First impression A+. Thanks Alicia!

title: Tout simplement une horreur, à fuir....
text:
- Accueil : déplorable
- Ascenseur : 2 pour tout l'hôtel, tres insuffisant
- Nuisance sonore : aucune isolation phonique. Bruyant, un cauchemar....
- Taille de la chambre : grand comme un placard à balai
- Salle de sport : ridicule
- la piscine : je n'en parle même pqs, tellement c'est risible 
- Ergonomie de la chambre : pas pratique, pas de rangement, evier ridicule, pas de lumière au chevet, pas de place pour les valises (posé à même le sol). L'architecture et le design d'intérieur ont du être fait par un stagiaire
J'en ai fais des hôtels à NYC, c'est ma plus mauvaise expérience et la plus onéreuse : du vol... Une honte pour la profession. 
A FUIR, à part si vous êtes maso

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel + Excellent Service
text:
I've stayed at the Dream a few times now for work and each experience has been better than the last.

For starters, you can't beat the location in the heart of Chelsea, and right across the street from Chelsea Market.There's a number of popular bars and restaurants in the area, including a nightclub on the top floor of the hotel. The Dream also has a very modern feel to it and has a number of wonderful and convenient amenities (on-site gym, pool, bar, breakfast/lunch cafe, evening restaurants, etc).

The room size is fairly standard, but it's the polish within the livable spaces that really sets them apart. The rooms have ample space for the bed as well as assorted furniture pieces to really make it a cozy experience. My favorite part is the bathroom. Each restroom has a large mirror, ample space and a walk-in shower with a giant waterfall shower-head. The shower is the crown jewel. Highly recommend.

But above all else, what really sets the Dream apart is their client service. Every time I've checked in, had an issue or needed help, the staff has gone well out of their way to be accommodate me.

Ex: During my recent stay, I was in a rush for a business meeting and I forgot to call ahead to request early check-in. When I spoke with Amanda at the front desk, she not only made arrangements so that I could get checked in to my room sooner, but she also personally called me to let me know as soon as my room was ready. Thanks for her help, I was able to make it to my meeting in the knick of time. She even gave me a complimentary umbrella so I wouldn't be soaked on my way into the city (it was pouring last week). Huge thanks to Amanda!

And I would be remiss if I didn't mention the front desk manager, Lauren. She and her staff are always incredibly polite and greet me by name when I stay at this hotel. They've saved me from numerous hassles and headaches that I generally experience when traveling for work and they're always very warm and friendly. This is the kind of service I've come to really appreciate when coming to NYC on business.

Whether for business or leisure, I highly recommend the Dream if you're looking to stay in Chelsea (which you should). A+

title: Very cool hotel, maybe not perfect for families
text:
This is a very cool hotel. It is designed for wealthy young business people and partiers. We generally enjoyed our stay here.
It is very well-designed. 
We were there as a family of 4 during the holiday weekend in May. Packed with 20-somethings wanting to have fun. This was fine, save that you had to queue from about 8am to stand any chance of a place round the cute little outdoor pool.

The good things:
It's very cool, and really centrally located - great for business or pleasure / site seeing
It has a nice, small pool.
It has a great bar and good in-house restaurants and cafe.
The rooms are a good size.
A small but quite well-equipped 24hr gym/fitnesss room
Perfect for clubbers: there's a rooftop club with DJ's.

The not so good things:
Our mattress was rubbish - after 6 nights my back was in agony. This is unacceptable in a place of this standard and cost.
There is a rooftop bar and club. This had loud music until 3-4am. It did not ruin our nights sleep, but if you are a light sleeper - be aware / take earplugs.
Arrangements for the pool could be better. One morning, there was a huge queue before it opened, and then the staff opened a door at the WRONG END of the queue. This caused a lot of upset and frustration, and was really thoughtless of the staff. Also, to ban children from the pool from 12 noon is kinda harsh - maybe extend that to 3pm?
The concierges tried to be helpful but did not appear to be very knowledgable about pretty basic things.
Ask for extra pillows - they supply one per person, and they are of a low quality.

title: Nice Hotel
text: I stayed here for a week during a business trip. It was at a convenient location and with great facilities. The staff was helpful and attentive. The overall ambience was great and i had a comfortable stay.

title: Dreaming of going back!
text: The staff was amazing. Daniel at the front desk immediately took care of everything I desired, even before I mentioned what I wanted! The pool is super fun. Definitely the place to be on a weekend in NYC.

title: Pleasure
text: We had a very pleasant stay at the Dream Downtown in Manhattan.  The concierge Joseph Sabatelli was very helpful and answered every request with great care and eagerness.  The front desk was also very helpful with all requests.  We look forward to another stay at the hotel.

title: Mediocre hotel at best
text:
This is an old hotel that has tried to add hip finishes.  Unfortunately these don’t compensate for understaffing, loud air conditioner, ugly hallways and constant noise in the hallway and from music in the lobby that can be heard in the room.

There is a very cool rooftop bar if that is your thing.  But for a good night sleep and a bit of service I would go elsewhere.

title: A paragon of a one stop shop - Hotel
text:
Was there for a good time not a long time but my one night stay couldn’t of been better!.

I want to start off by mentioning that I was in the hospitality industry for a long time so I know good customer service when I see it and experience it. 

First impression,(which means everything) 
I immediately felt welcomed by Daniel at the front desk, such a positive attitude. Great atmosphere and the interior is aesthetically pleasing. 
We arrived around noon and was able to check in early, yay! The good news didn’t stop there, we got there just in-time for a pool party. (Shannon) your poolside server was dexterous and attentive.  The room was a bit small but the queen size bed was big and comfortable enough for my bestie and I. We had an exceptional dinner next door at TAO and later danced the night away at the PHD Rooftop Lounge that not only played great music but also has outstanding views.  

Thank you, Dream Team. 

Warmest Regards, 

Mel O.

title: Becoming a bit disappointing
text:
This is the second time I’ve stayed at this hotel and I must say this time around it is becoming disappointing. I booked and paid for this trip using EXPEDIA and it seems it gave the hotel the right to give me the worst room. Too tight, small and somehow rundown and prepared for a disabled guest!, which I am not. I’ve also realized that this hotel does not have breakfast service unless you order room service (which I can’t given how small the room is!). There is a order-yourself cafeteria at the entrance in case you want to have breakfast with very poor, even non existence service and a very limited menu. This means that, for tomorrow morning I will have to walk outside if I want a proper breakfast served properly. For a fancy fashionable hotel like this, not having proper breakfast service for the guests is a big miss. 
Let’s see how the rest of my visit goes.

title: I just wanted a cab
text:
After staying here I recognize the hotel attracts a certain clientele. If you’re into late night drinking and weekend pool parties this place is for you. But if you’re not, be prepared for extremely loud patrons and obnoxious yelling and noise throughout the evening. 

Hotel rooms were clean and well kept. 

I would have given the experience four stars (after all, I knew what I was getting when I stayed here) had it not been for the unpleasant experience departing the hotel. After checking out, I asked the front desk to call me a cab to take me to Newark. They told me it would take ten minutes. That struck me as odd because there were multiple cabs on the street, but whatever, maybe they know more than me. After fifteen minutes I was ready to depart and catch my own cab. I was told my cab was right around the corner. Fine, I’ll wait. Next thing I know an Escalade is pulling up. I didn’t want an Escalade. I didn’t ask for an Escalade. I asked for a cab.

Is $100 to Newark airport a lot? I honestly have no idea. But I expect that it’s likely more than I would have paid in a taxi. 

Cheating your patrons for a quick buck is not the kind of service I expect from a nice hotel. And yet here I am.

title: Amazing staff
text:
From start to finish the staff were just amazing. Every question was answered with a smile and every request was made to seem possible. Aaron Overton was the first staffer I met when I visited the hotel in April to decide if this was the right hotel for me. My interactions with him was the driving factor to me choosing the Dream as my vacation location. Nicole the front desk supervisor was beyond kind.  I can’t wait to visit the Dream hotel Downtown town again. And let me not forget, the decor is stunning.

Brandon

title: Great Stay, great food!
text: Anthony and Nicole were great! My family and I received great customer service. The food was awesome and the staff made sure we were comfortable and accommodated our needs beyond our expectation. We recommend this place and will stay again.

title: Friendly staff, room amenities lacking
text:
The staff was very friendly and helpful, the location was very good.
Disappointed that there was not an ice bucket included with the room. Had to wait for room service to bring ice for a $5 fee. No fridge for personal use (only a mini bar fridge). Only one trash can, no drawer storage space, small TV, Chairs were weird and only user friendly if the backs were against the wall and the towels were not two full sets. No resolution on the heavy marijuana smoke smell in the room when returning in the evening (staff claimed it was reported two floors down as well). The rooftop bar/cub was energetic and very busy when visiting in mid afternoon.

title: Best Experience
text: Had an amazing experience with and customer service with front desk employee Danny. He exceeded my exceptions, was very attentive, kind, polite, I felt I was being taken care of as if I were a queen and would definitely stay there again for my next stay.

title: avoiding times square
text: Stayed at Dream Downtown in April 2019, quick wkend trip to help my daughter move into her new apt in west village. not a lot of options in that area but I thought Dream was perfect, I walked to most things in west side, some tourists in hotel and at night there is club end of the street called Tao. but other than that, room was nice, bathroom was good size for NY standards. comfy bed, not much of view but it was fine. great coffee shop and bkft and lunch place in lobby. staff was nice, bar scene was not my thing but saw young hip crowds. best part is it was no where near the times square where you are weaving thru people at all hours of the day. if you need to stay in lower west side, this is good location. Maritime hotel is on the same block

title: Lovely
text:
I stayed for just one day on an impulse.
From the booking, checking in, to the sweet room my impression remained pleased,
Someone name Kat. helped me with booking and she stood out in my mind bc she was helpful and made me feel attended to.

Overall I would stay there again and for more time.
I loved the design of the room . It was unique and worth seeing for yourself . The entire staff was amazing .

Clean, modern and welcoming .

title: 5 star service in Mahnattan
text:
I really wanted to give this place 5 stars, because the service was so wonderful. However, on the "Hilton v Hipster" hotel continuum, this place is definitely way more hipster. Specifically, I don't love having to climb down into bed and the light switches are super-confusing. It was also SUPER expensive.

But if you're into nightlife and coolness, this is definitely a place you should stay.

title: Fun hotel (2 blocks from the High Line)
text: Great Chelsea location (2 blocks from the High Line and West Side Highway/Hudson River, around the corner from Chelsea Market, 2 blocks from the subway (A,C,E,1,2 lines), surrounded by fun bars/restaurants), clean/trendy rooms, pretty (heated) pool on the 2nd floor (with real sand under some of the lounge chairs-fun touch!), and phd nightclub on the roof

title: Great service from joe and chris
text: Joe and chris made the stay great and would definitely do it again. Good sized rooms and good location for exploring the city of New York. Nice to be so close to things that are fun to see and do and be able to walk to them

title: Love the Dream Downtown, Jane & Team!
text:
As New Yorkers, we always stay here when we want to have a weekend staycation. JANE SRIPRAYUL is the best and always super responsive with all our questions and requests. She’s a pleasure to work with and one of the reasons we choose to book here. Super professional and sincere. Chris at checkin was so wonderful and helped us with our room request. Jesus took care of all our bags and ensured our belongings were handled with care.  The hotel itself is super trendy and great dining options!

With so many options to choose from, we have never been disappointed with our choice of staying here. We love the dream downtown and Jane and team! Thanks again for a wonderful stay! Be back very soon.

title: Fun place for a business conference.
text: Fun and boutique hotel in great neighborhood. Lots to do in hotel and near by. The pool and lobby bar are highlights. Beware as you look 👀 up. Conference set up was nice and food was good. No coffee in room, hence the 4 stars! Not ideal for children.

title: Nice location
text:
The hotel is conveniently located in the old meat packing district. Its close to the subway and within walking distance of Soho, Chelsea Market and several tourist attractions and prime shopping.

The service was very average and impersonal. The rooms are ok,although they are starting to look a little shabby and dirty. The drawers in the wardrobe are broken and the carpet was filthy. Several of the amenities were missing in spite of being listed on their website (hairdryer, glasses for mini bar, slippers, etc.) The mini bar was also never restocked.

title: Great stay and very central!
text:
We are from France with a family with 2 kids and stayed in a room with 4 beds. The rooms are great, big showers and no noise on the second floor. Great views over New York and very close to Chelsea market and the High Line. I used the heated pool every day for swimming in the morning and the boys used the gym.
Christopher, the Concierge, gave us some useful information where to go and Daniel behind the reception was always very kind.
Thank you for making our stay so pleasant!
Sutherland family

title: Unless you're a Google employee visiting Chelsea...find someplace else!
text:
I really wanted to love this hotel, but there were so many things wrong with it.  Inconsistencies, from the bathroom products to the furniture in the room, are many. I was there for five nights.

On the plus side, the front desk is good, and the towels were soft, however the first day we had bath sheets but just bath towels after that.  On the flip side, the entire hotel smelled of pot, which was what it was except one night a security guard knocked on our door asking if it was in our room (not!).  The platform beds are dangerous, and many bruises were acquired due to the fact the platform sticks out AND there is ZERO room to walk around the bed.  You need to see it to believe it.  

More than once, cold water came on during my shower and I needed to wait a long time for the hot water to get hot.  Oh yeah...no ice machine on the floor!  Finally, for being across the street from Google, this place could use more outlets for charging electronics and using a blow dryer and styler in the bathroom.

The hotel is edgy, and there's a fun club on the top, but not worth the discomfort IMO. If you stay here, one person/room max is recommended.

title: Chic, comfortable stay
text: Loved the decor and interior of Dream - it was very modern and whimsical, but not at the expense of comfort. The staff who checked me in and out were all so helpful, supportive, and friendly (especially John)! My only regret is not getting to stay for a bit longer to fully enjoy my own balcony, the heated rooftop pool, etc...

title: Holiday in New York
text:
Wonderful hotel, excellent service, right place for fun in the city, vibrant atmosphere and close to Chelsea Market, CHRISTOPHER SCALI
Lead Concierge did a great job and organised a cool helicopter flight from White Plane into Manhattan

title: Excellent
text: The Dream Hotel Downtown was a great experience and everyone was very friendly. John was also helpful at checkout and with transportation. The amenities, pool, restaurants and location were all great.

title: What a stay!
text: Love the dream!!!! Yet another great stay here at the Dream! And Daniel! what can i say!! He made it that much better! I’ve been to the dream before and had a great experience, but this time, Daniel made it just that much better! Customer service at its best! Thanks again Dream!

title: Oh Dream!
text:
I stood at Dream with my boyfriend for our anniversary as a surprise, and Nicole was kind enough to make it extra special by sending us a bottle of champagne 😍! Thank you so much Nicole! You’re a doll! 
We had a minor discrepancy with our room but the staff was so accommodating and attentive to our needs. So I  also wanted to quickly shout out Anthony for assisting us with our minor issue. 
Dream is really good is you’re looking for a fun night out of town or a romantic night in, we booked a Gold King and our room was a great size with views to die for! Will def recommend everyone and anyone!

title: Dream is the ishhh!
text:
I’ve stayed at dream plenty of times but this time was really dope! Nicole checked us all in and was very attentive through out our whole stay! Thanks Nicole for everything! You really were a tribute in making our stay one to remember! 

Dream itself is a beautiful property with the best places close by! If you don’t chose dream, you’re crazy !

title: An actual Dream
text: I loved this hotel! It is actually really fun and unpretentious. The staff were very friendly especially Daniel at the front desk...I give him 5 stars! I will definitely be back this summer to hang out by the pool.

title: Fantastic stay!
text: My family and I visited from FL and Daniel made us feel so welcome.He took the time to answer all of this southerner's questions. He truly made us feel at home. For us, we can really stay anywhere, as long as it's a clean place to lay our heads( which your hotel was very clean and comfortable)..but Daniel is truly what sets your hotel above the rest! What a great asset to your establishment. We will definitely stay here again!

title: A working stay more than pleasant
text:
I was stayed at Dream Downtown two full week for a business trip. The localisation of the hotel is very central and very reachable.
Just near Chelsea Market and the HighLine you can have many good time arround the hotel and the subway is just at one corner of the block.
All the team are very lovely and very helpful for all demand that you will have.
I have been taken in charge by Lauren Nordstrom who is a very appreciable and competent person. I was very happy to stay in this hotel and i will come back the next month with pleasure.

title: Fine, it’s fine, everything’s fine.
text: Checking in, hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Lobby is fun and vibrant. Standard rooms are small and somewhat loud. We stayed on the 11th floor, and even with the white noise speaker turned all the way up, the bass from the rooftop bar kept us up at night. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom adequate, and everything else was fine. The hotel is conveniently located next to Chelsea Market and the High Line. I would recommend for its location, just be aware the rooms are small and can be loud.

title: More like a night terror
text: Low quality dump of a hotel, should be razed to the ground. Rooms are falling apart and look like the inside of an IKEA. Extremely loud all the time from outside noise and you can’t turn off the orange night lights; good luck sleeping. Do not recommend.

title: Birthday
text: Awesome fun time with friends! Anthony at the front desk was so gregarious and accommodating and knowledgeable!! He truly welcomed us in such a warm manner. We hung out having cocktails at the lobby bar and people watching. The room was spacious and the bed super comfortable!!! Great value in a fun neighborhood!!

title: Great stay!
text: Very cool hotel.  Great rooftop.  Great rooms and great location.  In a very cool neighborhood next to some really good restaurants, the Chelsea market and high line.  Can’t wait to stay here again.  Highly recommend.

title: Perfect night getaway
text: Surprised my fiance with just a night on the town as we both have hectic work schedules and this couldn't have been a better decision to stay here. My 3rd time here and each time I get more and more comfortable and ended up letting the front desk know what I was staying for and they accommodated us in an amazing way!

title: Nice.. good vibes
text:
Stayed for a couple of days. 
Very trendy hotel, nice atmosphere. The rooftop bar is fabulous. 
The hotel offers a nice pool, great lobby, and decorated rooms.
The staff was very friendly and helpful 
Final verdict - go for it

title: Exceptional service
text: I’ve never been to the dream hotel before but after hearing about it from a friend I’ve decided to book here for my anniversary. The lobby had a modern decor and a bar lounge area to chill.  I went to the check in area  where I was assisted by a beautiful lady by the name of Nicole. She was very sweet and informative. she gave me a quick rundown of what the hotel has to offer and recommended I visit the rooftop lounge after my dinner reservation. I’m glad she did because we really enjoyed night view of the city and the atmosphere (music, people) was refreshing. I really appreciate the complimentary drinks  I received during check-in that was a bonus . Overall,  I enjoyed my stay and will definitely be booking again. Thanks again Nicole and the dream staff for making my first stay a great one

title: Thank God its Monday!
text: Arrived at Dream Downtown and graciously greeted by Aaron at the Front Desk. He welcomed me, reviewed the property, gave some suggestions and to my surprise he upgraded my room. The room had so many luxurious amenities to list. The most important to me was cleanliness of the room, comfort of the bed and the shower experience. All were 2nd to none. Pls consider the Dream Downtown on your next stay in NYC.

title: Weekend Trip
text: Dream Downtown is a great hotel in close proximity to everything you want to be around in NYC.  Daniel at the front desk was awesome- helpful and knowledgeable- great hotel staff which is always a plus when you're traveling.  Will definitely use this hotel again!

title: Amazing Staff!
text: I am in New York for a job conference. As soon as I arrived to the hotel a young woman attended me. I believe her name was Nicole... I had multiple questions regarding the area (this is my second time in NY since 2016) so I’m a bit unfamiliar with what’s around. But I bombarded this young lady with questions and she was able to guide me properly. This was an excellent welcoming to my stay for the next 4 days.

title: great place to stay
text: It's my fifth time there and it is always amazing. Superbe location, great rooms and very pleasant staff with special thanks to the Concierge ( Christopher ). I will go there next time for sure ! see you there : )

title: Not worth it
text:
I’m surprised at how well this hotel has been rated. 
There was weak to no wifi, requiring registration each day. 
Staffing was inconsistent and not always a concierge at hand.
The elevator had problems and we could not get to the floor, and other guests experienced this also.
The design is poor: a distinct lack of power outlets near bedside tables, and no lamps - hence having to go to bed in the dark. 
But it was never actually dark, because the choice of switch is illuminated orange and the room is constantly glowing from them.
In my opinion, shower curtains are an indicator of a cheap mentality and voila... then within the shower was a broken shower caddy that was attempted to be fixed but rendered useless (it could have been replaced for $10).
The first hotel in a long time without soft close toilet seat, again a cost cutting decision.
The privacy curtains had been damaged and didn’t close properly, and the furniture was damaged. 
First time in NYC, so weren’t sure of where to stay, but this place is not good for tourists. Across the road is the Chelsea Market, which is the only saving grace for this location as there seems nothing else in the area. The concierge (when around) wasn’t very helpful. 
Spent a small fortune on Uber to get uptown constantly, to see the sights and to get to dinner etc
I can only think locals stay here after (or during) a big night out at the clubs.
Hence the cheap design, the damaged and tired feel of the place.
Very disappointing for the price.

title: Mr David Hughes
text: Great Hotel in super district. Hotel staff friendly and efficient. Concierge Christopher is top class . Made us very welcome and all his advice was spot on . I would advise all families to seek advice from Christopher before planning your sightseeing or dining out.

title: Good Service
text: Service was excellent. A gentleman named Daniel at front desk helped us throughout the trip, I would say if it wasn’t for him our trip wouldn’t have been the same. He knew exactly what we were looking for in terms of restaurants and hot spots. It was our first time in New York so we definitely couldn’t have managed on our own. He remembered us by our first names and always greeted us with a smile. Thanks to Daniel I would say the hotel staff nd service was above average. The hotel it’s self was good, I would encourage slippers in the hotel room next time and and body lotion. Otherwise prime location walking distance to all the best spots and lots to do in the area. Would recommend.

title: not what expected
text: Using this Hotel for a business trip in the Area, it was very much below my expectations, Rooms small and not very clean, during 4 day stay, rooms were 2 not cleaned. Hotel very noisy, even on the 7th floor, you could still here nice from nightclub, the only positive aspect was a very friendly Reception employee. but i wouldn't book this hotel at my next trip anymore

title: MISERABLE NIGHT
text:
A/C not working well
TINY rooms (yes, even for NYC)
Internet horribly slow ( under 1MB)
RUDE front door security staff 
Dismissive front desk staff
Ineffective and poorly trained front desk
NO PLUGS near the bed
Random charges on credit card a week after departure
Terrible customer service
*** Upside:  good location

title: Dream Downtown NYC
text: Had a great time with the family. Hotel was lovely and the staff were really helpful. Mr Scali, the Lead Concierge who helped me get a late delivery forwarded onto me in the UK deserves a special mention. Barrington Roberts on reception also helped us with a room switch on our last night which really made a great end to our stay. Recommended

title: Birthday celebration
text: My husband and I stayed here beginning of the month (Sunday night) to celebrate his birthday and had a great time. Location is perfect, walking distance to great neighborhoods and good food. We stopped in Sunday night to Mexican restaurant and enjoyed some tapas and drinks...food was fresh and tasty. Staff was courteous helpful and did everything to make our stay pleasant. We will be back with the kids (young adults) and take advantage of pool!

title: Peace in downtown NYC
text: I really like Dream downtown, the staff is very friendly and accommodating. Thanks Nicole for placing me in a nice quiet room and for following up through out my stay.  Definitely will recommend to my colleagues and friends for party as well as business trips! See you soon Dream!

title: the trip was wonderful
text: lauren in reception was the first person I met when I arrived in the hotel. she was so kind, and helped me on my arrival. I was made to feel so welcome and valued as a customer. jimmy in the coffee shop was terrific.  thank you all for a wonderful stay

title: Great Vibes!
text: I really liked my stay here! Even though I was here for work, there’s so much to explore nearby. The location is awesome! Danny was super friendly and gave me some great recs.  It has a really swanky, unique vibe, and I’d stay here again!

title: looking forward again11
text: i have stayed here last two years consecutively and everyone of the staff has been amazing. the rooms are wonderful too. looking forward for my 3rd stay next month.the bouncers to go up to the rooftop can be nasty but understandable as it is one of the happening rooftops with late night permissions. however they can cut a little slack with long stay and regular customers. the food is amazing at all restaurants. service and cocktails at the lobby bar, FANTASTIC! pool side service is a little slow but then it is a busy spot in downtown new york. would recommend to anyone without kids. And will go back again next year too.

title: Rooftopbar/-club und ausgezeichnete Lage!
text:
Das Hotel ist extrem gut gelegen und auch mit der Ubahn hervorragend zu erreichen und angebunden: Man kommt ohne Umstieg zum Flughafen (JFK), zum (One)World Trade Center, sowie in die anderen Teile von Manhattan und Brooklyn.

Besonders gut hat mir die Rooftop Bar mit Club gefallen, die sich nicht nur unter den Hotelgästen großer Beliebtheit erfreut. 

Die Zimmer waren sehr stylisch gehalten und mit Google Assistant ausgestattet, das Personal war immer aufmerksam und äußerst hilfsbereit.

Alles in allem kann ich das Hotel für Geschäftsreisende und Pärchen (ohne Kinder) absolut empfehlen!

title: Noisy, and dishonest with pricing
text:
Besides from the unacceptable noise, this hotel charges a mandatory "reservation fee" of $20 per night for stuff you don't use, such as the pool in winter and the "free" WiFi.
If it's mandatory, why don't you just add it to the price? Unless... You want to screw your customers?

title: 21st
text: I had arrived three hours ahead of time to setup a surprise 21st for my friend. The people at the desk were super helpful especially Danny and Keen. They helped give me advice about where to take my friend that night and were super responsible when thing didn’t work out. Best people ever!

title: Exceptional Service and Location
text: My husband and I booked hotel for same day stay on a whim , we decided to be adventurous for our 3rd year anniversary, and head to New York for day /night. We had a great  time ! I have to say the Dream Hotel had a lot to do with it. The staff is so warm and friendly and courteous . We were greeted By Daniel Perez at front desk and he set the tone for the rest of our stay . He was very attentive , patient and genuinely showed interest and care in our stay. He even made sure our room was up to our expectations. He had great suggestions and helped organize our day. Daniel definitely made us feel welcome and at home. We look forward to coming back . From the door through desk , concierge & hotel bar Until the moment we exited the service was exceptional . This hotel with the location its staff & great room views is definitely a must.

title: Dream Downtown NY
text:
We were slightly worried at the negative reviews but found our family stay here to be excellent and we would certainly return to this hotel. Positives first. The room sizes are great, especially the larger superior King rooms, and really nicely decorated. The location is perfect, right next to Chelsea Market and the pool is lovely.
The hotel is noisy, not people partying but, in the standard room you could hear the TV in the next room, and in the King room (which we had to change due to noise) you can hear the heating and ventilation systems of the adjacent buildings. This didn't bother everyone in our party but worth knowing if you are sensitive to this kind of sound. The baths don't drain properly due to a design feature which makes the base totally flat. Otherwise, the front desk staff were lovely, especially John Tadros and the concierge Chris Scali. In contrast, the barman in the lounge bar was very rude and the service in the breakfast bar was dreadful. Despite these negatives (no hotel is perfect) it is a fab place and fun for families with kids.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Everything was amazing! There was not one thing we could fault, amazing room, lovely friendly staff. one of the best holiday I have ever been.Great value for your money to stay in this hotel.definitely we will come back again

title: Great hotel
text:
We stayed at Dream Downtown for 5 nights. From the moment we checked in Daniel Perez was super helpful going above and beyond to ensure we knew all of the top places to see/do and give us his top recommendations which were all fabulous! 

Our room was a great size and worked well for us. There’s also the rooftop bar which has really nice views of the city at night. 

The hotel is located right near Chelsea Market which is great for foodies, just a bit further up is the entry to the Highline and the subway is roughly 5 mins walk away. All in all we really enjoyed our stay and will certainly be back again!

title: Excellent Experience!
text: Clean, modern environment with great amenities. Restaurants on site were exceptional and the front desk assistance was perfect. Check in and check out were quick and easy. I was also impressed that the manager took the time to introduce herself to everyone. Definitely staying there on our next business trip to NYC (enjoyed it so much we may even plan a leisure trip too). Comfortable beds too and a beautiful view of the city!!!

title: Weekend to Remember!
text:
My boyfriend and I travelled to NYC for my birthday weekend and decided to stay at Dream based on its location and what I’d seen online. I was worried because of some negative reviews I’d read, but I’m SO happy we decided on Dream. 

Before arriving, I called the hotel and requested a room with a city view and not too much noise. A lot of negative reviews seem to be about the noise from the rooftop and basement clubs. I also mentioned it was my birthday the day of check in. The hotel accommodated us with no issues and we got a room on the 7th floor. We arrived to find a bottle of champagne and a hand written birthday note which was so sweet. 

Noise was a non-issue. We didn’t hear a thing and slept like babies! Having said that, the hotel is close to the Meatpacking District and does attract a younger crowd. The lobby has a DJ and bar at night and can get quite busy until the early AM hours. For us, it was a bonus. A beautiful space to have a drink without leaving the hotel. A lot of people also commented on the “frustrating” lighting system. It was literally a button that you push to turn the light on or off or hold to dim. No difficulties there. It’s a boutique hotel so it wasn’t the most spacious room I’ve been in, but it had what we needed which is most important! 

What blew us away was the staff’s personal touches. On the 2nd day of our stay, my boyfriend proposed and the staff was beyond awesome! From delivering champagne after the the proposal to sending chocolate covered strawberries with ANOTHER handwritten note to our room, the customer relations at this hotel were above anything I’ve ever experienced! 

I’d recommend this hotel to anyone who’s looking for a more authentic NY experience away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and other touristy place, but still close to a vibrant nightlife scene. Thank you to the “Dream Team”! Can’t wait to visit again.

title: Hip and modern
text: The facade of this place is so modern it makes you wonder whether the rest of the hotel can keep up.  Yes yes yes it can!  Only thing missing was a robot bartender to bring my martini into the next millennium.  Whether the architecturally miraculous pool hanging over the lobby or the futuristic talking Google devices in the rooms, my stay was memorable at every turn.  Shout out to the staff as well.  Thank you Nicole and Lauren for being so helpful.  "Hey Google, when can I come back!"

title: Amazing customer service!
text: This was my first time staying in Dream Downtown, I live close to the city but was looking for a cool spot to spend an early birthday weekend with some friends. My experience was completely made from Lauren in the front house. She was SO professional and made sure to not only make our stay comfortable, but went out of her way to make sure I felt special for my birthday! Little things go a long way, and my stay was completely worth it from the extended care we received from everyone on staff. Not to mention, it was in a close distance with some of the best bars in NY! I'll definitely be back.

title: Awesome hotel, amazing location.
text: This hotel is awesome and in the best location. Lauren at the front desk was the best and so helpful. We were in such good hands with her and she made our whole experience amazing! She gave us great tips about the area, and there’s so many great restaurants, clubs and bars around!

title: Super fijn hotel midden in de Chelsea
text: Goed hotel met vriendelijk personeel. Erg kleine kamers met daarbij dan wel weer er zeer ruime douche. Kamers zijn schoon en het hotel is/ wordt zeer goed goed onderhouden. Muziek in de lobby staat hinderlijk hard als je wilt praten. Op het dak is een club maar de mooiste en chiqueste zit er pal naast TAO. Soho, Madison Square alles is af te lopen. Fantastisch is natuurlijk Chelsea Market. Ik kom hier zeker terug.

title: Wonderful hospitality
text: I had the BEST experince at Dream Hotel thanks to Ms. Nicole, she was very helpful throughout my entire stay. She was very friendly, polite, efficient and super accommodating. I will definitely recommend this hotel. Thank you Nicole for your outstanding service!!

title: Would recommend to a friend and absolutely stay again
text: This was my 3rd time staying at the Dream Hotel, Downtown, and it was by far my best stay. It was my birthday and upon hearing this fact and that I was a reoccurring guest, the woman at the front desk (Maria) had some complimentary champagne sent up for my guests and I. It was a wonderful surprise. The staff is super accommodating and tentative  and the hotel is down right gorgeous--from the lobby, to the restaurants, to the rooms themselves. It's also surprisingly affordable--all of my guests were pleasantly surprised with the beautiful atmosphere of the place in its entirety. I'm quite looking forward to my next stay at Dream Downtown!

title: Not business class
text: Stayed at this hotel over a recent business trip and while the room seemed large by NYC standards it did not meet my needs for business purposes. There was no desk or convenient outlets to plug in electronics. I had to follow a cord to where a bedside lamp was hooked up to plug in my cell phone which meant I had to move furniture and leave my phone to charge on the floor. The hotel is better suited for someone on a leisure trip rather than business. It’s modern in design and has a huge night time social draw with hip restaurants and bars but the minor details lacking in the rooms made it inconvenient to work around for a business trip.

title: A great and well-priced surprise
text: We recently stayed here on a parents' one-night-only getaway after booking on Hotel Tonight for a great deal. Found the room to be fun, comfortable and spotlessly clean--especially enjoyed the round windows with city views. (Some rooms look into the courtyard, instead, I think.) Every staff member we encountered was helpful, nice and, best of all efficient. Would definitely stay again, especially once it's warm enough for the pool.

title: Big disappointment
text:
We arrived 3 persons for 6 nights, we checked in to a narrow dark room whit two lamps one of them didnt work, no garbage bin, 2 very small beds not even close to be double beds, the mattresses were so soft it felt like you are sleeping on the floor. We had zero room for our suitcases not to mention zero room for our cloths (tiny closet) and no hot water only after 10 minutes the water was on. after two nights they moved us to a "bigger room" with a king size bed and another folding single bed but unfortunately there was still no garbage bin, no lights, the sink was floating which brought bad smell whenever we used it,still no room for our laugages and the safety box wasn't attached to anything so we couldn't leave our staff in the room and had to carry it with us every day.
In the morning we told everything to the lady on the front desk she said she is sending someone to fix everything, sink, safety box, garbage bin, light etc but when we came bake to the room nothing was changed.
Never will we return to this hotel nor recommand it to the people we love. We visit NYC every year this was the lowest value for money deal we ever had!

title: Wow!
text: I had a last minute trip to NYC and I had to organize transportation, lodging, EVERYTHING in just 48 hours. I'm so lucky + grateful to have been connected with Dream Downtown because it really blew me away. The building itself was beautiful, and we loved the room so much. Everyone from the front desk, to the valet, to the housekeeping staff were incredibly friendly and left a positive impact. It says a lot about a place when every interaction is a positive one. I can't wait to stay at Dream Downtown next time I visit the city!

title: More like a Nightmare
text: Hotel in general is ok, cool decoration and all, but it fails in one of the most basic principles: to have a goodnight sleep. I tried to sleep last night before having to leave at 6am to the airport but there is a nightclub within the hotel that was so loud, I simply could not sleep. It went on and on, until around 4am or so, no stop. They have some serious insulation work to do. It was a nightmare and the next day I felt awful, no sleep at all and needed to work. I recommend to skip this hotel if you are looking to sleep at night. Awful, awful, awful

title: Fun hotel
text:
Came back to the Dream for recent long weekend in NYC.  Its a fun and busy hotel.  It you want total rest and relaxation it may not be for you, but if you want a hotel with some life and bustle, then this could be the one. 

We had a fantastic corner room on the 9th floor with dual-aspect views over Manhattan and stunning view uptown towards Empire State and midtown.  Room 908 was also tucked away at the end of the corridor away from the elevator so super quiet as have noticed some noise of passing guests in other rooms during previous stays

what do I like about the Dream?  Funky modern décor and design in the rooms, comfortable bed, great large round windows with wicked views (particularly higher up you are).  Also the location - right in the middle of the Meat Packing district and only a couple of minutes walk from the High Line and 14th Street metro stop - where you can take the metro out to JFK

Downsides?  Well it gets busy at the weekend with the reception/bar area full on a Friday and Saturday night with DJ so resembles almost a club.  I like this - but maybe other readers will not.

I'd happily come back to stay

title: Pool above lobby
text: The pool above the lobby was just about the most fantastic thing I've ever seen in a hotel.  Wow.  It's an architectural marvel.  Great staff.  Good drinks.  Fantastic area of NYC.  And - rare for NYC - the prices were fair.  I think I'm going to make this my spot for future visits to the big apple.

title: Basic Bad Designed Hotel
text:
I stayed here for work for 4 nights. The hotel is terribly designed, so many things that are just complicated and dont add anything (the shower curtain, the lights switch, etc).
You dont get slippers to walk around (which is a basic in any hotel now), or body cream. 
We asked for an adapter and they didnt have any complementary and had to buy it which doesnt make any sense.
The Bodega Negra restaurant and breakfast place are crazy expensive and low quality food, do not eat there.
Great location though..

title: 4 Day stay
text: I had an awesome stay here at Dream Downtown hotel. Great room service. The security was very professional and friendly. The people at the desk helpful and the concierge knew about all the popular places in the area. Not to mention the night life being one of the best in NYC. Thumbs up!

title: Fantastic Service and Wonderful Staff!!
text: Gorgeous hotel located in the best neighborhood.  This is my 3rd stay and I'm loving it! I felt like - a home away from home! Concierge, and the front desk remembered me from my previous stays.  I enjoyed my stay very much - again - very comfortable and the location is convenient to go anywhere. The front desk/reception staff is incredible and were excellent in the detailed way they responded to my questions and truly took time and care in responding to my needs. Will be back again soon!

title: Fantastic
text: Recently stayed at the Dream Downtown.   Beautiful facility.  Great Service.  Clean and convenient location.  This will now be my "go-to" hotel for business trips.  Wonderful staff.   Really great experience.

title: Fantastic Services !!!!!
text: The whole experience was quiet fantastic, with many restaurants, nightclubs, and bars to chose from, Joseph Sabatelli recommended and booked all my reservations for me. I did not have to make any phone calls. He truly made my stay here stress free, and easy. I highly recommend this property for anyone who needs assistance with what to do while visiting Dream Downtown.

title: Bien ubicado
text: Me gustó la ubicación cerca del metro. Las habitaciones son pequeñas pero normal en NY. La comida es cara así que lo recomiendo para comidas. Cama cómoda y el mini bar muy completo. Es bonito para estar en pareja

title: Always A Dream
text: On many occasions I've stayed at this hotel and every stay has been amazing. The staff here are always accomidating. Especially Joseph Sabatelli, With many reservations to broadway shows and last minute reserved dinners hes never let my stay here not worth it !

title: Amazing Concierge !
