text: This hotel is right in the heart of the meatpacking district, with many amenities to chose from in such short notice I was able to contact concierge Joseph Sabatelli, and in no time he was able to reserve one of the rarest last minute reservations to Carbone. That alone made my stay at this hotel the most memorable experience in NYC !

title: Appropriately alternative.
text:
Appropriately alternative. 
It's a hotel that's fine.
But If you like a classic style, it is not the hotel for you. It's a bit alternative with hipster aspirations. I particularly don't mind at all. But if you prefer a more classic attention and prefer no dj playing in the lobby nor people drinking something and chatting near the elevators, this hotel is not for you. 
Drawback: apparently thin walls. You could hear clear passionate noises from other rooms. 
I particularly like the Chelsea area.

title: Delightful business trip at the DREAM!
text:
Loved the vibe of the hotel, very upbeat and hip. My room was delightful, overlooking the pool. Very stylish  interior design in the room. Small room, but intimate and again loved the decor.
I'm a swimmer, so I did swim  while it was cold outside, thus the pool temperature was perfect..however it's important to still maintain the cleanliness of the pool (debris and dark coloring on the steps) and have towels available.
I also, enjoyed having a drink and snacks at PHD. WOW, great music and service.Wished I could have stayed for the wee hours to really enjoy it.

title: devi essere giovane
text: se sei giovane, questo hotel fa per te! feste, discoteca, tanta vita! tuttavia, se vuoi dormire, assicurati di avere una stanza tranquilla! personale gentile e organizzato. Colazione media (non inclusa).

title: Amazing Staff!
text: My stay was very good, I stood in a silver room with my boyfriend and the view was pretty nice. During check in Nicole was assisting us and she was very lovely! ♥️ thank you so much Nicole for accommodating a quiet room and for your recommendations. We also enjoyed a cocktail at the roof top bar and wow was it a good vibe. Definitely recommend to all my friends.

title: Great mix of funky, stylish, fun, and practical
text: Usually my travel to NYC takes me to Murray Hill, Midtown, or the UES; this time though it was Meatpacking District. Found Dream on the web, it looked interesting, and it completely delivered on its promise. Very comfortable bed, great fun round windows, good size bathroom, good work desk, and a neighborhood that on Sunday night was quiet enough to get a good night's sleep. The staff were friendly and helpful, and I regretted not having enough time to take advantage of the bar, lounge, and cafe. Having Chelsea Market and other appealing places within steps is a plus. Dream has an energy that is stimulating without being overwhelming. Absolutely would come here again if I need to stay in the area.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE
text: terriblly small and uncomfortable room. Loud music bumping from the top floor which resonated down four floors to my room until 3 am. Then when I got my bill they had charged me an extra $100 for some reason. I've called their accounting department and let multiple messages and no response. Save yourself and stay at the much nicer gansevoort around the corner

title: Birthday Weekend in NYC Dream Downtown
text: I’ve stayed at Dream downtown before and honestly still is my favorite. Fun hotel with so much to do within the hotel. Location is perfect so close to museums, shops, restaurants and much more. Staff is amazing and always so helpful. Do not hesitate and book. Will not be disappointed!

title: Cool
text: Super cool hotel in great area next to Chelsea Market. Reception and bar area are very cool, rooftop bar / club is amazing. Expensive but worth it for a drink or 2. Rooms were fine, very comfy bed, fairly quiet, nice shower, the lights in the rooms are ridiculous, so difficult to use the dimmers. Apart from that all good.

title: Dream is a great experience!
text: The team there were friendly, fun, and really help to make your stay enjoyable.  The views are great, the area is unmatched and the restaurants in the hotel are wonderful!  We had a memorable night, the only thing to consider is if you really need quiet at the end of your night to sleep.  Some rooms are right under the rooftop lounge and can be noisy.  But hopefully you have such a wonderful evening, as we did, that by the time you get back to your room you don't hear any of it!

title: Stylish venue, friendly & accommodating staff
text:
I really enjoyed my stay here. On arrival, I had a booking issue (that I'm pretty sure was on my end), but the front desk sorted it out for me without any hassle. I absolutely loved the location, it's across the street from Chelsea Market, <2 blocks from the best nightlife,  and about a 5-10 minute walk to the waterfront. Also, with your hotel key, you can access the rooftop lounge, PHD, where you can enjoy one of the best views in the city.

The only thing I would request of this hotel is an in-room coffee maker and a usable mini fridge (their mini fridges are full of items and sensored, so there's no space for personal items).

I was surprised by their very reasonable rates. I plan to stay here again soon.

title: The Dream is a Dream
text: This is the best Place to stay in NYC hands down!!!! I stay here every week and wouldn’t imagine going anywhere else.  Jane and the staff are beyond accommodating and with their hospitality they make it feel like my home away from home!!!!!!

title: Excellence
text: Had an excellent stay here at the Dream Hotel for Valentine’s Day. Joseph Sabatelli made sure everything was perfect. He made sure someone was outside to valet my car as soon as I pulled up. He also had my room decorated with rose petals. Wanted to eat at Philippe Chows but it was completely booked and Joseph managed to get us a table. Joseph Sabatelli as well as the entire staff made the stay here very pleasant. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Comfortable bed, nice room
text:
I enjoyed my stay here. The bed was very comfortable, everything was clean and I had a room in the quiet area of the hotel.

The elevators seem to have a mind of their own, so do account for that.

Most of the staff is lovely while some were a bit disinterested and / or rude.

The hotel apologized for this, so I feel it's down to individuals.

title: Great Staff !!
text:
Everyone was really nice and really helpful will be back in the summer for sure.
Amazing stay with the Family, Bell staff was great Big shoutout to Kenen !! Always there when we needed him. Cant speak on him enough.

title: We will definitely be back!
text:
Joseph Sabatelli at the Concierge desk really made this trip special for us.   We were new to this hotel and had lots of questions.  Talked to Joe before we arrived from NC about tickets to show, transportation, where to eat, etc.  Everything was waiting for us when we arrived just as he said it would.  His quick reply and ability to get us everything we needed totally exceeded our expectations of a busy downtown hotel.  

Dream is full of energy and something everyone should experience.  Great rooms and location.  However, it was Joe’s above and beyond customer service that will be the reason we return.

title: Dream
text:
It’s call dream and for the first business trip to NYC, that was a dream! 
The room is small but really comfortable with a king size bed. 
The open bathroom is really modern like the entire hotel.
The roof top bar is just amazing.
The food is not so dreamy.

title: Great location & awesome amenities
text: Loved our stay at the Dream Downtown. Very close to important sites and meeting locations. Also appreciated the 24/7 gym, very responsive room service, and comfortable stay. With PHD up top, great restaurants on the ground floor, and Electric Room below, the hotel makes it hard to want to leave...even though you're in NYC! Look fwd to my next stay.

title: Nicole to the rescue!! Great staff!
text: I just have to say the service was amazing, Nicole at the front desk made me feel right at home. She went above and beyond and honestly I don't usually have a great experience with Hotel staff. I had a hiccup with my check in and Nicole was able to check me in! "Came to the rescue!" Wasn't too excited about the rooms but I travel often so it was sufficient for my needs, great pool area & the highlight was the location - Chelsea Market was across the street with so many food selections and the Highline Park is walking distance! Great vibe. Great management! Thanks again Nicole you saved my trip!

title: Lovely Concierge at Great Hotel
text: Love the space of this wonderfully located hotel in the heart of meatpacking. Trendy and has great staff, Joseph at the concierge was extremely helpful letting me know the best trains for me to catch uptown for my unexpected meeting! I would of been late if it weren’t for him. Definitely ask for him if you need any advice in the big city! I will be back!

title: Weekend Away
text: My girlfriend and I spent the weekend in the city as a bit of a getaway. Since we do not frequent the city often we enlisted the assistance of the concierge services. We worked with Joseph, who was very helpful and set us up for dinner at Carbone. We enjoyed every bit of our dinner. Joseph was very thorough and followed up the very next morning. He was very eager to assist us and see of there was anything else he could help us with to make our stay more enjoyable.

title: Keenan was great!
text: My overall rating is a 3/5 because the elevator wasn’t functioning and the room felt a bit sterile, but I wanted to write my review to commend a specific employee who helped me with my bags, Keenan. He was unexpectedly friendly and helpful both times I interacted with him. Thank you for your hospitality, Keenan!

title: Great staff !!
text: The overall stay was good, aside from the fact there was a no hot water for about 48 hours. But the staff was amazing big shout-out to Nicole and oeteka at the front desk really nice and Keenan the bellman who brought my luggage down and got me transportation to the airport.  Would definitely be back fun hotel.

title: Great hospitality
text: I stayed at Dream Downtown for work and it was an amazing stay. Great hotel, great staff, great energy..  Lauren hooked me up with a room with awesome views of the Empire State Building.. All the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The hotel's in a great location in the Chelsea neighborhood. It's close to everything. I will definitely be back!

title: I won't rush back here
text:
Was put in to the Dream by our corporate travel team so did not choose it. It could be an age thing as I think the Dream is aimed at young and hip things and not people travelling on business. Decor and style of rooms was not to my taste - but that is not a complaint, it's just a personal thing. 
As usual everyone is super polite but its a bit superficial but that is as deep as it goes
Conversation this morning:
"There was a fire alarm this morning just before six this morning"
"Yes sir, I apologise about that"
"The problem was that I did not know about it until my colleague just told me 2hrs after because the alarm did not sound in my room, so if you did have a real fire, I would likely be dead at this stage"
"I apologise about that sir" (clearly thinks that is sufficient response and reverts to blank expression)

Then there was the no hot water situation for two days due to some major steam pipe burst apparently (allegedly) so cold flannel wash ahead of check out in to the rainy lower Manhattan day.

Won't rush back

title: Not worth it
text:
Having spent a lot of time in NYC and stayed in many hotels there, I had often passed by the Dream Downtown and wanted to stay there eventually. I booked a Gold King room for my girlfriend's birthday, and was very excited for our stay. I have never left a negative review before, and am not usually one to complain, but since this hotel was less than impressive for the price point and for such a special weekend, I hope this review will save others the disappointment. 

Upon our arrival, we were greeted by Aaron at the front desk who was kind and pleasant, and we had an easy, straightforward check-in. When we got on the elevator, we had to try at least 5 times to get the key card to work so we could get to our floor. We had issues with the elevator reading the key cards every single time we used them, which was annoying and seems to be an on-going issue for everyone. Once we made it to our room, we were impressed by how spacious the room was and the beautiful skyline views, including the Empire State Building. Since it's winter time on the East Coast, the sun sets pretty early, and my girlfriend and I noticed that even with the lights on and windows open, our room was completely dark by 4:30-5pm. We were trying to get ready for dinner and a night out, and spent at least a half hour trying to work the bizarre light switch buttons. We managed to figure them out, but were disappointed when we realized the single overhead light in the room lights up almost nothing at it's max brightness. The lightbulb in the tiny lamp on the desk was broken so we called to have it fixed. Although the man who changed the lightbulb came shortly after and was very nice, the newly lit lamp did almost nothing to brighten up the room, and he told us the lights did not go any brighter. We were left to change and do our hair and makeup in darkness. We literally had to use the flashlights on our phones to try to get some light. Why is there not at least more lighting in the bathroom? If you like living/getting ready in the pitch black, maybe you will enjoy lol. 

Aside from the whole bizarre lighting situation, there were too many details lacking that made the price of this hotel not worth it. Their website states that Gold King rooms include "ultra plush bathrobes," which there were no robes. We had to call for an ice bucket, which took far too long to be delivered. We then realized there are no glasses or cups available in the room so we had to call again for those. The bed is not particularly comfortable like most I've stayed at in the city. The pillows are absolutely dreadful. Sleeping without the pillows probably would've been more comfortable since your head will sink into them and practically touch the bed anyway. It was also annoying that there was no body lotion provided in the bathroom as we did not pack any since it is usually provided at other hotels. The drain in the sink must've been clogged or broken because washing your hands for a few seconds would cause it to fill all the way up and take forever to drain. You can imagine this gets pretty gross when you're brushing your teeth. Lastly, the thermostat seemed to not be working as it was freezing cold even when we turned the temperature all the way up to 78 degrees. 

There were just too many things wrong. We only stayed a night and wanted to enjoy our time so we tried to overlook them and did not go out of our way to try to get all of these issues fixed. However, they are worth noting so that others can steer clear of this overpriced, underwhelming hotel. Definitely would not stay at a Dream hotel again, and will opt for better hotels at this price point.

title: Excellent lux spot for a Staycation!
text:
I had been overworking myself too hard recently, so I decided to stay in a nice hotel for a day over the 3 day MLK weekend. 

I chose Dream Downtown because I was looking for places with a year-round pool and that looked like it they could provide an interesting, luxury experience.

As soon as I walked into the lobby, I knew that I had made the right decision. The whole space had a modern elegance, especially the fascinating interactive Mother Nature art installation.

The front desk workers were welcoming and friendly, and made sure to tell me about all the amenities, including the restaurants and the rooftop nightclub.

I chose a room with direct access to the outside, heated pool, and I’ve included pictures of my room with this review. Even though it was rather cold out, the pool itself was warm enough to get into. (I didn’t stay in the pool too long because the part of my body that wasn’t in the water was very cold, but if it had been a normal winter day rather than high winds and rock bottom tempteratures, I probably could have stayed out there longer.) The pool deck area was pretty, and I’m sure it would be a popular attraction in slightly warmer weather.

My room itself was comfortable, with plenty of space and well stocked. (The robe was missing, but as soon as I asked about it, they were quick to send someone up with two!) I really liked the rain shower, and the shower supplies were fancy enough that I actually bothered with taking them home with me. When the nighttime turndown service housekeeper came around, she was extremely attentive and made sure to give me extras of all the consumables, and offered me ones I didn’t think to ask for.

For dinner, I went to happy hour at Bodegra Negra, their Mexican restaurant. I was able to have a few excellent margaritas and two delicious small plates (either of which could have been enough on their own) for a much lower price than you would expect from a high quality restaurant attached to a high-end hotel.

Later that night, I went to PhD Nightclub, their rooftop club. That’s a separate experience that I might review another time (it wasn’t bad, but it just wasn’t my scene), but I figured it was worth including that they do have it there and it has an amazing skyline view.

I had room service breakfast the next day, which was a relaxing treat and didn’t cost too much extra, considering the fact that it was room service. I wasn’t in a hurry to get moving in the morning, since check out wasn’t until 12 (and simply by calling the front desk and asking nicely, I got it extended until 12:30.)

I was kind of sad to leave, but I think I’m going to come back soon for my birthday in February, and probably bring friends this time!

title: Highly Recommend
text: I had an excellent experience! I'd like to thank Ray, the front office manager for his accommodations; Keenan from the bell staff for his party and food recommendations; and Keenan and Neglin from the bell staff for helping with great transportation to the airport. I had a wonderful stay.

title: Friends Birthday
text: I had a wonderful stay! Special thanks to Barrington at the front desk that greeted me with smile and a warm welcome the hotel. The PhD rooftop was very cool nice music and drinks. I will be visiting again.

title: Best experience
text: By far the best hotel in nyc. We are New Yorkers and only stay at the Dream Downtown because of the stellar service by the dream team. I really can’t thank them enough. Jane Sriprayul went above and beyond to accommodate all my requests prior to checking in, day of checkin and throughout our stay. She’s absolutely amazing! She had our room setup with lovely surprises to welcome us and we greatly appreciate it.  Joseph Sabatelli with concierge took care of our requests and was a delight to communicate with! The hotel, grounds and amenities are 5 star. The service is beyond 5 stars. Would not stay anywhere else in New York. Thanks Jane and team! You are amazing!!

title: Ms
text:
Highly recommend! The best NYC stay. Extremely accommodating staff! We called for more blackets and pillows at 2 am and in 2 min they came to the door. Very friendly and courteous staff. Beautiful decor spacious rooms. Thank you Aaron O for your being so accommodating to our large group! I used to stay at Gansavort but no more. Definitely returning to The Dream!
Thank you again and see you soon!

title: Great Hotel and Great Staff
text: From the moment we stepped out the taxi we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff. The service continued on check in where the gentleman who checked us in could not have been more helpful. Without even being asked he pulled out a map and proceeded  to give us directions on the best places to go, his enthusiasm was contagious. I’m just sorry I forgot his name. The room was great so different from anywhere else we’d stayed with an amazing view and a great location right next to The Chelsea markets and close to so many restaurants and shops. Would definitely stay here again

title: Not for me
text: I'm sure this place is fine for many, especially the hip crowd. I've started there several times, but I think I'm done with the place. The rooms are not laid out well and feel cramped. I did enjoy the small balcony I had in the last room I was in. I did NOT enjoy the small of cigarette smoke that permeated the bathroom in the room each day I was there. Staff said they'd look into it but nothing changed. Also, I absolutely hate the lighting controls in the rooms.

title: Wedding
text: Beautiful modern fun accommodations. Alll the staff were fabulous and very attentive to our needs. Enjoyed the gorgeous city skyline at the PHD lounge for wedding reception. The place was a blast!  Our Room was quite and bed was comfortable. Wish we could have stayed another day. On the way out one of the staff gave us an excellent recommendation for breakfast. I had to hug him when I got back. It was that good. We would definitely visit again. Thanks

title: Excellent service all around!
text:
Ok so this is my very first review. I just had to make mention of the complete front desk staff Nicole, Jane, Tenzin and the other guys at night who helped me make sure all my guests were good to go. Then there was Joe the Concierge, Alanna, Danielle, Delores, Cassandra, Lauren and Michelle. I couldn’t have had a better experience with any of them. They kept up with me and helped me every step of my couple days. Thank you!!! 
The Cafe staff working for Juliana made my day easier!! Thank you! 
A very special shout out to one guy..... Keenan Davis. Every request I had he did with a smile and showed me complete attention. He was the best!! We need more people like this in the hotel industry!  
Overall- my guests were happy... my job was easier because of the awesome staff and their attentiveness! 
I would highly recommend this hotel for events! 

I am looking forward to another one there!!!!

Thank you for everything!!

title: Great Stay!
text: Had a wonderful time at the property. Thee bell staff were very friendly, especially Keenan. He was very kind and helpful throughout my stay. Overall it was a great stay and I look forward to coming back.

title: Best service
text: John Tadras was so helpful! We got to NYC 6am and he was so nice over the phone that we decided to stay at the Dream Downtown. He went the extra mile to get us a really nice room!The dream is very lively and has amazing energy!

title: AmaZing service
text: My boyfriend and I came for the holidays and had the best time. Joesph in concierge helped with everything and even helped when I had a package arrive. Thanks to him everything went smoothly! Couldn’t recommend more:)

title: Superb service during and after your stay!
text: I have now stayed at this hotel twice and will keep going back. Besides the 'coolness' factor, the staff are amazingly friendly and helpful. I recently forgot a signed copy of book that means a lot to me in my room. The super helpful concierge Joseph Sabatelli, who arranged for me to be reunited with my prized book across the oceans. The stuff that Dreams are made of.

title: Best experience ever!!!
text: Surprise my girlfriend with a weekend in the city. Staying at the dream downtown hotel was the best decision because we were close to hot and juicy crawfish restaurant which is her favorite spot to go. The dream hotel experience was amazing, we were accommodated by the bell captain Keenan Davis, he made the experience much more fun felt like we were in our own home. He was very helpful and knew the area very well.

title: Great Service and Location !
text: Stayed at The Dream for a quick weekend with my lady and the hotel was very chic and staff was super friendly. Special thanks to the bell captain Keenan Davis who took great care of us from the moment we stepped into the hotel. Will definitely be back !

title: Dream Stay
text: I stayed at the Dream Downtown while visiting NYC on a business trip. I had a great time at the bar and my room was beautiful. The staff were efficient and helpful. Keenan Davis, the bell captain, was particularly professional, friendly and accommodating. He answered all of my questions with a smile. I would certainly stay here again.

title: Post new years family escape
text: Great hotel and very accommodating.  Excellent staff and helpful.had a wonderful time at the bar and resturant in-house. Recommend a getaway for anyone. I booked it through the hotel and got a great rate.

title: Dream downtown
text: My boyfriend and I have visited dream downtown a hand full of times, and each stay have been absolutely amazing. Food is great, rooms are beautiful and service was very effencient and reliable. I would also like to thank Tenzin whom has been very helpful during our stay. We are definitely looking forward to our next visit!

title: Professional and friendly
text: I've been visiting Dream downtown alone twice and except from the cool rooms and a great rooftop I must say the service is AMAZING. There's an awesome guy called Joseph. He's at the service desk and he helped out with museums, restaurants, clubs, where I could get my watch fixed and best shopping around. Girls in the check-in is so sweet and the people recognized me a year later. Best staff ever at this hotel. Very friendly and serviceminded. Quick and helpful.

title: Party hardy here!
text: This hotel is amazing for a partying New York experience. "take the elevators after the DJ booth" is not what you typically get advised when you check into a hotel. On the downside, there was a constant beat of the bass until the wee hours. It's fun when you're in it, less when trying to sleep! The concierge, Joseph, was incredibly helpful and booked us several events whilst we were there - really recommend him! Thanks Dream for a party experience.

title: Alt for dyrt og alt for meget støj
text:
Jeg boede 3 nætter på dette hotel fra d. 9. - 12. januar 2019 og har været meget utilfreds med stedet. Der er utroligt lydt på hotellet - man kan høre alt, hvad der sker på gangen - døgnet rundt. Smækken med døre, snak og råben på gangen og lyden fra natklubben. Receptionspersonalet var ikke specielt informative og virkede ligeglade med andre end dem selv. Morgenmaden skulle købes, og det var virkelig dyrt, men ok.
Mit værelseskort virkede ikke til elevatoren, så jeg var spæret inde i elevatoren i lang tid, selvom jeg trykkede på både reception, hjælp-knap, eller call knappen.. Der var ingen response fra receptionen. Først da en anden gæst fik elevatoren ned, kom jeg ud.
Jeg kan ikke anbefale stedet, og jeg kommer ikke igen.

title: More than simply hip
text: It would be far too easy to write the DREAM DOWNTOWN off as merely hip. This would be an oversight. What makes a stay at the DREAM so appealing is attention to detail, brilliant design and quality of service. Gleaming elevators, scrupulously kept common areas and of course rooms that both comfort and demand attention. "I want those shower curtains and tile at home. Why are my own windows not round?" The thoughtful lighting creates a soothing vibe, but the switches are tricky to control, but I do not care because the net effect is, well, hip. And those hip people in the lobby? Yeah, that’s you, hip and smart for staying at the DREAM.

title: This hotel is a party
text: The Dream Downtown was perfect for my friends and I in the middle of the Meatpacking District in NYC.  We came to hang out in this neighborhood, and the hotel was the perfect springboard into nightlife with the PHD rooftop nightclub in the hotel and a nice hotel lobby bar.  If you are looking for a quiet sanctuary to escape NYC, this is not the right hotel.  If you are looking to for a hotel lobby that screams nightlife, I highly recommend the Dream Downtown.

title: Loved it!
text: We came for a Broadway play and dinner..location excellent to subway.So easy to go uptown and back. Tenzin and Lauren at desk were so nice and personable.  Will tell friends and family and will definitely return.

title: Think twice
text: The hotel itself is great. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the location is perfect BUT..... if you plan on sleeping do Not stay here! We stayed for 3 nights and were kept up by the night club noise all night!! Not only do you have nightclub noise but you have drunk people partying in the hall through 4am. If you plan on partying and staying up all night, good choice. If you plan on needing any sleep, don’t stay there!

title: Unfortunate stay.
text: We booked this hotel on Hotel Tonight more than an hour before arrival.  We were told at the front desk they didn’t have our reservation despite showing our receipt. Without apology, we were told to have a seat.  We had to approach the reception desk four times before they gave us our room.  The location of the hotel is excellent and the rooms are clean, modern and quiet.  Unfortunately the less than acceptable reception will prevent us from returning.  There are many other great hotels with a professional front desk in NYC. Go elsewhere.

title: Amazing!
text:
Was my second time in this hotel. Perfect stay during one week. 

The Meatpacking district is really great and only 15 minutes from the biggest places of Manhattan. 
Daniel Perez at the reception desk is nice and helpfull 👍🏻

Enjoy this hotel!

title: ASK FOR  Joseph Sabatelli !!!
text: I go to NYC probably a few times every few months. I always stay at Arlo Nomad, but decided to branch out and stay here for my 25th birthday. IT WAS AMAZING!!! Joseph and Chris took care of everything before I arrived. I got the pool terrace room and I will be back this Summer! They put flowers saying "happy bday tara" on the bed which was an amazing touch. I read reviews about the lobby and rooms being too loud - they were exaggerating...it was not that bad. Also, there is a great coffee machine in the room - so not sure why people complained about that either. The staff is AMAZING, like I said Joseph & Chris are AMAZING - 5 star! I will be back soon :)

title: Very noisy
text:
I visitied NYC from december 30th to January 3rd.. Nice hotel, nice rooms but our room (#204) is located just over the hotel nightclub... If you are thinking of going to bed before 3AM, forget about it.... You can clearly hear and feel the music and there are a lot of people walking/talking/partying around this area of the hotel. 

On the last night, our neighbours decided to finish the party in their room... woke us up around 4am.. people were obviously drunk and having fun... which is fine but after 3 nights of very bad sleep, this was just too much for us...  We called security twice and ended up leaving the hotel at 5:30AM...

So if you are looking for a place to party, this is perfect... if you wish to rest at night, avoid this place or at least the area around room 204... We all are very tired following our escapade to NYC...without attending parties ourselves...

title: A Dream-Team!
text: Warmly welcomed by the staff from the moment of check-in and throughout our entire 5 day stay!  The holiday season in NYC can often overwhelm even the most polished hotel staff – but that was hardly the case at The Dream Downtown- the entire staff- from management, to front desk, to bellmen, to housekeeping was extremely friendly, responsive and genuine.  Several custom requests were also expeditiously accommodated.  The atmosphere really felt like a home away-from-home by the end of our stay. A true example of excellent hospitality!

title: Amazing Staff, Excellent Hotel, Outstanding Location
text:
The Dream Downtown was precisely that. The staff is exceptionally attentive and helpful (Lauren at the front desk is wonderful and there were several of the housekeeping staff who went out of their way to help but I didn't catch their names), the hotel itself is great from top to bottom.. comfortable beds, AMAZING water pressure in the shower (it's the little things haha), and a great seating area in our room for unwinding a bit between adventures in the city (I know they have several different room types though so make sure that's in the room description when you book!)

The location is really outstanding. We were 15-20 minutes via walking or subway from everything we wanted to do. The High Line (walk), Central Park (subway), Empire State (subway), Terra Blues (subway), The Rubin Museum (walk), The Met (subway), David Geffen Hall (subway), and paralyzing amounts of delicious food (walking or subway).  Important note: the subway entrance is a very short walk (less than a full block) from the front door of the hotel, so getting around either on foot or via subway is really easy.

The cafe attached to the hotel is great for breakfast (healthy but very tasty, convenient, and doesn't cost $4,000 for a latte).

Will definitely be back for another round of Dream(ing) Downtown!

title: Disappointing
text:
Whilst a perfect location and Jane the manager was great! I have to agree with many of the comments on here, the noise was excessive and is definitely a "party hotel" !
We were unable to sleep for the 3 nights staying due to noise from various locations in the hotel. We were told on arrival that we had to pay $150 per night in advance for charges and were charged full amount upfront unlike other hotels where you pay on departure! so $450 of our "spending" money "held by the hotel" which we were also told could not be released and put on another card as it would take 2-3 business days to hit our account, then on departure it was instantly refunded! so basically a lie! 
There were not sufficient towels, robes or pillows in our room either, it is not a cheap hotel and we expected a much more positive experience......very disappointing!

title: Not for relax
text:
The hotel is very beautiful and famous for the roof top club 
Rooms comfortable, amazing lobby with the    pool as ceiling
The pool is open to the public and not only for the guests of the hotels, this means that if you want to have a chair on the edge of the pool you have to book in advance
The pool is always crowded 
Persons at the desk not polite, it looks do not be comfortable with the clients

title: Truly a Dream
text: As a first timer in New York wasn’t sure what exactly to expect, but our stay at the hotel was was everything and more.  The staff always so polite and willing to help. Daniel Perez at the front desk was the best. He took the time to give us his best recommendations of places to see. And he did not disappoint. He was such a delight. 10/10 would definitely recommend.

title: The Real NYC Experience
text: This hotel is definitely geared towards a younger crowd on the weekends offering a rooftop nightclub, PHD lounge. Walking into the hotel we were greeted by a friendly concierge and a small cafe to the right. Ended up grabbing coffee and fresh pressed juice here in the morning and was absolutely worth it. Walking back to the elevators after checking in we saw giant hanging place and large spectacular circular windows facing the outdoor pool. *This is a must if you come here in the summer - rent a chair, it's worth it. Awesome Koi fish painted on the walls and limited availability. Like many NYC hotels you get what you pay for with size of the rooms. I have stayed in three sizes and the cheapest rooms aren't at all bad, you can definitely walk around. The circular windows facing the pool  open and the decor is very modern/chic. PHD is a blast on a Friday/Saturday, be prepared to spend. At times they require 100-150$USD hold on a credit card for alcohol purchases to gain entry. The entire night club overlooks Manhattan and the drinks are top notch. If you are looking for a great night out, a beautifully designed room, an awesome pool, and cafe for brunch in the morning you literally get that all in one place. Never have to take an Uber or leave which made the $ worth it! This Dream is a bit classier than the Dream in Midtown, perfect for a night out, couples weekend,or first time visiting Manhattan!

title: Great Concierge!
text: I stayed at Dream only to realize I left a shirt in my room.  Upon calling nearly a month later Joe Sabatelli quickly located and offered to ship my shirt.  He was both polite and responsive.  I felt that the rest of the staff was equally as accommodative throughout my stay.

title: Dream location. Dream hotel. Dream experience.
text: Words cannot express how grateful I am for the experience I had at Dream this past weekend. From check in to check out, your team members were extremely attentive and helpful. The king suite room was beautiful and spacious. The specialty drinks at the lobby bar were delicious. The hotel lobby was bustling with both hotel guests and visitors to the hotel’s club, HQ.  Ray Wong and his team provided me with exceptional attention and service. Thank you for the personal attention. I look forward to my next biannual visit, which will be in the summer, when I can relax at your beautiful pool.

title: Not a Dream
text: As a semi-seasoned traveler, this hotel goes down as the absolute worst hospitality experience I’ve had (even lower than a hotel in London that smelt like a giant cheeseburger) I can only equate my entrance to that of a frat party, with the lobby reeking of marijuana and drouths of people overtaking the bar. I was willing to let that go given the fact this was rated a 4 star hotel and I was assuming the rooms would overcompensate. I was sorely mistaken, each full bed only has two pillows. I called down to request more pillows, come to find that the hotel was out of pillows, I repeat, a hotel, where you pay to sleep, was OUT OF PILLOWS. I can assure you the walls are so thin, we were able to hear our neighbors bumping their music for the entire night despite several calls and complaints to management, including an in person visit to the front desk in my jammies. This was followed up by management with the offer of EAR PLUGS so we could get some sleep. The icing was the fire alarm going off at 1:45 AM, followed by a fight in our hallway at 2:45 AM. To top it off, they have charged us $1,100.00 for two rooms for one night. Needless to say, no member of our family will ever frequent a Dream hotel again. I would highly encourage you and your family to visit one of the many other hotels in the city unless you’re looking to sleep amongst a dance party.

title: Truly was a dream!
text:
Everything from check in to check out was perfect.  Brettt and all the other front desk staff I worked with were knowledgeable and friendly.  Room was attractive and very functional.  Bed was super comfy! 

Lobby area is great for cocktails, snacks, and relaxing. 

They have their priorities straight. By that I mean that room service coffee in the morning arrives in minutes and they don’t charge through the roof for it :) And it’s delicious!

This was my first time staying here. Booked based on my sister’s recommendation since she had stayed there before. She was right!  She was there at the same time and had an equally pleasant experience. 

One caveat:  The lighting system in the rooms is pretty high-tech. Make sure you don’t accidentally turn on the red “do not disturb” button.  When I realized what I had done, they serviced my room while I was at dinner and they could not have been more gracious about it. 

Will definitely return.

title: Best Concierge in NY hands down
text: Joseph and Christopher remain the reason why I stay at the Dream Downtown. They truly have charm and personality that is one of a kind - they make you feel very welcome with open arms and take care of anything you ask. Thank the both of you once again!

title: FIRST CLASS ALL AROUND
text: We booked two rooms and our entire experience was first class. Not only the property is great and conveniently located, but what sets this apart if the friendliness and kindness of the entire door and front desk stuff which set the tone of our great stay. Checking in was easy, the gentleman who took care of it all was as good as any front desk member I have come across. There are a lot of hotels in NYC, but in terms of location, service, personnel, this is probably as good as it gets. Go right ahead and book your room NOW  You will not be disappointed.

title: The perfect stay❤️
text: Dream Downtown gave us the best 4 Night stay in NYC. We stayed in the the platinum king with great views over the city and enjoyed every minute. The location couldn’t be better - Chelsea Market just across the street and the area offers some of the best restaurants and shops, all with a cool urban vibe! The hotel is lively and welcoming with music and a bar in the lobby, but the best of all is the really high level of service and professionalism that meets you, whether you is greeted by the doorman, the front officer or the concierge team - thank you so much Tenzin, Christopher, Joseph and all others that really made an effort making our stay fantastic.

title: Don’t waste your time
text: We recently were supposed to spend a weekend at the Dream.  Upon getting there on a Thursday night, there were parties booked at all the bars until 10:30 so unavailable to their guests.  Once entering our rooms, you quickly discovered the walls were paper thin as you could hear everything your neighbors were talking about.  At 1:00 AM the hotels fire alarm system went off and was on for ten minutes.  After which some rooms down our hallway decided to have a party.  Security came up but were of little use.   Finally at 2:45 AM, there was a hallway fight outside our room.  We checked out the next morning but were still charged the full scale    I won’t be back nor recommend the Dream it was truly a nightmare!

title: Only for the Young!
text: This hotel should be solely marketed to young people because it's perfect for that. A DJ plays in the lobby at night, a basement bar will allow in only who the doorman approves of, music can be hear in the guestroom (on the 10th floor) at 2.30am, etc. There are many reasons to be young and stay here. That's not saying anything bad, just being honest.

title: halloween in new york
text: the hotel is super nice, very trendy.  Best location ever in New York.The rooms are very comfortable very clean. Christopher Scali, the concierge was very welcoming very friendly and helpful like usual. He really helped me for restaurants bookings and advising places to visit during my stay. He helped me arranged my transportations and many other things. Christopher went the extra mile at a time when it was really hard to get a booking at a famous restaurant for halloween. I enjoyed the stay mostly because of the service provided by your concierge Christopher. Anyone staying at theDream Hotel Dowtown, ask for Christopher. He is the man.

title: Great service
text: Tenzin along with the front room staff was polite, helpful and also prompt in getting me checked into my room. I love the atmosphere from the lobby, the rooms, to PhD upstairs. I will be returning. Thank you all so much.

title: Girls Trip
text:
I took my daughter to NYC for a few days and for the first time decided not to stay midtown.  I really liked this area. Great restaurants, walk to the high line. Easier access to SOHO and Midtown.  I found the staff quite helpful.  Was a bit disappointed when they me that they would call when our room was ready, only to find out that they had written my number down wrong.
The Dream has a cool vibe.  I think it would be a lot of fun in the summer with the outdoor pool area.  The room was actually quite spacious for NY.  However, I found there was not enough light in the main area.  Not even bedside lights!!  Lighting in the bathroom was adequate.  The bathroom is walled in by frosted glass, so if someone is up in the middle of the night, the light will shine through.. We didn’t have a chance to eat at the hotel. There are great breakfast places nearby and of course a Starbucks if that’s what you need.  The rooftop club was closed for a private function the one time we would have had to go check it out, so can’t comment on that.  Bed was comfortable and the room was pretty quiet as well.  Never waited long for an elevator.  Overall, it was a good stay.  My daughter enjoyed it too!

title: Weekend in New York
text: It was a disappointing start to our stay at Dream Hotel. We arrived tired from London around 11pm Thursday night and walked into a nightclub experience in the lobby. Unfortunately the young man behind the desk was very blasé and not at all welcoming. The room was small but modern and clean with a great view. The next morning I expressed my disappointment about the service we received to Nicole at the front desk. When we returned to our room that evening, lovely Nicole had organised a bottle of Prosecco on ice with a hand written note congratulating us on our 10th anniversary. She is the reason this review gets 4 stars instead of 3. I would recommend Dream Downtown for the great location. We probably would stay again for that reason. I believe if you do not have the desire to make people feel special, you shouldn’t be in the service industry.

title: Amazing Experience ONLY place to stay in NYC
text: Within the span of 2 months (October & November 2018) I stayed at Dream Downtown twice. From now on, it is the ONLY place I will stay when visiting NYC. The room pictures exactly represent the state of the rooms now, the location is amazing, and the staff is one of a kind! Keenan, who works at the hotel was so patient and great at taking our bags and recommending some awesome places to visit besides the basic sight seeing “tourist” spots. I’m looking to go back in January and there’s is no doubt I will be staying at Dream Downton again :)

title: Great hotel
text: Arrived on thanksgiving check in was very quick staff were so friendly and made us feel welcome. Stayed in room 332 it was basic but has everything you need , bed was extremely comfortable the only thing I could fault was the lighting which was very dim. Loved the cafe in the lobby for breakfast. Visited the roof top bar for a drink which has absolutely stunning views. The hotel is in an ideal location Chelsea market is just round the corner. I would most definitely stay here again :)

title: Great family holiday in New York
text:
Just back from a fantastic holiday celebrating anniversary/milestone birthday with wife and kids.

We stayed 5 nights at Dream Downtown and have to say with the exception of a little misunderstanding on my bill, that was quickly rectified, (Thanks Jane) it was an absolute. pleasure from start to finish.  

The location of this hotel is brilliant for all of the tourist locations.  You walk 2 minutes down the block and you are right at the subway and access to anywhere NYC/NJ.  You turn the other way and you are on the Highline or in Chelsea market with loads of little shops and food places.

The rooms were spacious in comparison to some of the rooms I have stayed in previously in NYC.  Great view of upper Manhattan from the funky windows!!!

We didn't get to use the pool bar because we had a 16 year old with us but the regular bar was extremely cool and trendy for my age group!!!  

An added bonus was eating in Bodega Negra.  The food was fantastic and there was the added bonus of a discount offer.  Staff are friendly, but not in your face.  I like that.

Read some of the comments around noise.  We were on the 4th floor and there were no noise issues.

All in all, a brilliant stay and look forward to taking another trip to NYC and staying in Dream Downtown.

title: Total ripoff, poor customer service
text:
I got here late after a red eye flight and a full day of work. The room cost about $500 for a night.

There is exposed dust from the ceiling (see pictures). The heating fan is very noisy. I asked the receptionist to ask to have a look multiple times and nobody came. The manager on duty was supposed to come and then call me but I had to go multiple times to the reception to finally have her explain that “she is sorry, the hotel is full and cannot do anything”. Also as there is a constant party in the lobby with dj playing, talking to the staff is difficult (but they didn’t seem to take listening to their customers after all)

I pointed out the bad reviews on websites like yelp and the manager told me such reviews “are not important” and “does not count” (why I’m posting here my review in addition to yelp and google)

On top of that you can hear the music from downstairs (bar with dj).

There is no coffee maker in the room.

And the size of the fitness room is ridiculous with 2 elliptical, 2 treadmills and a bike. 

And the card in the elevator can take 10 times to swipe before you can go anywhere, allowing you nice rides to the roof and the basement before you can go to your floor.

For $500 a night you expect: (1) another quality of service and (2) real customer service. You get none of that.

I had a two days reservation and I cancelled. That time I carefully read reviews on yelp to pick my next hotel ... hope you follow the same advice!

title: Great hospitality and service
text: Had an amazing 2 day stay at hotel. Great rooms, food and service. Big thanks to Lauren for helping with early Check-in and making sure that the stay was fantastic. Nice clean washrooms, great amenities to make your stay worthwhile.

title: Loved this place!
text: My daughter and I stayed at the dream over thanksgiving weekend and I can’t say enough about it. The hotel is very cool. The decor is edgy and fun but functional and attractive at the same time. The beds are some of the most comfortable I’ve ever slept on. I love the layout of the room which I found to be spacious relative to average NYC hotel rooms. We stayed in a double ($500/ night). We had drinks in the lobby in the afternoon and Again when we got back to the hotel after a late dinner. Everyone we encountered was helpful and pleasant. The light switch arrangement was strange but that is my only complaint. Love this place.

title: Huge Disappointment
text: Stayed at the Dream Downtown over Thanksgiving and it was very disappointing for such a hotel at the price point that they charge. The security system for the elevator and the room entry did not work and we had to replace our card 3 times. One of the nights our room was not made up. The lobby turns into a very loud disco around 9 o'clock and quickly fills up with lots of drunk millennials. The room was very small and the lighting system was a hassle to operate. Not much to recommend as there are much better accommodations in Manhattan.

title: Truly a Dream
text: The stay was exceptional, everything from the service to the prime location. You have everything you need without ever having to leave the property, and if you do leave there are prime NYC attractions in walking distance. The food both in the Mexican restaurant and the cafe are exceptional and a great way to start the day before heading out. There is attractive nightlife right in the lobby and two different connected club venues. It's a vacation within the building. This has just become my go to spot to drop anchor whenever coming to NYC!

title: Lost and Found
text: As we all know, sometimes items get left behind when you stay at a hotel. Cannot express how professional and helpful Chris Scali was to ensure my items were not only located but shipped to me as well

title: Boa escolha
text:
O hotel é badalado e movimentado! Tem um rooftop animado, bar e boate. 

Os quartos normais são pequenos. Escolhemos um quarto com varanda que tinha um tamanho bom! Vale a pena pagar um pouco a mais por esse quarto!

title: Wow, the Dream Downtown continues to raise the bar!
text:
I stay at the Dream all the time and one could expect routine to set in, rooms to get tired or maybe service to degrade but not at the Dream Downtown.  The property is in great shape and shows signs of actually being upgraded recently.  The staff continues to exceed expectations and are just downright super friendly.  From check-in to the bar to the recently relaunch Natura, everyone greets you with a smile and is super nice.  Room 901 is now my favorite room.  Not only is it larger than most but it is a corner room and has a bunch of really cool, large windows that look North over Manhattan.  Oh, and it also has a full size couch which is nice.

So there you have it, the Dream continues to be a Dream.

title: good staff but the best concierge - Christopher Scali
text:
The location was great, it was a mild atmosphere with a good balance, not too loud and busy but not quite or boring
The concierge Christopher Scali would have to be this hotels best asset as he took time out to go above and beyond his duty. He always had a big smile on his face and was more than happy to assist with any enquiries or help required

title: Thanks Christopher
text:
I have stayed at Dream over 40 times in the last 7 years.
That I return - is clearly the best form of geniun appreciation.

There are plenty of situations arise where I need help from the concierge. 
Over the years I have come to know Christopher Scali, their experienced and competent concierge.
He is exceptionally solution-oriented. 
There are few who can arrange a table at a good restaurant on the toughest day of the year "New Year's Eve" You made it!
You took a fight with DHL, when my shipment was mysteriously lost, and yes, you even find parts for my car at home in Sweden. It says a lot about your variation and the confidence I have for Christopher.

title: Best Concierge Service in NYC!
text: I wanted to do something special for my best friends birthday at the Dream Hotel because I wasn't able to make the trip... Joseph Sabatelli with the Dream Hotel concierge was beyond helpful. Not only was he extremely quick with his responses, but he made the process incredibly easy. He presented my options to me that ranged from flower arrangements to a ballon filled room. I went with the balloons and let me just say, my best friend was in love with the surprise. Overall great experience dealing with the concierge at the Dream Hotel.

title: Trendy but lacking for the price.
text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel a couple of times now for work predominantly because it’s walking distance to the office. It’s a trendy hotel with a DJ in the lobby who blasts music - that’s fine and doesn’t bother me too much. The problem is at 2am when you can still hear pumping music from your room - bring ear plugs if you’re going to stay here. 

The design of the room is not to my taste but it’s comfortable and warm, the lighting system is super irritating, you shouldn’t have to decipher how to turn the lights on and off because the architect wanted to be fancy (I work in design and this element is completely unnecessary) and there is no bedside lamp so it’s either full brightness or nothing (maybe I’m wrong but the lighting is so hard to adjust and it’s a running joke with all my colleagues who only use this hotel because of its proximity to the office) and when will hoteliers learn that no one wants to dry their hair in the bathroom in the humidity after a shower? Please provide power outlets in the bedroom near a mirror where we can sit and get ready - it’s not a lot to ask but so irritating.

When you’re paying $500+ I also expect some complimentary water in the room, coffee making facilities and a robe - come on guys the lack of these items just seems miserly! I give 2 stars because the staff are friendly and the bed comfortable but I’ll be looking for an alternative option next time. Not for me, sorry.

title: Amazing service staff!
text:
The service was amazing, from the front desk with Lauren and Damisha to the staff that took care of laundry. Amazing service.

The decor of the hotel was stylish and very appealing. 

The only 2 small downsides is that the elevator buttons seem to be finicky, and for light sleepers, the club at the top might keep you up at night.

title: Best Concierge in NYC
text: Love coming to the Dream and the meatpacking district. Hotel is so close to everything. The Concierge Christopher really made my trip. Thank you for hooking us up everywhere, you really are the man and the reason why we will come back.

title: Weekend at the Dream
text: Great weekend getaway in the Meatpacking District. Concierge, Chris Scali, was awesome at securing some decent dinner reservations and the whole staff was great.  Great hotel in the best neighborhood in the city.

title: Chris- concierge
text: Thank you Chris for your help as usual ! Needed dinner, impossible to get a table, he got me one. Arranged me theatres tickets and club table. Anything you need in nyc he gets it done like a pro, you the best!!!

title: You won’t access to anything
text: The property advertises great amenities but don’t pretty much access to much. The PHD bar and The Electric Room accessnis at discretion of some dude at the door. False advertising. Stay somewhere more civilized. Bad karma

title: Very trendy hotel but rooms are small
text:
The room and hotel is super trendy.  The bathroom in the room is a frosted glass cube.  That means the lights and sounds are heard/seen in the bedroom so there is 0 privacy.  The room has the best stocked mini bar I have every seen but there is no coffee maker in the room... That was a huge minus for me.  
The room is super small.  There is only room to walk around the bed.  
The bedding was terrible, it was a flat sheet that came loose everynight leaving you sleeping on the bare mattress.  
We had a pool view and our friends had street view.  They said they could hear traffic all night.  
The lights in the room are on dimmer switches and were difficult to work.  
There was a younger party crowd in the hotel.   
The hotel was ok, I would not spend the money to stay there again. We paid 500 a night.

title: Stop. Just don't.
text: The Dream is a Nightmare.  Unless you’re a 20-something scantily clad club hopping Kardashian wannabe, you will hate it here.  (Actually, you will hate this whole block.) The Dream has zero interest in actually being a hotel.  It is a nightclub, or several nightclubs, plain and simple.  It’s like the rooms and actual hotel guests are an afterthought.  Upside: the bed is super comfy. Downside: it doesn’t matter because if you’re here on a weekend you will get zero sleep until at least 3:30 AM, due to the thumping and shrieking coming from every which way, from the clubs and from drunk idiots roaming the halls after hours.  AND, you will have to fight rude obnoxious club goers (and doormen) to get in the door TO YOUR HOTEL.  Where you are STAYING.  And forget the elevator situation, also shared with club hoppers.  Don’t think you’ll be able to grab a drink at the lobby bar, unless it’s Monday…the lobby’s a club too.  Even small annoying details of this hotel are made more glaring in the face of the club situation: like, if you have a coffeemaker you will not get coffee replenished, ever. If you take a water from the minibar, it will never get replenished, ever.  You will get lots of towels at first, but as the days go on, sometimes you’ll get all of them, sometimes you won’t.  There is zero closet space, but LOTS of mirrors.  Wow, waaaay too many mirrors.  In a creepy way.  I’m just sayin’….if you aren’t staying at this hotel as a crash pad for the clubs, don’t bother.  (I will say, that when there is more than one person at the front desk, I did receive decent service from 2 of the gals there who helped me with a room move from the hellish Silver to an almost acceptable Platinum, which still doesn’t solve the hotel’s main problem…but they did their best.)

title: Great hotel
text: This is such a great hotel to visit when in the Chelsea / Meatpacking area   You’re right across from Chelsea Markets and a few blocks from great restaurants and the High Line    You also get access to PhD rooftop bar which is worth the stay alone   Great staff here as well   I’ve been here 4x already and look forward to my next stay

title: concierge service spot on!
text: Dream Downtown is always a great stay in NYC , and Chris Scali is hands down the best dot connecter for premium Concierge service! Every recommendation and reservation was spot on and treated A list upon his referral.

title: One of my favorite Weekend Getaways!!
text: “The Dream Downtown is fantastic and so is the Concierge service! Thank you so much Chris for the hospitality! Very knowledgeable Concierge, five stars!” I always stay At Dream Downtown when I am doing my NYC weekend getaways. Great rooms. Conveniently located and everything from my car, my bags and my excursions get taken care of by the best concierge. I can just enjoy my time and not worry about a thing.

title: Great place!!
text: We stayed at the Dream for 8 nights, it was a great experience. Cool people, great service, good food. Chris, the lead concierge, helped out in every way possible. I would stay here again any time. Thank you.

title: Better as a Hip Place than as a Hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed here in late October for four nights. It should have been a wonderful trip. He works for Google, which is across the street, and he learned he got a promotion while we were there. We should have had a wonderful celebration and a great time. Instead, we were exhausted and stressed the entire trip because of this hotel.

There was jack hammering outside our window well past midnight, and after two nights of this, we insisted on a room change. We were exhausted, and in the rush of changing rooms, my husband left his wallet behind. He went back to the original room around 8 a.m., and the wallet was gone. One week later, and no one at the hotel has made any move to address this with us.

When I checked out, I told them I was extremely disappointed that they didn't tell us about the jack hammering when we checked in and provided us immediately with the option to switch rooms. The millennials at the counter kept telling me it wasn't their fault, that it was the city's fault, and I kept trying to explain that I understood that, but it was still their responsibility to take care of their guests. Apparently, they half heard me, because when I came back for my suitcase, I heard them tell someone checking in about the noise, and that if he wanted to avoid it, he would HAVE TO PAY FOR AN UPGRADE.

There are no words for how awful that is. That is not customer service: that is extortion.

This hotel is great if you want to see and be seen. It was clearly very hip. However, if you are a grown up with business to attend to, and if you expect your $500 per night should include genuine customer service (and no theft), this is not the place for you.

title: Amazing
text:
What a great experience. We got there a little early... it was nice and quiet, they took us immediately, had a room ready, checked us in, sent up the coffee maker with No problems!!!
The staff was amazing, the cafe was perfect ... the room was perfect! Clean, perfectly decorated etc 
My only complaint was the bed... it was more like a futon ...really uncomfortable ...
I feel bad even saying that as the rest of our stay was spot on! 
Please invest in better beds and I’ll be back!!!! 
Loved our stay.

title: Top Notch
text: Probably the comfiest bed and pillows I've ever slept on. Great room service menu with good prices, especially the all night menu. The cafe downstairs is great for breakfast and lunch, dinner you can hit Tao that's in the same building.

title: Mr
text: This is the best hotel In Nyc.  Excellent service.  And close to everything.  Rooftop is amazing.  Food is great.   And all the staff and Sequirity are very helpful. Definitely would recommend this to my friends and family

title: Great stay at the dream downtown
text: We stayed at the dream downtown this weekend for the second time this year and had a really great stay.  The room was comfortable and had great view of the NY skyline.  We had dinner at Bodega Negra with amazing margarita selections.    Jane (the general manager) went above and beyond for us since it was our anniversary.  You cant beat this location if you want to be in the center of NY nightlife & shopping.  Thank you we hope to be back soon :-)

title: The Dream Guest House is Amazing!
text: We have stayed in many of The Dream Rooms, as The Dream is a Hot Spot to be, and Great Location! This year we rented then Guest House to host a Halloween Party. Jane the Director of Rooms started communicating with us and assisted each and every guest we invited with additional rooms in the hotel. Upon arrival we were not only greeted by the Concierge Chris who offered to line up anything we need, but also by Jane!  The room was just beautiful, and the few items that needed to be addressed the Maintenance crew came right away and addressed, and even added heat lamps to the outside balcony for us! The Dream is a lively, colorful place, and we recommend it for your next visit to NYC!

title: 20 days there - it was great. Dog friendly!
text: Dream Downtown was amazing, never a disappointment. Special shoutout to two staff members, Ray the Director of Front Office and Christopher the concierge. They really went above and beyond to make my stay extra special. I was in a pinch one day stuck at work and needed my dog walked. Christopher the Concierge was to the rescue! That is what I call above and beyond service. Thank you again guys and will most certainly be back.

title: 5 Star Overall Experience in the heart of the Meatpacking District!
text: What an experience! This is definitely the place to stay if you’re visiting New York whether for business or pleasure. I was in New York for 2 weeks for a business trip and decided to spend the weekend in the city. The hype surrounding this establishment is real. From the moment we checked in, to our departure, we were greeted by kind and professional staff who were always willing to offer their support. Rooms were immaculate, modern, and extremely clean. I met many hotel staff throughout my stay and all were an absolute pleasure to work with. I had the bronze king bed with a balcony as recommended, and I couldn’t have asked for a better overall experience. Nightlife on their PHD rooftop lounge will grant you with the most spectacular rooftop views of Manhattan along with a bustling scene of gorgeous women and great music. A special shoutout to Chris from the team who made sure I was taken care of throughout my entire stay. Will definitely be back!

title: Hotel Motto:   F' the Customer
text:
Used to stay here 5-8 times per year when visiting NYC but no more.  Finished. Why?

--WiFi painfully slow unless you upgrade
--To have fully operational Air-Con, you need to have a "VVIP" status.   Not making that up.
--Check in takes forever; way too few staff on duty.

Hotel charges rock star rates, but the service is better at an Embassy Suites.

title: This place is not for sleep or business
text: My company has a deal with this hotel due to their proximity to our office. However I can't think of a worse place to stay for business. Loud music from clubs shake the entire building until early morning hours. I can deal with NYC sirens, but the strong club base is harder to deal with when you have an important meeting next morning. Also I missed an early morning meeting because they forgot to honor their wake up call that they confirmed the night before. So don't count on that either. And no customer service or apologies either when I complain about that, so that was that. Frankly this hotel is more catering to people that want to party all night, have a hip place to crash at 4AM in the morning, and sadly at almost $500/night, there is not much for biz travelers to like here.

title: Another great stay at #dreamdowntown
text: I am frequent visitor to this hotel and had another great visit last week. Friendly staff, clean hip hotel, and great location whether you want nightlife or quiet time the Dream Downtown in the Meatpacking Dist is a great choice.

title: My fav thing in New York!
text: An incredible stay! The facility is very unique and artistic. You experience unique architectural features at every juncture, wether in the bathroom or the lobby. I am not one to spend so much money on hotel stays, but for the traveller who wants a splurge, use Hotel Tonight to find the best price. (I stalked this hotel for a week before booking on Hotel Tonight which always had the cheapest price. Downside is you must book same-day.) Next to Chelsea Market and The High Line walking park, you really can't miss staying here if you have the cash flow. And the customer service is impeccable.

title: Hip Hotel
text: My husband and I stayed there for the last leg of our NYC trip and it was very good. Location wise, you are literally a stone's throw away from the Chelsea Market and other great restaurants (Tao, La Sirena, Basille's Artichoke Pizza et al) and just at the back of Google's humongous office. The High Line is near too. Room is bigger than most NY hotels, with a partial view of the Manhattan skyline. Bathroom is very good with awesome amenities. The mini bar is well stacked, with some personal throw-ins that could be very useful to the youngins. All front desk associates as well as the bell hop and concierge were very helpful and pleasant. Would definitely stay again.

title: September 29--October 2, 2018 visit
text: I thoroughly enjoyed the concierge person, Christopher, and his service.  He was very considerate, cooperative,  and cordial with me.   The room was very clean, comfortable,  and cozy.  The housekeeping was proficient and prompt.   ---Lou

title: The best
text: We’ve stayed at Dream downtown several times and have loved it every time. Front desk staff  is excellent. . Great atmosphere. Been there every season. Great place to stay!  Love the lobby and roof bar. Lovely pool. Fun people watching. Rooms have “sound machine” built in   Very cool place

title: July 4th in NYC
text: I really liked this hotel even through my stay started off badly. When I at arrived 4:30 pm my room wasn't ready. I had to wait an hr. I left my bag with the receptionist. When I returned they couldn't find it. Eventually it turned up about 30 to 40 mins later. But this really put a sour taste in my mouth. The room was clean and well kept. There was a party on in the pool area, everyone looked like they were having a blast. The outdoor roof top bar was closed due to a party. $100 entrance fee. I declined. I did go up there later when the party finished. I loved it! I would recommend this hotel, but not if you’re traveling with kids.

title: Great location, small (NY-size) rooms
text:
Great location and service - very happy with the location, as it was close enough for a (long) walk to midtown, but still in an area with its own character. No need for breakfast as we could grab from Chelsea Market across the street and cosy up on the small balcony.
Upgraded to larger room as the standard was much too small for two people + luggage, and upgrade wasn't too expensive ($40/night). Recommend to go for the larger room if possible, especially if you're +1.
Downside: even in the larger room, the closets are absolutely tiny! Construction also meant a lot of traffic and reduced the amount of time we wanted to spend on the balcony.

title: Great location, service and vibes!
text: Hotel overall was clean & modern, had friendly staff and nice in-house options for drinks and food. I came for the pool, which was not heated sadly, but very relaxing, surrounded by greenery. I would have liked music or the bar service to have been open in daytime by pool so, be sure to check since that may be seasonal. Dream is situated in a great neighborhood for nyc nightlife!

title: Nightmare
text:
Worst hotel i have ever seen. 
Room smaller than a bathroom. Impossible to connect any wifi. Music playing lound. No service at all. Trying to call for assistance but no one answers ! 
Elevators not working (waiting all the time to access your room). 
Run away !

title: Felt like I spent 3 days in a Night Club
text:
We recently stayed 2 nights at this property, and I would never stay there again.  The room was adequate and a fairly good size for NYC.  BUT, that is where the good news stops.   There were no ice machines, but you could call room service for ice - -which of course, requires a tip.   There are no coffee machines, and the coffee in the lobby cafe is $4/cup.  (I saw on another review the management said coffee machines were available upon request - but who knew).   
There is an incredible amount of noise, and activity.  We were on the 3rd floor over the pool and loud, pounding music played all day Saturday.   Had to give up on a nap.  If you are looking for a party - -then I guess this is your place.  But be prepared to pay for every. little. thing.   Absolutely no amenities at all.

title: Ok
text: So if you are looking for a party hotel this is good.  There’s a rooftop club and a lot of people around at night.  The location is also better than midtown because you are close to high line and Chelsea market. Not a good place for families and the rooms are just ok but roomy for ny standards.  No privacy with the bathrooms.  If you are staying for the pool just know there are very limited amount of chairs that actually get sun.

title: Great Hotel Great Location
text: The staff were all really friendly. The restaurant inside the hotel was great. Additionally the bar on top of the hotel is a fun place to hang out. I would recommend this hotel especially if you plan on going out at night in the area! there are many fun restaurants and bars in the area as well.

title: Lots of Noise, Slow Lifts. inconsistant service, style over substance
text:
There is a Truck Depot opposite the Hotel, so the noise started at 3 am. There was also road works. 
I complained and eventually got moved, this took a long time and I had to keep chasing as they did not on any occasion keep their promise to call me back.

The elevators were very slow and seemed like some not working.

title: Don't stay here!
text:
Rude arrogant staff, don't have a clue on reception desk or care about guests. Everything is an effort look at you clueless. Need some customer service training! 

Paying alot of money and get treated badly.

Only good thing about the hotel was concierge team who managed to book places for our stay, everything else was too much effort. But then that's standard for a $400 a night hotel, "4* hotel" DEFINITELY NOT 4*

If your face fits and you know managers you may get some benefits. Unfortunately they didn't do much for us and we stayed here for our wedding. Big mistake! 

Couldnt access mini fridge, no room extras they bring around one small bottle of water for you at night and think there being generous, $40 for coffees on room service with all tips added.

4am music blasting, dirty hotel, drunks everywhere screaming girls and men. 

Think you would get into rooftop being hotel guest, nope que like everyone else and have the most arrogant door men. 

Badly run and organised hotel. 

Wish we never wasted our money so many other nice hotels about. Didn't make our day special at all! Don't stay here and make the same mistake as us!

title: Place is ok not worth the money
text: I got my wife and I a pool view room with a balcony. The balcony is basically a step outside a door. The lighting is bad, the bathroom will make you want to puke if you’ve been drinking because it’s all these dotted weird tiles. The tv is slow and the cool dimming lights get annoying by the third time you want to shut everything off and It takes 5 min. It took 5 calls and a front desk visit to get the mini fridge unlocked . But hey at least there is sex lube on the counter, just no coffee. Location is good, room is small but typical ny. Unless you are staying here to have fun after the clubs downstairs this is not a good hotel. Also, no real place to put luggage or a couple of bags. I have to stick the suitcases on the floor and step over them or on the two little chairs. If you bring anything more than a carryon don’t expect to be able to put it away. For me this isn’t quaint it’s stupid planning.

title: Great location, OK hotel
text:
I stayed at Dream Downtown for 2 nights in September. Location is right across from the Chelsea market which is adorable and there are many other great spots near by. 5th Ave is a quick walk from the hotel which was nice as well. 

The room - we had a double room which was a good size based on New York standards but there were a couple much needed updates needed (bathroom shower, hardware - furnishings all worn down - minor things like that). *Huge bummer when we didn't get our room cleaned after 3 calls to the front desk. 

The lobby was very modern and chic but SO busy and loud at night. There is a nightclub (phD) which brings in a lot of young people and causes quite the commotion in the lobby after 8pm.

Pool area was great - got to enjoy on a Monday so was not busy - other reviews mentions weekends being the opposite. 

Overall, the hotel is nice and the location almost made it worth it but based on price alone we were expecting more.

title: Weekend escape
text: Great location, chill hotel, friendly staff, rooms are ok, not spacious but clean. Roof top is nice for a drink. In room breakfast is my favorite, multiple choices for dinning and clubbing around, I would recommend Dream Downtown for quick weekend escape.

title: Highly misleading & trip tarnishing
text:
Stayed at the DD hotel for 3 nights before and after the 4th of July 2018. We were first greeted after a 14 hour flight by a queue to get in to the lobby which doubles as the entrance for a nightclub (not kidding). Lots of heavily done up young girls and men walking around, incredibly loud and intoxicated. The reception staff were nice however got a call from American Express shortly after checking in to confirm at charge of US$ 10,000 to my card from the hotel, no wonder the reception staff were so nice. 

Quickly rushed downstairs and informed them of their error (overcharging $7000 to my card) to which they didn’t initially oblige and after some debating finally agreed to pay the price that we booked at. F**king ridiculous. Further, the bond/incidentals charge is $2000 (they charged me twice - thanks) which is absolutely pathetic. 

Returned to the room - terrible water pressure, TV doesn’t work and there is a consistent barrage of noise coming from my neighbors, a girl celebrating her 21st. Little did I realise, this would set the tone for my entire stay - exhaustively, both metaphorically and literally. 

Next thing I became aware, the pool may as well not exist. Always INCREDIBLY crowded and somehow people manage to reserve the pool chairs even though there is a policy of no reservations - funny that. 

Fire alarm went off twice during my stay, once at midnight and another at 3am one morning. The lifts weren’t working for part of my stay and so the security guards were polite enough to inform me that the only remaining lift that works is for the night club - you’ll be taking the stairs pal. 

There was vomit in the hallway that had been half cleaned up for the duration of my stay. In fact, I believe that if I returned this instant that vomit would still be there. Potentially even more.
