In conclusion, the hotel is for partygoers and holds itself out as a trendy, chic and nice place to stay. This is completely misleading. Regret my stay and would advise others to consider other options, particularly if they want to sleep at all.

title: Cool, clean and youthful classines
text: Nice ,Very friendly Hotel at a great location Meatpacking and Chelsea . Small but smart Fancy rooms and we dont miss anything. The friendly lovely staff make us feel welcome. The location close to bars and restaurants  is worth the price.

title: Loud music until 4 AM
text: Building and rooms are nice. Unfortunately, it's impossible to sleep on the lower floors due to loud music in the building going late into the night. Was unable to find any workable solution with the staff.

title: Magic place, superb location
text:
I wanted to be in the Chelsea area! Bingo. Outside of hotel is discrete, they had road works in front. Walking to the reception was amazing! The whole atmosphere is magic, the rooms very bright and not huge but very well organized. 
Two minutes walk from Chelsea Market, 3 from trains to Midtown. A gem!

I will definitely recommend this hotel and go there again...

title: ottimo hotel in zona trendy
text: sono stato diverse volte in questo hotel in viaggio di lavoro. design moderno. camere piccole negli standard della città. alla sera molto spesso si svolgono feste e quindi in particolare la hall è molto affollata ma le camere in cui sono stato erano silenziose. la fermata della metro è a pochi minuti a piedi cosi come la zona di negozi e ristoranti di meatpacking district

title: Fun, lively and energetic
text:
Be young be carefree and be upbeat come stay here.
Round windows , soft beds and wonderful pilows.
The rooms are a good size for NYC, don't expect large , it's compact !
Staff are attentive and helpful. A hairdresser downstairs and lots of restaurants around.
The pool on the 2nd floor is Ibiza meets st Tropez in NYC. Young frivolous crown with pink flamingos .
Rooftop is awesome and chilled. So yes chill out and relax it is rather dreamy.

title: Loudest hotel rooms ever with paper walls...
text:
I'll start with a positive--front desk woman with pink hair was lovely and very helpful. It goes downhill from there. While the area is pretty with chic, modern rooms I have a few gripes. The lightning situation is a mess, you must press buttons to adjust lights in the room and it's incredibly fussy and frustrating. Also--we were on the second floor near the pool and the walls are PAPER thin. We could hear every conversation, drunk yell, etc...very disturbing. 

THE POOL....if you want a chair expect to be up at 8:30 and put your name down otherwise by 10 am on weekends it's all full and you will wait FOREVER. Also, I've never seen so much plastic surgery in my life. Prepare to see augmented, Euro-trash skin everywhere you look while they balance on a floating flamingo or unicorn and get their friends to take a picture. The pool chair situation could be much better, the waiting list and 'paid reservations' clearly aren't working and many hotel guests were upset.

title: Bad service at front desk
text:
Spent 3 nights over Labor day weekend at Dream. We were already prepared for the hotel to be a loud, club feel and we figured the rooms were going to be very small....what we weren't expecting was the poor service. We checked in late evening on Thursday and asked if they had a king bed (rather than queen) and we were told there would be a $25 upgrade fee. That's fine, but as it was so late, it's not like they would have sold that room, so I'm not sure why they had to charge me. The process to check in took so long and there wasn't any hospitality. I believe the staff is so worn down by the annoying clubbers using the rooftop bar, but they shouldn't let that affect how they treat the people staying at the hotel. We went to several other hotels around the city to use their rooftop bars or clubs and all of their staff was very gracious to us...would have been nice to get the same treatment from our own hotel. 

Besides the bad service, the King room was impossible for two people to get around. And the bathroom was also very tiny...no where to put your stuff or even hang a towel. The only reason I give this place 2 stars (and not just one) is because of the locations. We prefer to stay in the Chelsea/Meatpacking area due to all the hot spots, but next time, we'll avoid Dream.

title: Very disappointed
text:
The hotel seems to be a target for wannabe kim khardashians and the lads think they are all drake ! Between the pool and PHD club is attracts quite the crowd ! We arrived last Thursday night and was desperately tired and just wanted to go to sleep..fat chance of that happening when your room is over looking the pool party ! The room was moving ..
We were promised that the music and party would be over at 10pm..it was more like 11.30pm

When we wanted to use the pool for an actual swim forget it..to many posers in their for that ..we had to wait long periods for a lounge chair
To become available. 
On our last day we noticed that one of the bedrooms on the ground floor beside the pool seemed to be a drug den...real classy joint !!

On our last night we got about 3 hours of broken sleep due to loud music playing once again ..we obviously complained and they said they new where it was coming from and would tell me to turn it down...2 hours later it was still going.. 
This place is for someone who plans on parting !  
Its So overly priced !!And not worth it ! Will not be returning

title: Check your bill
text:
Nothing wrong with our stay but several days after we checked out a huge extra bill was charged to our credit card.

Contact the hotel who initially denyed all knowledge but are now contesting it when charged back through the credit card company.

If you hace to stay here check your bill, keep the paperwork and double check your credit card statement.

title: Lack of service with waitresses at the pool
text:
Rooms are small for the price being paid
We had some issues with our reservation with Booking online. We reserved a room for 4 persons and the hotel gave us a room for 2. They said it was Booking's error and they proposed to give us another room with an extra bed and to pay 75$ extra. To my opinion,  we shouldn't have paid for such an error and the Hotel should have been comprehensive. i have to say that staff from reservation were really trying their best to help us and to move us to another room. It was done quickly. I appreciate the room service. Always cute and nice. People from front desks were also nice.
The mattress was a little bit hard in our room compared to the first one we had which the bed was super confortable.  We had issues withe the shower. The water would just go everywhere in the bathroom. A real disaster. We had to put towels on the floor and have advised the hotel about this issue.

Pool :
Pool is nice. Not a big one but still very convenient and pleasant.
Its possible to tan depending where you are sitting.

Before booking,  i read other reviews and I can confirm that the waitresses are really the worst.  They would just ignore you or giving you some attitude. I remember on last Sunday (August 26),  they had this fake blond girl  who looked so upset.  She was the only one working on the terrasse and she seemed so frustrated. Another client told me that she has shared to them that she was not used to do day shifts. She also seemed not used to use her common sens either. Even when i tried to get her attention she just blew me off with the sided eye. That b%$/!
Anyway. She kept walking around like a frustrated woman who never got the proper training to work with the public and then they expect to get the tip, right?! She had this mad face... ouf!
Other clients around me were also complaining about the lack of service at the pool and the poor attitude of the waitresses. Some of them thinks they are all that but need a quick reality check:  they are not even hot. Just cute girl with too much make up. Skinny doesn't make you hot.

Average faces with some much attitude. Poor them.

Anyway,  the other staff like the lifeguards were really nice  and service oriented.

One thing that i think needs to be improved :   no waiting list for the pool chairs. This is a weird way to distribute the places. Its all reserved by 8h30 am and you can litteraly see empty chairs just because they are reserved. 
It shouldn't work like that. 
It should be first come first serve and to forbid  to reserve a poolchair for someone who is not even there! 

Music is good. The vibe is really great as well.

I think the service at the terrasse / the restaurant is a big shame for this hotel.
It's really a huge dissatisfaction.
I remember that the first day when i was sitting at the restaurant and looking at one of the waitresses,  she just turned her head in a way to avoid me. I was losing my patience.

I got up and went to see her and she was just : oh yes,  sure! Where are you sitting?!

Come on,  as if!
Hypocrite and incompetent. 

Food:
Good food. 
A little bit pricey but it is a Hotel.

Phd Rooftop

I was happy to be able to go to the club. I liked better the music on Thursday night .
Saturday night,  the dj was so-so. Music was good but the dj was not on point.
One of the positive :  you have a direct access to the club with no cover when you are client but they still ask you to wait online. I think they should have two lines:  one for the clients of the hotels and another line for the clubbers.
By the way:  view is amazinf from the top.

Be careful with the charges. Hotel over charged me and now i am disputing the charges.

Im happy that i lived the experience once but i don't  believe i would go back unlesse i read positive comments and they take in charge the services.

The service at the pool with the waitresses does not match at all with the rest of the staff at the hotel.

title: Hip and Great
text: With its rooftop pool - yes did you hear that - a rooftop pool in Manhattan!  How can you go wrong.  Really cool spot and wonderful for a splurge.  Highly recommended for business or pleasure.  Rooms are spacious.

title: Nice hotel and great staff
text: The Dream Downtow is a decent hotel to stay in the West Village Manhattan for a business trip. It is a nice hotel with a pool, roof top bar, mexican restaurant, and great staff.  Manni in particular was very helpful.

title: Amezing views
text: Went there in August for my husband’s birthday we were in the ninth floor so we’re not bothered by the club noise the front desk was friendly but yes the concierge’s was absent most of the time ,they send us a nice bottle of champagne for my husband’s birthday but like in some of the reviews that I’ve read it is true they are concerned more about the club  crowd,Did go up to the club for a couple hours and then went i’m down to dinner to bodega Negra Great food slow service. If you do go have an open mind it’s a club hotel.

title: Great design!
text:
Good vibes, even better location!
Pool is fabulous, but too little beds. 
Prices are what you can expect in a place like this, in NY... service is good and friendly, 
Not a family hotel, pool times for kids are limited.... too limited. Loosen up a bit:-)
Rooms are great, super design. Not huge.

title: Beautiful hotel - just avoid weekends!
text: The hotel is beautiful and located right across the street from Chelsea Market and some great places to eat. The rooms are a good size for the city, and the fit out of the entire hotel is beautiful. The only downfall is they seem much more focused on image than service. While the staff were friendly, there wasn't the level of advice you would expect from a hotel front desk and the concierge was often absent. The hotel seems much more focused on servicing the bar and club areas and if you stay over a weekend, be prepared to put up with big crowds at the lifts going up to the club, noise from the rooftop bar and noise on the guest floors from drunken party goers. Pack your earplugs.

title: Don't look too close...
text: To be completely honest, my wife and I seriously erred in choosing this hotel for the following reasons.  First off, several rooms overlook the pool which features thumping, DJ driven, really loud music.  When we asked for a room change the woman at the front desk was both rude and condescending.  Secondly, the furniture in this place is vile...and I mean really nasty.  If you choose to stay here, don't look too closely at the white, leather couch in your room unless you enjoy eliciting your gag reflex.  The bed was clean, I hope, but completely worn out.  The mattress was years past its lifespan.  Additionally, the bathroom lacked the basic essentials one would expect at a hotel of this level.  For $500 a night, we at least deserved to be treated like humans in a reasonably clean and comfortable room.  This is a hotel for young, wealthy, hipsters who simply don't care about aesthetics or common courtesies.  NYC offers many places to spend a nice weekend, and this isn't one of them.

title: Dream hotel
text:
What a great stay we had at this hotel downtown NYC. Modern trendy design with a cool pool and bar out back. We also made use of the 'night club / roof terrace' which provided some excellent views of the city. We had a room with a balcony - not much of a view but we barely spent any time in there.

Walking distance to lots of attractions, chelsea market, highline etc. Would definitely recommend a visit to TAO next door - amazing food!

Hotel staff very friendly and couldn't do enough for you, my girlfriend left cash in the safe when we checked out, luckily they found it and held on to it for us until we could return and pick it up.

10 out of 10.

title: Love it !!!
text: I visited the Dream hotel more than once, well designed - modern hotel with DJ on site. Great location!!! very trendy place. My only comment is the size of the rooms, could be bigger but still, I'll book the dream again for my next trip.

title: Nothing Special
text: The location across the street from the Chelsea Marketplace at the crossroads of Chelsea and the Meatpacking District is its best asset. The staff is a bit standoffish. The decor is cool. The rooms are small and the beds very low to the ground which can be a bit uncomfortable. The bathrooms are tiny and poorly stocked with the typical BR items. The rooms are very expensive for what you get. The pool is cool but all the chairs are taken by 8:30 am so good luck with that. In addition the windows are not well soundproofed and the nights are very noisy even from the sixth floor. Not our favorite anymore.

title: 31st LINGERIE party for my self -
text:
So I booked this hotel for my 31st birthday 
At first I booked bronze  king balcony and I found that the room was a bit too small for about 10 other girls so I called to upgrade ( it was smooth to do after the 2nd time trying being that I booked with hotel.com ) i then upgraded to “ platinum king room “ room 1108
This room had the view of the whole corner side of the building viewing the city life including the Empire State Building and the BIG H&M sign  our room was located at the end of the hallway so we didn’t disturb anyone ( our main concern ) in fact no one complained about any noice ( thank god ) the doom looks huge on photos but it’s kind of small when walking gun but the amount of windows and view make up for the space we still had fun ! Front desk was awesome with me and whoever came up I wished I remembered names  I met MANNY  johan Steven and another ( ask manny for his name “the guy that helped me checking out) so impressed by them ✨✨✨✨ kind gentlemen ... the one night was a night to remember thank you !! I will def do it again and I will totally recommend —-

title: Maybe just not for us
text: The hotel manager was unprofessional from the moment we walked into this hotel and to the check in desk. His attitude was in desperate need of an adjustment. We live close to NYC but stay quite often every time we visit for a show or dinner. I understand this hotel is more "trendy" and caters to a bit younger (we are late 30's/early 40's)   but that shouldn't change the way your treated bu the staff. We did give DREAM MIDTOWN a chance even after this experience and would return there but, certainly not here.

title: Ok for pool parties but...
text: I’ve been to a couple of day parties here and to the bar a few times. The bar has a small selection but has really reasonable pricing for Veuve. That being said, the hotel itself has a kind of seedy feel, and I personally wouldn’t recommend staying here.

title: More of a nightmare than a Dream
text: Arrived with optimism of a wonderful stay but major disappointments throughout the 5 day stay left us very sad. Noisy lobby with the restaurant under construction, one of two elevators to our wing out of service most of the stay resulting in long waits and lots of people crammed into a small working lift. NYC experienced a 90+ degree  heat wave during our visit and our room thermostat said 65 but it felt like 85. When I call the front desk multiple times I am informed the hotel is "green" and  the thermostat is motion sensitive. But after telling them its not working, after 2 1/2 days I finally got them to send maintenance who replaced the burnt out sensor and got the AC finally working. They finally offered me $100 back on my $1500+ bill, of which they mostly took back at checkout as the "resort fee", although at least one day the pool was closed for a private party.  Hmmm. And at this "green " hotel, good luck trying to find a recycling bin.  Maid service is requested by activating a light-- a system which was not communicated with me at check in, so we didn't get timely maid service after the first night. Be aware.

title: Vista maravilhosa
text: Passamos a virada de ano lá, reservamos de última hora já conhecia o outro hotel da rede dream, e não erramos. Hotel próximo da estação de metrô, starbucks e da High Line. A vista pro Empire State é um show à parte e na virada estava ainda melhor mudava de cor toda hora. Funcionários simpáticos. O quarto é lindo como na foto, é pequeno como todos em NY. E limpo também.

title: Great views! Friendly staff!
text: I saw some reviews complaining about the staff, noise, and trendy vibe prior to visiting. And I was more than pleasantly surprised. If you are expecting a serene quiet vibe NYC prob isn’t a good choice for you vacay. The location is awesome! The vibe is trendy and fun. And the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I arrived before check in time and was able to check in early! My view was great (excuse the fog). And the room was clean and decent size for NYC! Highly recommend this place! And will definitely be back.

title: Dark/dim lighting, sticky floor...not impressed
text: This is my 3rd time at this hotel, and likely my last. First time, my room was above the club downstairs. Couldn't sleep b/c of the loud music. They were full and couldn't move me. This last time, the room was small (though the mirrors make it bigger). It was also very dim. The floor was sticky. :-( I wouldn't put my makeup on in the bathroom b/c the light was so dim. The room wasn't clean so perhaps that's why they set the lighting very dim. The toilet on the first floor was filthy and dark. Reminds me of a bathroom in a developing country. Yuck! Not getting your money's worth. It's more like a lower end Day's Inn.

title: Great hotel, great staff, lots of tattooed biceps!
text:
Family and I stayed here (9 and 7 yr old). It was superb, was initially concerned that it would be too achingly cool hipster for us but most of the clientele were 40 something trying to recapture their youth!

It delivered a lovely room, great customer service, no noise at night (despite the night club on site) and an amazingly pool. Well done and reasonable as well.

title: Total Garbage
text: $400 a night for a microscopic room that smells like mildew, zero amenities in the room upon arrival, a stained rug on top of a cold cement floor, and a mold filled bathroom. This is not an exaggeration. I stay in NYC 3-4 times a year for 4-6 days each trip, and have stayed in hotels across the city. This experience is just gross.

title: En riktigt bra hotell med party kännsla
text: Detta hotell ligger verkligen bra till nära till allt mitt i smeten. Nära till allt och små goda restauranger runt omkring. Vist är de lite dyrt men väl värt pengarna. Kommer gärna tillbaka hitt igen.

title: Very expensive, would not stay again
text: I expect the rooms to be small in NY, but our room was particularly small, and smaller than others in this same hotel (I saw three other rooms). Not enough closet space, not enough light, one mirror (in bathroom), hardly enough room for two people to move around at the same time. The beds are VERY low to the ground, as is the one chair in the room. The staff is friendly enough, but that’s about the only positive I have. It’s annoying to have to deal with the crowds trying to get into the clubs, the lobby is dark, it’s loud, the construction out front is annoying, and it’s very expensive! No doorman to help you get a cab. I will not be staying here again.

title: Super location and trendy hotel
text: Stayed here for the second time. I was worried if it had lost its vibe, but was not disappointed. The location is simply amazing, next to so many great restaurants, shops and bars. The room was small and if you get a room on the top floors the noise from the rooftop bar might annoy you. But otherwise, it's great, trendy and very busy.

title: Amazing Stay
text: I don’t write these often but our stay at the Dream was amazing! Everything front the hotel staff to the restaurant selections and accommodations was great. Our room was very spacious especially for meat packing and the hotel pool was really fun! I’d stay here again in a heartbeat!

title: Really bad
text: On a street with heavy construction . No concierge or bell boy . Pool shut down . Really bad service. Tiny rooms. Lots of public bar scene. Stay away.  Bar device was terrible . No changing rooms for pool

title: What a ripoff
text: paid over $600 a night, thinking it was a nice hotel (like many in NYC).  Room looked like an upgraded hourly motel.  Bathroom was dirty, concrete floors were stained, blue light in the room, i could go on and on.  Hallways were dirty, as were elevators. Restaurant is closed due to renovations and Nightclub was booked for a private event.  We had to leave at 4am to catch our flight and had to deal with call girls and all the drunk people from the bar next door loitering at the doors.  this is my first trip advisor review but i would hate for other people to get duped like we were.  i think only millenials or people looking to party at phD would enjoy this place.

title: Great location and Concierge
text: Stayed for business for 2 nights over 4th July. Rooms were decent and clean. It was heaving due to the pool party but staff were patient and nice. Shout out to Joseph Sabatelli at front desk who was very helpful with getting a package to me after I had left.

title: good - but...
text:
I loved the design part of this hotel. But i wasn't too happy with the location. The staff were really helpful and the room was very big. If i had been staying up all night it would have be more exciting but being so sleepy from sightseeing meant i didn't get to experience the best part of the hotel - which was supposed to be the restaurant/club/bar. Maybe i will try and see if i like it more another time and focus more on the evening activities. 
I had to pay for my room to be cleaned which was annoying and also the holding fee was ridiculous - it took ages for them to lease it as well. 
loved the option of having a pool and gym.

title: A mixed experience
text: The hotel itself is great with a fantastic bar - really lovely pool area and a fantastic restaurant (Bodega Negra).    The reason why it's a mixed experience is that the hotel is also home to a nightclub (PHD) which plays music till 2-3am every night.  I don't understand why the sound proofing isn't better in the hotel but 4 floors below it we could still hear it every night really loudly.    We booked this hotel for a family vacation and because it had a pool we thought it'd be great for the kids but they are only allowed in it till midday which is a real shame.   Overall this is a party hotel which meant as tourists this wasn't a great choice.

title: They let public use pool
text: Don’t come for the pool. It’s for 20 something’s to party in.  Staff are like bouncers...bad service.  They make more selling booze than rooms. Don’t come with children. Music blaring with DJ in full steam.  People making out in pool. Rooms take forever to get and we waiting hours despite being priority. Staff don’t care. Ganesvort way way way better!!!

title: Muy fancy hotel, las habitaciones preciosas.
text: El hotel es un encanto. La zona del lobby está increible, con la alberca en el techo es muy original y diferente. Las habitaciones comodísimas y con una vista increíble, además de que son bastante amplias y silenciosas. El servicio es muy bueno, aunque los precios son altos. Tengan cuidado al hacer el check-in, ya que yo viajaba con las habitaciones pagadas por anticipado, y con todo y eso me hicieron un cargo para "imprevistos" muy alto de $450 usd. A mi compañero de viaje le hicieron uno por $2,000 usd y no había como revertirlo hasta que haces el check-out.

title: Super Hotel mit sehr guter Rooftop Terrase
text: Das Hotel hat mir insgesamt sehr gut gefallen. Die Lage ist toll, Metrostation ist 5 Gehminuten entfernt. Einzig negativ war, das Hotelzimmer ist eher klein (ist halt in NY überall so) und es hat leider kein Kleiderschrank. Das ist sehr mühsam, meine Kleider waren die ganze Woche im Koffer… Das Zimmer wurde allerdings sehr sauber gehalten.

title: Awesome Hotel for 25-35 crowd
text: very nice hotel with a great scene for anyone looking to have a classy time, but also have a lot of fun. PHD is a must any night, but a definite must on saturday nights, when it really gets bumping. pool is small but a lot of fun and will make a great insta

title: Pounding Music Constant
text:
This hotel thinks it's a nightclub. The music plays so loudly (almost all hours) that if you try to make a call the people on the other end of the phone will hear the song. The staff act more like bouncers than hospitality employees and the lighting is so dim (even in the rooms) that there's no way to know if anything is clean. The scene at the pool is like Miami Beach. Unless you are a Kardashian wanna be, you'll feel out of place.

Pros are a good location and a comfy bed (which are less enjoyable since the noise is so loud).

If you are a normal person, stay somewhere else.

title: Not for good for Business trips
text:
If you do stay here make sure you request a room that is NOT close to their nightclub. There is a nightclub on the roof that plays horribly loud music until 3am and prevents you from getting any sleep. I will say the staff was very nice when I called at 1:30am to complain and did ask the DJ to turn down it’s bass but It still was very unpleasant. It didn’t help I was there on business and two very important meetings the next day. 

Overall hotel is really nice and a fun place to stay. Cool lobby and bars. Probably better for vacation than business.

title: Party Party Party
text: Anbefaler egentlig ingen som reiser med barn under 16 å bo på dette hotellet. Beliggenheten er super, men rammen rundt er lagt opp til PARTY, hver dag. Basseng området ble kjapt fylt opp av festklare mennesker, men det er nok også hotellets mål. Rommene begynner å bli slitne, badet var ok. Har bodd på både dobbeltrom og suitene. Maten fra restauranten Bodega Negra et alltid bra. Betjeningen generelt er hyggelige selv om de rundt poolen var litt arrogante.

title: BEWARE
text:
We booked this hotel on Hotel Tonight after being stuck at the airport from flight cancellation. We paid almost 700 per night. We have to stay 2 nights until we can get another flight. I am currently staying here with my daughter. 
This place is like checking into a night club! This is not a place for families!!!! We thought it would be nice to have a pool and realax for a day before heading back to airport. 
I’ve stayed at nice hotels all over including Napa, San Francisco, Hawaii, Hollywood etc. I have stayed at 4 hotels previously in NYC.  I’ve paid rates like this before and never been disappointed or felt as ripped off as I do right now!
Blaring music at check in so dark you can barley see and music so loud we had to yell to hear each other. We get the key to our room and you have to use your room key to use elevator. That didn’t work and there was another visitor with his key saying he had nothing but problems. So back to the front desk to get two new keys. Back in the elevator and again only one key worked. Once up to our room we called down for an additional key and extra pillows which we never received!!
I am also pretty sure a drug deal was being made while in the elevator! Terrible 
The Room is clean but that’s it. It Chic I’ll give them that. If I were in Las Vegas I’d get it! There is nothing fancy about this room and very cheaply done. The mattress doe not even have box spring. It’s basically on the floor. It’s also very small. Absolutely not worth the money paid. If we hadn’t book on hotel tonight we would have gotten a refund and left. 
So if you want a nightclub party scene this is the place! They have a nightclub connected to the hotel. And your walls vibrate from the music. It’s not quiet you can hear everything from other rooms. Personally I prefer luxury or even a Marriott. I would never stay here again.

title: Betty Farakos
text:
We loved dream downtown 
The staff were very helpful 
Very good location 
The main negative was they allow the public into the pool so in our week there we never got a sun bed . The pool area wasn’t big enough for the amount of people using it 
As guest, we were disappointed as we chose the Dream downtown for its pool

title: Amazing experience!
text: The Dream is always perfect.  The ambiance is unmatched especially in the summer with the pool. Something not many places in NYC can offer you. Staff is great, Mallory Matoush helped make the stay was perfect, be back soon.

title: Bad service
text: Super bad service had too wait for ever after drinks at the pool and the hotel was not super busy very dissapointed about everything here so I can not recomend this place to any one will never be back here

title: Nightmare Downtown.
text: Have checked out of this hotel early after finding hotel staff rude and unhelpful. This hotel is set up for an Instagram generation and if you are too old or too young you will be ignored. The room was beautiful but very expensive for a good view.  When we arrived there was a private pool party, the basement dining is closed and as my daughter is 18 we were not welcome at the rooftop restaurant.. Effectively left us with no amenities we were able to use. The pool and nightclub are open to the public and this area of revenue appears more important to the hotel than guests comfort.

title: Great times!!!!
text: Had a great time during the day. Check in was smooth. Pool area was great. Seemed like you were completely out of NYC. Drinks and food by the pool were great. Visited the restaurant for dinner and it was great. A bit over priced but nothing I didn’t expect. Great food.  Went to the rooftop and though the place was nice the bouncer in the lobby by the elevator was extremely unprofessional, sarcastic and rude which killed the vibe for the night. Besides that all gravy.

title: Truly an Unexpected Oasis: An experience in immersive design.
text:
This hotel salvaged my trip to NYC last month.  I started out at another hotel (Sheraton, Tribeca, also reviewed recently, including a price comparison), but on the advice of my sister who had stayed at Dream before, moved over to  after two days.  I actually wanted to move hotels a day earlier, but it was an almost full occupancy type of week in NYC with multiple events.  

The architecture and interior design are matched by the quality of the service - all three working in unison towards a memorable guest experience.  (Design buffs , google Handel Architects to get more of the design back story)

As I did not have much choice with my last minute arrangements, I ended up in a smaller room, just barely bigger than the queen bed, plus a bathroom and circulation.  No complaints at all though.  I had a quintessential NYC view from my circular window. A word of caution to the property and facilities management: some of the room finishes and fittings are starting to show some wear and tear.  Best to deal with it sooner rather than later. (Shower enclosure, side tables etc.)

Food offerings are excellent, most notably the on-site mexican restaurant where  I had the best meal of my entire trip, again matched with five star service.

This place has a distinct feeling, energy and vibe.  Will absolutely return here without hesitation.

title: Management is top notch!
text:
I've been staying at the Dream Downtown several times a year both professionally and personally for over 5 years now, and have no plans to change that! The hotel management staff is always accommodating and go out of their way to ensure my stay is comfortable and convenient, from room upgrades, to late checkouts, to early check-ins, if they can do it, they have always accommodated me and my guests. Jane Sriprayul, Director of Rooms, is always responsive and a class act. 

Outside of excellent management and service, the hotel location can't be beat, it's so central, minutes from Meatpacking, and a 15min Uber/Lyft ride away from anywhere in Manhattan. The metro lines are also within a block or so walking distance from the hotel. 

The rooftop is beautiful, especially in the summer, however, I will warn you if you are sensitive to noise, ask to be placed in the quieter tower. The pool and lobby lounge/bar are always fun to hang out at as well to grab a cocktail! Bodega Negra has excellent food and is right downstairs. 

Overall, I give it a 5 star rating and would recommend staying here on your next trip!

title: Best New Year’s Eve Celebration
text:
Spent the whole night at the hotel for their NYE event, everything you need is local and you’re surrounded by some of the best restaurants including Tao downtown which is where you might find a lot of celebrities walk through. 

Also great hotel staff and very responsive when we needed snacks and more blankets!

title: Location location with 5 star service!!!
text: I checked into the Dream Downtown for a last minute stay on 7/2.  I was greeted by Andy Charles at the front desk who could not have been more accommodating. He made sure I was happy with my room and gave me a complimentary upgrade. The hotel is beautiful with so many amenities and is near all the best attractions NYC has to offer. Arsh, at the pool set me up with a lounge chair and I had an amazing day. I would recommend getting to the pool as early as possible as chairs fill up fast and there is a demand. Lastly, Mallory who is the Guest Services Manager pulled some favors  and was able to get a reservation last minute at Tao (which I was unable to do on my own), which was unbelievable. I cannot recommend this hotel enough!!!! I have stayed at most of the properties in the area and this one by far has the most to offer. I recommend a room with a balcony overlooking the beautifully landscaped pool. You won’t leave this property unsatisfied, the staff is so accommodating and is always there to help.

title: Excellent customer service from Nicole
text: My stay at dream hotel was absolutely fabulous. Our room had a nice view and we really enjoyed the pool party/nightlife. Nicole at front desk was so helpful and kind all throughout our stay. She was very accommodating and made things go smoothly for us. She went above and beyond to make sure that we enjoyed our stay. I will certainly recommend this hotel! Thank you Nicole & night crew!

title: AMAZING Bachelorette Weekend
text: This hotel was absolutely perfect for my friends stay-cation Bachelorette. We are all New Yorkers but we felt like we were in a different city - this hotel is so fabulous. Located so close to so many trendy clubs/restaurants - we walked to everything. Spent they day by pool - which is a must, PhD at night - amazing views. We got the platinum suite as our home base and it easily fit our big group for pregaming and such. The front desk staff is awesome. Highly recommend

title: A great experience
text: I have stayed here twice. Once in September for my birthday, another time in February for a girls night out. Both times I had a great experience. It is certainly a party hotel so know that upfront. The first time I went they gave my group free drink tickets and comped lunch at the pool because we got stuck in the elevator for 15 minutes. The next time I stayed they upgraded my room for free! I have yet to have a bad experience at this hotel!

title: Shevonne
text: Huge shoutout to Shevonne who served us at the beach bar! She was so incredibly sweet, fun, and anticipatory of our needs. She was pretty busy but did not show it in her demeanor at all. The drinks were also amazing!! Was incredibly impressed by her and will definitely return! Thank you Shevonne!

title: Holiday Weekend
text: I stayed here over 4th of July weekend. The staff is friendly, accommodating, and it’s clear they put their guests needs at the top of their priority list. I also had a chance to check out the pool which was a little crowded, but the party vibe was awesome! Will definitely be back.

title: Anniversary weekend
text:
We had such a great anniversary weekend. 
Greeted warmly by reception, they were able to give us our room right as we got there and we got upgraded! The rooms are a great size for Downtown with a nice modern decor and quite a big bathroom. The lobby is very cool, you can look upto to the bottom of the pool, and there’s a nice bar there too.
Mallory the manager really took care of us ,she found out it was our anniversary and  we were pleasantly surprised to have a bottle of champagne waiting for us in a tub of ice after coming back from lunch.  The pool is just awesome, had a DJ and poolside service, quite crowded because it was one of those sweltering hot weekends, but best way to cool off on a summer day while having some drinks. Staff in the hotel is just great, everyone is super nice and attentive, over all we It was a great way to celebrate our anniversary, we will definitely go back for another weekend this summer.

title: Dream Pool Party
text:
Great time and great vibes at the Dream pool party on a Saturday. Drinks are super tasty and the music keeps the vibes going and are on point. Lots of beautiful people! Great way to start your day on Saturday prior to hitting the town for the night. 

Be sure to try the guacamole and the sweet potato fries, as well as, the casamigos margaritas🔥🔥🔥🔥

#NEW YORK CITY VIBES!!!!

title: Hôtel moderne et branché
text:
1 semaine dans cet hôtel, chambre avec vue... sur la piscine, un luxe à New-York ! Literie très confortable et housekeeping d’une grande efficacité, bravo ! 
En revanche la restauration de la piscine est très moyenne, salade pas bonne du tout, c’est dommage car le spot est superbe. 
Pour conclure je recommande cet hôtel très bien situé et proche du célèbre Chelsea Market.

title: Official!
text: The attention to detail and level of customer service Nicole gave us was outstanding. She let us know we could upgrade our room and we did! Our room was beautiful clean and in the heart of the city. I truly enjoyed the environment they created.

title: Student
text: I needed a room last minute and Tenzin was extremely accommodating! Was patient with me and got me a room on one of the top floors. Loved the amazing hospitality and my overall experience at the Dream Hotel Downtown. Will be coming back :)

title: Daily Pool Pass - AVOID
text:
I wasn’t a guest at the hotel, but I paid for the pool day pass. I would honestly say don’t bother. 

$65 to be crammed into a tiny pool with no guarantee of a lounge chair. I was put on a waiting list, but there were beds left unattended, and some that were "Reserved" for guests not even present. 

I also waited 30 minutes to be served by a waitress who ignored me time and time again. (and reading past reviews, this is a common thing)

Totally not worth it, save your money and head to Lasker Pool in Central Park instead.

title: Si es un sueño
text: En realidad la razón más grande que elegimos este hotel es porque tiene una piscina, y hay muy pocos hoteles en NYC que tienen piscina. El hotel es ultra moderno, si no te gusta la la música a alta volumen en el lobby, la decoración contemporánea, y la juventud, entonces no será el hotel para ti, porque el hotel es muy guay y divertido. Tiene un restaurante Mejicano, Bodega Negra, súper fabuloso, oscuro, y sexy. Nos encantó este hotel, nos sentimos muy chic, y queda en el área 'Meatpacking' que tiene todos los restaurantes, compras, y más.

title: Terrible
text:
We (a couple in our early 30s) stayed here for five nights at the end of May/beginning of June. It was a rubbish experience. 

To start - when we checked in the lady at the front desk accidentally charged me twice (2x $600 charges so $1200 total) for the incidentals block (i.e. the amount they block off your account as a bond). She didn't realise, but I checked my account by chance up at the room and tried call the front desk. Took us about 5 or 6 phone calls before someone answered, but then we spoke to a friendly guy who said he would fix it, and the extra amount would be off my card on 24hrs. 

Four days (/three nights) after checking in, both amounts were still on my card, so I went down and spoke to another friendly guy (Manuel?) who said that nothing had been done about it yet, but he would fix the mistaken charge that very day, and he would give me a call to confirm (and took my number). I also asked him to get us some bathrobes – as we’d had our bathrobes taken away by housekeeping on the first morning, and despite calling maybe 3 times, no one had returned these yet. He assured me these would get put in our rooms.

Got home that night, no bathrobes, no phone call from the guy on the desk. So the next morning (five days after overcharging me $600), I was starting to get cranky and I went down to the desk again, the same guy said it was going to take another 24hrs, and that he hadn’t been able to call me because it was an international number (you would think that a hotel could call international numbers but whatever). He said he had apparently tried to come to my room to let me know, but I wasn’t there (we had told him we were going out, so this isn’t surprising). He told me he had “tried his best”. But by that point I was really annoyed. I didn’t actually get the amount unblocked until after we had left NYC six days later.

The pool itself is cool and I didn’t have a problem getting sunbeds. The froses are delicious and the food is also fine. Service is again terrible. It was really weird – there were staff hanging around everywhere, but the only people allowed to serve were the waitresses, and trying to flag them down took about 45m each time. Once I got off my pool bed about three times to keep asking the front guy (a lifeguard/door guy of some kind) to send over a waitress and he would be like yeah sure and do nothing about it, and the waitresses would literally walk past so quickly without making eye contact I just wouldn’t get a chance.

Despite telling them your room number, they make you hand over ID, and when we paid the bill at the end of our first day they didn’t return the ID. We had drunk a fair few froses so didn’t notice. So the next day I’m lying on the pool bed asking about our ID and it took me maybe five times of asking (keep in mind it takes forever to get someone to come over to you in the first place) before someone checked on the ID – they said yeah sorry really weird but we don’t have it. Waitresses seemed totally unconcerned about this. I kept asking different people about this as it was pretty annoying and so they checked with security and were like yep sorry no one has it and then they would walk off again. Like wtf – you guys have definitely got it, you took it off us just yesterday and didn’t give it back. In the end I walked inside the restaurant and was like ok so where do you keep ID’s – can you show me? And then the waitress shows me this little alphabetical rolodex thing and I’m like have you tried the letter behind? Lo and behold the ID was under the wrong letter. It would have been so easy to find if they had bothered to try.  

In the meantime, we had tried to have breakfast at the Bodega Negra restaurant once, where the service was also terrible. We walked inside, and just stood there waiting while the staff were just chatting to each other (it wasn’t busy). We stood about and were like ok maybe we sit ourselves down and someone will come over. We’re sitting there for ages and no one comes over and we had decided what we wanted to eat by then so were like ok maybe we have to pay at the counter during breakfast? So we walk over, and waitress is like oh we will come over for your order. Ok so we sit down again. The girl wanders out the back, comes back with a box of drinks and proceeded to unpack all the drinks into the fridge before coming over. Pretty rude. She takes our orders, then my husband’s meal comes out but no sign of mine. We wait.. he finishes his and then I asked about mine and she’s like oh did you order something? I was like yes… and she’s like “do you still want it?”. Ah yes… I don’t just generally sit around waiting for a meal when I’m not hungry.

It was honestly just the most overwhelmingly and consistently poor service I have ever had at a hotel in my life. And despite all the continual screw ups, no one was ever like “oh hey sorry I said I was going to call you and fix this and didn’t – here have a free drink on us”. Little things like that make a big difference, and I probably wouldn’t have been quite so pissed off if from time to time I had been offered a free frose or coffee over breakfast as compensation. To be clear – the staff aren’t unfriendly, they’re definitely friendly enough (when you can grab one), but they’re totally incompetent.

When we checked out the guy at the front desk was like hey hope you enjoyed your stay. I proceeded to tell him all of the above, and he apologised, was really nice, and then took the resort fee off my room. This was good of him, but no one had actually told me there was a resort fee in the first place so it was a little hard to feel gracious at that point. Oh and when we paid for all of our room service etc, he forgot to take the other incidentals block off my account (i.e. the $600 charge which I had authorised being blocked), so two weeks after checking out of the hotel I had to email and ask them to sort out. So annoyinggg.

The whole nightclub thing in the hotel is pretty weird too – you get back after being out for dinner and there are all these wasted, heavily made up people hanging out in the lobby and the sound from the club is reverberating through the hotel. We didn’t mind that so much as we went out a fair bit, but I can certainly see why people who aren’t out every night would hate the hotel. Not a place for kids!

In terms of the rooms – these are a little shabby for what you pay for. Our room had large marks on the carpet etc. The bathrooms are tiny, and have serious limescale or something building up on the tiles which is a bit gross. If the service had been OK I would have said that it’s probably not a place to stay for as long as we stayed (5 nights), but I would have said it was an OK hotel for a long weekend for a girls night out etc. BUT the service was so bad I would honestly just skip it. Stay away.

title: Not What we expacted
text:
Dream Dowtown is a beutifully design hotell with a lot of fantastic things to offer, bot not for us. 

We booked this hotell for our family of 4, the reason. A room with 2 dubble beds and a lovely outdoor pool. But the room was really small and the beds even smaller. A bed width 140 cm is not a dubbelbed in my standards.

The poolarea was just acceceble for the kids before lunchtime and they have no access to the rooftop, not even at the afternoon. 

But the staff was nice and friendly, and after a upgrade did we have a much better room. (But for a suite still small).

title: Loved it!
text: My friend and I stayed for 4 nights last week and had the best time. I loved the location of the hotel (right in the middle of all the trendiest eateries in NYC) and loved the hotel itself. Rooms were small, but clean and comfortable, and with a really spacious shower room. We were on floor 7 and experienced zero problems with noise whatsoever. We loved the pool and terrace area, welcome respite from the sticky NYC weather. The rooftop bar was incredible but, the only annoying thing about our stay was that EACH night we were there, there was a private party which prohibited us from going up (until the last night when we were allowed up after 9.30pm). I don't understand why guests of the hotel should be shut off from a key attraction/facility within the hotel that we have effectively paid for and this did annoy us a bit. Other than that, fab stay and will definitely stay again if I visit NYC.

title: Favorite Hotel in NYC
text: Took a bite of the big apple yet again and stayed at the Dream Down Town. This might be my 6th or 7th time staying at the Dream while visiting New York. The staff is lovely and really welcoming.  You can’t go wrong. The facilities are simply exceptional, from the spacious rooms, beach pool, dining experience and of course the PHD for all the nightlife lovers.  I would like to extend a special shout out to Guest Services Manager Mallory.  She made absolutely sure we had an amazing experience at the hotel and our check in was accompanied with a bottle of wine. The whole staff makes you feel welcome and works to make your experience happy and memorable. The atmosphere is vibrant, the pool is entertaining and the location is hard to beat. I will return.

title: Party and pool palace- best in the city
text: This hotel has it all: in the center of action, hands down best pool in the city, great service, and a vibrant vibe. We stayed here our first night and it set the tone of fun for the week. The next night they were booked so we had to move elsewhere, booked at the Dream immediately the following day. Book early, popular. Will definitely return!

title: still my favorite nyc hotel, from a NYC resident
text: I frequent dream DT and recently had the pleasure of meeting Tenzin at the front desk. I usually arrive after his shift but I wanted to specifically thank him for taking care of me and my friend. Dream DT is my top choice bc of location vibe etc, we noticed some new faces but the customer service we experienced with Tenzin was like a breath of fresh air. Especially during pool season its so busy and he made our stay as comfortable as possible. Thank u for continuing to keep this on our top 5 in nyc!!! :) PS. the view from PHD is SO underrated. absolutely stunning.

title: Daniel and Dinesha were amazing 五星级服务
text: Despite of being fully booked, Daniel and Dinesha went to the extra mile helping me switch to a extra quite room. Expect the best customer service from front desk staff to Manager and also from room service staff. Daniel called the morning after our switch to ask if I was happy with the new room. Room service called to see if I need extra towels.last time stayed uptown Omni hotel, room is double the size at dream downtown compared to Omni and service much better. Much more restaurants, right across from Chelsea market. Vibe of hotel is lively catered for younger people. Will definitely stay again! 交通方便又安静,住的舒适宽敞，吃饭方便，前台人很热心。经理Daniel帮我换安静的房间超级热心。强烈推荐！

title: Keep looking. This isn’t where you want to stay if you actually want to sleep.
text:
PROS:
- the water pressure in the shower was so good it was hard to take a quick shower
- The meat and cheese plate is excellent and large
- The location
- The Frosé up at the pool is a refreshing treat to enjoy while people watching at the pool
- Guys at the door to hotel were helpful and nice
- If you like circles, this is the place for you!

CON:

- OUR DOOR WAS NOT SHUT AND LOCKED AFTER TURN DOWN. We returned from being out all afternoon to find that our door was ajar and unlocked for who knows how long. No one seemed to be too upset about it at the front desk, no offers for a rate reduction. Cancellation policy made changing hotels not an option.
- Paper thin walls. You will hear EVERYTHING, music from the club included. We were on the fourth floor.
- The beds and pillows are terrible. A dorm room bed is more comfortable. The pillows should not be referred to as such, even folded in half they served no purpose other than to remind you that the pillows absolutely sucked. The beds are made in a way that you feel like you’ve been short sheeted.
- Speaking of dorm rooms, you will feel as though you’ve been transported back to college when you hear the drunken squeals of drunk people galavanting about the hall ways.
- The rooms feel ridden hard and put away wet. We had some mysterious stains on the bathroom wall that never seemed to warrant a clean up from Housekeeping.
- DID I MENTION THAT OUR ROOM DOOR WAS LEFT OPEN?
- Have fun figuring out how to get your lights off.
- Your trash will never get emptied.
- Service-wise, people were nice enough but running on island time.

There are so many places to stay in New York. If you are looking for a nice place to actually get the kind of service that the rate should be calling for, keep looking. If you’re looking for a place for a bachelor party, this is your place.

title: Above and beyond
text: I recently stayed at the dream downtown and I was absolutely blown away. From the moment I contacted the hotel about making reservations, I was immediately contacted by Tenzin. He was great and very accommodating answering all my questions and even upgraded my room which was very sweet. We stayed 2 nights and would def go back. We got drinks before dinner at megu which was amazing and staff was friendly and went above and beyond. That same service continued the next day at the pool. The head of security said he had only 1 chair left at the pool but since we were 2 he went out of his way to find another chair which I thought was great. Our waitress Shelby was amazing and very attentive even when she got busy she made sure we were taken care of. We also loved the manager Elizabeth or Liz as we were introduced, we met her at Megu and then again at the pool, very sweet and hardworking. We had breakfast and lunch by the pool and it was amazing. The area is great and walking distance to all the rest and nightlife if you feel like venturing out of the hotel. Overall I would stay here again, only downfall the mattress and pillows were uncomfortable for me other than that, my new favorite hotel.

title: Great hotel & pool
text: Loved the hotel! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The pool was beautiful, you would think in Manhattan they’re isn’t much space, but the hotels outdoor pool exceeded my expectations. Whether you’re there to relax, do work, hang with friends - the pool was great to hang around in. The staff accommodates well and are quick to get you your drinks & food. The hotel in general has a beautiful ambiance and interior design, very clean!

title: Nightmares
text:
See that beautiful picture of the sparkling pool? Yeah, it is a quarter of  the size and the only way you will get a chair is if you are up before 9 am to lay on it the entire day. It is interesting they say it is first come first serve however apparently you can reserve a chair for $150..? There are empty chairs throughout the day yet if you go to sit on one (that has been empty for an hour) you are promptly told no and the chair stays empty.
Want a drink? Great they need to know your room (fair) and then have you wear two wristbands and keep your Id at the desk with them (as hotel guests this is odd). The front desk already has a copy of your id when you checked in. They refuse to serve without keeping your id. As someone who sees identity theft every day this is an issue. You never want your id being help onto. You already have two wristbands and one has your name scrawled on it. (No privacy here) 
We booked two nights and the first night we stayed elsewhere as the room next to us had 7+ girls celebrating a birthday. No sleeping possible. Also the bed is tired at best. My husband described it as “seriously you want me to sleep on bare springs?” We left the next day because we were just truly over the lack of customer service and prison like environment.  Check out the bathroom for the true prison vibe. 
This is a hotel to go to with 30 of your friends. Split the cost of the room and have whoever passed out first save your pool Seats for the next day. Play your music loudly and care about no one. That’s the status quo. 
Anyone who wants a decent nights sleep and to be able to sit on an empty pool chair I suggest you book elsewhere.  

We had the king pool room which literally is two steps away from the back of a pool chair you will never get to sit on. Don’t worry though people have their backpacks and stuff everywhere so you get a fun obstacle course to jump on the way to your prison... oops room.

title: Dream...wake me up!
text:
We will not be going back to Dream. Stayed in a Platinum suite and the noise is endless. Yes it’s a party hotel but music all day and evening until 10 is a little much. Food and glass all over the floor when we arrived. Called several times for housekeeping to please come and vacuum.
Asked for turndown service and they made up the sofa bed and not our bedroom. Left only 1 regular and 1 decaf option coffee for two people. Charged us 300 dollars for lounge chairs we didn’t use. Mis-understanding  but it was not made specifically clear.  Great location but for the price there are better hotels with nicer rooms, more functional amenities and better service.

title: Was a DREAM in NYC!
text: Not to make it cheesy. But really, when it comes to NY hotels at a mid-range price (for NY) this place was awesome. The location is perfect as a home base, walkable to everything. The rooms are above average when it comes to size, with a large bathroom and shower. The common spaces are gorgeous, with a ton of entertainment options - don’t go here if you need quiet or don’t like a buzzy venue. Though, kudos to the place for putting noise cancelling systems in the rooms! They seem to really have thought things through. The pool is beautiful and I hear the rooftop is a place to be. The fitness centre was clean and open 24hrs. Really no complaints here - service was also great with SMS assistance. I would definitely stay here again for business and for personal.

title: Vacant and rude staff partnered with awful service
text:
We arrived in the morning from our flight from London, being aware that check in wasn't until 3pm and we were told we would get a telephone call when our room was ready. So we were happy to put our bags in their luggage storage and hang around by the pool. Whilst there we asked the pool bar staff if we were able to charge a phone (we have the charger so all we needed was a spare socket) to be abruptly told to go downstairs to the public bar area where we could pay 2 dollars to use charge box. Strange, seeing as only hotel guests are allowed by the pool so surely it's all the same electricity if we were to charge it in our room? Fast forward to 4:30pm, still no phone call or update on when our room would be ready, we addressed this to the clearly not bothered reception staff who reluctantly investigated and after having to chase 3 times we finally got into our room. 
One evening we called room service to bring up some water for the room, 1 hour later still no sign of the water so we had to call back to find it's whereabouts. Eventually, with no luck or water we went down to the bar to get it ourselves which took around 2.5 minutes.
A couple of days into our trip one of our guests had a suitcase delivered to the hotel, she's 4 months pregnant so kindly asked at reception if someone could take it up to our room as she was heading out, which they agreed to do. 2 hours later when she returns, to the suitcase still in reception unattended so she was then forced to take it up herself. 

By the end of the trip we were convinced the staff were told/trained to be rude, dismissive, inattentive and have zero personality. We lucky if any of them managed to force a smile at us, very bizarre..

title: Great stay
text: Had a great experience at the Dream Hotel. Great place to stay with a pool and nice rooms. Also a special mention to the night manager Tenzin Basnet who upgraded our room to an amazing suite with direct access to the pool. If hes helping you out you're in good hands.

title: A COMPLETE NIGHTMARE
text:
Where to start?
- The beds have a strange set-up with a thick matteress protector which isn't attached to the bed which slides and slips underneath you as you sleep.
- The pillows..well you cant call them pillows they are pillowslips...flat, featherless, lifeless and did both my husband and my neck out. 
- The food is simply inedible. DO NOT ORDER CHICKEN it tastes literally like rubber. Disgusting. Everything else they served we could not eat. Never had such terrible food.
- Prepare to not sleep as they have a club pumping music all night and if thats not bad enough wait till the guests go crazy and run up and down the hallways banging on doors and not being controlled at all by staff. 
- What are the rooms like? DARK AS NIGHT. There is low lighting everywhere so forget finding clothes to wear and watch your extremities as your gonna get hurt.
- This hotel values form over function. Im all for an uber cool designed hotel but if you cant see anything, everything you use doesnt work and is uncomfortable, food is inediable whats the point of fancy decor? NOTHING. 
-This hotel is all scene and caters for party-goers visiting the establishment.

My recommendation is DON'T STAY, have drink instead and thank your lucky stars you dont have to stay the night.

title: Excellent experience.
text:
Top notch experience. I will stay there for my next visit. 

Angela at the front desk is incredibly helpful. 

The queen room is small, but large for one person. 

Great shower. 

Excellent location. 

Near the highline.

title: I wouldn't stay anywhere else in  NYC!
text:
Everyone at Dream go out of their way to make you feel appreciated and welcome.  Tenzin and the front desk staff make checking in and checking out a breeze. Asking all of the right questions to make sure you get the room & experience you want while staying in NYC.  Mallory & Alex go out of their way to ensure a great time is had by all at the pool, and they always greet you with a warm, genuine smile!
The icing on the cake regarding this team....I was impressed, but not surprised when an item of value I had accidentally left in the front seating area had been turned into lost & found. Integrity!!!!

title: Nightclub not a hotel!
text:
Our stay started well with an early check in to our platinum suite. That was much appreciated, especially with two young kids. 

Later in the day (Saturday) the hotel basically turns into a nightclub. The pool is just an excuse for privileged 20-somethings to wear little and drink lots. The music echoes through the rooms and the faint bounce of bass was hard to ignore long into the night. 

They got our room service order wrong (although gave a discount for that) and it took 1hr to get someone to bring up beddings for the kids beds. 

All in all, not worth the $850/night we paid. This place really isn’t for kids, but if I could have afforded this place when I was 20 I would probably have loved it. So party on if that’s what you’re after.

title: Can’t beat the Dream
text:
Was in the city for a long weekend at the beginning of June and stayed 3 nights at the Dream. Great experience from check in through check out. Was greeted by Mallory one of the managers on check in and she helped out with suggestions around the city and reservations at the pool and Bodega Negra for dinner one evening.  Food was awesome and pool was a great party scene during the day.
Attentive and courteous staff and amazing location.  Can’t beat the Dream!

title: Favorite Hotel in NYC
text: I come to NYC on business regularly, every 4-5 weeks, and love staying at the Dream, especially on our extended weekend trips.  The staff is lovely and really welcoming.  When we arrived Tenzin took amazing care of us during check-in.  We had a beautiful room with a view of the empire state building and the room is much more spacious than hotels around the area.  Mallory insured we had an amazing experience at the hotel and gave us a great restaurant recommendation in the neighborhood.  My business partner left her Gucci scarf in the lobby and someone turned it - Perseus at the front desk facilitated finding it for us and was really lovely.  The whole staff makes you feel welcome and works to make your experience happy and memorable.   The atmosphere is vibrant, the pool is entertaining and the location is hard to beat.

title: Very Disappointing
text:
I didn't get to travel for memorial day weekend so I thought I would just enjoy a staycations. Dream Downtown is very popular so much that I ignored the recent bad reviews. 

I checked in about 20 minutes early, everything seemed on the up until I got to my room. Although they are currently working on the hotel you can tell everything is very old and outdated. The carpet in the room smelled pretty bad, the mirrors were dirty, and the bed was very uncomfortable. 

Now to the biggest problem the service, I understand this was a holiday however there was no communication between the staff. Upon check in I was given two free drink cards for the on site restaurant MEGU, when we went to redeem the cards we found out the restaurant was in fact closed. After confirming with the front desk, we were told oh we are so sorry they don't expire you can always come back. (Terrible)

The only great experience was at the Bodega restaurant where the service was great and food was good. I will review this separately but wanted to mention that. 

Lastly, the rooftop loung PHD, terrible terrible staff. As a hotel guest I was shocked by the treatment we recited trying to get up there. The woman at the guest was very rude, she pointed us to the door man who was also rude. When I asked for her name, I was told by the door man that he didn't know. (Yeah, like I was born yesterday). I totally understand the crowd they are trying to attract however you should really consider treating everyone with respect because you never know who you are dealing with.

I do not recommend this hotel to anyone, and as a New York native I really hope that visitors spend their money somewhere where their money is appreciated and truly enjoy the big apple. Dream was such a disappointment and I will not return nor recommend anyone stay there.

title: Desastroso
text: Quarto extremamente sujo, barulho insuportável. No meu andar tinha uma festa do quarto vizinho com mais de 20 pessoas a noite inteira. Ligamos mais de 10 vezes na recepção e nada foi feito. Os sabonetes e shampoos do banheiro não são repostos.

title: All show, no go.
text:
This is a nice looking hotel but...

There seems to be a basement club, which means fighting your way through a crowd to get in and out. 

Maid service seems to think 4pm is reasonable. 

The wake up call didn’t happen at all.

The check out... no one at the desk, and when they arrived (ok it was 0500) they didn’t want to reset ‘the system’ to give me a printed invoice. 

If you ate in town for a party, great. For business? Skip.

title: Small but stylish room
text: I liked my room, although it was small. The bed was mostly comfortable, and the room was quiet enough. The service was okay, but I never felt truly 'comfortable' in this hotel. Because of the top floor/rooftop lounge, it could get crowded at the elevators in the evening. However, in the space between the front desk and elevators, there was a persistent smell of raw sewage. Maybe they had a pipe leak or something?

title: A wretched experience
text: Checked in for an overnight. Second floor room. Should have known something was up when the bathroom lacked toiletries. Those were brought quickly enough. But there was nothing to be done about the crushing bass line playing in the nightclub downstairs and pulsing through the room until quite late. Nor was there anything done about the young woman screaming in the hallway from 3 to 3:30 a.m. that she couldn’t find her purse and who took her purse and you guys what was she going to do? At checkout, asked about my stay, I told the front desk folks just how bad it was. Did they take anything off the bill? They did not. One offered apologies and suggested things would be better on my next visit. I told her not bloody likely.

title: Loved
text: Celebrated my birthday here it was a blast! Had a great room up on the ninth floor with a view! Professional and very attentive service! Thank you Lauren, you made our stay very special! Coming back ASAP!

title: God beliggenhet
text: Hotellet har en god beliggenhet, kort vei til Subway, Chelsea Marked, Highline, gode restauranter og roof top barer. God størrelse på rommet, noe små bad. God seng, savnet muligheter for å lage kaffe på rommet. Vi hadde bestilt rom med balkong, denne var så smal at det var kun plass til en i bredden. Roof top baren er populær, verdt et besøk. Det spilles høy musikk i resepsjonsområdet/barområdet hele tiden, og gjennomstrømming av festklare mennesker på vei til/fra bar og roof top baren gjør det til et støyende og travelt hotell.

title: Fantastic Location...great buzz...a little noisy...service only OK
text:
The problem with NYC there are lots of 'suburbs' to stay in. One of my favourites is the meatpacking district and this is where Dream Downtown is located. The meatpacking district is a great location with lots of bar and restaurants. Not a lot of shopping...but you can do if you want exclusive and expensive. 

The hotel has a great buzz all the time, especially at night. It does create a little of a challenge to get to your room late a night as you have to flight through the crowds. But I would prefer that to a boring place.

However, like most NYC hotels, the rooms are very small. Plus it is a noisy city and you can end up waking really early as the city comes alive at 3/4 in the morning. We had have that as an issued, but were moved to an inside facing room were the noise levels from the street where much lower.

Great value for a great location

title: Thoughtful customer service
text:
The hotel is very pretty - I loved the round windows (that open!) in my 8th floor room.  And breakfast in the charming bodega on the main floor was a step above the standard hotel fare.  Plus the second floor pool is super for people watching and relaxing after a day's sightseeing or travel.

Mallory and Jane in the Guest Services were very considerate and helpful.  Staff like that makes all the difference in the world!

title: Ms.
text: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Dream Hotel downtown for 9 nights. The outstanding aspect of this hotel was the professionalism, attention to detail and friendliness of its staff. From Daniel (who was extremely helpful at the front desk - he's a keeper) to the cleaning staff, they were all extremely helpful. Thank you all for making our holiday in New York so enjoyable. Thanks Daniel you turned a disaster into a winner. Sheryn - Australia.

title: Not only a nicely designed hotel...
text: I like contemporary design hotels around in the world, but I've often found an attitude supposed to be "cool" but that simply make people looking like robots and not humans. At the Dream the staff seems well selected. Everybody tries their best to make the guest comfortable. I was there for business and I had to extend my stay without notice and last minute. I found the kindest collaboration especially from Angela and Tenzin, who did their best to guarantee the lowest prices for the same room as per the booking reservation. They did certainly everything that  was in their power to make me happy. Probably a  special rate or a discount for "long stay"  should be advised to the hotel management,  for those customers who plans their business trips often and they won't change the hotel each time. Thanks to the staff for now if I will be back.

title: Hotel für Personen die das Nachtleben schätzen
text:
Das Hotel liegt in Geh Nähe der U-Bahnstation 16 Street Station und verschiedenen "Attraktionen" wie der Chelsea Market oder das Intrepid Museum. Vom Flughafen JFK kann dauert die An- oder Abreise ca. 45min. Der Eingang liegt neben dem Klub Tao und der Bar "the lately" was den Lärmpegel am Wochenende etwas in die Höhe schnellen lässt. Die Zimmer sind zweckmässig aber in Ordnung eingerichtet, sind sauber und werden jeden Tag gereinigt. Die Isolation (Lärm wie auch Wärme) ist grauenhaft, was jedoch für New York anscheinend nichts Unübliches ist. Wie bereits erwähnt kann man die Nachtschwärmer vom Klub Tao nebenan gut hören. Das Hotel selber verfügt noch über die PH-D Loung Roof Top-Bar welche über das Hotel betreten werden kann. Am Wochenende war der Andrang relativ gross und kann dadurch nicht sagen ob und wie der Einlass funktioniert. Ausserhalb des grossen Andrangs, ist der Zutritt kostenlos und man hat eine gute Aussicht auf Lower Manhattan. Nachtleben findet man im SoHo oder Chelsea zu genüge. 
Das Empfangspersonal ist beschäftigt hilft jedoch gerne aus. Über den Pool kann ich leider nichts sagen, da die Temperaturen einfach zu niedrig waren um ein Sonnenbad zu nehmen. Über das angeschlossene Restaurant «la bodega negra» kann ich ebenfalls nichts sagen, da wir unser Frühstück in den unzähligen Kaffees (z.B. The Grey Dog Chelsea, The Commons Chelsea oder High Street on Hudson) rund um das Hotel eingenommen haben.
Würden das Hotel wieder in Betracht ziehen, sofern wir wieder in New York unterwegs sind. Zu beachten ist, dass das Hotel eher für Personen geeignet ist, welche auch nach einem strengen Tag den Abend lange ausklingen möchten und nicht für jene, die Ruhe suchen.

title: Good location, friendly staff
text: Great styling, good service. Hip and young. Located close to subway and easy to get to theater district, highline, Whitney Museum. Upgraded us to a larger room for free. Manny Moya was so helpful and friendly.

title: Still thrilled by how great the service was.
text:
I stayed at the Dream for 4 nights for work and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. As a nursing mom who was traveling for work without her baby, I made a lot of demands - most of them awkward (like handing reception staff a bag of milk and asking them to immediately run to the freezer and place it in my chiller bag). Having heard horror stories, paranoid me wasn't sure if things were getting done... but by the end of the second day, I was at ease and felt that I could trust the staff to take care of me and my oddball requests. One staff even suggested he called me after the deed was done, just so I don't need to worry. Another put down the work she was doing so she could help me right away, saying "I know this is important to you".

The cherry on top was the kind soul at the door who stood in a downpour for about 20 minutes trying to flag me a cab. He was not only courteous throughout but ushered me into the cab so quickly so I wouldn't get too rained on without even giving me a chance to tip him. When I checked out, the same person automatically helped all my luggage into the cab while I was on the phone.

Let's be clear, this isn't a stuffy business hotel, it's a buzzy boutique-y hotel. There are clubs in the building and there are lots of partygoers strutting their stuff in the lobby. If, like me, you're going to go downstairs for any reason in shorts and a tshirt, unmakeup-ed, and feel that you should've coiffed up and put on a pair of heels, that's something you'll need to bear with. Once I was back on my floor, I couldn't hear a peep from the music downstairs.

All in all, I've travelled a lot, stayed in a lot of hotels, and encountered lots of hotel staff. The team at the Dream hotel is unquestionably some of the most friendly, competent, and considerate people I've come across in a while. So many things could have gone wrong but I finished my business trip on such a high note because my biggest worry (being able to pump and transport my milk home on a 25-hour journey) was easily achieved with the help from the wonderful team at Dream.

title: Girls Weekend worse part
text: Front desk was rude. No hair dryer in the room when we went downstairs to complain about it we were told it was in the cabinet under the sink and it we informed them that we checked and it was not there. Then we were told we should have just called and they would have bought us one up which would have been nice except for the fact that the phone didn't work in the room. Was told the pools open till 8 p.m. however when we went to go to the pool and ask for directions and was directed by one of the staff they sent us to a location where the door was locked thankfully the maid let us in.  However we didn't stay long because the heated pool was cold and bar wasn't open. When we notified staff they told us we went the wrong way and should have accessed to pool from a different location. When we tried to go to the Rooftop Bar you took the elevator up and were informed by what look like the bouncers that we need to have a stamp on her hand so I have to go all the way back downstairs to the lobby and get a stamp to go back up to the bar which I thought was absolutely ludicrous considering the fact that we were staying at the hotel. Will not be back. Not worth the $500 a night price tag.

title: Choose Wisely, Not for Everyone.
text:
We stayed here for three nights in May 2018 in a double/double room.

Pros: Proximity to Cheslea Market. Staff is friendly. Lobby has comfortable seating. Fitness center is well equipped even though it's quite small.

Cons: Uncomfortable beds. Poorly laid out rooms (no room on nightstand, only trash can in bathroom)  Loud (blaring) music in the lobby late evenings and well past midnight.  No coffee makers in the rooms. Rooms are hard concrete with very thin area rug. Mirrors everywhere... rooms, bathrooms, elevators, lobby bathrooms.  

This place definitely has its ups and downs.  My overall impression is that it is more hip than practical or comfortable.  If you'd rather have a pool that looks over the lobby and mirrors everywhere, than a decent bed to sleep on and poorly laid out rooms, than this is for you!  If you care about comfort and basic practicality, you'll probably be disappointed.

title: May 2018
text: We stayed at Dream for both business/vacation and we’re immediately greeted by staff. Location of dream downtown was central to everything! Definitely a trendy hotel, has a fun rooftop nightclub! Rooms and room service food was fantastic. But what had really topped off our stay was the best customer service by Tenzin.
