He had taken care of all of our needs and is the best problem solver! Everything he had done was quick and efficient as well!! Thank you Tenzin for making every night we stayed in NYC absolutely delightful. I would 100% recommend staying and I’d come back to stay at Dream esp bc of the service he had provided. Thank me Tenzin!!!

title: Great Stay & A Great Location
text: Had a very comfortable stay and was happy at how conveniently located the hotel is.  Tenzin was so nice and upgraded my friends and I for our special weekend.  We loved the drinks at Bodega Negra and the entire Dream staff was so friendly.

title: Nightmare at the dream
text:
The king beds are so uncomfortable that it feels like you are on a squeaky pullout couch of your friend. I've stayed at two different king rooms.
I have back pain now and my hips are also aching from the bed.
If you call the front desk, room service, consierge at night when the clubs are noisy and busy, none will pick up your call.
The bathroom floor is all oily. The toilet seat is uncomfortable and high off the floor.

title: Conveniently located
text: The Dream is very conveniently located; this hotel has a famous rooftop bar and an excellent Japanese next door. The rooms are comfortable; some services are upon request: useful to know beforehand. Hairdresser provided inside.

title: Horrid- run. Never again. Blaring noise, rude staff. Worst hotel ever
text: As I write this, I am listening to music blaring from 3 clubs. It is intensely awful and impossible to sleep. My feet are vibrating and I hear crowds of people scream to the DJ and this is a place to sleep? We are here for two nights- 1st night music didn’t stop until midnight, tonight we were informed that it won’t stop until 2am. No housecleaning, no toilet paper. This is the absolute worst experience in any NY hotel I have ever had.

title: Dreamy Dream
text:
Must be my 6th or 7th visit and that probably says it all. 

A special shout out for the Pool staff (it was blisteringly hot so I spent lots of time there), especially Alex, the pool supervisor, who's a star; and the Pool maintenance men, Dragon and Jose. 

What I like best about The Dream is their approach to customer service which is always first class from all the staff - those who work behind the scenes keeping the place clean and tidy, the front desk team, bar staff - everyone.   

Keep it up! I'm back next year with my cousin and can't wait.

title: Desorganizado e barulhento
text:
Se estiver buscando um hotel tranquilo, corra do Dream Downtown.
Fica localizado bem próximo à entrada da hight Line, do Buddakan e novo Tao porém tem um rooftop com boate super movimentado. Seria ótimo se não batesse polícia todos os dias na porta, se os hóspedes não fizessem festa com som nos quartos e se o som da boate não vazasse para os quartos.
Fora a desorganização da recepção.
Na chegada ao hotel sinalizamos que tínhamos 5 diárias em nome do meu namorado e 1 diária no meu nome. O atendente disse que não havia problema mas que para ficarmos no mesmo quarto deveríamos pagar uma quantia aproximadamente a 40$. Pagamos!
Pois no último dia cancelaram nossas chaves de acesso e estavam nos cobrando essa diária. Após muita reclamação, eles viram o erro e nos deram como cortesia a permanecia do quarto que eu já havia pago.
Isto é, o atendente que nos recebeu no primeiro dia embolsou o dinheiro e não atualizou o sistema.
Fiquem espertos! Tranquem o quarto antes de dormirem, tranquem as malas antes de saírem e peçam SEMPRE recibo de qualquer consumo ou transação feita no hotel.

title: It was all a BAD Dream...
text:
I booked the dream for 2 nights over the weekend of my 30th birthday as I wanted my stay in New York to be memorable and special. Unfortunately the stay I was hoping for did not happen... You will be greeted by rude, pretentious receptionist staff that don't seem to understand the cost of a nights stay in the hotel, if they did - their attitude would be different! Oh also, early check in is $75 so don't bother going before 3pm. 

You will be told you have EXCLUSIVE access to all of the hotels facilities - You don't.. If there's a private event (there was private events all weekend) you DO NOT have access. Reception advised  'you can try to queue up and get a stamp with non guests but entry is not guaranteed', obviously this made us feel super special (NOT).... Plus point - you can get up there once the event has finished which was post 3am on the Saturday - Big woop!

I complained via email directly to the hotel as I didn't want to deal with reception and they were understanding and apologetic, they also offered to send a bottle of Prosecco to the room for the inconvenience. After a day out, we returned to the room, no Prosecco. I then emailed to chase and waited nearly an hour (with an added prompt of a phone call) for the Prosecco to arrive. 

The rooms are average at best and I paid an upgrade fee of $50 for a queen room with balcony, the noise from the road outside is insane (especially on a Saturday night) and the drinks at the hotel bar are way too expensive! I can accept all of the above but rude staff and not being able to have FULL access to the hotel facilities when paying so much money is un-acceptable. 

My stay in the Dream for 2 nights was $764 including tax.. When I return, I will be staying in one of the nicer hotels in the area and probably pay less. 

The location and the gentleman that arranged us a cab for the journey home on the other hand are great!

Buh bye.

title: Dream Hotel? More like a nightmare
text:
The hotel was in a trendy location and I will admit the rooms were large (compared to other NYC hotels) but my overall experience was pretty terrible.
I stayed over the weekend and it was more of a nightclub then a hotel. People were being thrown out by security, the police were called to break up fights, it was filled with intoxicated obnoxious people, many of whom were not even staying at the hotel. It was impossible to sleep due to the noises of parties and people CONSTANTLY slamming doors. 
The staff were very rude and the check-in process was terrible
The beds are very uncomfortable and the shower was one of the most poorly designed showers I have ever experience.

title: Birthday Weekend w/ my boyfriend
text: Let me first say i have stayed at this location over 5 times & have always has superior visits. I was thrilled to take boyfriend here for his birthday. Upon check I was informed of a $110 room service charge in which I never made. I advised the person at the desk that We never ordered room service and the time in question in which it was ordered we were never in our room. They sd they would look into it. 2 hours later they inform me that im being charged for ordering it and not answering my door or phone to accept delivery. And then proceeds to tell me everything I ordered. Now I starting to feel like a criminal and have to prove to them where I was the night this supposed charge was made. The way the handled and treated me was very unprofessional. Im an innocent customer of your hotel being charged for someone elses nasty food.... Never will I stay here again! Beware & check your bill!!!! Repeat honest customers are not their priority!!!!

title: Awesome
text: Strategic location, rooms had a lot of space and light. Nice forniture, everything was clean, service was good, breakfast was nice too. Wish I could try the swimming pool the you can see on top of your head while sitting in the hall. There 's also a rooftop where there is a pub But I couldn't manage to enjoy that. Well done!

title: Friendly Staff!
text: This hotel is kind of ridiculous - I was here for business, and the rooftop PHD nightclub and lobby bar/DJ makes it a scene which just feels extra funny when you're grabbing your takeout in sweatpants in the lobby with all these hipster kids around you (seriously, a guy puked on himself in the lobby while I was checking in.. on a Sunday night). The walls are super thin - I could hear conversations and TV (and more) of all neighbors which makes it annoying if you need to rest or work... BUT just want to make sure I shout out the staff and FERNANDO specifically, who was hailing me cabs in the rain with a smile and overall the nicest person there, super helpful, super respectful, I watched him gracefully help many patrons trying to catch ubers and cabs and despite how rude many were, he was a perfect gentleman. Someone give this guy a raise and a promotion, seriously - it's support like Fernando's that can make or break a hospitality experience.

title: Exceptionally Personal Service
text: On a recent business trip to NY, I had a terrible airline experience with delayed & canceled flights that resulted in my arrival in the wee hours of the morning into JFK.  I arrived at the Dream waterlogged and bedraggled only to have everyone from Jane, the Director of Rooms, to the bell staff and the wait staff at Bodega Negra present such a wonderfully warm and accommodating welcome that all my problems washed away.  My whole stay was as great as the first 5 minutes.  I'm coming back Sunday.

title: Bad hotel bad service bad all around
text: This hotel put us in the worst possible room. The fact it is even used as a room given the price is unconscionable. Right on pool level with people constantly walking right past our room and a bar 20 feet away. I will never stay here again and will make sure everyone I know hears about my lousy experience.

title: Hotel branché dans quartier super sympa
text: Un bel hotel design mais malheureusement pour dormir c'est plus compliqué!  C'est extrèmement bruyant!  La salle de bain est toute petite avec une petite douche.  La chambre est bien, j'avais un balcon mais sur la rue donc pas facile!  Toutefois le restaurant - bar en haut de l'immeuble était super avec une vue géniale.  Le quartier est très sympa et branché.

title: Beautiful, clean, great staff and location, just not my cup of tea...
text:
I was in town for 3 days on business. My work put me up here since it's very close to the office.  First, I wonder why they call it Dream Downtown? It should be called Dream Chelsea since it's in Chelsea and not Downtown.
Anyway, check-in was easy. The staff are friendly.  The lobby area is very trendy.
The location is perfect! The ACE Subway line is close, and Chelsea Market is literally right around the corner!
Figuring out how to use my room key to activate the elevator was a challenge. I noticed others had the same issue as I was, so I didn't feel too bad about that. 
Regarding my room, the room was clean, and so was the bathroom.  I liked the stainless steel sink, and the tiled shower with the large shower head that feels like it's raining was terrific. The large porthole windows are a great touch, but  that was where it stopped for me.
1. The bed is literally on a platform, and you're sleeping 8 inches off the floor! There is no box spring, just the mattress on a wooden plank, that's it. I felt like I was sleeping on a friend's mattress in his living room!  I had to sit on the desk chair to get dressed and put on my shoes!  Maybe that's the new trend, but it wasn't my cup of tea to say the least.
2. The shower curtain would not close all the way on both sides, especially with the heavy chain mail that was on it.
3. I could not figure out the light switch buttons which controlled the dimmers to the room.  First of all, when the buttons were not literally FALLING OFF THE WALL, I could not figure out how to turn the lights off or back on in my own room! Once I did figure it out, I somehow activated the Do Not Disturb light outside my room. When I left for work the next morning and came back to my room that evening, of course my room was not made up!  Had there been labels or even basic instructions on how to use these buttons, that would have helped. And the fact that these buttons were literally falling out of the wall didn't help much either.
4. Internet access was spotty at best. It kept dropping, so I gave up on that.
By the way on all 4 points, I had coworkers who were staying here as well, and they had the same issues with their rooms as I did. So I wasn't a lone case on this.

Anyway, when I checked out, I spoke to Bridget at the front desk.  She was very nice, and I told her all of my concerns.  She wrote them all down and asked Engineering to look at the buttons that were falling out of the wall.

If it were not for Bridget's attentiveness and customer service, I probably would not go back.  I do like that it's close to the office and Chelsea Market, but the mattress being literally on the floor still bothers me the most! I'm still on the fence about returning because of this.  Granted, I was only there 2 nights, so it was bearable. But I probably would not stay there for longer than that.

title: Amazing Birthday Experiance, Jane You were the Best!!
text: Stayed their for my Birthday not too Long ago and it was Great! Party was really going on upstairs and it was only 9pm at that time. Views were Sick, location of the hotel was great too and our host Jane was Awesome! Really accommodating, sincere, and genuinely a nice person!

title: Best Hotel in NY- DREAM Downtown
text: Love the Dream Downtown! It's a special place for life and conveniently located by all the great places, Chelsea Market, Gansevoort Market, Whitney Museum, The High Line, Equinox, etc. Everyone was super attentive, genuine, and friendly, felt like home away from home. Exceptional service from Tenzin, Nicole, and all bellmen. The room is luxurious, posh, elegant, and overall felt great to stay. I've been to many hotels around NY for business and vacations, but the Dream Downtown is my most favorite stay, especially because of the great service!

title: Excellent stay
text: This is my second time staying in Dream Downtown. In the first time, 2 years ago, I loved the hotel and booked again this time. It was as good as my first visit. I like the hotel, location and the service quality inside. All the employees are very kind and helpful, thanks to Fernando for helping me arrange the cab and luggages while leaving. Also PHD Rooftop with a wonderful Manhattan view is a must-visit place.

title: Hip Trendy Hotel with disappointing customer service
text:
Overall: Good. Great for clubby & party lovers. Not for those who need a quiet time. Disappointing customer service. Convenient location. I would not return.  

Room: Clean. Comfortable soft mattress and pillows. No coffee machine or tea set at least for lowest-priced rooms. Nice view of the pool but it could be very noisy. 

Wifi - Available in rooms. Slightly slow. You could pay for a higher speed internet. 

Facility: Heated pool, hair salon, gym, cafe, bar, club upstairs - I did not use. 

Customer Service:A blonde long hair receptionist I had for check-in and out had an attitude. Not suitable for a hospitality industry job. Other people I interacted were fine. I booked directly for the deal of possible early check-in, late check-out and one free cocktail. No early check-in was available at noon when I first showed up at the hotel. I asked the receptionist to call me whenever the room was ready but she never called. The complimentary cocktail ticket was only inserted in the room key slot in the morning of check-out. I only noticed it when I left the room for check-out. I did not get to use it. Late-check out was available until 1pm, which was nice. Regular check-out is noon. 

Location: Excellent. Close to 14th/8th subway. Convenient. Close to Chelsea market.

title: What a great find!
text: After looking at quite a few hotels in the nearby area we booked The "Dream" hotel downtown. Boy, was this the right move! The only downside was that it was only for one night! Being in the interior design field, I always look for something special in the room design and overall feeling. The room was modern and chic, the bed super comfy and the view of the pool super fabulous. Not that the room was extra big, it was not, but it had all that we needed and then some. I have stayed in many New York hotels over the years but never made a return visit to any. This is going to be my go to hotel. Already planning my next visit and then a party scheduled there after that. We took advantage of all that the hotel had to offer. This is no sleeper. Between the attached restaurant, the night club, the pool and the hopping lounge we were busy until 4 a.m. :) And the is staff better than all the other hotels put together. From the Doorman's greeting, the friendly (yes, I said friendly) front desk personnel and the easiest check out ever, it remains on my mind a month later. Stay at the "dream". You will not be disappointed!

title: Funky hotel
text:
Great location and great atmosphere. I don't think you can find many other hotels with the NYC feeling that you get here. The reception and bar area is great for an afternoon with friends before going out. The stylish outdoor area with swimming pool is fab. 

But I would like to see the rooms being a bit fresher, and a bit more soundproofed.

title: Désagréable
text:
L’hôtel Dream Downtown est un hôtel branché et bruyant qui convient parfaitement à une jeunesse dorée mais certainement pas à une population qui a dépassé la quarantaine.
Le service est désagréable et les chambres n’ont rien d’élégantes ni de fonctionnelles. Tout petit placard même pour une suite et ne parlons pas de la salle de bain au lavabo riquiqui !
Plus jamais !

title: Dreamy
text: This hotel never disappoints.  As a frequent traveler, there is a certain level of service, atmosphere and aesthetics that I’ve come to expect.  The staff seems to truly care about going that extra mile and providing an elevated experience- and that goes a long way.   The Dream continues to live up to their name and excel across the board.

title: Dream Staff
text:
Mar is the man who helped me and a few friends check into the hotel. My friends and I came in about 5 hours early and although we had to pay a $75 early check in fee Mar was about to upgrade our room from a single bed two a double. 
Once we got up to our room we were met there by Keenan, the baggage man, Keenan was super kind and chatted with us about sports. Being my first time in New York I am extremely excited for what is to come. 
Thank you Dream Staff.

title: Good times
text: Super friendly staff! Had a wonderful stay, met some really cool people & got to go dancing at their in house club, Electric Room. Will definitely come back and I highly recommend staying here whenever you're in town!

title: Cool crowd
text:
We started having drinks at the hotel bar which was great. Friendly staff , good drinks , good looking people to stare at! 
We wanted to go dancing a bit and the bartender suggested Electic room downstairs of the hotel. Music was so dope , really cool atmosphere, drinks were on point, we had a really good time! Can’t wait to go again!

title: Heerlijk bed, beste kussens
text: Hip hotel in fijne wijk om de hoek bij chelsea market. Leuke restaurantjes in de buurt. Zakelijk perfect door de week, super lokatie. in het weekend meer voor de party ganger en hippe New Yorkers. Klein nadeel; geen koffie/thee faciliteit op de kamer.

title: Another great trip to Dream Hotel
text: We love the pool and the nightclubs at the Dream and always recommend it to our friends and family who are looking for a hotel when they visit. The staff is friendly and it feels like the full NYC experience!

title: Dark
text:
At first glance, the hotel is very trendy with low ambient lighting throughout the lobby. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. No complaints there. However, the room also had low lighting which makes it difficult to see how you’ll look once you step outside. 

My biggest complaint is the bedding. It is a low platform bed. The mattress was covered with a down mattress cover with feathers that poke you all night and makes you sweat. Who likes to sleep ON a down mattress cover???  I asked for it to be removed but still found the mattress to be uncomfortable, lacking adequate firmness and support. I woke up with significant hip pain. The sheets felt like they had been washed in sand as I kept having to wipe off tiny fragments of something. 
The bathroom is also “trendy” or in other words, dark. There is really no counterspace. And despite all the seating in this hotel being low, the toilet is awkwardly high, making that equally unconfortable. 
I had a three night stay and didn’t sleep well either night. Would I stay here again?  No!

title: Art direcyor
text: Love this hotel. Not just only the look but people and service. The restroom is well design. I feel so much relax in nyc this trip. Thank you Fernando Molina, you are the best, so friendly and has a big service mind!!!’

title: Volvería una y mil veces
text:
Estuvimos de luna de miel 5 días en este hotel. Habíamos reservado una habitación con vista a la ciudad y pedimos un piso alto. No es nuestra primera vez en NY por lo que ya sabiamos al barrio al que estabamos yendo que para nosotros es nuestro preferido. 
Nuestro vuelo llegó muy temprano, y por suerte nuestra habitación ya estaba lista. Entramos y no podíamos creer la vista que teníamos desde la habitación. Quedamos sin palabras. La habitación de lujo y amplia. Todos los servicios del hotel impecables y todo MUY DIVERTIDO! 
El bar de la terraza tiene unas vistas increibles 360°.
¡¡¡¡¡¡No vemos la hora de volver!!!!!!

title: Awesome location
text:
Stayed here Wednesday - Sunday, the hotel is a bit noisy as you can hear the music from the club, we had to change room.
The service is good.
When you stay in the Chelsea area you are close to everything.

title: Really bad house keeping
text: They took the mat for the shower and didn't replace it with a new one on the first day.  On the second day, they took our only trashcan.  So we ended up putting the trash in one corner of the room.  We didn't get new soap even though we were clearly out on the third day.

title: Tiny rooms, awful service, dishonest staff
text:
Hotel room: Booked a "suite" the room was so small I could not open my suitcase. I was unable to sleep due to the loud music all night from PHD. Room was messy, crumbs on floor, ants on the window, hair on the bed, foul smell coming from the bathroom. POP chips in the mini bar. Who eats pop chips, please tell me?They are disgusting. Total slop pit. Total cost for the room? 485 USD. 

Staff: non existent, rude, uneducated (asked for a restaurant and got a reply are you not from New York), main directive is to squeeze more cash of out of you.

title: Good vibes
text: I really like staying here. The lobby is hip, The rooms are chic and decent size and the beds are comfortable. They have the night club on the penthouse level called Phd and another nightclub in the basement that’s my favorite on Monday nights called Electric Room. The staff is friendly and I told the housemaid I’d give her a nice shot out named Mariam, she’s a doll and gave us extra pillows. I have nothing bad to say about the hotel except that the light switches which are push button in the rooms are kinda confusing at first. And I travel with a hdmi cord so I can plug my MacBook to the tv and the remotes don’t allow me to change the “source” good choice if you plan to stay here.

title: Great location
text: Very stylish and hip hotel, not very luxurious. My sons had room 301, which was very small. We had room 904 which had 3 round windows and was spacious. After looking at the reviews, we were worried about the noise coming from the club and lobby, but we were not at all bothered by the music. The lobby and the hotel bar becomes extremely busy at night which makes it impossible for the hotel guests to enjoy a late night drink in the lobby/bar. Service was good. The location of the Dream is a plus, it is closed to the Chelsea market, the subway is a 5 min walk from the hotel. We recommend this hotel for younger customers.

title: STYLE OVER SUBSTANCE
text:
There is something about new hotels being erected everywhere where the sole aim is to become the next hip and happening hotel to be. The focus is placed on stylish architecture, modern & contemporary artwork, and rooms that create a sense of "wicked cool". Some hotels have been successful in achieving this sense of art nouveau and you find yourself saying, "this is so worth it". Sadly Dream Hotel is not one of them. 

Lobby- Check-in
Upon arriving at the hotel at 1am to check in, we were greeted by a barrage of thumping music and partying right in the actual lobby. The bar area downstairs is part of an open plan concept and you are literally having to shout to get heard by the Front Desk attendant, who I have to say was not impressed by the loud partying going on. Regardless of it being 1am I asked her if this was a regular occurrence to which she replied most disappointedly "yes". And I can concur that on the second night, after returning from dinner and drinks we arrived back at the hotel at midnight to find the crowds gathering for yet another party night for both the upstairs bar and the lobby bar which was slowly turning into a night club. 

The Room:
Our room was located on the third floor of the South Tower. It was a very nice room and the nautical windows are terrific. The stylish sense of decor really gives the room a different feel, and you do feel like you have stepped into the guest room of a NYC celebrity or banker; stylish, chic, and cool. But that is where it ends. The bathroom door does not have have a knob, instead it has a baseball size hole as a handle and while I love my husband, the fact that he can see me sitting doing my business as he walks by just makes it lose that sense of privacy we all love in the bathroom. (not recommended if you are going away with someone you are first dating). There is hardly any shelving or cupboard space and so you find yourself having to find a way to make it work with all your toiletries.  Cupboard space is also lacking in the bedroom wardrobe so be warned if you are having to hang suits and shirts or dresses. You only get half a shelf each and two small drawers. There are also no coffee/tea making facilities in the room so be prepared to go grab a coffee at the nearest Starbucks if you are like me and like a shot of caffeine before facing the world. 

Finally, I am sad to say that the walls are thin and so we found ourselves woken up constantly during the night because of the partying guests who would be making their way to their bedrooms next door. Worse still are the nautical windows which do nothing to prevent the loud sounds of constant honking cars and shouting party goers. Had the hotel invested in triple glazed nautical windows then that would definitely have created a sense of silence and going off into dreamland. Instead we woke up more tired and less rested because of all the broken sleep.

The Gym:
This room, you would hope, should contain modern equipment, which the cross trainer and thread-mills are. However one treadmill was out of service. The weights machines are stiff and non-functional so you find yourself having to use the free weights which is great apart from the fact that the only bench there is broken. 

Sadly this hotel really has gone for style over substance, I can say that the staff are friendly and helpful and overall I would classify the service as good. However, when you pay $350 per night to stay in what is classified as 4 star hotel you expect to get a lot more for your money.

title: OK for business stay
text:
The stay was pleasant and fine. However, it took me 50 minutes to get the proper invoice for my accountant and figure out that we have paid for everything.

Fernando saved my day! Airport taxi, free advices you name it. Happy to see him again sometime!

title: Mediocre Hotel-Great Doorman Service
text:
This was my first time at this property. I try to frequent different areas for different experiences. The hotel itself was “OK” if you don’t plan to spend a lot of time in your room. I stayed in the “Bronze King” and the best part about this room was the SHOWER (amazing temperature, pressure and space for TWO) :-). It is an excellent location as you are minutes away from a lot of cool places. Housekeeping did accidentally take a blouse from the room which I’m guessing because it was white like the sheets. I figured that no one would “know what happened to it” which is a bit disappointing. The staff apologized but didn’t seem interested in assisting any further so my loss! 🤷🏾‍♀️

Shout out to Manny and Fernando who are 2 Bellmen that took great care of me and my partner!! They were very Friendly, Professional, and Resourceful. IF I were return, it would strictly be be because of those two! Keep up the great work fellas!! :-)

title: Easter Weekend/Birthday Getaway
text:
First time I stayed at this property and it was great.  Check in was easy, Service was great, and rooms are clean and well appointed.  The vibe is pretty young and it makes the hotel lobby feels alive. Lobby DJ did a nice job of mixing multiple music genres.
My room faced 17th street and was very quiet which is unlike many other hotels I have stayed at in Manhattan.
Chelsea market is right across the street and all of the Meatpacking District's hottest  clubs and restaurants are within a 5 minute walk.  
The front desk is very helpful in directing you to anything you could possibly need.  Mallory made us feel at home and could not have been more helpful.  This is a great hotel in a great location and I am looking forward to a return visit this summer when the pool is open.

title: Great Place, would reccomend
text: Amazing pool, great little gym, cool decor, friendly staff. I was worried before I got there that some of the reviews were not particularly favourable, but it was honestly great. Sure there is a little noise on a Friday and Saturday (nightclub on the top floor) but the positives are many.

title: Flott hotell,perfekt beliggenhet, mye støy!
text:
Dream Downtown er et fancy hotell med perfekt beliggenhet. 2 minutt å gå til Subway stasjon og Chelsea Market. 3-4 utrolig gode restauranter innenfor 5 min gange, hvor 2 av de tilhører hotellet. Store rom og bad og høyt under taket, veldig god seng. Hotellet vil jeg si passer godt til par og unge evt vennegjenger på party tur. Anbefaler ikke barn og familie dette hotellet da det har en av NY mest populære rooftop nattklubber som har åpent til 04 hver natt. Dårlig isolasjon gjør at du hører musikken og generelt lytt mellom rommene. Stor gjennomstrømning av feststemte mennesker i lobby og heis stort sett hver dag. Rooftop baren er på den andre siden helt fantastisk og veldig verdt å besøke!
God service og utrolig flott interiør. Alt i alt meget fornøyd

title: Favorite hotel in NYC - hands down!
text: Over the years, I've stayed at a number of centrally located hotels in NYC including The Hudson, 6 Columbus, The Westin Times Square, The W, Hotel Wales, The Dominick, The Ritz Carlton Battery Park... Dream Downtown was by far my absolute favorite. I actually had a quiet, restful night's sleep... the neighborhood is fantastic, the decor is beautiful, and the staff were extremely helpful/welcoming. I was able to easily walk to my favorite local restaurants and shops, and just loved being a stone's throw from Chelsea Market. Will definitely be going back.

title: Abysmal Lack of Professionalism
text:
We were in the city to celebrate a special birthday. We reserved a bloc of rooms including the penthouse!
Apathy abounds in this sub par hotel.
I have travelled the world and logged over a million air miles and this was without question, the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I would have been better off sleeping in my car!

title: The Dream Downtown is awesome - and Andy is the best front desk person I have ever met.
text: I had to go to NY for work, and I took the red-eye (from SFO) to minimize the amount of time I would be away from family.  I was super tired when I got to the Dream Downtown and it was also super early, about 6am.  There was no obligation to get me into a room but I was still hoping to get some down time before the first meeting.  Andy was at the desk and he was SO nice, so friendly.  He really made me feel welcome and at that moment I started to feel slightly less depressed about being away from family.  Then he got me into a room despite the early hour and it was a *great* room.  Andy if you ever see this, thank-you for making my stay amazing.   You are the best.  Thank-you a thousand times over, not just for getting me a room at that crazy early hour but for making me feel so welcome in NY.

title: EVERY ASPECT was a dream
text: The dream was one of the most efficient, organized, and beautiful hotels I have stayed at in NYC (and I have stayed at easily 50+). In a city that never sleeps, neither does the staff at the Dream. I was working strange hours and had odd needs from food to service etc, and the entire staff was friendly as well as fast at executing my needs way above average. My room was clean, modern, and gorgeous. Rarely in NYC is every detail so fresh and modern-- but here it is! The staff at the desk as well as some management I interacted with always remembered me and greeted me as a friend. The Dream honestly made my week in NYC feel like home... but better! I couldn't recommend this hotel more strongly.

title: Fabulous hotel and staff
text: From check-in to checkout our stay at the Dream was dreamy.  This was our second stay and it did not disappoint.  The beds are incredibly comfortable.  And I mean *incredibly* comfortable. Dan at the front desk made sure all our needs were met and went the extra mile to make us feel pampered and taken care of in the sweetest way.  Manny at the door was friendly and super helpful as well.  The area is fabulous with the Chelsea Market right across the street.  Thank you Dream staff for a lovely NYC hotel experience!

title: Great hotel with the most friendly service in New York City!
text: We stayed at the Dream hotel because of its location in Chelsea.  We were dining at Del Posto and wanted to be able to walk there, it's only two blocks away.  We were greeted immediately by the very happy bellman.  After unloading our luggage he directed us to the front desk.  It was only noon and the hotel was able to give us our room early because they provided us with a free upgrade.  The hotel has a very energetic young atmosphere.  My wife and I are in our 50's and definitely were one of the older hotel guests but we still felt comfortable.  The room was well designed to make the most of a smaller space in a contemporary fashion.  The bed was extremely comfortable. Chelsea market is only a block away which was a major bonus.  The hotel also had several different bar options which we did not have an opportunity to visit.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is young of heart, the staff does an amazing job and make a guest feel happy.

title: NYC Family Weekend
text: We stayed at the Dream Downtown for an NYC weekend with my family - kids 8 & 10. I stay there often for work and find the staff friendly, the rooms clean well appointed. Special shout out to Manny who was very friendly and nice with the kids, helped us with our luggage, and made sure we had a great trip back to the airport. We will come again!

title: Cooles Cityhotel in bester Chelsea Lage
text: Das Dream liegt direkt am Chelsea Market, einen Block vom Highline Park weg. In der superstylishen Lobby ist immer was los, und Frühstück gibt es entweder beim Mexikaner im Hotel oder in einem der vielen und vielfältigen Kaffees vor der Tür. Wie in City Hotels üblich sind die Zimmer eher klein, aber man ist eh die ganze Zeit unterwegs.

title: 23rd Birthday
text:
I stayed at this hotel for one night for my 23rd birthday and I would be very interested in staying again. For my age group I felt like the vibe and energy of this hotel was right up my ally. We stayed in a gold king room and the view was to die for. I had such an amazing time at this hotel. The room was clean and the shower was perfect.

When I stay at hotels I always go for their breakfast packages so I did the same when I booked my stay at Dream. When we were given the vouchers at check in we were told where to go to redeem them in the morning and we were under the impression that we had paid for everything at that point. In the morning when we went to the cafe we presented the vouchers to the man who greeted us at the door and we asked if we could use our vouchers there before ordering anything. He told us that the vouchers would cover our meal and handed us a menu. My friend had pancakes, eggs, and bacon and I had a waffle, eggs and sausages. We left gratuity on the table. We were shocked to learn at the door and then again at check out that the vouchers only covered part of our meal and that we owed an additional $50+. I really appreciate Elizabeth and Jane for hearing out the situation and waiving the additional cost. It was an honest mistake. I’m happy to say that the customer service is just like in the reviews I read on the hotel when I was looking for a place to stay. Thank you for making birthday so memorable ❤️

title: Manny the door man is the MAN
text:
Manny the doorman is awesome! 
Gotta love him. 
So helpful, so good to his co workers! 
Love him! THE BEST!
Terrific guy! Carried all of the bags- nicest guy, positive attitude! #buymannyamatteblackmaserati

title: Never Disappoints!! Over 50 Stays and Counting....
text: I've stayed at all the "best" hotels in NYC, the "trendy" ones, and the "fun" ones.  This is my favorite place in New York City - hands down.  I've stayed here over 50 times, approximately every other week.  Dan Farley at the front desk is a true professional, makes the guests each feel important and appreciated, and consistently ensures that each stay is perfect. Room service is quick and runs 24/7.  Food is great.  In the summer, I recommend the SK Pool rooms in the south tower facing the pool.  If you have an opportunity to get the Guest House, it's worth it.  Get it.  It's a unique New York City experience and there's no other room in the City like it.  Also, reserve a spot at the pool in the summer.  Check out Phd and Electric Room in the evening.  Have breakfast at Botega Negra.  Step out and explore Meatpacking.  But first, be sure to stay here!

title: not a hotel for middleaged!!
text:
Having travelled to New York 11 times in the last few years and having stayed in very good hotels mostly in midtown we decided to try the Meat Packing district for a change.
While the area is really lovely and very different from the hustle and bustle of midtown, the atmosphere felt a little flat.  Having said that, if I lived in New York this is where I would like to live.

The hotel, however, is not a hotel I would visit again.  We had problems from the moment we booked in.  We had booked two rooms, one was not ready (this was 4 o clock in afternoon) and cleaning staff were very rude to us.

Noise level was awful, rooms were not cleaned sufficiently and mayhem at hairdressers salon on way to lifts was incredible.  There was not enough room for guests to sit while waiting for friends to meet in lobby lounge.  It was obvious those taking up seats were not guests.  This area seemed to be a meeting area for young New Yorkers.  Wonderful for them but not for guests.

Cleaning staff were quite rude and often jumped ahead of us getting into lifts (which were not working well) pressing button to their destination leaving us longer in lifts than necessary.  

All in all I would advise people to investigate the many, many other good hotels in wonderful New York.

title: Great bellmen!
text: The bellmen at the hotel were so welcoming, helpful and friendly! Specially, Fernando who not only helped me with all of my bags (there were a lot) through the slush and snow but also gave me some great Netflix recommendations as well! Such a nice guy! The bellmen gave me a great first and last impression of the hotel.

title: Fernando is the best
text: I was staying here during a work trip so didn’t really spend too much time in the hotel, but upon my departure, Fernando, one of the Bellman made a lasting impression! So incredibly nice and genuine, gave us tips for the best ride service to get to JFK on a stormy morning. Honestly, one of the nicest people. Thank you Fernando!

title: Tolle Location, enttäuschendes Frühstück
text:
Im Rahmen eines Firmenevents nächtigste ich hier einige Nächte. Das Hotel ist super chick under modern eingerichtet, mit viel Liebe zum Detail. Der Ausblick aus den Zimmern ist grandios, ich hatte Glück und direkten Blick auf das Empire State Building. Einige Kollegen von mir hatten nicht das Glück und hatten nur den Blick in eine Hinterhofstrassenschlucht, bei der Buchung also aufpassen, wenn einem das wichtig ist.
Auf jeden Fall einen Besuch ist die Lounge auf dem Dach, auch wenn die Cocktails hier wohl aus Sicherheitsgründen nur aus edlen Plastikbechern ausgeschenkt werden.
Eine echte Enttäuschung war aber leider das Frühstücksbuffet, daher ein Punkt Abzug.

title: Consistently great!
text: Dream Downtown did it again!  I love the contrast of the "buzzy NY vibe" when you enter and the modern beauty and quiet of a mid-level room.  My last visit I had a view of the Empire State Building - awesome!  The service is top notch, with wonderful management, desk and door staff.  AND - the location can't be beat.  Across from Chelsea Market, a short walk to the West Village.  I can't recommend highly enough.

title: St Patrick's Day & Night in NYC
text: Modern and sleek decor throughout the Dream Hotel. Very comfortable accommodations and impeccably clean! Very welcoming and accommodating staff as well- A++ in my book 👍😊 Will be our "go to" place for future overnights in NYC!

title: Great hotel, great location and incredibly friendly staff
text: I typically stay at the Dream when I visit NYC for work and I always have a great experience at this hotel.  Angela at the front desk is super friendly and helpful in addition to all of the staff at this hotel.  I would recommend the Dream Downtown to anyone for business or pleasure.

title: Fab hotel !!
text: What a stunning hotel, and in a great location. This is my 6th visit to the DDT, and it just gets better & better, from the greeting from at  the door by Fernando, who always know who I am, which makes a huge difference in a city like New York, through to the front of house staff, bar and waiting team - they all work hard to make any visit to tthis hotel special.

title: Best Doorman Ever
text:
I have been to New York on business several times, but this was my first time at Dream Downtown. The hotel is in a great location with a good vibe, but this review is for the guy who made my stay: Fernando Molina. 

Very personable and thoughtful, Fernando asked if I needed a cab or anything else, right after I checked out. We had a great conversation as I waited for my ride and I couldn't help but think about his world class service and how it makes each guest feel welcome. 

I would definitely stay here again and hope that Dream Downtown hangs onto Fernando; he's one of the good ones.

title: NY Chelsea
text:
Excelente hotel! Se encuentra ubicado a 60 metros de la salida del subte, con el cual se puede llegar desde el aeropuerto JFK por usd 10 por persona. 
La habitación es amplia, bien climatizada y con unn baño que tiene una ducha digna para viajeros. 
A la vuelta del Chelsea Market, Gooseevart Market, y tan solo 10-15 minutos de la Bleecker St (sitio llenos de restos/bares).

title: Anniversary
text: The icing on the cake. I have to give this hotel a 5 star rating. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted very professional by Fernando Molina.  He was very informative and provided the best location to make my anniversary special. The service didnt stop there, anything I needed he made possible. Throughout my stay everyone was great but this gentleman gets special thanks and recognition. Thank you Dream Hotel, and shout out to Fernando.

title: Will Probably Return!
text: Really nice hotel in the "Meat Packing" district where we were visiting relatives.  The front desk personnel were professional & caring.  The hotel cafe's food was wonderful while the service was sketchy.  Our room was lovely except for the platform bed which was too low to easily get in & out of.  Fortunately at our ages of 59 & 65 & not into the 'Club' scene, our room was far enough removed to avoid the 'Club' scene noise; South Tower Room 438.

title: Awesome stay!
text: Unbelievable Hotel, location and staff. Mallory at the front desk handled our check in, all requests throughout the stay and check out. She remembered us by our name and room number. We will definitely be back!

title: will be back!
text: Loved the location of this hotel and especially the staff! Johan at the door took his time to give me the best deal on a car service back to the airport and Angela at the front desk was lovely and recommended an amazing Italian restaurant! They both took the time to give quality service and for that it changed my whole experience.

title: Amazing Experience
text: I had an AMAZING stay here and the staff made it even better. Neglin was EXTREMELY welcoming at the door who then walked me to the front desk where he dropped me with Angela and she made my stay much better. She was very helpful and greeted me everytime she saw me in the lobby. Neglin and Angela are great staff! The hotel itself is beautiful and vibrant! Will DEFINITELY return!! LOVED it!!

title: Don't waste your time here unless you are a party goer
text:
What a disappointing stay!!

First of all, the rooms are so small, but that is probably true of Manhattan in general.

As other guests have mentioned, the hotel is so loud and music thumps in the rooms till the early hours of the morning (even though we were on the fifth floor).

The bed was a real shame. To call it a bed is actually unfair. It was more of a spring mattress put on a wooden platform. We struggled to get any sleep at all throughout the night.

The lights in the room work really weirdly. It's next to a popular night club, so all the nuisance if you are just looking for a quiet stay.

I asked for 2 extra blankets so I could sleep on the floor somehow, but the miserly folks only dropped off 1.

Not a good vibe at all at this place.

title: Mark L:  Stayed there for MONTHS - Shout out to Fernando!
text: I stayed at this Dream for several months in 2017.  The staff and service were AMAZING.  A special shout-out to Mallory ... best concierge/customer manager EVER, and Fernando, out front.  Fernando could not do enough for you.  He treated everyone SO special...I still go by just to see him and say hello!

title: Friday feb 23rd 2018 stay
text: The service I received from the staff on this particular night was very good and I was very happy with how they greeted me and took care of my need on Friday feb 23rd, Angela Bombara at the front desk was very warm and inviting, Neglin at the front door was extremely kind and took care of my needs, plus Mallory Matoush who also works at the front end went above and beyond for me. I really appreciated the service they provided.

title: My TOP pick
text: I am a frequent guest at both uptown and downtown Dream Hotels. I love the company for it's great staff especially Angela! I recently just visited for the weekend with friends and her exceptional service stood out to me and made my stay so wonderful. Dream is always my GO TO spot and staff members like Angela is the reason for why I always choose Dream.

title: Fernando was great!
text: Fernando was fantastic! He was so helpful with our bags.  He ran to the corner to get cabs for us.  Fernando is friendly and really made us feel special.  I’m glad he was working while we were staying at the hotel.

title: Dream NYC Downtown is great
text:
I like staying here -- it's close to the office for business trips. I've stayed three times and every time has been great.
  Shout out to Fernando, super helpful doorman at the Dream!

5 stars, will return again

title: Awesome location and friendly staff
text: I stayed at the Dream Downtown hotel for a conference and got a preferred rate.  The location is fantastic - right around the corner from Chelsea Market.  The staff are very friendly and willing to help.  The room was good - a little funky and modern.  The shower water pressure was terrific and it had all of the amenities.  I would have liked a little bigger desk to work from.  Definitely a great choice to stay.

title: Wonderful Guest Service
text: I am visiting from Charleston, where southern hospitality is a common business trait. Visiting New York is always a treat and its especially delightful when you recognize the same customer service in such a hustle&bustle city! Angela at the Dream Hotel in Midtown was absolutely wonderful! I couldn’t find a nearby hair salon to accompany me last minute so she made a few pulls to get me in, this was above and beyond! Highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure!

title: Great Anniversary Stay!
text: Great experience from Check-in to Check-out. Definitely have to give a mention to Fernando whom was very professional & made me not want to leave. But I will definitely book another stay once the weather gets warm! Thanks again Fernando!

title: Great weekend
text: We enjoyed our stay.  Comfy beds, beautiful funky place.  PHD and the lounge downstairs were fun spots with great music.  Fernando the doorman is fantastic and helped us to connect quickly with our driver.

title: Awesome stay at the Dream
text:
Had a fantastic time! Beautiful suite that opened up to the pool area that was also quiet, which is always a plus NYC! 
Daniel Farley made the quick stay seamless and fun! He arranged all reservations that were spot on in the area and he couldn’t been any better. Five star.

title: Great Hotel
text: Rooms were clean and well furnished. Service was excellent. Staff there are extremely friendly. I definitely will be back. Shout-out to Fernando Molina in particular for extremely helpful advice as I was new to NYC.

title: Great views, hip and upbeat Property
text: Stayed here for a work event. Lobby is amazing- unexpected artifacts that are eclectic; super vibe. Only stay here if you like loud music and enjoy a fresh, modern staying experience. I had an 11th floor room and I could hear the music until about 3am as there is a club on the Penthouse floor. Room had UNBELIEVABLE views of the city and the area is spot on. I typically stay in the Time Square area- the Chelsea neighborhood had a lot to offer. Walking distance to Joyce Theater, High Line, retail and more! Will be back to the area. I wouldn’t bring my kids here- in fact I don’t think I saw any. It’s a great place for partygoers. Check-in was meh, I didn’t get the info about breakfast, amenities like I overheard someone else getting. Asked about a restaurant and the first answer was “she didn’t know” not, let me look this up or talk to the concierge. Valet staff was super attentive. Fernando helped and arranged a car and was really nice about making sure my needs were met. 👍

title: Dream away in the cloud beds
text:
The only problem with this hotel is the beds are so comfortable, you don't want to get out of them. 

The Pool is amazing but crowded on the weekend. I live 3 blocks south of the hotel and took my lady friend for her birthday. It was the perfect summer escape from the heat of the city, while keeping it hot in this romantic escape. 

The portal windows everywhere is a unique touch that really makes this hotel stand out. But the cloud beds is where its ad. 

Get to the pool early to get a spot.

title: Very Thankful
text: I had a minor booking issue between a travel agency but Angela from the front desk was so sweet and helpful! She made sure I was taken cared of being that I'm not from New York. I really appreciated her kind gestures and hospitality. She gets 5 stars! Thank you, Angela, for your warm spirit.

title: Great Service
text: It's my second time here in the hotel for work and I wanted to take a second to thank two special employees. I genuinely appreciate the exceptional service that Angela in the front desk and Steven the bellman have given me thus far. I have stayed in many hotels but what sets one hotel apart from the next is always the service so there's no doubt that I will be coming back here again.

title: A night at the Dream
text: Very comfy beds. I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud. The staff was very helpful. A special thanks to Mar and Mallory Matoush. I was only at the hotel cause I didn’t want to commute back home to Westchester after a long day at work and they made my stay wonderful. I’ll definitely be back.

title: So Thankful
text: Here for a grueling week of work and I had a small issue with my room that was giving me added stress I simply couldn't handle. However small my dilemma, Angela at the front desk made it her priority to put me completely at ease. She really did go above and beyond and made my stay so special. I couldn't be anymore thankful for such amazing service. Employees in hotels too often don't realize the value in actually servicing your clients well. Angela  gets it and I appreciate her so much for it.

title: Accomodating/Friendly Staff
text:
My boyfriend ran into booking issues between his company's travel agency, but Angela from front desk was patient enough to help him through. Luckily, he was able to upgrade to a gold king suite from a queen. I was impressed with her professional manner in handling the tricky situation and her dedication to fix the problem which almost made her work overtime! 

My key card wasn't working well either and we did miss some toiletries/bath robes, bu she took care of it right aways. Angela is incredibly reliable and always have great recommendations too!

The hotel is spankin cool with a 24 hour gym, pool/deck, sweet club like decor, with an actual club on the rooftop. I also love the art installations they bring in seasonally to support various philanthropic causes. Yup, they're also social media post worthy. 

Overall, I love how timely the services were and the staff was very friendly and made me feel valued and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel for its great service and convenience location!

title: Excellent Service and Wonderful stay!
text: When taking a bite of the big apple, I love staying at the Dream Downtown! The vibe is great and the service is exceptional. Fernando is the real MVP! Simply a great guy, willing to go above and beyond to make your stay comfortable. I will return soon thanks!

title: Excellent Service - Especially Fernando
text: Love staying at the Dream Downtown! The atmosphere is amazing and the service is great -  seeing Fernando outside in the mornings is the highlight of my day. Such a great help & nicest man I’ve ever met! I’ll surely be back.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: From the time we checked in until we left, the Dream was wonderful! Angela, at the front desk, went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. She gave us a fabulous dinner recommendation and each time we were in the lobby, she greeted us by name. The room was very nice and had all the amenities -we will definitely be back!

title: Great location in Manhattan but room for improvement
text: This hotel is in a fantastic location right near so many places to eat and drink.  Don’t book breakfast there are so many options for this that it would be a shame to miss.  Rooms were ok. Beds a bit odd and lumpy and probably a bit old.  Could have done with more hanging space as this was very limited.  But don’t stay here if you want a quiet time.  The walls are thin and you will hear the music when the bar/club is pumping and it doesn’t stop until 4am.  Reception and concierge and door staff were all very nice and helpful.  Shame the same cannot be said for the bar and security staff who were not very friendly or helpful at all.  But all in all not a bad stay.

title: Never Disappoints
text: Stay here everything we come to New York; staff is great and rooms are as well. Location is ideal as tons of food, drinks, and things to do within walking distance or short cab ride. Thanks to Fernando for helping with our bags as we checked out!

title: AMAZING!
text: Amazing stay thank you so much, loved the hotel it was such a great place to be alone and everybody was so super nice! A huge shoutout to my doorman Fernando who helped me get a cab in the rain and carried my suitcases out such a gentleman, happy birthday! 😁

title: My second home!!
text: Where do I begin?! I live about an hour outside of Manhattan. When I'm ready to enjoy an overnight, this hotel is my go to! The staff welcomes me with open arms from top to bottom. Whether it's Fernando the valet, or Mallory the Guest Services Manager, or the bouncers at the nightclubs(and in essence there are several) no question or need is left unaddressed. I have stayed at this hotel countless times. It's location is primo and offers excellent dining opportunities too! I cannot wait until the pool opens this summer. Please give this venue a try! Tell them Angel sent you! Enjoy all!

title: Days Inn disguised as hip hotel
text: Extremely overrated, essentially a roadside motel masquerading as a hip hotel. Everything about this is horrible. For example, the curtains don't stay in place or don't fully close. They are placed so far from the window that the gap essentially allows the sun to rise inside your room. They only have two wine glasses in the room, and you can't fill them with tap water because the stems are too high. There is no body lotion among the toiletries. The mattress feels like it's been bought second hand after a good 10 year run in some suburban basement. Pretty much nothing has been thought of. No outlets by the bed so you can't charge your fun. The most unfriendly and pretentious check in personnel; one felt personally disturbed during check in because she felt I interrupted her class work--she was reading an intro chapter on government studies. No smiles, no friendly attitude, don't even look you in the eye. I'd just say never again here unless they put a gun to your head. I know all NY hotels pretty much suck, but at least some don't pretend to be cool.

title: Loved
text: This place is really amazing! Cant wait to come back soon! Thank you Lauren for being such an amazing host, she made us feel like we are home! So fun.. great bellman Johan the rooftop bar is great for a nightcap..

title: Dream come true
text: Booked a room at the Dream for some friends who were coming out of town and wanted to stay in the neighborhood. Lauren was amazing at helping me get all of those little details right. The hotel is wonderful, but the staff is what really makes it a “dream”. Will be back for sure!

title: Mixed feelings of the cool hotel
text:
Pros: Swanky and clean, cool decore, great location, polite staff.
Cons: there IS a club somewhere in this place that rocked my room until 6am. When front desk was asked about it the stated they knew nothing about it. I now know from other reviews that this is false and they choose to ignore and deny it. Luckily it only happened one night of our stay. Not a place for kids. No no machine available, no complimentary coffee and no room in the fridge unless you want to be charged a fee for removing items. Nickel and diming.

title: TRULY a dream!!!!
text:
I’ve had the pleasure of staying at the dream downtown twice now, the first time was in the heat of summer. The hotel has a great summer scene with their pool deck & next level delicious frozen cocktails. 

With 12 guests flying in from all over the country and abroad, when it came time to book my bachelorette party, The Dream Downtown seemed like the obvious choice. From start to finish, my friends and I received the best and most gracious hospitality I have ever experienced. Everyone from the doormen, front desk staff, cleaning staff, & PHD staff were amazing. 

We were helped at check in by Tenzin, the hotels front office manager. He spent significant time rearranging our rooms for us so we could be on the same floor in close proximity. He emailed me through out our stay making sure we were having a great time, he even gave his personal contact information on his days off so I could reach out should I have any questions. To top it ALL off, he sent a bottle of champagne to our room to congratulate me. Hands down the best hotel management I have ever seen. 

Aside from the incredible staff, the hotels convenience is also unparalleled. The hotel itself is home to incredible night life and dining, and in close proximity to many of New York’s best (in my opinion) attractions. It was 14 degrees almost everyday of our trip, and we managed to never leave a 3 block radius and still have the BEST time. 

We spent ended up spending two nights at PhD it was so fun. The hotel generously allows complimentary entry to guests before 930pm. The views are some of the best manhattan has to offer. If nightclubs aren’t your scene, even the lobby bar is incredible (and Wednesday nights DJ has the best moves in the game). 

We were in New York for a party, but I would recommend the Dream to absolutely anyone. Our rooms were SO quiet and comfortable, we didn’t hear city noise or our neighbors once. 

As a former resident of NYC my biggest regret now is not spending more time at the dream! I still visit the city around 5-6 times a year and the dream downtown is my new go to hotel. 

Thank you, thank you, thank you, Tenzin & the rest of the staff at Dream Downtown... you made my bachelorette party SO special for my guests and I. 

Sincerely,
Your new biggest fan 
Lizzy Thongpaithoon

title: Fabulous hotel, great location
text:
We frequent NYC quite a bit, and know the neighbourhoods quite well. First time in Chelsea and have to say this is a fabulous location. This hotel was awesome, room was great bathroom modern and huge. Hotel was a stunning rooftop terrace bar that is quite happening so if u come for the scene this is a great place. Next door to Tao walking distance to meat packing district so really well situated. Chelsea great for walk around to eat. Great breakfast places in area too. Close to soho and the village so really terrific way to see the city. Would definitely recommend for people coming to NYC for first time since this is a better vibe than staying in touristy mid- town or Times Square. Better to walk to those locations and stay at this hotel.
Also the Mexican resto in hotel is fabulous-drinks are lethal!

title: Sexy
text: Great hotel, love lobby decor, music/DJs a plenty!  Room was more spacious than I was expecting (2 double beds for 4 people) but the cold, modern, clean/white style of room is not for me.  No street noise, but walls seemed thin.  Don't touch the mini bar unless you plan to pay...literally it is touch sensitive!  A very cool place for a girls night out as it has great restaurants in and around the hotel and a club on the roof.  It must be even better in the warm weather!

title: One of the BEST hotels in NYC!
text: The Dream hotel is by far my favorite place to stay while vacationing in New York. The staff is nothing short of professional and accommodating (special shoutout to Yelena for being SO GREAT with our reservation after we had to reschedule our trip due to weather issues). The front desk staff is friendly, prompt and helpful (another shoutout to Stephen for being so organized and taking such good care of our belongings. You’re awesome, Stephen!) Overall, hotel vibe was fantastic, late night room service was PERFECT (because who doesn’t want guac and chips at 4am?), and staff was great. Definitely recommend!!

title: Perfect night
text: Recently stayed  the weekend for my friends birthday and Angela was very hospital and accommodating towards our whole group! Location was great and phd was the perfect night out. I highly reccomend this hotel

title: The Best Escape
text:
Dream Downtown is my favorite escape in NYC. I have been staying here for 3 years now and still can't get enough. It is our go to for staycations and we have a great experience each and every time. Whenever I need a weekend pick me up or an effortless summer retreat, we find ourselves booking our next stay. There are countless reasons why I would recommend Dream Downtown. The service, ambiance, location, guest relations, and amenities are hard to beat. The whole Dream Downtown team has been super accommodating for each of our visits. If you are looking for an exceptional hotel, awesome vibe, perfect location, friendly staff, and a comfortable hotel room, look no further than Dream Downtown. I highly recommend the pool rooms for convenient pool access in the warmer months and the beach party vibes being steps from the comfort of your room. 

Tenzin is amazing and ALWAYS goes above and beyond with spontaneous reservations and miscellaneous requests. He is one of the reasons why it has been so easy to return each time to Dream downtown. Also a special thanks to Angela who was a great help for our most recent stay!

title: Meh...
text:
I booked on Trip Advisor and got a great deal! 

First off: it is BEAUTIFUL. Second: The room was a lot smaller than anticipated. I ordered a deluxe room with a king size bed. The bed took up the majority of the room. The balcony over looked the side street. Mehhhh...

Don't even think of going up to the rooftop bar at night. It is a see and be seen for 21yr olds. Also, the elevators after 9pm are chock full of drunk people being drunk. Okay, so maybe if I were a college student on my first tip to NYC, I would love it. 

The remote control for the tv didn't work :( they promptly brought a new one. 

I would not stay again but, again, if I could time travel, I make reservations there as a feisty and hip young person.

title: Best Refuge Ever
text:
I live in miami but visit NYC often, and when the hurricane hit in early September I fled straight to the city. I stayed at the Dream for almost 2 weeks; and honestly didn’t want to leave. Manny was so helpful; always said hi when I’d head down to bodega for lunch, get me car services or flag down Uber’s, and even let me know about sales in the area. 
I haven’t been back since, but my next trip up there I’ll be so excited for my Uber to drop me off on 16th between 8th and 9th :)

title: Another nightmare here
text: We spent a sleepless night due to 2 parties in the room above us and then the room behind us. It felt like our room was a club, the music was so loud and the ventilation system piped all the MJ in - don’t bring your kids to this hotel. After 2 fights in the hallway outside our room, we were done, and frankly scared. We called to reception multiple times but either they too were scared of the fights or enamored of the guests who were presumably spending more on the minibar than we were. Won’t ever go back.

title: My 2nd stay was better than my 1st!
text:
Great hotel with INCREDIBLY friendly staff...Marjuan(sp) and Manny specifically couldn’t have been kinder. Incredibly gracious to my wife & I.
Quick room service & perfect location in the heart of Chelsea...walking distance to some of my favorite restaurants!

title: Thank you Angela!
text: Location great.  Restaurant and nightlife great.  Service is EXCEPTIONAL.  Thank you to Angela from the front desk for making my experience memorable.  When people follow up with you it makes you feel special and those are the memories you keep with you. Thank you for making my stay what it's been thus far.  I've stayed several times at Dream in the past and you ensured I'll be coming back.

title: Funky hotel in great location
text: Cool design and well located in meat packing District. Staff very friendly. Easy access to clubs like PhD, Electric Room and TAO. Furniture and installations are somewhat dated but overall a great hotel. We even had a view from our room!

title: Amazing all around!
text: I stayed for a weekend and when I got there I was greeted very nicely by Angela at the front desk. She helped me out a lot and was so sweet! Customer service is one of the most important things when staying at a hotel!

title: Dream = Nightmare
text:
When I first arrived, the checkin staff was so preoccupied with her phone that I was surprised she could be bothered to check me in.  It was around 11PM, so I guess she was no longer expected to be hospitable.  I've seen a better service attitude at a Del Taco in Lubbock, TX than I experienced at the Dream.  

I should have taken that as a warning to find another hotel right away, because the constant drum beat from the club upstairs reverberates through the paper thin walls of this hotel. I was in room 820 - supposedly the "quiet section", but every night of my stay I was awoken around midnight or later by the incessant thudding from the music.  Sleeping at the foot of the bed made it almost tolerable, as my head wasn't right up against the echoing wall.  And it just doesn't stop until sometime around 3-4AM.

Bizarrely, they've chosen to position glowing light switches right at the head of the bed, along with a phone with a large blue-backlit screen.  Those merely serve to exacerbate any attempts to sleep during the constant pounding of the music.
I could also hear every conversation in the room next to me as well, even when sitting across the room from the shared wall.

And forget trying to watch TV, unless you either want to watch the same station the whole time, or you're OK with standing directly in front of the screen.  That's the only place where the remote control worked, other than the on/off and volume buttons.

To make things worse, there was no hot water the first morning of my stay, which -- after a mere 2-3 hours of sleep -- was the icing on the cake.

After letting the manager know of my experience, my incredible compensation for my troubles was a free breakfast coupon.... at the hotel.  As if I'd trust another area of service at the hotel to display a higher level of competence than the rest.  Thanks, but no thanks.

Had it just been one night, I would have chalked it up as anomalous.  But those were the longest FOUR NIGHTS of my life.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
I stayed there for a weekend. Such a beautiful hotel. Rooms are very small, but is part of New York attributes. Big buildings, small rooms. Very tech, everything was connected. Even though the hotel is located in a night life district, and has one party rooftop PHD, and very nice bar in the lobby, you cannot make much noise in the rooms. We had visits from the lobby asking to be quite and actually we weren't noisy. But rooms are small, so you can hear everything. 
So, for my perception is highly recommended for party not for resting, is too busy the hotel and the location for family or business.

title: Amazing weekend stay!
text:
My Wife and I recently stayed for a weekend and upon arrival received a warm greeting from Angela at the front desk. She walked us through the check in process and helped with a few things to do in the area.  Frank at Concierge was extremely helpful in suggesting dining options. we stayed in a Gold King room with a beautiful view and the amenities were nothing less than expected. Dream is our first choice to stay when in NYC 
Steven V

title: Great experience!
text:
My girlfriend and I stayed at dream downtown for the first time together back in November and it was a great experience. Manny was there when we arrived and was very helpful, outgoing and kind. He made sure we would taken care of and volunteered to help us out if we had any questions. We’ll definitely be coming back soon and looking forward to another great stay.

Thank you Manny and Dream!
See you guys soon.

Jimmy

title: Great place
text: I Love coming to the dream when in New York. Close to cool spots like Tao restaurant, and the roof top bar always has a great atmosphere. Manny at the door is always helpful and makes checking in easy

title: Birthday Weekend
text: I just checked out of Dream on Monday, making it my 4th stay there. I love everything about the place - from the atmosphere, food, service, and staff. Thank you to Andy and Manny for making it a memorable experience. Andy helped secure reservations and accommodate us with an early check in, since we took a red eye. He made sure to follow-up whenever he saw us to make sure my group and I were having a great time. Manny greeted us with a smile as soon as we arrived and helped us with our bags. He even got us two cars to the airport when were leaving. They both went out of their way and we appreciated it so much! Until next time Dream!

title: Weekend stay
text: It never fails, Dream Downtown always comes through. I stay here every time I visit New York in January. The staff and service is always amazing, especially because of Andy and Manny. They’re friendly and helpful from the moment I book until I check out. My whole group of 8 appreciated them. Thank you for making it yet again another memorable stay! I’ll definitely be back.

title: Great staff.
text: Second time around at the hotel, stayed for a week. All in all another good stay. Great location, spacious rooms. Some hiccups with partying groups over the weekend (maybe avoid 2nd floor?) yet swiftly dealt with. What makes the stay all that more pleasant is the professional yet easy going staff, from reception to housekeeping. In particular, Many (spelling?) was of great help with arranging transportation/answering Qs/ managing my extra luggage (many thanks!)

title: Perfection/Stellar guest services
text: Perfect second stay and couldn’t be more happy! Daniel Farley went above and beyond to make our stay so special! He made all the accommodations we requested and even exceeded! The service, staff and grounds are 5 Stars/stellar experience. Cannot wait to return. Best hotel hands down. Thank you Dream Downtown!!!

title: great location, great service, great hotel
text:
Concierge - spectacular service, always available, proactive, permanently willing to help
Location very funcional - near good restaurants, chelsea market, clubs, etc..
Room/amenities - met all my expectations
Service - all people are so kind and proactive to help you solve issues

title: Beautiful Hotel, awesome staff!
text: We travel to spent NYE in this hotel, we had a great time. The staff is incredibly attentive and they treat you amazing since you get there until you leave. Our favorite was Manny, he was amazing and extra helpful. We'll be definitely coming back.

title: Modern
text: Great modern hotel on an amazing location. The hotel is very modern,  very happening. If you want something quiet, this may not be for you. There is a night club in the same hotel, so there will be a lot of people in the lobby. Although the rooms are very quiet.

title: Great Stay, Great Staff
text: I booked a last minute stay and it was great. Beautiful room, great location. I was worried about noise, but there was none. Angela @ the front desk was amazing, extremely accommodating, and welcoming.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: A Cheap Modern Aesthetic that seeks to Disguise Poor Service and Thin Walls
text:
Have you ever walked into a hotel, and after two minutes of being checked in, been pushed to write on trip advisor, give 5 stars, and mention the person who just checked you in?

That was my first 5 minutes in this hotel; so if you like pushy, self-serving service, this is the place to go. And it only got worse after that. Just a few notes of that this property has to offer:

1) Wifi at glacial speeds, of course with the option to pay for decent ones
2) Thin walls, allowing you to hear every nuance of your neighbours conversation
3) A bathroom door handle that is really just a hole in the door, allowing you to enjoy hearing your guests doing their business
4) A minibar that gets its own lighting, so you're reminded to buy their overpriced wares while trying to sleep
5) A bellman who gives gives you the wrong price of a cab, and doesn't respect your need for an itemized receipt for reimbursement purposes

This was a very poor hotel service. If you'd like people to give you cheap smiles and try to take advantage of you under the guise of service, book with Dream Downtown.

title: Perfect stay every time
text: Our stay at the Dream was perfect. The location is great, and the staff is super helpful. A super big thank you to Andy at the front desk for being so accommodating and making our stay even more memorable. I'd highly recommend staying there and I'll most definitely be back soon.

title: Dreamy Service
text:
Quick Trip to NYC ended with the lovely assistance of Manny at the front door. After  checking Lyft and Uber’s insane surcharges I knew I had no choice than to stand out in the freezing cold and hail a cab. Luckily, just as I was walking out Manny, of the Dream Hotel, asked if I needed help with transportation. He quickly jumped out to hail a cab and all with a sincere smile. Poor guy walked out even further and could not get one but, instead worked it out with the nice and plush Cadillac SUV out front for the same (ish) flat rate. 

Now, I’m comfortably on my way to the airport without an insane Uber surcharge that I would have had to explain to the boss lady later. 

Thank you, Manny!

title: Great Stay!!!
text: My stay at the dream was amazing. I also had outstanding help from Andy at the front desk. He mad my stay even better than it already was. I already recommended the hotel to others ! I plan on staying there soon . Maybe try out a suite !

title: Very Special Occassion
text:
Dream makes dreams come true 

We had an outstanding time , staff was very welcoming and so much thanks to Andy for taking care of us and making sure me and my wife enjoyed our stay . Roof lounge was very appealing and the rooms are  very clean and well kept .

Again thank you Dream Hotel ! 

W & K Cruz !

title: Manny is amazing!
text:
I stayed at the Dream in 2017 and it was my first time in New York. Manny was amazing. He was always smiling, helpful, and kind. Every time I walked through those doors he took the time to ask how the day was, if he could do anything at all for us, and did it all while staying super genuine. Having Manny at the Dream really made our stay at the hotel what it is was, and when he wasn't by the door I could feel his absence!

I'd suggest the Dream Downtown 100% and, if you see Manny, let him know Parmis says Hi!

title: Great Service
text: My boyfriend and I had a pleasant stay at the Dream. We walked in without a reservations and Andy was the first person to welcome us and book a room on such short notice. The rooms are clean and everyone was very nice. Thank you Andy for your help!!

title: Great hotel with even better staff
text: My last stay at the Dream Downtown was nothing short of marvelous. When I first arrived at the hotel, I was warmly greeted by an employee named Manny, who helped me with my bags and waited for me to check in. He told me if there was anything I needed during the stay, I could ask him or the concierge for help. The check in was quick and effortless and I was on my way to my room. I booked a poolside room, and even though it was kind of chilly, it was still nice to be able to relax outside just steps away from my room. The room was the perfect size for me and the amenities were great. The hotel itself is gorgeous and is also expansive as there was several nightclubs and lounges located within the hotel itself.
