I've checked out both the PHD lounge and the Electric Room and they were phenomenal. My stay was fantastic and I hope to return soon!

title: Great team at Dream.
text: I had the pleasure of staying at Dream for 4 nights to handle some business in the city.  I have to say I wasn't expecting the quality of service I received from the entire team.  Lauren at the front desk was very helpful getting me checked in, Jane, the director of rooms was very kind to stop and welcome me to the property.  The big thanks go to Chris from the Concierge team...I was in desperate need of same day business card printing on a Sunday...before a holiday and he delivered.  Much appreciation goes to him and the whole team here.  Look forward to coming back.

title: Awesome Boutique style Hotel in Great Location!
text: The location, décor, ambience, hotel gallery, staff and trendy lounge were fabulous! The service was great and the rooms were cozy and chic. Walking distance to a lot of hit attractions. And the TAO restaurant next door made the experience that much better!

title: Perfect destination to stay in NYC
text:
The strategic location, interior and unique hotel gallery, warm welcome of the hotel staffs, trendy lounge and bars, and the hotel’s F&B service were excellent! Angela at front desk has been very helpful in accommodating and foreseeing what the customer needs! I’ve got a nice upgrade of the king room with balcony at special rate; all the other staffs such as the housekeeping, doorman and room service have an amazing speed to answer my needs. 
It’s been my favorite NY hotel so far and I definitely will come back to this hotel when in NYC, in the near future.

title: Great welcome to the Dream!
text:
I’m starting a 2 day get away with my daughter in NY. I come to the city frequently and usually stay in Midtown. We wanted a different flavor so decided to stay at the Dream Downtown...While my trip is still in progress I had to take a minute to rave about the wonderful welcome I experienced upon check-in. Angela at the front desk was lovely, personable and very accommodating!!! She expedited my room for early check in and offered several perks that would make my stay even more pleasant! I haven’t even began my exploring but I had to stop to thank Angela for taking time to make me feel special. I’m sure I’ll be posting more after the weekend!
Also wonderful bell service. Extremely professional help from Stephen!!!

title: Boutique hotel that aims to be different and mostly succeeds
text: This boutique hotel is well located. It is a short walk to the subway, Chelsea Market, and the High Line trail. The room key controls the elevator but was sometimes flaky. However, there always seemed to be a staff member to help. The room was small but very comfortable with a view of the courtyard and pool. The light controls were a little frustrating because I was never sure whether the lights would stay off if I left. The bathroom is enclosed in thick glass, which is an interesting touch; the shower was roomy and the water pressure was fine. The strangest thing about the room is that the only plug-in outside the bathroom was at floor level below a long table/desk that had no space to thread a cord through. The top floor has a bar/restaurant with terrific views of Manhattan.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: Angela at check-in was amazingly sweet and helpful! The rooms are comfortable, clean, and inviting. This will easily become our go to hotel when we visit! Valet was quick and easy and the guy was super friendly!

title: Fantastic front desk staff.  Angela is the best!!
text: Outstanding service at Reception.  I arrived at the hotel and wanted to know about room types, rates, concierge services, hotel amenities, and get a feel for the property.  Angela gave me a tour, placed a special call to get more information for me, and detailed the offerings in a way that made me never want to leave.  She was professional, helpful, polite and charming.  I booked several subsequent stays at the hotel based on her level of service.  As a very frequent traveller, this is an example of what can make the difference in guest experience.

title: Very young crowd
text:
The rooms were nice and extremely comfortable.  We are in our mid 50s and were clearly the oldest people in the house.  Staff and guests were all in the very young 30s.  Big crowds coming in for the music/bar during the weekends.  
Great location, central to great, close places to eat and easy for the subway.

title: A Hotel like no other
text: I have been a returning guest at Dream Downtown for three years now. Having just stayed again this past weekend, it was a reminder of why I continue to come back. As a native New Yorker, staycations at Dream are highly looked forward to as an escape close to home.  Always welcomed by a friendly staff – from the moment you arrive, check in, concierge and in room dining to the pool staff. Anyone who knows me knows that Dream is like a second home and love to share my experiences there. I highly recommend staying in the summer in one the pool rooms to take full advantage of the amenities – there is no other place in the city to lounge poolside with your room just steps away where you can be laying in the most comfortable bed, have your door open and still enjoy the DJ and vibes.  Having your own area to be comfortable is also a plus. But don’t get me wrong, winter stays are also just great but more relaxing! (Fun Fact – the pool is heated in the winter but do you dare go out there in the cold?) The Beach also serves very good food as well as in room dining (who is always there for you at all hours of the night), Megu and Bodega Negra. Don’t forget to check out PhD, either for their Sunset Party or regular club hours and Electric Room on the lower level. There isn’t another hotel in the city that has this many offers, is located near a great restaurant and nightlife scene and easily accessible. Special thanks to Tenzin who has been accommodating me time and time again as well as Angela for this weekend. I’ll see you both soon!

title: Exceptionally nice staff
text: This is a very mod and cool hotel. The design and decor of the rooms is very appealing. The best thing about this hotel is the helpfulness of the staff. A big shout-out to Fernando Molina a valet at Dream downtown who found my wallet. I will certainly come back to Dream downtown!

title: Always feels like coming home
text:
Just finished a fabulous quick trip to NY which included another amazing stay at the Dream Downtown. Perfect location for shopping, great restaurants and night life. 

Can’t say enough about the amazing people at the Dream Downtown - always warm and make us feel like family. Special thanks to Mallory who welcomed us with open arms, made sure we had a quick check in and arranged for a beautiful room with a special welcome gift - very thoughtful. Also, thank you to Manny and Fernando for their warm smiles and kind words every time we came in and out the hotel. 

Already looking forward to our next visit.

title: Super cool hotel
text: Dream was definitely a great hotel. The rooftop bar was great and the rooms were very modern with comfortable beds. Very trendy and overall a cool hotel in a great location for a night out in NYC. If you're looking for a trendy hotel, this is it.

title: VERY NICE TRENDY HOTEL
text: Hotel is located in a wonderful place  , close to whole happening area of NY  .  The Concierge was really helpful  and full of knowledge whatever we ask for . Chris is the guy , He is very helpful like managing his own Hotel  . I can not say the same for the rest of the workers specially the reception . too young unexperienced girls  and manager  , They always answers with unlogical solutions which are not acceptable at all for the problems ... Overall was a great stay  , But the manager and the reception workers needs to be more friendly and knowledgable about their work ... Again the concierge is totally different , logical solutions and helps always ...

title: Great hotel great staff
text: I stayed here two weeks ago and the rooms were amazing the location was great and in the middle of all the clubs and restaurants I wanted to be around, but what topped it all off was how helpful the concierge was, his name was Christopher Scali and he made our whole experience 10x better, by telling us great places to go to, telling us to visit attractions, taking care of any inquiries we had about the hotel. I would strongly recommend staying there just because of this concierge.

title: Semplicemente Top
text:
Ho soggiornato per la seconda volta in questo Hotel del quale posso elogiare tutto.
Dalla zona in cui è ubicato questo hotel,comodo raggiungere sia Midtown che Downtown, situato nel cuore dell’affascinante meatpacking district .
Di questo Hotel ho apprezzato tutto, dalla struttura con rooftop e ristoranti, alle camere arredate con design, alla pulizia e SOPRATTUTTO la disponibilità,gentilezza e professionalità di tutto lo staff del dream e con doveroso accenno al simpatico Chris della concierge ed alla fantastica Jane Sriprayul che con una rara disponibilità,mi ha assistito nella spiacevole disavventura della dei perdita bagagli all’aeroporto J.F.K. Con tutti i disagi che ne sono conseguiti.
Ovviamente il Dream tappa fissa nei miei prossimi soggiorni newyorkesi!!

title: The Best service!!
text:
We enjoyd our stay at The Dream during the New Year. Mostly because the concierge Christopher went all the way to make us experience the best of N.Y including tickets to a basketballgame, hipp restaurants and tips on what not to miss.

Best regards,

Anna

title: 10/10 would recommend!!
text:
The fact that I went out of my way to download the trip advisor app goes to show how well my trip at Dream went. We were welcomed with awesome vibes and a champagne bottle for my birthday! It was such a cute surprise from Mallory, who also was so helpful when I left my credit card and ID at the hotel. This is very typical for me because I am the most scattered person on earth but the staff made the process of me getting it back simple! Manny also helped my boyfriend and I with our uber situation. All of the employees were kind and chill which is very important to me when I’m staying at a hotel.

The restaurant was also FIRE!!!!! Bodega Negra I could probably eat for the rest of my damn life and be happy happy happy. The waitress was SO COOL and cute she made our time that much more enjoyable. 

Overall, the hotel decor, employees, and food was dope and amazing. I will probably never ever write another review again. BUT I know for sure this will not be my last stay at Dream I’m bringing all my friends this summer so see y’all then😎

title: Best place to let loose!
text: It has become a yearly trip for us and I love every aspect of it!  The staff is super cool. Rooms are very trendy. Sat and Sunday’s by the pool are so much fun. Live dj all day. We get a room on the pool level so we can go back and forth as we please. Food is amazing!!!  Fed a good time :)

title: Great experience !
text: We spent the night here for my birthday with a few friends. Angela helped us at the front desk. She was extremely helpful and professional! The hospitality and cleanliness of the room itself was great also. What was great for us was that it was nearby all the places we were looking to go as well as nearby penn station. I would absolutely be staying here again!

title: Terry and Steven-Event Kings Review
text: Dream downtown was amazing from the very start.  We went to the front desk and we were greeted by Angela who was amazing.  She was so accommodating and sweet perfect for a first impression.  Our room was also very clean and had a beautiful view.   We highly recommend Dream Downtown.

title: Good location
text: Visited during the xmas time, so stayed farther away from the downtown hassle. Everything was reachable and in a walking distance. Location pf the hotel is very good. Some good dinning and breakfast places around. On a bad note, you should not choose the hotel during the summer time as the aircon in extremely loud. Impossible! Pity the hotel doesn’t have its own restaurant. Especially for breakfast that would have been good. The place you can have breakfast is accessible from the street by anyone, eggs benedict - not what i have expected. The bernaise sauce tastes different, not as it should have! But room was decent, bit small but compensates by spacious bathroom.

title: Super trendy, lovely staff, great location
text: On the plus side - this hotel is fantastically situated - right by the highline, Google and Chelsea Market. The staff are really excellent on reception. The rooms are great for NYC - small but well done - and loved the bathrooms. On the downside it is aimed at a certain demographic - and I don't think I am it! If I had read the small print then I would not have booked this with two young daughters in tow - particularly with the see through holes in the pool allowing people from the lobby to watch people swimming.... Also at weekends kids aren't allowed in the pool after midday as it's more of a drinking place...The 'beach' isn't really that brilliant - a patch of sand at one end. What was most irritating was nowhere to breakfast - despite nice tables by the pool which isn't open til 11...all the staff standing round drinking Starbucks from a few blocks away was a clue about where you had to go if you didn't fancy the mexican restaurant downstairs streetside - missing a trick I thought..... Service in both restaurants was average and not attentive - especially by the pool! A great place for young couples but not so much for young kids.

title: Best Vibe of any hotel in NYC!!!
text: This place is awesome!!! The staff is incredible and the vibe is always chill. I come-up nearly every weekend from Annapolis Md and it's the only hotel I ever stay at....it's like a resort in the middle of the Meatpacking District. 5 Stars!!!!

title: Fantastic Anniversary at The Dream Hotel!
text:
My husband and I decided to spend our 6th anniversary at the Dream Hotel in Downtown NYC. From the moment we walked in everything was perfect! The service was exquisite and they went above and beyond to make our anniversary special and one of a kind. The management had a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting in our room for us, for our anniversary, upon our arrival. Not only was the service amazing, but the room itself was out of this world! The view of the city skyline from our room was breathtaking and really made the room extra special. If that wasn't enough, the hotel even arrange for my husband and I as well as some friends, to be included on the guest list for electric room. Electric Room was a fantastic venue and the music was the best i've heard in years. If you're really looking for a fun time filled with good music and a hip vibe, we highly suggest the Electric Room. Overall our stay at Dream was the best we've had in years and if you're looking for Grade A service, out of this world room with amazing accommodations and views as well as fun nightlife venues that won't break the bank but provide that exclusive feel with a high end hotel, we highly suggest the Dream Downtown!

-Desiree Mistretta

title: Mrs
text:
Cool hotel in Downtown NYC
The Dream is a great hotel with very comfortable beds and trendy rooms 
The staff make the place .....Chris ( the concierge ) and Mannie were especially helpful 
Nothing was too much trouble 
We were there for 3 nights over NYE 
The hotel is well situated in The Meatpacking area surrounded by bars and restaurants plus Chelsea Market which has shops and places to eat 
Go you will love it

title: Vacation
text: Hotel was very nice. Clean and close to everything. Service was excellent. Even with New Years parties at the hotel, the hotel accommodated us with quieter rooms.  Chris at the concierge was great. Fernando and Manny at the front door was extremely kind and helpful. And thank you Daniel at the front desk for your assistance.

title: Great stay!
text: I enjoyed my New Year’s Eve stay at the dream!  I️t was a short trip but the location of the hotel was perfect and my room was comfortable and clean.  Manny at the from desk was incredibly professional and kind.  He made my checkout simple and pleasant and helped me check my bags until I️t was time to leave for the airport.  I would recommend this hotel and definitely stay again.

title: Dream doesn't live up to my expectations
text:
My friends and I stayed here for a birthday evening. We had a very warm welcome but when I asked if I could have some champagne glasses and some ice in my room it took 4 hours. For the price you pay for this hotel I would expect exceptional service. The lobby is very beautiful and the servers are nice. The room was small with double beds. Somet things with the bathroom were a little annoying. The dimmers wouldn't go down just completely shut off or stay on high which made it very hard to sleep as the bathroom isn't enclose with walls but glass. Also, there was a huge chunk of cement broken on the floor by the wall. I thought this to be odd, also one of the light fixtures in between the beds was missing. One would expect the room to be top notch. I'm a New Yorker so I really have no need to stay in hotels here in the city but when I do and I pay good money for one I think we deserve the best. 

As far as the night life this hotel is the happening place...So many young people come in to go to the bars and lounges and the rooftop bar. It was a little disappointing at how rude the hostess was for the rooftop lounge. She was very standoffish and didn't have any type of personality and was very snooty. That irritated me to no end. Since 3 of us were staying with us we were only allowed to bring 2 people up per one person. We were a group of 6 and if we all wanted to go up we were asked to pay $200 !!!! Really? This absolutely ridiculous. Honestly I wasn't impressed by this place. I'd much rather go to Vandal and pay $200 for a table than to fork over $200 to a smug hostess who thinks she's the President of the hotel chain. 

The pool was gorgeous and relaxing and the food in the restaurants were great.

title: Great Hotel Great experience
text:
The Minute we got out of the car, our bags were being unloaded by the bell services and the hotel doors were being held open. The services did not stop their. The front Desk Manager Tenzin Basnet took our rough situation (double booked our hotel room for the wrong night) and smoothed it all out for us in such a professional mater. It was Amazing. He was very professional and made us feel right at home. Something to say about great customer services as i find it harder and harder to come by now days. 

The hotel has 4 clubs i think and multiple bars. You really don't have to go anywhere once your here. we felt like were staying in Vegas. Now don't let this steer you away. The clubs everyone was dressed to the nine. I felt underdress just walking through the lobby hahaha. OO and did i mention it has its own salon!!!! 

Pet Friendly as well is a big bonus. There were super nice to our furry family member which made our trip even more special. 

Hands down i will be coming back.

Jason/Kristen and LIlly

title: Good location - friendly staff
text:
My girlfriend and I stayed over Christmas Eve.  Overall it was a positive experience.  The room was clean - slightly over designed and night clubbish but comfortable bed and good shower. Excellent views and location.

The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Manny the bellman was a particular stand out. 

For the price I can’t complain but it certainly didn’t rank amongst the best hotels I’ve ever experienced.

title: Very helpful staff
text: I bought some products at Amazon and they didn't delivered in time, so I have to leave before the packages arrived. Luckly for me, the hotel staff were very kind and helpful and gave the packages to a friend of mine that will bring them to me in Brazil. Awesome! Thank you again, Mr. Joseph Sabatelli!

title: Never Again
text: We stayed here over the weekend and will not stay here again.  We knew going into this hotel that it was more of a lively scene with a lot going on.  However, nothing prepared us for the paper thin walls and the rowdy floor that we were staying on.  The first night, we were woken up on the hour by drunk people returning very loudly to their rooms.  The second night, our direct neighbors were having a party in their room.  Around 1am we called security.  However, they didn't quiet down until at least 2am. We also had an issue with the shower the floor above ours dripping through the ceiling into our bathroom. Finally, when we checked out, the hotel tried to charge us a fee (even though we had been told at check in that all costs were covered as we had booked and paid through a third party website).  It took speaking to a manager to have that fee waived.  The only positive - the bed was comfortable and I really like the product they use for toiletries.

title: Tre giorni con i miei due figli di 15 e 20anni
text:
Albergo molto cool con due discoteche dentro media età dei clienti 25/30 anni, la sera molto movimentato nella hall dove si possono prendere aperitivi .
La stanza che avevamo preso noi era una Silver con due letti Queen size, ma i materassi erano veramente inadeguati troppi morbidi e direi malconci, mia figlia ha avuto forte mal di schiena. Per il resto servizio in camera impeccabile colazione in camera anche . L’albergo e A 50mt dai due famosi ristoranti TAO e Buddakan .
Lo consiglio con riserva solo per il materasso delle Silver .
Sicuramente è un albergo per giovani sentendosi la musica fino a tarda notte consiglio camera piano alto

title: Great Hotel!
text: I just stayed at this hotel for the past week and really enjoyed the lively fun environment.  Also, Demario checked me for my stay and was so amazing! He really made it a VIP experience for me and my mom for our NYC getaway.  Thank you Dream Hotel & Demario for making our week! :-) xoxo

title: Excellent location, service could be better
text: Everyone is friendly but when things go wrong, they are not helpful in offering a solution. I arrived and there was no WiFi the whole day and the guy ate the reception told me to find a Starbucks at the corner even though it was late at night and I was tired. I requested for stuff from housekeeping and it took 4 calls to finally receive the extra hangers 3 hours later. The gym on the 3rd floor gets very busy in the morning so good timing is advisable. The room could do with maintenance especially with the light fixtures.

title: Subpar hotel in a city of great Hotels.
text:
Some hotels are driven to make sure that their customers are taken care of.  The Dream Downtown is not one of those hotels.  They provide the lip service to taking care of the customer but this hotel is all about taking care of their image.

It was not a good start from the get-go.  My front desk person firstly had a computer that did not work.  He tried to pass me to another lady who was working in front of a "Google"  sign, but she did not acknowledge her co-workers pleas for help.  She then took it upon herself to help someone else.  It was a strange behavior that I've never experienced before.

Secondly, the room, which is basically a stylized concrete box is poorly designed.  The floors are concrete (no carpeting), and they are dirty.  As a person who does not wear their shoes in the room, this is unacceptable.  They should at lease provide slippers.

Thirdly, to prove they are not about service, they pre-light the button that refuses housekeeping services.  I admit, I was not aware that there was even a housekeeping button, but to premark it "no housekeeping services" is inexcusable.

Fourthly, the TV did not work, I had to call for service twice (over a 8 hour period - I'm still there, it may break down before I leave!).  The tech said that the Dish network service (from cable) was awful and blamed everything on the Hotel's awful decision.  I don't care, I just want a TV to work.  A Motel6 can manage that, why can't the Dream?

Also, it took over an hour for the tech to come the second time with multiple calls on my end.  Again, this is a hotel that cares about promoting their pool, their rooftop patio, their restaurant.  Nowhere do they promote their service, which is, I guess, truth in advertising.

Finally, the room, in it's attempt to be cool, is overly complicated.  It took me some time to figure out the lighting system (how about on/off).  The toilet system has a massive flush button that is hard to reach.  Even the cool shower, has a weak flow system.  What's the point of such a massive shower where the showerhead only covers the front 1/3rd the room?

For a business traveler, this place is not worth it.   As a casual traveler, I guess I am just not tool, or tech savvy enough (I'm sure in their words).  

As a tech user who  works for one of the most advanced companies in the world.  I say that the experience in and of itself is needlessly complex, does not work and the service is not the point of this hotel.

title: Bachelorette party 5 stars!
text: I booked two rooms here for an all girls bachelorette party and it was absolutely perfect! From the second we pulled our car up we were greeted by such a wonderful staff! The front desk was eager to check us in and offered us any help we needed (from dinner ideas to night time plans they wanted to help us). Upon booking the rooms I had stated we were a bachelorette party just so we could hopefully get rooms next to each other but, the hotel staff went above and beyond this. They sent each of our rooms a bottle of champagne! So nice and unexpected in a New York City environment! The staff was beyond nice and I want to give a special shoutout to Manny (I hope that is right) who was such a pleasure with our bags and Cars! Highly recommend this hotel for any occasion! The hotel is in the heart of the meatpacking so you are close to food, clubs, and much more.

title: Meh dream
text:
Went for a weekend with friends and was let down by the room and overall cleanliness of the hotel (plus room needs a bit of polish as things are looking run down and not shabby-chic shabby). Few outlets, little lighting, horrendous mattresses and pillows.  
However staff was nice and accommodating when they gave us wrong rooms. Biggest plus is that location can’t be beat as steps from Chelsea market, fashion row in Meatpacking, high line, and multiple restaurants.

title: Amazingggg experience!
text:
Honestly, I've been to New York a few times and I've always had issues every where I've gone. From inexpensive hotels to the most expensive ones, I've never had a better stay than the one I did here. Despite the fact that the rooms and hotel itself is fricken awesome (with the sickest bar, restaurant, AND club inside) the overall experience was amazing. We met the manager upon arrival (Tenzin) and this guy was beyond cool. He was very accommodating and only cared about my friends and I having an great stay and experience. I wanted to talk to him directly because I noticed how he was with a few other people who were staying at the hotel beforehand so I approached him directly to check-in once the other guests left. I'm glad I did, he checked up on us every single day and made sure he let us know all the dos and donts in the city and all the places we need to check out. 

Overall: Awesome stay, great experience, impeccable service, and definitely the only place I'd stay the next time I'm back there.

title: Amazing place away from the crowds
text: My family spent our Thanksgiving vacation in this exquisite hotel. Modern look of the room, nice restaurants, open pool made us speechless. The place is in Meatpacking district walking distance from art galleries, Samsung flagship store with VR experience your kids will be telling all their friends about. We strolled on High line, dined and shopped at Chelsea Market. Dream indeed.

title: Never Stop Dreaming
text:
Dreamy stay at the best location, walking distance from the amazing Chelsea Market which is a must for lunch or afternoon treats. So is Dream's rooftop and PHD to sip on the best cocktails over the NYC skyline.
Thank you so much for everything sweetest Carolina and the best concierge, Joseph!!
Can't wait to be back!

title: Great Weekend at Dream
text:
We had a great stay at Dream Downtown. We made a short weekend trip to NY with our 13 month old. The check-in was easy and quick and the suite we stayed in was perfect for us. The hotel was a great location with Chelsea Market literally around the corner and high line few blocks away.
The housekeeping staff were exceptional, they responded very quickly with our requests, and happily accommodated our needs. The bell man who helped us with our bags while we were checking our was very nice and helpful. Overall, we had a great stay at Dream and we will definitely come back!

title: CANT WAIT TO DO IT ALL OVER AGAIN
text:
Had an amazing stay!
Staff was super friendly and helpful!
We travelled with our children who were also very well received!
A special thanks to Chris Scali who was super helpful and sent us to a couple of awesome restaurants!
Exactly what a high end hotel is supposed to be!
Thanks

title: Amazing Stay!!
text: Dream Downtown was the best experience we've had in NYC, we come to the city once a year, and by far Dream is the best hotel we've ever stayed at! The rooms are lasrge and clean, the design is beautiful and the staff is amazing, from the hotel bartenders to the front desk to the salon, everyone was wonderful! The lobby bar is beautiful and so id the roof top bar. The area is perfect, we were within walking distance of everything we needed- we will never stay anywhere else again!

title: Needed to get away
text: This hotel is one of my favorite hotels in New York City the staff is always kind and generous and will help you do just about anything that's needs to be done the rooms are spectacular from the stainless steel tubs to the stainless steel shower curtains. The amenities at this hotel or to die for it from the sound machine in the room to block out the outside noise to the salon to the pools to everything. They never cease to amaze me.  Until my next trip a hotel is only a Dream of way.

title: Excellent Hotel and Helpful Staff - Will only stay here when I am in NYC
text: This hotel is walking distance to great shopping, amazing restaurants, Chelsea Market & subway station.  The beds are super soft and comfortable and a dream to sleep in. 2 happening night clubs that are packed every single night of the week. Bodega Negra that offers formal and cafe style dining options is a must during your stay.  Live DJ in the lobby bar.  It seems like every time I am there, I run into or catch a glimpse of a celebrity in the lobby. A popular spot with the New York in crowd.  The staff is also extremely professional and friendly. Mgr. Shaquoia Gulley was superb and overly helpful. I travel to New York city quite a bit and will not stay anywhere else but here.

title: Great location, disappointing rooms.
text:
We booked The Dream for a celebration weekend with friends. The location is fantastic, close to the Highline, Chelsea Markets and lots of restaurants and bars. The common areas of the hotel are well appointed and there is a party atmosphere 24/7. The staff are very helpful and well presented. 

What let’s down this hotel are the rooms. The size was expected for NYC, but the design was terrible and the condition was very poor. Design flaws included no plug for the trendy basin in the bathroom; no electrical outlets near the mirror in the bedroom (not good when trying to dry your hair); the bed was on a platform which projected into the very limited floor space and caused multiple injuries over the weekend; the window was in a sloping wall yet the only coverings were curtains which did not block out the light as they were inches away from the wall. 
The condition of the room was very tired with chipped and flaking paint, a very lumpy uncomfortable mattress and a giant iron burn mark in the carpets. 

We had an enjoyable weekend but are unlikely to return.

title: Stay and work
text: We had an event at the Dream for ~70 people and it was great. The staff were fantastic; on top of their game, the room (the Gallery) was beautiful and lent itself well both to the actual meeting and happy hour afterward. The wifi was great. And, the food was really good. I was very impressed by the attentiveness of the staff and the location works well for a work function as it's only one block from a subway station. I also stayed as a guest of the hotel and rooms are clean, and the bed was so comfortable. I would recommend this hotel for work and play.

title: Dream hotel
text: I was helped by Tenzin and it was a I couldn't have asked for a better person to help me with my stay. He assisted me with getting the best room and made sure I got military discount. He's an Awesome dude

title: Rough sleep at the Dream
text:
It seems to be a great choice if you want a place to party that also has a bed. If you want a good nights sleep while on a business trip, try somewhere else. The club carries on throughout the night, as do many of the tenants. 

Was also disappointed with the lack of basic hotel features, like an ironing board, a coffee maker, extra soap, towel bars or hooks in the bathroom, etc. Speaking with the front desk may or may not get you what your room is missing, because they “don’t have enough for every room...”

title: Great Service, Sad room
text:
This was my fourth trip to a dream property.  As always the service was fantastic. Thorough and accommodating. However my disappointment was in the condition of the room.  The front desk specifically told me the reason for my wait was I had a great room and they were inspecting it for quality. 
I found it to be less than. The balcony was great but the room itself was beat up.  The two outlets I found were both falling out of the wall and the furniture had burn marks on it, and my lights were temperamental. My dissatisfaction was only due to the high quality rooms  I had experienced in the past the location and the hotel are still beautiful.

title: Funky and Hip
text: Stayed here for work and even though I'm not OLD OLD (40's), I sure FELT OLD. Very hip and modern hotel with all sorts of "beautiful people" wandering through. The rooms are typical NY-sized (small) but bathroom is modern and hotel overall is clean and in a GREAT location right across from the high-line and Chelsea Market.

title: Loved it!
text: Had a great stay at this hotel.  Loved the rooftop bar as an added bonus!  The staff were very accommodating, the room was great (although hanging space could have been bigger, but not a deal-breaker). I would stay again.

title: Don’t stay
text: Unless your doing Coke or X you don’t want to stay at this hotel. Been there 8 nights so far and it’s extremely loud. Most noise is from the nightclub. Last night music stopped at 4AM😡 They also forget to give you hand towels. This is a nightclub trying to be a hotel.

title: Det er ikke et hotel, men en natklub
text: Havde booket 3 nætter på hotellet og bedt om et værelse placeret i et stille område af hotellet. Der fandtes bare ikke stille områder. Der blev holdt kæmpefester, så hotellet var omdannet til diskotek og værelserne blev brugt til private fester, der først blev stoppet klokken 6 om morgenen, når man gik ned i receptionen og bad om, at de gjorde noget ved det. Man kunne ikke få kontakt med nogen via telefonen. Det var umuligt at sove i to nætter - så book aldrig dette hotel, hvis du gerne vil sove om natten. Der bliver holdt fester i receptionsområdet og på toppen af hotellet - og du bliver mødt af topberusede personer, når du kommer hjem fra et restaurantbesøg. Virkelig en dårlig oplevelse.

title: Festive but very noisy hotel
text: I just stayed at the hotel for business for 10 days and I think this more a hotel for party people. I was not able to sleep for two nights with the Halloween parties and the reception didn't do anything. Also, found the rooms not very clean.

title: Better than my first visit
text:
Having given this place a pretty basic rating and slating on my first visit, it was certainly better this time around.
Potentially, as i didn't stay in the hotel as much, however, room was quieter service seemed better.
Front desk more helpful.

title: Fantastic Pool!
text: Great place to stay, close to everything. Rooms are fabulous. Great pool to relax and cool down after a big day out. Fantastic cocktails by the pool. Great night club downstairs. Staff very friendly and helpful.

title: Fun hotel with buzzy vibe
text: The Dream Downtown wasnt our first choice of hotel in the district, but will be from now on as it everything we could have hoped for, with two onsite niteclubs attracting a younger clientele, we thought it might be too lively for an older couple like ourselves in our 60s, but not at all, the basement club as a separate entrance and the 12th floor club uses a separate elevator for clubbers to use, the 12th floor club doubles as a rooftop bar, where we enjoyed drinks with fab views of the Empire State building,

title: Dream Downtown meatpacking Halloween trip
text: Stayed at the Dream downtown location and had a wonderful experience. The staff at the front desk was extremely welcoming and polite, Michaela and Demario were extremely helpful and went out of there way to make my Halloween weekend a very enjoyable one. I must say that the location of the hotel is great and the amenities are delightful, the only issue I had was a $69 charge for drinks in the lobby that I never ordered, but after a conversation with the manager hopefully they will credit me back the $69. Otherwise it was an A+ experience all around.

title: Great Hotel
text: Excellent location, beautiful rooms, super easy check in, great food, and great venues both above and below. Tenzin Basnet took great care of us and we would highly recommend him and the hotel. If you are spending time in manhattan, this is the place to stay.

title: Trendy Hotel, Great Customer Service
text: Room was clean, hip, and well decorated. Staff was always super friendly and willing to help me out with whatever I needed. I must give a sepcial shout out to Mr. Joseph Sabatelli for being so helpful when I forgot some items in my room. He called me and answered my emails promptly to get my belongings shipped back to me. Loved my stay. Thanks again Joe! :)

title: Great Service, Location and Amenities!
text: Our family really enjoyed our stay at Dream Downtown. The location can not be beat! Within walking distance from the Chelsea Market, stores and places to eat EVERYWHERE! The Hotel itself was very impressive. Modern decor with great attention to detail everywhere from the outside to the lobby and in each room. The Staff were EXCEPTIONAL! Very friendly and super helpful. Michaela and Ashley took great care of us and not only helped make sure we had everything we needed and assisted at every turn, they also capture the heart of our little 4 year old son! We will definitely be back!

title: Terrible... would not pay to stay here!
text:
This hotel is awful. Nothing about it makes it a "DREAM" and I’m actually very upset that I stayed here for business. Had I known how awful this place was, I would have paid out of pocket to stay somewhere else.

Room: small and standard for NYC. The bed is extremely soft - I’ve never had back pain in my life until I’ve slept here. The bathroom is on the bigger side but the sink reminds me of a cafeteria sink with it’s cheap steel/plastic. The rooms also have thin walls; I could hear people next door to me, as well as people walking down the hall as if they were standing next to me.

Service: Check in was fine, but on the last night of my stay (Tuesday night), there was a rager of a party on their rooftop club so I couldn't' sleep (mind you, this was at 2 am). Being on the 8th floor - I could hear their 12th floor's DJ playing loud bass so I requested ear plugs from the front desk. It took them an HOUR to get me my ear plugs. I called 3 times (every 20 mins) to check up on it until I almost gave up and downloaded a white noise app to drone out the awful club music. 

Don't waste your time here... it has failed miserably trying real hard to be a W hotel.

title: Great service and location
text: After traveling countless times to NYC and trying many “boutique” hotels, I was impressed with the quality of service and friendliness of the staff (special thanks to Jane Sriprayul). I also love how quiet the pool facing rooms are - something very important in NYC. I’ve stayed at more expensive hotels that were so loud and, in some cases, still had single pane windows. Finally, being across from Chelsea Market, makes it a fantastic location.  Headed back next week!  See you soon!

title: Sr. Executive
text: What an awesome trip to The Dream Hotel! The guest services managers, Mallory Matoush & Christina Diaz were AMAZING and very personable. The concierge Christopher and Fernando, the doorman gave some wonderful venue recommendations! Looking forward to our trip back! MAJOR kudos to The Dream Team!

title: Trendy with a Marine Feel
text:
The Dream Downtown is in a good location, but not in heart of NY (if you are thinking Times Square). You can get to many different locations for shopping and eating and all are within walking distance (or a taxi). Juliana Gallo - Senior Sales Manager, was very helpful in setting up the rooms that I needed (24 for 2 nights) and I greatly appreciated her help before and after. Joseph Sabatelli - Concierge was outstanding and his assistance setting up prearranged cars was so appreciated. 

Unfortunately, when part of my group went to check in, the computers were down at the time, so there was a wait. While I did not personally stay at this property, I did get to see the type of room that my travelers were staying in. The bath is large and has a frosted glass all around it. I suspect if you are more than one guest - someone getting up in the middle of the night could be a bit annoying. The beds surprised me. They are all extremely low to the ground (think IKEA). The room itself was typical in size and the windows were interesting (round like a port hole on a ship). 

Some of my travelers were not fond of the noise level from the night club/bar that is a part of the property. They said they could hear the bass throughout the night. 

For me the highlight of this property was the staff.

Safe travels.

title: Staff was absolutely wonderful!
text: I was lucky enough to film at the Downtown Dream Hotel.  Myself and my film crew were there for five days total.  The staff was incredibly kind and accommodating.  They were always available and were able to help us with every request imaginable without pause.  Our hours were long, so we were able to chat with every shift.  It made our late nights and early mornings much easier to get through.  Thank you all for such a great experience!  Looking forward to coming back!

title: Concierge Desk Extremely Helpful
text: Just wanted to let guests know how helpful the concierge desk is at the Dream.  As a photographer I need to manage several cases of photo equipment.  Today thanks to the great help of the concierge Chris Scali, I was able to print and schedule a Fedex ground pickup.  Chris was extremely helpful and helped me with the shipping labels and packing. Just a great shoutout to him! thanks Chris!!

title: Disappointing. Avoid staying here.
text:
This place needs to decide whether it's a hotel or a club. 

The rooftop bar played music until 4am. I kid you not, my room vibrated. Before checking in I asked for a quiet room (and was reassigned a room) so can't imagine what other rooms might sound like. 

This a trendy place where the bars seems to attract locals. Therefore the communal areas can be very busy and in the evenings, populated with drunk/raucous locals.  Some of the corridors smelled of drugs. 

Definitely not a child friendly hotel. 

Very very small gym. 

Air conditioning centrally controlled. 

Located in a nice area. Not the typical tourist location but Meatpacking and Greenwich are all very close by and fun places to check out.

title: All Style and $ Over Substance
text:
I’ve been around the block and stayed in hotels across the world of all calibers including the better Dream Midtown (5 yrs ago).

I see a bunch of high ratings for this hotel and am happy that those customers had a better experience than both my brother and I. We were disappointed.

Shonky electrics; i.e elevators not working properly, I got stuck in one for a couple of minutes. Issues with lighting in the room, ie switches not working, lights strobing / flashing and poor lighting in the rooms that made it difficult to relax. I asked them to check them out on the second morning and had to ask again when I got back into the hotel at the end of the day.

Check-in; we stood at the counter waiting for someone to help us check in for 25 minutes. One helpful guy Stephen went to get someone else to come to the front desk. The manager came and served another customer who had just got to the desk.

Gym; average, I’m thankful it was there though.

There are bouncers on the front door, not door men. This is a night club with rooms you can rent, not an upmarket hotel.

Toilets; in the lobby were gross in the evening as this place is a night club, not an upmarket hotel.

There was nothing relaxing about this hotel

With the exception of Stephen, housekeeping and the engineers who fixed the lighting in our room, the hotel team were disinterested and provided a sub-standard level of customer service.

title: Very disappointed
text: The room was super small, bathroom tiny and lacking in cotton wool etc.. only a shampoo bottle and shower gel. Room service outrageous! Ordered a sandwich and burger - came to $100. Wouldn’t stay again.

title: Unique design and atmosphere, but not a good value if you only need a place to stay
text:
The design and the atmosphere at the hotel make it a unique experience from the beginning. From room design to the restaurant and bar - you know it's going to be a different. There is many staff around the reception that are glad to help and let you feel a welcome guest.

But when you look at the basics of eating / sleeping / shower - this is where things start to get complicated. The basic (bronze/queen) rooms are small. The curtains don't close all the way and the curtain rods make a "ding" against each other when you try to get into or out of the bed. There is no coffeemaker in the room so you need to call an expensive room service or go downstairs/to Starbucks for coffee. Yet they really let me down when I asked for a wake up call at 5am, even got asked if I want another call at 5:15 - and there was no wakeup call at either time (the alarm on my phone worked, but that was a backup plan). 

Will I stay there again - maybe, but will wait to see if there is a good deal on bigger/better rooms.

title: Third time visiting
text: I have nothing but amazing things to say about the Dream in Downtown NYC, I have stayed 3 times, its my favorite hotel in NYC with the absolute best location, and I will continue returning. The manager Dan has been fantastic with me on the several times I have visited. Also, its one of the only hotels in nyc that has an outdoor pool during the summer!

title: Great Location and Cool Hotel Bad Noise on the Second Floor
text:
I have stayed at the Dream Downtown twice. The first time I was impressed with the entire experience!! The lobby is sensational and the rooms are spectacular. Plus, the first time I was there in 2012, the products a guest could use in the shower were fabulous: Etro. When I returned in June 2017, they changed to some terrible products. 

If you happen to get a room on the second floor facing the outdoor deck, refuse it. It seemed like the whole second floor was one big party room, including the hallways. My room was still cool, but I had to keep the shades on the window because you could look right into the room from the pool, which I am sure some wouldn't mind. 

All the way around, my first stay at this hotel made me want to stay there again. After my second stay, I will never stay there again.

title: Funky boutique hotel close to Google on 111 8th Ave
text:
I stayed as this hotel mostly because it was close to work and I was going to be working in NYC for the next few days. The rooms were good sized for typical NYC hotels and I did not feel cramped in. The decor was kinda like walking into an funky 70’s movie updated to the 90s. Big glamor effect portrait of Drew Barrymore on the wall and everything was low to the floor: Bed, chairs, ottoman, etc. You almost felt like to had to fall into them and getting out required a lot of leg strength. The bathroom had translucent walls with a great shower. At night, the street noise was not too bad for NYC and the bed was comfortable. The hotel staff was attentive. When called about a shortage of washcloths, they not only brought what was missing, but more.

I am not sure I will return because of the low slung furniture, but  otherwise it was a good stay.

title: Amazing first impression
text: Was greeted and assisted by Tenzin at the front desk he was extremely helpful and polite! Look forward to the rest of my stay at this beautiful hotel. Also, was pleasantly surprised to receive a complimentary bottle of wine with a greeting note from Mallory! The staff and this hotel decor and location is all 5 star!

title: Bachelorette Dream
text: My stay at the Dream was an experience. The night manager Tenzin really made our stay special for my cousin’s bachelorette party. The room was larger than we expected and had a great modern style. We did utilize the valet parking, which I recommend you come at least a half hour earlier if you plan on using it. We did thankfully make it to PHD (the rooftop bar) with its city line views...breathtaking. Again, plan on going early because the line is insane, but I would say totally worth it! Their price is high, but you get what you pay for. Brand new rooms, in the hottest area, with a rooftop bar in the hotel…we enjoyed it! Tenzin really should be valued at this establishment. He represented this hotel with class and professionalism that really should be rewarded. Thank you, Tenzin, and Dream Downtown for a memorable weekend!

title: Party disguised as hotel
text: You need to be in a certain state of mind to enjoy this flashy ongoing party disguised as hotel. Music and alcohol spill from the great rooftop to the swimming pool and bars downstairs. If you are not in your twenties- you may feel like dad hanging out with his vulgar kids. It’s fun but it’s a bit too much for grownups. Rooms are nice and you can watch Google HQ from the round windows. I actually enjoyed the three nights, but I wouldn’t stay longer.

title: Awesome Stay
text: I stayed here at one night! It is really cozy! It is very quiet, and the service is very good! The equipment here is in good condition. I like the experience a lot. I will choose Dream Downtown if I visited New York again.

title: Celebrating my husbands birthday - Awesome concierge
text:
It was my husbands birthday and I decided to surprise him wit a night on the town. I booked a room at the dream hotel. I wasn't sure what to do b/c we live in the city and haven't been out in a while after having children. I emailed the hotel concierge for suggestions. Joseph Sabatelli Was so helpful and accommodating. He made reservation for us at a wonderful restaurant not too far from the hotel. The food was awesome, the staff was great and he even set up a surprise for us (cake) at the restaurant and champagne on ice in the room! 
My husband had such a great time!

title: Staycation
text: I stayed in the south Tower suit with balcony and out door hot tub. The room was amazing. How ever I would only have given 2 stars if it was not for Mallory Matoush and Rob Dellibovi. They hands down made my stay special. Mallory was in contact with me the entire time to make sure I had everything I needed. She took care of a few request that went above and beyond the call of duty but made it seem like it was business as usual. She deserves a raise and promotion for professionalism. Rob Dellibovi I did not get to meet in person but handled my reservation as well as making sure I had everything I needed. Dream is a large venue with many quests I’m sure, how ever Rob and Mallory made me feel as if I was the only guest at the hotel. I will be going back for sure because of these 2 exceptional people. Thanks for a great staycation guys. Your the best 🙌🏽

title: The AMAZING DREAM Downtown continues to be my incredible HOME AWAY FROM HOME!!
text:
I have been staying at DREAM Downtown since I had the privilege of attending the amazing grand opening party in June 2011!!  It remains one of my favorite places to stay in the world - an intergalactic oasis that for me feels like a home-away-from home in the heart of NYC's booming Meatpacking District.

I have stayed there many dozens of times and have recommended the hotel to hundreds of my fiends in the US and abroad . 

The property's spectacular out-of the-box architectural design coupled with the amazing DREAM team management and staff who remain amongst the best I have experienced in all my travels make me feel like both family AND royalty.  

From the new GM Randy, Director of Rooms Jane, and Guest Services Managers Mallory and Carolina, to the entire front desk staff, doormen, maids, security team, lifeguards, bar servers, Dren at the PhD door, Joe and Cassandra at F&B along with dozens of others on the team that are all amazing at what they do and dear friends,  all  make staying there an exceptional experience. I cannot wait to return for my next exciting adventure. Mitch

Room Tip: Platinum and Gold King Pool rooms with ivy covered terraces opening onto the glass bottomed pool on the sand beach are my favorites!! Gold King Pool Rooms on floors 3-6 with Juliet Balconies overlooking the same are also great. The GUEST HOUSE is also OFF THE CHART!!
ENJOY!!

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60763-d2173604-r166825328-Dream_Downtown-New_York_City_New_York.html#

title: D:Ream - Things Can Only Get Better
text:
Another hotel hankering to hipsters that aren't even hip. Quite a lot of boxes ticked (pool, flashy decor, trendy bar/ club etc) but when all's said and done it leaves a sour (and downright seedy) taste. 

Booked owing to extremely last minute work trip, and boy did I get my pants brought down (a familiar sight at The Dream no doubt) - admittedly the UN General Assembly was carte blanche for any hotelier/ landlord/ to go full on Gordon Gekko in terms of pricing, but $500 + a night for a tiny room with worn out carpets is the wrong kind of tasty.

For the lone traveller all good, but with wife and baby daughter in tow things didn't go so swimmingly - could barely fit a cot in the room, the fridge whirred and hummed plus rowdy guests kept us up well into the wee, small hours. 

In the interests of fairness, the staff were lovely (particularly Mallory who did everything she could to help us) and they did bosch out a mean Mac N Cheese (don't ask how much), but it's just not enough. 

At a glance you might be fooled, but superficial splendour soon gives way to grim reality. This isn't a dream. it's a nightmare.

title: Excellent one night stay
text:
I was on a one night trip for business. A colleague recommended this hotel.

Warm greeting by bell staff was followed by exceptionally friendly front desk staff. 

Room was not huge. It’s N.Y.! But not a teeny tiny N.Y. room either. I had space to walk around and the bathroom and shower were not cramped. Very nicely decorated and comfortable. 

I did not get a chance experience the night life but it seemed lively. Still, it was not noisy and I slept fine going to bed at 1030 b/c of an early morning meeting.

Ate at the Bodega Negra hotel for breakfast. Staff was friendly and attentive and the food was really good. 

Asked the next day for via email for updated folio so I could bill back all expenses. Response came in under 10 mins. 

This is a nice property. What makes a difference is that they clearly have a commitment to customer service. Hip hotel without the hip attitude. 

It’s not cheap and not the priciest either, but definitely a great value.

title: Not such a dream...
text:
This place is very, very cool, maybe a little bit too cool for me. There's so much right with this place but disappointingly so much wrong. So my not so perfect view of this place started before we'd even arrived, we were a group of seven girls staying for two of the girls 40th birthdays, I emailed ahead of time to ask if we could be placed on the same floor as one of the girls had a solo room and if I could arrange anything to make the birthday girls stay more special. I got a reply saying they'd do their best and asked if I'd like to speak to concierge to see if there was anything further I could arrange with them, I said yes and was looped in on an email, I replied twice but no one ever got back to me, I was slightly miffed as I'd never really been ignored by the concierge of a hotel, especially one in the USA. 

Anyway, on arrival at the hotel we of course weren't placed on the same floor, which wasn't a huge issue but I would have thought they would have at least tried to put the solo female on the same floor as at least one of us. They did put a couple of bottles of prosecco in one of the birthday girls room but not the other which was a bit of a fail. We also ended up getting to the hotel quite late on a Thursday night, the hotel reception is like a nightclub so trying to hear the attendant was pretty hard!

The rooms are nice, we all had very differently laid out ones and ours was slightly bigger as it was an accessible room.  The beds are very small, there's no proper wardrobe, not enough hangers, only one robe and no tea or coffee making facilities. All of this I probably could have lived with but what made me slightly cross was the attitude of the staff, they treat you like you should be grateful that your staying there and not like you've just paid out an awful lot of your hard earned cash. I've stayed in NYC too many times to mention in various levels of hotels and while the rooms are always small the service I've had from every other hotel apart from this one has been exemplary, it's such a shame as with only a few tweaks it could be so good. One thing I'd never experienced before in NYC was the use of a pool which was so nice, especially as it was so hot, will definitely be seeking out a hotel with a pool for my next trip, unfortunately it won't be this one.  

Oh, and if you're looking for a more reasonable breakfast than the one served in the hotel, try the Grey Dog on 16th just 5 mins walk from the hotel, excellent food and good old American service!

title: Dream on
text:
Came here for one night. The room was amazing and the view......something very special. Friendly and correct staff. 
Didn't try the food or any installations, had a drink at the bar located at level 2, where the pool is. PHD upstairs was something very nice to enjoy.

title: Great hotel- love the location
text: Great hotel, in an awesome neighborhood. We loved the lounge, pool area and our room was much bigger then we expected. The location is great- we walked to Greenwich Village, Little Italy, to the World Trade (a little bit of a walk), and loved being near everything, but not in Times Square.

title: Juleshopping
text: Elsket dette hotellet. Ligger i en spennende del byen. Våknet opp til lysene på Manhattan. Super kult interiør gjennomført fra inngangen til rommene. Rommet hadde en kald men behagelig blå innredning. Dyr frokost men god. Anbefaler å prøve en av de sjarmerende kaféer som finnes rundt i distriktet for frokost.

title: Ricardo Ordonez
text: I have no words to describe the excellent customer service and professionalism by the staff. We were greeted and treated respectfully by Guest Service Manager: Kimberly Cuellar. 5 stars just for her amazing customer service. The room was confortable and it meets our standards.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
One of the best nights hotels sleeps in a long time. Really good conference facilities and the food was exquisite.

Staff were lovely and loved the pool and beach area. 

Would recommend to anyone going near New York.

title: Great pool experience
text: Alex at the pool was such a gem. He treated me with so much respect and got me a great spot right in the sun as I had hoped for. I am really accident prone, and of course slammed my finger in the pool chair when I was trying to get it to lay flat. Within SECONDS, Alex was at my side, offering to get me ice. He was like superman he got there so fast! The food I had for lunch was absolutely delicious, and the vibe all around at the pool was such refreshing escape from the hostel and bustle of the city surrounding.

title: Yet another wonderful stay
text: I LOVE this hotel!  I don't fit the usual profile in that I'm an older woman - but oh boy what wonderful and friendly service I receive!  I enjoy the "buzz".  I like walking in and seeing and hearing what is sometimes a lively party scene.  And then taking the elevator to my quiet, peaceful and very cool room (the rooms on the 4th and 5th floors are quiet). Everyone I have encountered on staff has been wonderful.  They remember my name. They smile.  They're kind.  They're responsive.  I needed an extension cord - it was delivered right away.  I asked for more towels - someone brought them within 5 minutes - with a smile.  The lobby bar is really fun for a drink or just to people watch.  The neighborhood is just the best - I love the proximity to Chelsea Market and that I can easily walk to the West Village and Soho. This hotel is a dream for me.  Recommend highly.

title: Boutique Hotel in great location
text: Manny at the front door made the hotel go from a 4 star rating to a 5-star! Thanks Manny for making me feel like I was visiting friends. Rooms were clean. Was able to walk to dinner and shopping. Will come back!

title: The Perfect Choice
text: NYC is never short on hotel options, and fortunately I made the perfect choice with Dream Hotel Downtown. Both my room and the service were impeccable. I arrived early, and the front desk staff was extremely accommodating in getting me situated. Shaquoia and her staff left me no other choice but to make Dream Downtown my home when I'm in NYC.

title: Nightmare Hotel
text:
This is a nightclub masquerading as a hotel.  If you're looking to party all night and sleep in the day - this is for you.  If you're not - avoid it.  The hotel sits across from some sort of warehouse - trucks backing up and loading at all hours.  
With a club on the roof, basement, lobby bar and pool - think Hard Rock Hotel on rehab Sunday and you get the picture.  Staff is trained to ask for id and check wrist bands but little else. Clueless about service.  No grown ups - hard to tell who's actually in charge.

title: Coolt och bra även om rumen inte är superstora.....
text: Dream Downtown är ett av de trevligaste och bästa hotellens Meatpacking. Även om rummen är lite diminutiva så är helhetsintrycket riktigt bra. Trevligt poolområde med servering. Glöm inte bort att gå över till Chelsea Market och fiskavdelningen för en varm hummer.

title: Wonderful visit
text: It was our second visit to the hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed it.  The staff are all really friendly the rooms a good size (for New York) and the location is great. If you want to stay in a neighbourhood rather than the tourist hotspots of midtown I would recommend

title: Bad service
text:
Bad service and rude staff
Rooms OK 
Service in the lobbybar OK
Realy bad service cheking in and breakfast
If you would like to stay at a hotel vere you dont feel welcome- book this hotel
Never going back!

title: Wow!
text: We were visiting on our honeymoon and the hotel could not have been better. It has an amazing roof top bar with an incredible view of the city but the room we stayed in was still quiet and we had no problems sleeping. The service was impeccable with the manager, Tenzin, going out of his way (even when he wasn't working) to ensure we had a memorable stay - we would definitely stay again and highly recommend this to visitors of NYC. Located across the road from Chelsea market, it's located in a stylish, fun neighbourhood!

title: Average rooms but great surroundings
text: The rooms was nothing special and located halfway in the restaurant with a lot of noise. The surroundings are great and the clubs/restaurants are worth a visit. The pool does barely have sun, so forget about tanning but focus on exploring the city

title: Convenient location, but nothing special
text: The hotel is right in the heart of Chelsea, next door to Google and across the street from Chelsea market and the metro. But the night life in this area makes it noisy all night, with no place to escape. It's alright really prolly marked if you've never been here before; the on-site restaurants are easier to notice. BTW, NONE of the on-site restaurants are worth the cost (tho very popular), and service was terrible in the 3 of 5 I went to. Comfy beds, clean bathrooms, and great decor. But no in-room coffee or fridge?! C'mon...

title: Great Hotel for Value
text: I stayed there for the weekend and the hotel had a very hip vibe going on there. Lots of people buzzing around and the lobby had a good vibe. The room was nice and clean. I appreciated the Guest services team made sure that I was well taken care of.

title: Nice pool and decent food but overpriced
text: I stayed here for 3 nights in one of their penthouse suites. The balcony and hot tub were great but the bedrooms a bit so so. . The beds were murphy beds that were not too impressive. Once you pulled them out the room was small.  Room service was ok and the food was ok but overpriced.  $10+ for a glass of milk ?????

title: Fantastic hotel..
text: .. in a nice area. Friendly and helpful staff, that fixed everything you needed. Average age young, so you definitely get younger by staying there... As a 60+ person with young daughter it was an interesting experience altogether. At first we were a bit overwhelmed by music and intensity, but we soon got addicted to the place. Dedicated and lovely staff, nice pool, friendly atmosphere etc. A fun experience we never will forget!

title: Not All That!
text:
Expected a good stay but was quite disappointed! Checking in was efficient but then when I arrived at the room it was downhill from there. The room smelled like a cheap hotel that had an old rug that was vacuumed with that deodorizer that is used in cheap hotels to cover up odors.  And, the odor lingered....thank god there was a small porthole type window that I was able to partially open to air out the offensive odor. The bathroom was nothing to rave about and the hole for the doorknob wasn't really hip...it just was another cheap feature.  The restaurants were ok...expensive, but ok. My guests and I went to the PHd lounge to have a drink before dinner. I don't think that I would return there.  The views are fabulous but the bartenders and waiters were inattentive and unfriendly. We were seated and handed drink menus. The waiter never came back despite the place being not very busy....it was early...515 pm.  So, my son said, " Lets get out of this pretentious place and go elsewhere." So, that is what we did and we went to Megu. The cocktails were good and the waitstaff was MUCH more professional and friendly. We did not have to wait for some unprofessional bouncer type person to get the special code for the elevator to the underwhelming PHd lounge. 
Now...the worst part was trying to get to sleep. DO NOT let them book a room in the front facing street section. It was impossible to sleep...not to mention the extreme noise in the hallway....I am talking people screaming!.....It was Saturday and it wasn't like I went to bed early....it was 1am when I returned from my concert..   OH well....you live and you learn....just disappointing....I go to NY often and will not return.

title: Amazing experience
text: Excellent customer service experience; a manager helped me out of a complicated situation with my bank, really saved me from a lot of trouble. Stayed for two nights; the room was clean with an great view of the city. Located in a very trendy part of NYC, many fun spots within walking distance.

title: Perfect location
text: I loved when I saw pictures of this place, with round windows. The rooms are tiny, opposite to the prices, but overall is a great place located next to Chelsea Market. You walk a block and find the subway station, restaurants, and many things. One thing, that could be a problem for some: the night club is on the top floor, so we could hear the music up until 3 am, which is not fun when you are trying to sleep.

title: Nice weekend night
text: The rooms were very small, but it had a large bathroom! Okay view of the Empire State Building! It was a Friday night during a wedding at Chelsea Piers and was very comfortable and not to noisy, with a very busy club in the hotel and next door.

title: Trendy and cool
text: Great location with loads of good restaurants and bars within walking distance, the room was decent, good bed, nice spacious bathroom with good toiletries. Nothing stand out though, everything was as you would need but not as you might want. Food was average. Hotel pool and rooftop club/bar are the highlights. Staff helpful but the hotel was always really busy so you never get a feel of being looked after. Would probably stay again as it ticked just enough of the boxes

title: Favorite NYC hotel
text: Very cool, trendy hotel with an outdoor pool that is an oasis in the city. Dream midtown has an  excellent location with lots to do right out the door! The staff goes above and beyond, especially Mallory, Willis, Demario, Alex and Tenzin. They always make me feel welcome and appreciated.

title: Do not stay here if you want to sleep!  Don't stay here with children!
text:
Well, where to start....
DISCLAIMER - I have never paid this much for a hotel or stayed in a 5 star hotel before - I was excited!!  I was travelling with my family, kids are 11 and 15.

1. On check-in, I was instantly asked to accept the pool policy which doesn't allow kids in the pool after midday.  When I asked why "It is to protect them, as there are adults drinking alcohol by the pool"??  You can imagine how my children took this news!! But, I couldn't check in without agreeing to the policy (it was 3.00 p.m. we were baking hot and looking forward to a dip in the pool)  Couldn't remember reading this on the website, it's hidden in Hotel Policies.  Who reads that before booking?

2. Family room was small - would have been suitable for 1 double bed, not 2.  Bit disappointed, oh well, we're in New York!  View out the window was amazing.

3. First night - woken up by bassline vibrating through my pillow at 1.30 a.m.  I text the main desk (this seems to be they're preferred communication method - I suppose they don't have to deal with you face or face.)  
First reply - we don't know what that could be, our rooftop bar closed at midnight.  Our room was on the 4th floor.  
Me "It's still going"  
2nd reply - we'll send security to see where it's coming from.  
Me "I don't know where but it's vibrating through my pillow and my husband and I can't sleep" 
3rd reply - Security can't hear anything 
Me "Come to my room and listen!"
4th reply - It could be the club in the basement (do you think??), would you like to move rooms?
Me "No, it's 2.30 a.m. and I have two children with me!"
5th reply - We've asked them to turn it down (They didn't)
Me "What time does this go on to?"
6th reply - 3.30 a.m. We can move you tomorrow?
I was so infuriated it took me till 4.00 a.m. to go to sleep anyway.

4. Next day - moved to room, five rooms further along the same corridor. Same, small size (but view was better).  Apologetic but not even a drink to say sorry.
3.30 a.m. Our new neighbours return to their rooms to continue the party for another hour.  The walls are so thin I can hear each swear word! My children can't be exposed to people drinking alcohol, but this is OK apparently.
Didn't even bother to complain, they'll only move us again and we're only here for one more night, I can't face packing/unpacking again!

5. Kids use the pool (in the morning!) There are lots of beautiful people, by the beautiful pool, taking selfies.  The pool policy has more to do with beautiful people not wanting to be splashed by pesky children having fun in my cynical opinion. When I questioned the pool policy again, they said it 'should' be OK for the children to use it after 12 during the week when it's 'quieter' -  quieter, not at night!

6. Check out, I make a point of doing this in person, so I can answer the "We hope you enjoyed your stay" remark.  She apologised before saying anything and said the Duty Manager (who had made no contact with us during our stay and our complaining) would allow us to upgrade next time we visited a Dream Hotel - I declined the offer as we won't be staying there again.

This was our once in a lifetime trip to NYC with the kids, saving for 6 months to stay in a 5 star hotel!  Thanks Dream!  The motto behind the check-in desk.....It was all a dream - I wish.

title: My favourite
text:
Still my favourite hotel in NY.
Vibe, music, atmosphere.
Nice people.
Service is good.
Rooms big enought.
Just be carefull to balcony room.
Request the front pool ones, the on the front Street a small and noisy.

title: Uncomfortable beds, terrible customer service, and slow. Very disappointed!
text: This was such a horrible stay! The beds were awful, lumpy, hard, and extremely old.  The room was not as pictured on the website - we booked "platinum" rooms so that we could have a divider between the sofa bed and the king bed for privacy since we had people sleeping in both, but there was no such divider, and the sofa and bed are right next to each other. After we checked out, we'd been charged $120 extra per night for no reason - labeled an "upgrade fee". This fee was never discussed with us before it was charged, and we have no idea why. Then, when I called about it, I was transferred around to 3 different people, none who could explain the charge or resolve my issue. I was told they would get back to me, but they never did. Breakfast & room service was also a terrible experience - extremely overpriced and the service was horrible - it took an hour to get our food. For the money we spent, we were extremely disappointed.

title: I paid for 4 nights but escaped after the first night
text:
this is after visiting more then 20 times 5 star hotels in newyork far out the worst hotel I have ever stayed in newyork.
It cost me 3 nights but I was so happy to move to a proper hotel.
this is a dirty disco hotel with no service at all.
drunken cheap people all over the place.
everything in the room is dirty...

title: Perfect hotel
text: Just had an amazing 48 hours at the Dream Hotel. If you're looking for a place in manhattan that's fun and chic without appearing to "try too hard" visit the Dream. My girlfriends and I spent the first day lounging by the pool, which feels tucked away in a little urban oasis. Everyone was very friendly, especially the staff. The rooms are clean and surprisingly sound-proof.. very easy to sleep until the early afternoon. We also ate at Megu and went dancing at the Electric Room. Each restaurant/bar on the property has a different feel, but a cohesive theme of effortlessly cool. I couldn't have asked for a better experience. I live in NYC and would recommend the Dream to tourists and New Yorkers alike.

title: Bell'hotel, nel cuore della vita notturna, ma...
text:
Struttura molto particolare, però camere molto piccole, il bagno estremamente minimalista, non mi è piaciuta la tenda nella doccia, invece del classico vetro. Spazi anche dell'armadi ridotti al minimo.
Camera con balconcino che da sulla piscina e sulle belle ragazze che la frequentano, ma scordatevi di nuotarci perchè soprattutto nel weekend non c'è spazio.
Proibito a famiglie con figli piccoli, non è il posto giusto... giovani single invece perfetto

title: Business trip with a perk
text:
Been traveling a lot to NYC for work, but that was the first time i got to stay at Dream Downtown. In the middle of a bad blizzard, actually. The hotel is greatly furnished, the room was not big but sooooo comfortable, super clean.
Major thanks to the hotel staff, from welcome desk to concierge to the breakfast staff. They were beyond helpful.

title: Fab girls weekend
text: Great location, fun good sized sized rooms, great pool lots of bar and dining options on site and nearby I even managed to get a decent haircut. Not pretentious or preclusive I would definitely come back with the family.

title: Back Agaon
text:
I don't often re-visit hotels but I did with this place.
I love the hotel. Staff are great and the service is 5*.
I normally visit NYC for work in August, its very hot. So the pool is a must.
The hotel is for the younger crowd if you ask me. But its a great place.

title: Classic New York experience, young, vibrant, and high energy!
text:
Upon our arrival we were warmly greeted by staff member Willis at the front desk, who was extremely pleasant, informative, and welcoming. Every encounter with Willis during our stay we were treated as special guests.
This hotel is a visual feast; every area is a virtual conversation piece. Totally unique and hip.  If you are looking for an exciting, high energy spot this is the place!

title: Horrible customer service
text: Be careful of guest service agent Michaela McCormack and front office manager Tenzin Basnit...I had no complaints really with the hotel, but those 2 are reason enough for me to never return. I booked through Agoda for 1 room and was given another upon arrival. Instead of trying to accommodate me and my guests I was rudely dismissed by Michael McCormack. She didn't believe me. I had to prove so much just to show that I indeed paid for this specific room, just for her to later admit that this was a ongoing issue with Agoda.Her attitude was enough for me to to not even want to stay there, however I was optimistic and still stayed. Upon checkout 2 days later, there were several discrepancies to my bill. Also,I was promised a $50 refund by Manager Raymond Wong because they never gave us the correct room ,however there was no note of it upon checkout. The manager Andy at the time was pleasantly nice and apologized for the incident during check in and the discrepancies in the bill, as well as the imaginary $50. As a courtesy, he offered to waiver the food charge which was about $120 or so. Front office manager Tenzin Basnit was there during checkout and overheard the entire conversation. He came off pleasant and added to the conversation here and there. After I left, I received a phone call from the Andy telling me that Tenzin felt that we did not deserve to be accommodated and override him and charged our credit cards. He never said one word in opposition to Andy's kind act of waiving the bill while we were checking out. He waited until after we left and used our saved credit cards on file to charge us.
