What kind of manager is that? Not only were some of the other charges not valid, we were given the wrong room, lied to about a $50 refund, treated badly. And to top it off, we had a manager sneaking Ly charge our credit cards. If those weren't reasons for an accommodation, someone please tell me. Smh

title: Great Trendy Hotel..Amazing experience because of Hotel Manager Tenzin Banset attention to detail !!!
text: We checked in for a 3 day weekend getaway.   The hotel is trendy with an amazing pool, trendy bar and great atmosphere along with surprisingly delicious food.  Everyone at the hotel is friendly and wants to make sure your stay is a stress free vacation full of fun.  I want to specifically mention the hotel manager Tenzin Banset who made sure we had the accommodations and experience that we wanted.   He was very helpful with restaurant and nightlife recommendations as well.  Always there to help he truly cares about the customers.

title: HORRIBLE guest experience and lack of professionalism
text:
This is my 2nd time staying at the hotel and I must say both times have been horrible experiences. I chose to write a review now as I like to give places a 2nd chance due to it's convenient location. 

The check in staff member Michaela (McCormack) was very condescending , cut us off when speaking, and when she realized that the room we booked online did not match what was in their system she stated that this is a frequent occurrence and did not try to accommodate us. The manager Raymond (Wong) stated that he would contact the online booking company to refund some of the money for the room downgrade but when I contacted them directly they stated that he never called. Very disappointing as I expect leadership to set the example of exceptional customer service.

I was extremely disappointed in the size of the rooms on both occasions.I understand that this is a boutique style hotel but the rooms do not match what is displayed online.
During both stays after 9pm I could hear the DJ from the rooftop very clearly and had difficulty sleeping due to the noise level.  DO NOT STAY HERE if you want excellent customer service and a relaxed environment. If you would like a Las Vegas feel, rude staff members, and overpriced rooms than this is the place for you! I recommend just purchasing a day pass to go to the pool. 

Also upon check out there were alot of errors on the bill which were not fixed due to the assistant director who works the overnight shift  (unfortunately I did not get his name but it begins with a V).

title: EXTREMELY EXPENSIVE HOTEL THATS DOESNT GIVE A &#&!* ABOUT ITS SLEEPOVER GUESTS
text:
What can I say about Dream.... 
This hotel is super impressive when you see it online and even when you check in - for a moment. I chose to stay there becaue I had a HUGE presentation in New York and I wanted to find a hotel I could work from, enjoy being on whilst also being in an interesting neighbourhood I could stroll through whenever I needd a work break.  
So I arrived at Dream.  When my eyes got used to the dark interior, I quickly realised how beautifully appointed the whole place is.  The structural engineer is a genius... that swimming pool ceiling is just impressive and marvellous.  (The ceiling of the lower lobby / bar is  the rooftop swimming pool floor).   But  quickly you realise that their key clientele are the non-stop rush of corporate events that hire and use the lobby and the rooftop to host private parties and so on.  Where does that leave YOU the guest whose paid gazillions to be there?  Kicked to the curb, I found. 

But its not even the fact that the space I thought I had paid to enjoy with other guests was always overlfowing with private events confining me to my room, or forcing me to eat out,  its the sad sad thing that happened the day I realised I'd need to order room service - I was working on a presentation, and would have preferred to eat in the downstairs bar but there was a huge corporate function going on.  I CANNOT EXPLAIN TO YOU THE MEAL THAT I GOT.  This huge, dry lump of "steak"  really tough - accompanied by a pile (literally) of cold, dry  fries.  ALl this appeared to have been dumped onto the plate.  Veggies?  Oh... no!  Ofcourse not!!!  Why not eat in the main downstairs restaurant?   Its Mexican!  People, not everyone likes Mexican food!!! Having said that, the room service waitress was great  - bubbly, friendly, prompt etc but OMG I could not eat what she delivered.... and it ended up being the MOST EXPENSIVE and most awful meal I ate in my 6 week stay in the States. THANK GOD for Chelsea market across the road. Actually even the kebab guy on the corner had better food. 
Something else.  In my five night stay, I they had fire sirens waking up the whole hotel on THREE OF THE FIVE NIGHTS. IMagine being in a deep sleep with terrible jetlag only to have repeated fire alarms wake you up on the night. Awful.
I chose a "balcony" room not knowing that huge droves of people come here to party on the rooftop each night and ... yes, you can kinda hear hem arriving and leaving. AND YOU ARENT EVEN GURANTEED ACCESS TO THAT SAME ROOFTOP THEY ARE ALL HEADED UP TO after 8 unless the doorman deems you "fit".  Even if you are paying an extortionate amount of money to be there. 
Yes, its a pretty cool looking hotel.  But thats about it.  A stay there is simply not worth it.

title: Dream Getaway!!!
text: My daughter and I stayed at the Dream Downtown Hotel. We had a wonderful experience. The highlight of our stay was the AMAZING customer service from Guest Service Manager Mallory Matoush who went above and beyond to make our stay so welcoming and special & the gorgeous rooftop pool!!!! It felt like an island vacation with the palm trees, sand beach, DJ music, beautiful pool with floats and glass bottom. The hotel staff were extremely friendly. We also loved the modern decor, the extremely clean and spacious room, the delicious onsite restaurants and the convenient location across the street from Chelsea Market. Please keep in mind weekdays are better if you are looking for a low-key chill atmosphere compared to more of a party scene on the weekends. We can't wait to return and highly recommend Dream Downtown for out-of-towers or locals looking for an escape.

title: Dreams really do come true!
text:
I had a lovely stay at Dream this past week with a friend from out of town. From the room, to Bodega Negra, PH-D and the Pool Bar & Grill brunch! Special shout out to the servers of Bodega Negra staff who were super attentive, as well as Jen Z who checked me in AND out! Will stay again for the spicy margaritas and great service!

-Lori V

title: 5 stars
text:
Tenzin the floor manager greeted me and my wife upon arrival and even offered us a complimentary upgrade. The service was amazing and the hotel was incredible. Room had the perfect amenities and was kept in excellent condition. The pool is one of the only roof top pools in the city and is really hip. If you're looking for a beautiful hotel, that has an awesome rooftop bar & pool in the best location in the city and at a solid price... the Dream downtown is perfect.
Will definitely be back soon.

title: Experience does not live up to price.
text:
My friend and I stayed a night at Dream this past weekend and I feel compelled to write a review. We found this place via social media and online articles raving about the restaurants and bars, not to mention the hotel looked gorgeous from the images online.

We were greeted as most hotel guests usually are, very welcoming and accommodating, even making reservation for us at the Mexican restaurant there. Our room was far smaller than the images make it seem online. No fridge, only one robe, no ice bucket, no coffee machine, etc. But that was ok, the room, despite being tiny, was nice, looked clean and the bed felt comfortable.

We quickly discovered there are no ice machines available on any floor and after 4 phone calls to the concierge, house keeping and two to the front desk, we were finally able to acquire some ice more than an hour after our first call which was very frustrating as ice machines and a simple vending machine are typically available for guests at most hotels but perhaps the more money you spend and the “swankier” the hotel, the less accommodations you receive. Funny how that works.

After spending some time in the city we arrived back to our hotel around 7 to get ready for dinner only to find that the lobby was flooded with drunk people. On our way to the elevators we saw an inebriated girl being carried out and a man being escorted out while fighting with a bouncer. This was definitely a surprise and yet another turn off. Let me just add that we are both girls in our twenties and we were there to go out an enjoy the nightlife our hotel had to offer too, we aren’t a family with young children, so I think the fact that already we were turned off by the atmosphere in the lobby alone says something.

When we arrived on time to Bodega Negra we were told our table wasn't ready yet and to wait at the bar. More than a half hour later after standing around my friend went back up to the hostess to check in and then only a few minutes later were finally seated, which makes me think we were forgotten about. This place was also incredibly rowdy and full of loud drunk people too. It was only 9:30. Our food was delicious but it took forever to come out and because of the blaring DJ music our interactions with our waiter weren't the best either. We also ordered two of the same drinks only to have them arrive to our table looking like someone took several big swings out of one of the glasses... almost half empty for a $16 cocktail.

After finishing our meal we wanted to head to PHD, the rooftop bar we read raves about. We saw the separate elevator to the club had a line so we went up and waited, when we reached the front we were told by the bouncer we had to go back out to the front door of the lobby, wait in line there and get our hand stamped, come back, wait in this line and eventually get up to the bar. This was really disappointing as we thought being guests of the hotel we might be able to forego the line of everyone coming off the street but no, not the case and when my friend asked the front desk about any special accommodations guests may receive they told her, "they (Dream) are not responsible for the club after 9:30 and it’s technically a separate entity” which is ridiculous, if you read about the club on Dream’s website it says exactly, "our haute rooftop nightclub and lounge bar” seemingly claiming ownership of the club.

The rest of the experience to get into the club was incredibly unpleasant, we were treated with disrespect at every turn from all of the bouncers and staff of the club. The bar tenders were rude and could not even provide a gin suggestion my friend when she asked for one. I suppose they figured we were just like all of the other incredibly drunk people we were surrounded by the entire time acting like animals. Aside from the cool view of the sky line there were no redeeming qualities of this place. We were happy to leave and have a few drinks in our room.

I'd say after spending a night here we would  not choose to stay again. There’s definitely an air of elitism everywhere, which forgive me but, I think is just a common attitude of most people in NYC and this just confirmed it.

However,  earlier in the evening we stopped at the Conrad hotel to check out their rooftop bar- The Loopy Doopy and had an awesome experience there. The bar tenders were very friendly as well as the wait staff. One woman was even kind enough to come grab us from the bar and offer a spot to sit on the couches which was mostly sectioned off for reservations. We would absolutely consider staying here next time.

title: It's A DREAM!
text: My stay at Downtown Dream was AMAZING!!! I went for my bachelorette weekend and it was so much fun. We had a room with a balcony, which overlooked the streets of NYC and we were even able to watch a gorgeous sunset!  Pool party all day (make sure you arrive early in order to get a chair) otherwise you will need to wait - it's on a first come basis, unless you pay to reserve one. We woke up really early the next day and got a char. Food was delicious - try the watermelon & feta salad - drinks were refreshing. Clubs at night - rooftop club which has pretty skyline views of NYC. The club downstairs was more hip - hop with black lights, also very fun! The next day I wanted to make sure I was able to bring back my balloons as we needed to do an early check out BUT still wanted to hang by the pool. Mallory Matoush who is the guest service manager onsite was AWESOME! She made sure we were able to put them in a secure spot until we were ready to leave for the day. Thanks so much Mallory!!! :)

title: The Dream Is A Dream Come True
text:
After unfortunate circumstances caused us to cancel our 10 year anniversary trip to Charleston, we decided very last minute a one night staycation getaway would have to suffice. Nervous that whatever we planned wouldn't match a 5 day kid free getaway as originally planned, we went into our NYC trip with some reservation. 

All that worry for nothing because from the moment we walked into the Dream we were blown away.  The bellhop staff were very friendly and helpful finding us an inexpensive parking option. The front desk accommodated our early check-in request. We received a great corner room with a balcony - very clean!

We went straight to the pool and had a deliciously lunch. Prices were amazing and so was the food. Unique and fun drinks - We shared a pineapple tap - incredible drink for two (approximately 2.5 drinks each) served in a hollowed pineapple. The pool has a very fun, chill vibe during the weekday and the pool staff (lifeguards and waitstaff were wonderful and friendly). 

We requested hypo-allergenic bedding and when we returned to our room, the housekeeping staff immediately converted our bed. 

We enjoyed a cocktail on the rooftop bar. Beautiful and great views. 

We spent day two at the pool and we had such a great time. They even granted our request for late check-out so that we could continue enjoying our day at the pool. 

The manager, Mr. Basnet, was incredibly ingratiating and we had a fun conversation with Fernando, one of the bellhops. 

We cannot wait to visit again (is next week too soon?!). 

Perfect visit from start to finish!  Well done Dream. It's obvious that the staff is treated well at this location as they were all nothing but smiles and friendly attitudes.

title: Hip Hotel!
text:
This was my first time staying at the Dream Downtown. My company, and most people in our space, stayed at the Dream since it's in an ideal location. It's right across from the Chelsea Market, where you can get quick tasty bites. There are also some nicer restaurants in walking distance like Buddakan or Salinas. The hotel itself is very modern, full of young people. There's a pool that everyone utilizes. They even have a cool rooftop bar/club, PhD, with a great view. I spent the first two nights there, and met a variety of people who were surprisingly nice. 

The staff were all very accommodating, especially Tenzin. I checked in but my name wasn't on the room that my company booked, uh oh. I was tired from my flight and I was getting slightly agitated (although it was our fault) that I couldn't check in and nap. Tenzin trusted me, promised I wouldn't be on the streets haha, and added me to the room. I was very appreciative! 

The same night around 5am, there was a domestic dispute next door. I couldn't sleep for an 1hr+ because these people were banging on the door. That morning the front desk called and apologized although it wasn't their fault, and offered me some breakfast vouchers and gave me a later check out. 

Throughout my stay at the hotel, I was constantly hanging out in the lobby or coming back at 4/5am. Tenzin was usually there so he recognized me. His friendly demeanor made me feel comfortable chatting with him every night. I felt very welcome there so I'll definitely be back, along with the rest of the team!

title: Happening spot in Downtown NYC
text:
The dream Downtown was a fun happening spot in Chelsea Downtown Manhattan.
Packed with vivacious people from all over the world. Convenient to everything.
Tons to see or do in the neighborhood including the Chelsea Market.
Hotel staff varied from interested in your well being and plans to bored with the service industry.
Some front desk people not at all helpful especially to the folks that got locked out of their room and were not allowed back in to prove who they were!

title: PARTY HOTEL
text: all the hotel looks great... beautiful hotel, trendy, nice room, amazing pool... but so noisy...We were on 3rd floor, and we could hera music until 3 AM, and drunk people talking loud in the corridor. It's a party hotel, with a beautiful marketing...Where's the customer service?? don't expect a kettle in your room, even for 450USD per night! And when it rains, in the hotel book, it says there's an umbrella in the closet, but there's none....I tested also the laundry..nice work but they lost 1 pair of socks...Conclusion : beautiful marketing, but caring about he customers would be better...

title: NYC Bachlorette Weekend - Best Idea
text: I took my Best Friend here for a quick bachelorette weekend and we had the BEST time!!! Everything was right there from fun pool parties, great restaurants to night clubs upstairs and downstairs. We were having so much fun we didn't even realize we had pulled an all nighter lol .  We did run into one little issue which was I had about 40 balloons I used to decorate the bride to be's room and no where to hold them while we enjoyed the pool one more day. Mallory M., the manager at guest services came to the rescue and assured us they could be held in the storage room. She was a life saver. Although many of the staff members were very pleasant Mallory stood out since she was the problem solver. After we enjoyed another full day at Dream we went home with smiles, memories and our 40 balloons in the car lol. Anything is possible in NYC and Dream was the perfect place to go for a fun weekend away. The property itself is close to other restaurants and nightclubs as well if we wanted to get out and see more of the city. We will for sure be back again and without a doubt make more amazing memories. Thank you Dream for allowing me to give my bff bride to be the best weekend as her MOH :)

title: What a dream!
text: We had a marvellous experience and stay, the interior was unique and trendy and the hotel was lively. We were welcomed by Willis who's smiling face greeted us, he was very professional, fashionable and fun which complimented the hotel greatly. The rooms were stylish and the circular theme followed throughout the whole hotel and the beds were super comfy. The hotel was buzzing every day and night with people attending events, shoots,the phd rooftop bar, salon and pool, this hotel has a great atmosphere. Located in the busy meatpacking district within the trendy Chelsea neighbourhood the hotels location is not to far from anywhere and has great restaurants , cafes and shopping within walking distance. We had a great overall stay and will defiantly return.

title: Fun & comfortable in NYC
text:
I'm a luxury traveler and I tend to set high standards 

This was my first time in Dream Downtown and I was very pleased.

Service: friendly staff.

Room: Clean, comfortable and interesting design.  Reminds me of the W

Pool:  cool pool and interesting design.

Events:  loved the rooftop club.  Entertaining and convenient.

title: Party hotel
text:
A great place
For the young and late night people.
Cool design and great hotel location.
Roof top is super cool - I would recommend dressing up!
No place to sit at the pool to relax but if you want to party this is the place.

title: Michael McMahon
text: I walked in the door and one of the bellman named manny ran up to me with a big smile and took my bags and had the front desk take care of me. From that moment on I had an excellent experience which is very rare of me to say ,I usually feel bored and that service on the east coast in general is terrible . The dream hotel is excellent , manny introduced me to the concierge named chris who was A top notch concierge who booked everything for me . Manny had my day bed ready for me at the pool and introduced me to the manager who put a complimentary bottle of champagne in my suite. My friend came by the second day to hang out at the pool and she had a great time as well .

title: Perfect atmosphere, nice staff.
text:
This is a perfect hotel for an urban vacation. I´ve been living there for several times and 
i´m always having a good time. It has a great location and the staff is brilliant. If you need any advise on what restaurants to eat or what to do to experience the city, go to the concierge and ask for Christopher Scali. He knows the best spots to go to in any situation and he will help you out. 

I would recommend this hotel to my friends and btw, check out the roof!

title: Good location and good pool side cafe
text:
At a good location and known for its bar PHD. Rooms are tiny and beds extra ordinarily soft. Can not tell the difference between mattress and pillow.

Pool side cafe is good and serves good food all day long.

title: Good party hotel
text:
We stayed over a weekend in the heat of Summer in July. The main selling point for the hotel was the cool party vibes of the hotel overall. The lobby bar is great, with a very happening crowd and bumping music. PHD, which is a rooftop lounge/club was great but somewhat of a pain to get in even as a hotel guest, the entrance guy asked for $300 minimum tab for a couple, despite my fiancée not drinking at all... The pool is very nice but quite small (giant by NY standards I guess) and with very limited beds. If you want a bed, go before 10am either on Saturday or Sunday. On Sunday they sell the beds to non hotel people so you might have to wait till 11am to get a bed.

The staff was very nice but the Manager I gave feedback to regarding their shenanigans with the pool beds (they basically said all beds were reserved and paid for, $150 per bed, and if someone doesn't show up, then and only then even as a hotel guest would you get a bed) was close minded and not helpful at all. I explained that one of the main perks of the hotel was the pool, and not being able to get a bed on Sunday at 10am is a terrible policy. I get how capitalism works and I am a huge proponent of it, but there has to be some regard given to hotel guests...

The rooms are cool looking, very modern and trendy but tiny as pretty much all other hotels in NY.

Would recommend for a party weekend.

title: Good overnight stay, but need better program for frequent guests.
text:
I've stayed at The Dream about 15 times over the past few years as my office is across the street and it's a very nice hotel. I got a bigger room on a high floor with views of the Empire State Building. My issue with this hotel, however, is its inconsistency, which I've noted in previous reviews in the past. You can never count on what extra amenities will be in the room or how the front desk staff will handle your account. 

I understand this hotel chain doesn't have a reward program. However, they've got to figure out a way to record repeat business. If I notify them in advance that I'm coming, I almost always have free breakfast coupons and the highest speed internet. If I don't, it's like I've never stayed there before. I didn't have time to deal with them separately for this trip and they didn't even know I was a repeat visitor. They asked me if this was my first time. No...its about my 16th time here....under the same name. No apologies and no adjustment was made. So, no free breakfast or highest speed internet. I didn't care that much as I was there for about 12 hours, but it's frustrating to be a regular patron of an expensive hotel and they have no record of you ever having been a guest.

title: Very nice and clean
text: This is a beautiful hotel, amazing rooms clean and spacious. Pool and rooftop bar, lots of nice stuff inside. Great location right across from Chelsea market, recommend this hotel to everyone. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

title: Rooftop views!
text: The pool rooftop is by far one of the best in the city. Drinks are good and pool staff looks great.The hotel itself is a bit manic but I enjoyed my stay very much. Rooms are descent sized and amenities are very nice. The welcome desk was very friendly and made me feel comfortable. My interaction with Michaela was great, very knowledgeable and professional. I honestly prefer this location over the other. Again if you have a chance check out the roof!
